review_body: Promised breakfast wasn't provided. When I posted this on Marriott.com I received an email asking me to contact the hotel. I did but the person who emailed was no longer employed and whoever answered had zero interest in why I'd called. Upon checking my review on Marriott I see that Mia Fowler responded claiming no harm was done because we ate in the lounge. My review noted this wasn't true, we paid to eat out. She also claimed to have put 5,000 points in my Marriott account for our inconvenience but it's coming up on two months and nothing has credited.Advice to property, when you mess up and email a customer asking them to call in, don't blow them off when they do. More advice. When you promised a token amount of points to make up for a larger loss, at least follow through.Not a bad hotel but sloppy management.

There is nothing exceptional about the Sheraton. However, given its location (Manhattan) and the fact that I've had my share of stays at incredibly subpar properties in the area, I'd consider the Sheraton to be a decent place to stay, especially when considering the price.Rooms are spacious enough, breakfast is decent enough, it's reasonably clean (although it could stand to use a refurb in the near future) and has fast WiFi. The right kind of business hotel that does the job and doesn't break the bank. This is my third stay there, and won't hesitate to return should I have meetings nearby.

I've stayed at this property several times over the past 10 years and I must say that the service has definitely improved since then. The rooms are very small and for me at least, good for 1 person to relax in comfortably. Most of the time I've gotten rooms facing east or south which means very little to any view but recently I (somehow) got a west facing room which faces towards the Hudson River (although you need to have a higher floor to get the true view). Rooms have been renovated in the last few years with the typical Sheraton standards----clean and comfortable and they usually stock the bathroom with all the amenities you might need.Staff has also gotten better----in the past they were a bit gruff but now are much friendlier and helpful. If you want/get Club access, the Club has terrific views including an outdoor terrace (which is open to anyone staying on the Club floor). The Club is smaller than most and can get very crowded if there are more than 15 people in there. The location is central to SoHo and downtown/FiDi (about a 15 minute easy walk). If coming from JFK, the E train stops right around the block at Canal Street making it easy to get to or depart from. Lots of terrific bars and restaurants in the immediate area and while there are many pricier ones, do look around on the internet as there are many reasonably priced (and fun) places here too.

Living in CT and working in NYC I often come in for a weekend or day trip. For being in NYC, this hotel is actually a great deal.The hotel itself is out of the hustle and bustle of Times Square (where I ended up anyway due to a broadway show). It was an easy subway ride from our hotel to Times Square. If you are traveling by subway keep in mind it’s $2.75 per person per ride. The subway stop is Canal St but it’s a few blocks walk to the hotel. It’s easy to miss it if you aren’t looking for it, look for the large post office on the southeast corner. We got to the hotel around 5PM and during our walk we were harassed by the typical Canal St dealers selling their knock offs. If you aren’t interested, keep your eyes down and keep walking. We got a standard room for under $100/night which was an amazing price for NYC. Being Marriott Elite we were hoping for an upgrade but on a Saturday night there were none available. Hoping for the best but preparing for the worst, we made our way up to our room and was pleasantly surprised. Room 1620 was the typical small size but had a gorgeous view of the city. The room could use an upgrade but it met our needs just fine. The room looked right out to the NYC skyline, seeing Hudson Yards, the Empire State Building and everything in between. During the day it was nice but at night you can’t capture how pretty it is. The bed was comfortable enough and we both had a decent nights sleep. We got 2 free bottles of water in the room along with a larger bottle for purchase for $4. If you have lounge access, just go and grab a few bottles from there if you need. The only time the room was too small was when my wife was sitting at the desk and I needed to get to the chair on the other side of the room. I couldn’t squeeze through so I had to roll over the bed to get there.Being elite, we get access to the lounge on the 21st floor. This was also small but nicer than other lounges we’ve been in. They have the same gorgeous views of the sunset but just a bit better because of the additional height. They have a nice happy hour every day from 5-7PM. They offer free wine or beer plus some snacks like cheese, hummus, veggies w/ dip and chips and salsa. We heard there was food there and thought we’d be able to eat dinner there but that wasn’t really the case. There was a good amount of food but I wouldn’t plan a dinner around this. We did enjoy about 7 glasses of wine amongst the 2 of us so I can’t say anything bad about the lounge. The noise wasn’t too bad from the outside. Not sure if it was the fact that we were on the 16th floor or that there wasn’t too much car traffic in this area but I didn’t hear anything throughout the night. Overall this was a pleasant stay and hotel and I would stay here again versus being right in the heart of the city.

We stayed here for the NY Times travel show. For us the hotel was perfectly situated. We could walk to the World Trade Center sight, thete's a great deli and coffee shop next door. There are 2 different subway stops, one right around the corner and the other maybe 2 blocks away. There is also a great little Italian restaurant around the corner recommended to us by the concierge.The concierge was amazing. So funny and full of life. He was like watching a show with everyone. The room was nice but it seems the windows aren't double glazed because I have stayed in lots of big cities and this room was by far the noisiest. You heard every noise outside. The room itself was large but weirdly configured. To get into the teeny tiny dark closet you had to move the nightstand to open the door. I needed my flashlight to see inside. In order to see the TV from the bed you needed to lay on your left side as it is directly next to the side of the bed. Our room had a very comfy chair and sofa. There was also a large kitchen table and 4 chairs...weird. I think the whole room needs to be redesigned.The executive lounge was small and very hot with a limited breakfast selection. Not what is expected in an executive lounge. However in the warmer months, this lounge also has a huge outdoor area with amazing views. Again a redesign is needed and a refurb as the furniture is all dirty and stained. Nice touch in the evening is free unlimited booze.The staff are all exemplary. From the minute I arrived everyone was wonderful. Housekeepers, front desk staff, executive lounge staff and especially the concierge.As a lifetime Titanium member I have stayed in lots of Marriott properties. For me it served ir's purpose for a 4 night stay but I don't know that I would want to stay longer. That being said, I am planning on returning January 2021.

We loved Dion who took care of us for cocktails on the 21st floor lounge. He is very kind, helpful and full of positive energy !We love him!! This hotel should be thankful to have such a wonderful person working for them .

We stayed here for 3 nights in November and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Room was exactly as expected and staff was very helpful. This is a great location with lots of food choices and a great deli next door. We would stay here on our next visit.

One of the Marriott Bonvoy hotels, this is a good, basic place to stay in the Tribeca area. The rooms have no frills but are comfortable. No shower gel but soap and shampoo are provided. Staff very pleasant and helpful. There is a fitness suite. You can borrow an umbrella for a $50 deposit if it’s pouring down. They offer a green deal without housekeeping for 500 points a night.

I'm a pretty low maintenance traveler and do not expect perfection, but my recent experience at this property was so bad I feel an obligation to share it in this forum. We stayed for one night this past weekend and had the following issues: 1) 20th Floor room was incredibly noisy from both the street (which is understandable, it's NYC) but also from the elevator, which generated a loud banging noise all night. This hotel is poorly maintained, has thin walls and is long overdue for renovation. Do not stay here if you need to sleep. 2) The Sheraton "Lounge" is a gross exaggeration of what you're getting. The Sunday breakfast ends at 9am, the earliest I've ever seen for a weekend breakfast, and food/beverage options the rest of the day are minimal. Not worth the upgrade. 3) Service at the front desk can best be described as apathetic. There seems to be no incentive or desire to do anything but the bare minimum. With all the great hotels in the area, don't waste time or money at this outdated property.

Stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca first week of February 2020. This is a great hotel. Staff are professional and friendly. We always got a lovely greeting when leaving or entering the hotel. The location is just brilliant. We used the subway for the week and it seemed that every train stopped on Canal Street where the hotel is based. Yes turning right out of the hotel means you do come across some street sellers which may seem intimidating at first but they are not. Once you say no they move onto the next person. Turning left and then left again puts you into a really lovely area with great restaurants and the best pizza slice I have ever had. Room was very clean and much larger than we expected for New York. No real noise issue but then again we were tired from exploring all day. One block up and you are in Soho and would pay much more per night. Easy to walk to One WTC. We will definitely stay here again as it is a real gem in an expensive city.

Found a great rate on Bonvoy site on Friday and decided to head up from Northern Virginia on Saturday morning. We usually stay in Mid Town and then fall into the trap of never leaving the Times Square area. We got outside our comfort zone a bit and hung around Chinatown, Little Italy and the Village. The hotel is an area that might scare off some people. It's a little sketchy on the edge of Chinatown, but it's the "charm" I love about the city. The hotel itself is great. Modern with a huge bar area on the first floor. The young man who checked us in, Sal, was super cool and very professional. We did not utilize the gym on such a short stay, but did check out the lounge on the 21st floor. 24 hour access to water, pop and snacks is always appreciated. There is also an outdoor patio up there, which offered a fantastic view of the city to the North. We stayed in a King on the 11th floor. Typical small NYC room, but quite cozy. Good AC, fantastic shower and comfortable bed for all activities! Clean and modern. Not much more to ask for.We also received a nice email from the assistant manager, Mai, when we returned home. Direct service from the hotel itself will keep us coming back.

We stayed for 2 weeks at the Sheraton and overall it was value for money in a ok location in NY.I am extremely picky, so read below if you are too, if not it was a good hotel however I would give another hotel a go next time. Here’s why: - first major downfall, no contact details for the hotel can be found at all! No email address across, Expedia, trip advisor, Sheraton website, Facebook page. Nothing! No way to confirm your room prior to arriving!!! Something that needs to be addressed! -Check in process was ok, nothing special with staff, didn’t really go above and beyond however was quick. Didn’t touch on wifi so we had to check that it was complementary. - room wasn’t serviced until really late in the day or early morning so be sure to use your do not disturb sign if you would like to sleep in. - Rooms are not quite, noise from hallway and outside sirens/ traffic is normal. This only bothered us a few nights with loud people in the hallway, however the rest of the time was ok. We were on level 10. - Rooms are not smoking however we did smell weed within the hallway etc.- Towels and linen are clean and crisp. However there is no doona per se it’s sheets on top of the bed. - Room is small, hard to have two cases with luggage out. You get that most places in NY so this is average. - We requested a fridge on the third night we were here to be told they had none available, after requesting again in person they were able to send one up. Rooms should come accompanied with a fridge, wouldn’t have been a problem if staying one night however for two weeks it was nice to have a cold drink or milk available for a tea or coffee in the morning. If your staying a while I’d request one prior to arriving. - Pillows were very flat! It did say on the website they had a pillow menu available however it wasn’t on the in room guide. We didn’t eat in the restaurant, only had a drink at the bar. Was good value during happy hour. It’s not advertised however Friday and saturdays have free drinks and nibbles for members in the 27th floor lounge. This was a nice touch, along with festive drinks and hot chocolates in the afternoons in the lobby. The location is central to those using the subway and if you don’t mind walking to locations like china town, Wall Street, little Italy etc. 99c pizza and delis are a short walk too! Overall it was ok. I wouldn’t stay here again however I wasn’t overly impressed nor disappointed.

Staff refused to provide service to our room. Had to chase up our dry cleaning, which they then SHOVED into my suitcase when I was not in my room. I asked the staff about the issues I had while I was there and all I got was "we'll investigate the issue and get back to you" and zero follow up. I emailed the manager to resolve this issues I experienced, but it has now been over a week and they still have not gotten back to me. Hotel is not good value for money, and honestly provided the worst service I've ever experienced at a hotel. Do yourself a favour and avoid this place.

Not sure were to start. The rooms were clean, but there is a lot of road noise. The location is very close to China town and a stones throw from Tribeca. My issues revolve around the hotel using a very dangerous taxi company to take us to JFK. He was extremely dangerous, weaving in and out of traffic on the Freeway and we had at leat 4 near misses. I had to yell at him to stop at least three times. He also had an iPad in the front seat and I do not think it is ieagl to watch programmes on it and still drive, To add insult to injury he over charged us by $13 despite it being an agreed fare with the hotel. I emailed Marriott customer services at least 3 times and never had a response. I eventually rang the hotel (at international call rates) and complained to Sal (the hotel manager). He assured me that they would take that particular taxi driver off their books and refund the $13 via the travel agent. My issue is that the hotel should throughly vet the drivers before and not put their guests lives at risk. Ina addition, I have never received my $13 refund, despite t at least 4 emails to BOTH Sal and Mia. I have also rang the hotel and every time I get to reception and ask for Mia and Sal I am always cut off. When everything is ok, the hotel will communicate with you. When they need to learn from experience, they seem to not bother or care about their guests. I have stayed at a number of hotels in Manhattan and I have to say the customer service in relation to this incident has been atrocious. I am sure I will get a stock response, asking me to reach out to the hotel. What is the point when they cut you off the phone or never replay to emails!

When we arrived, it was around 9a and our room was not ready so the front desk staff stores our luggage, free of charge and we went out and explored for a while, while we waited for another couple to arrive!!After exploring and returning around 3p, our room was ready! It was a very comfortable room. One young lady at the front desk, wish I remembered her name, left a nice bottle of wine for us!! Thanks so much sista!!We would definitely stay here again.

I have stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca twice. Once with our daughter 2012 and once with my husband October 2019. Our room was small, but we were very happy with the cleanliness of our room. We had the club room. Which included appetizers and drinks. Our guest Service Agent is Deon! Deon was kind and friendly! No complaints about Deon. We also had breakfast buffet in the club room. Very satisfactory to us. If we are visiting New York in the future, we will certainly stay at the Sheraton Tribeca!

I have stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca multiple times and will continue to do so. Sal at the front desk always greets me by name and welcomes me back. It's a great feeling when you return to a hotel and receive such amazing customer service. There is something really special about how the staff works hard to earn your repeat business over and over again. They treat you well and try to do what they can to give you a warm, friendly environment in which you will look forward to when you return. Thank you so much Sal and the entire team at the Sheraton Tribeca. As a Gold Elite member, I can proudly say that the staff at the Sheraton Tribeca is World Class. You will continue to have me as a very happy repeat customer!

The hotel has some positives:- Central location- Large, clean bedroom with comfortable beds- Club Lounge area with nice views and free 'happy hour' drinksBut there were also significant negatives experienced during our stay:- Outside of the hotel is disappointingly drab and not what I would expect from a Sheraton. Inside is a little better but rather old fashioned.- Our room looked tired and not well maintained. The phone didn't work, light bulb was hanging from the socket, etc.- Our window "view" was a brick wall. We asked to change but we were told curtly that this was the only room available... As we had booked 11 months previously, I would have hoped for something better and also a more helpful response from reception staff.- Some reception staff (not all) were generally quite rude and unhelpful. For example, I asked about the Club Lounge when we checked in and we were told it was available only for Club members. After a couple nights, I learned from a different staff member that this was untrue and anyone can pay $30 for access.While the price does help to counterbalance some of the negatives, it wasn't the stay I had hoped for.

We have been to this hotel several times. Great location in Tribeca with super easy access to the subway uptown. We like staying here when visiting our daughter on the lower East. Weekend rates are great. When we drive we can find affordable lots and parking meters close by on the weekend. Staff is very friendly. The lounge while small has a great outdoor deck on the 22nd floor with sweeping views.

Good location close to so many fun neighborhoods! We were able to walk to Tribeca, Soho, Greenwich, financial district, west Village, union sq and Washington Sq! The hotel is nice. Rooms are the typical smaller NYC rooms but hotel is in good condition and clean. My only compliant is the pillows were lumpy.

I travel a lot but I rarely write hotel reviews. Most of my stays are at mid-range uninspiring hotels. Only when I have a horrible stay that people should be warned about, or when I find a gem of a hotel that deserves extra attention do I spend the time to write something on TripAdvisor. Sheraton Tribeca was the latter. The staff were very friendly and made us feel extra special for visit to NYC, something that we don't expect at a NYC hotel. The subway is just around the corner, 2 minutes away (blue line). We had Club Lounge access where breakfast was served daily. The lounge was super crowded at 8:30am everyday but the staff worked hard to keep food replenished and tables cleared. Through the lounge you could access an outdoor terrace with amazing panoramic views of midtown Manhattan. If the weather is nice, grab a drink during Club Lounge happy hour and sit outside. Room was average size for NYC. Clean and efficient. Elevators get busy during rush hour so expect a bit of a wait, which was to be expected. To wrap it up, I think the friendly staff here made our stay special and memorable and we'd return just for that reason. Well done!

Ok the 2 people that stand out the most to me ,,and who went above and beyond are Cesar and Josh.. super friendly and bent over backwards to make our trip spectacular.. had a blast.. thank you so much!

I've never had a worse hotel experience than when my mum and I stayed here last month. Check-in time was 3pm but we were coming off a cruise so arrived early at 11.30ish. We knew the room wouldn't be ready but wanted to leave our bags to walk round the city so we did this and were told our room would be ready, as expected, at 3pm. We walked miles and ended up getting back, totally exhausted, at 4.30pm. Plenty of time to have a quick nap and get changed in time for our restaurant booking at 6.45pm. But our room wasn't ready. We were told to wait another hour and that we could wait in the club lounge. They made this seem like a special treat even though it was included with our booking anyway. So we waited until 5.30pm and called back down. Still not ready!! They said it would be at least another hour which meant we'd have to go to our restaurant booking as we were, sweaty and under dressed. I also have a slipped disc in my back and it was hurting so much that I really needed to just lie down. We went for the meal and returned for us to finally be allowed in our room at 9.30ish. We collapsed onto our beds and I logged in to the WiFi (included with our room)... or tried to. There was no WiFi signal. I stepped outside the door to the room and tried again and sure enough it worked. Our room was seemingly the only place with no reception! Over the next two days I wasted hours of my holiday on the phone to their tech support who seemed to subscribe to The IT Crowd method of turning everything on and off again, and with the hotel's own engineer, but to no avail. This was massively inconvenient as we needed to make plans and call family members, especially as I had my 30th birthday while we were there. Also, on the last morning we had breakfast in the hotel and one of the waitresses was literally holding her head in her hands when greeting us, clearly suffering from the night before!Seriously, the price might be tempting but this hotel is not worth it!! Hope this saves someone else from experiencing the same!

I had a pleasant stay at this hotel. The staff are very courteous and excellent service all the way. Great location to stay and in close vicinity to Manhattan. The room was a bit small with tiny windows, but that is the normal for NYC hotels, I guess.

Having stayed here with my mother last month, I just wanted to write and say what a pleasant time we had. Staff, from the moment we arrived, were only too happy to help and very friendly. The atmosphere in the lobby was really warm and welcoming. As our room was not ready yet we were given a couple of free drinks to wait with in the bar, which was much appreciated after a long journey from London!When we got into the room it was lovely. Very clean, and modern - the bathroom was especially nice, as was the up to date TV. We only ate here a couple of times, and this was for the breakfast buffet. Very tasty - scrambled eggs, bacon, potatoes, pancakes, confectionary and so on - nice comprehensive choice that included a coffee. Reasonably priced for where we were too.Location was really good for going out sight seeing and getting back - some things were easy walking distance, and for what wasn't there was a subway point just along the road a bit which was very hand. Plethora of good eateries in the vicinity too.Check out was nice and painless, and the staff once again couldn't have been nicer.

We stayed here for a week and thought it was great. Ample space in our room and bathroom. Clean and excellent service. It is really located in a great spot so lots of walking around and close to the subway too. I'd highly recommend.We had lounge access which was amazing as the view of the city from the top floor is unbelievable. There's also a nice patio up there with heat lamps.

Definitely book this hotel, we had a Queen bed room, spacious enough for 2 people. Bed was very comfortable, two different type pillows to chose from. Fabulous view, looking towards the Empire State Building. Our room was 1018. Friends were in 1120 same view.The staff at this hotel are outstanding and work as a team. Check in and out was quick and easy. Answered questions from restaurants, what to see and definitely helped with directions. New subway system was great and people are very friendly and help with directions 24hr bagel place next door is the best. If you forgot anything they have it.Great breakfast sandwiches, smoothies to drinks for the room. Wine store across the street.Great dive bar around the corner Nancy’s whiskey pub.I loved this location.Central Park is a must

Visited NYC again on business and opted to be in Tribecca area - this hotel is near food and shopping areas.Room smaller than Sheraton in Times Sq. Limited in house coffee bar and lobby area seemed unnecessarily loud with music - myself and other guests mentioned to staff to reduce radio volume. Otherwise - staff was friendly and rooms were clean.

This hotel is the absolute best. Location is tops. Rooms are big for NYC. The staff is the so extremely helpful and kind. We have stayed in NY a few times and this was the least expensive hotel we have stayed at as well as our favourite. When we stay in Manhattan this is definitely the only place we will stay from now on. Thank you so much to all the staff especially the front desk! Can’t wait to see you all again.

Second time in this hotel in 2019.Location of the hotel is perfect. View from the lounge and some rooms is awsome.However, I’ve faced some issues with housekeeping:- it happened that the room was not cleaned at 5pm ; this is not what you expect after a day at work or visiting the city;- cleaning could be improved, really...

We don’t go to New York to sit at the hotel. Very outdated, but at 200 (all in) per night, we were happy with this hotel. We have no complaints. If there are other hotels for similar prices, would definitely consider those, but since most of the time is out the hotel this one works for us.

I spent a few days at the Sheraton Tribeca on business earlier this month. First, they put me on the club level which provides a breakfast and happy hour, on the 21st floor of the hotel. The food, service and view were excellent. But the most amazing aspect of there service was when I left the hotel! I used their flat rate car service to the airport and left my credit card in the car. The driver returned it to the hotel and the emailed me immediately. Finally, and what a crazy story, the car service fat-fingered my fee and instead of $55, my card was charged $550! The hotel caught this, and arranged a credit, before I even had to ask. Kudos to Sal and Carlos on staff at the hotel. I simply can’t get over this kind of service, in this day and age. I won’t stay in any other hotel in NYC ever, but the Sheraton Tribeca!

As a frequent traveler for business, I judge hotels by a few simple criteria: Does the Executive Lounge provide a decent breakfast?Is there a shower in the room vs a bathtub?With Marriott - Am I recognized as a Titanium Bonvoy member and offered any sort of upgrade?This hotel fails on all accounts. I have had better breakfasts in a bottom level Springhill or Fairfield, and the evening snacks in the lounge are just as bad. Honestly, don't bother if you must stay here - go outside of the hotel, turn left, and walk 50 feet to get an overpriced but delicious coffee and breakfast from Caffe Bene, or walk the half mile to Bubby's and get some biscuits.Any hotel these days that still has shower curtains should automatically get three stars at best. Especially one that doesn't block the water, and the bathroom floor ends up getting soaked.Staying more than 100 nights in Marriott's each year, I expect to be recognized. Didn't happen here. A tiny room with double beds, and terribly slow elevators for more than $600 per night.Stay elsewhere.

Great location, rooms are clean and functional. Decor could be updated.Our room was facing Canal Street and street noise was loud.Lots of fabulous restaurants and cafes within walking distance.Would stay here again using the ear plugs provided in the room.

This was our first stay in NYC, we were originally booked to stay near central park but changed the reservation to here as it only required half the points. This was a good decision as the Sheraton provided everything we needed. The location is near the subway and only a 15 min walk to world trade center so very accessible. The rooms are small but this isn't an issue in NY. Our room was a patio room on the second floor at the side of the hotel which was quiet so we slept well.We had lounge access on the 21st floor which afforded two hours of snacks and alcohol each evening (5-7pm) with amazing views. Breakfast was also available in the lounge and 24hr hot and soft drinks.We didn't eat in the hotel as there are plenty of quality options locally. If you're wanting a room that's away from the craziness of Times Square but accessible then this is a good choice.

This hotel is located on the edge of Tribeca and Chinatown. The property itself is very nice and the lobby is not too big. There is a restaurant/bar located directly next to the check in desk. The check in staff was very friendly and explained all the hotel has to offer and where the executive lounge is located and the hours for breakfast and happy hour. One great this about this property is that they offer free happy hour in the lounge. That’s very hard to find at a Marriott property in the US. The lounge is small but it has an amazing outdoor patio with great views of midtown. They also have heat lamps for the colder months. Deon who was working in the lounge was great!!! He was a one man show. The lounge gets very crowded and he was there as the bartender, waiter and whatever else you need him to do. He was very quick and efficient and friendly.The rooms are quiet small, typical of NYC, but who stays in their rooms in NYC. There is lots to do around the around and plenty of bars and restaurants. The subway is a few blocks away as well.Definitely check this hotel out if you are in town for work or pleasure.

This hotel is located within walking distance to many great areas and close to three subway lines. The room was small but clean and updated, fine for us. But, the hotel has very thin walls and cheap windows. We initially had a room on an upper floor that faced Canal. It was very noisy - there are approx 3-4 metal plates on the road (from construction) and you hear the “thump thump” of cars driving over the plates non stop 24/7. We asked for a new room after one hour. The new room was in a higher floor but was a connecting room. We were told it was one of their quieter rooms and they’ve not had complaints. But, we heard everything clear as day and had to bang on the neighbours door to quiet them the first night (at 1:30 am). Next night I sent a chat to the hotel bec noise woke me at 3:30 am - no response till the next morning. I could also hear the other neighbours alarms and people walking in the hallway/slamming doors. Doubtful that I would stay here again.

Nelson was a doll. I arrived early in the morning, Nelson went above and beyond to assist me in securing accomodations and helping out a tired traveler. He was just extraordinary. My whole stay was lovely and the hotel staff were very accomodating.Would definitely stay there and thank you to Nelson...stacey

The front of house team really work hard to make sure you are looked after. I needed a quiet room after a hectic trip to Mexico and they nailed it. Thanks guys for a great service and an understanding spirit.

Stayed in a Club level room for a week working in the city. Had access to the Club lounge which was a nice surprise. Breakfast wasn't huge but higher quality than expected so ate here each morning. Was also nice to come by in the evening and have been. Spectacular views from the terrace. Good location near Soho and Chinatown but Canal street is pretty rough.The bar and restaurant were pretty empty the whole time which I think was due to lack of any atmosphere. The gym was decent but small and all the staff were great!

Great property, great location and great service. The team here is service oriented. And the concierge lounge is open on weekends, unlike full-service Marriott hotels. The location is within walking distance of many local restaurants, and far away from the tourist traps of Times Square.

Nice hotel. Small rooms but accommodating. Helpful staff and quickly responds to meet needs or special request. Decent breakfast although it’s not complimentary. Small gathering place near bar. Elevators are slow. Comfortable bed.

Whether you go on business or vacation this is an excellent hotel to stay in NY City. Very good service, tiny but comfortable rooms. Clean. Reasonable rates. This hotel has a club room located on the 21st. floor. Take your lap top and work from there. The terrace is elegant with great view of the city. Don't miss the happy hour there from 5 to 7.

My wife & I recently stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca. Wonderful stay. Sheraton staff were amazing, considerate and very pleasant. Room was great, clean and spacious. View was incredible. Hotel location very close to Chinatown, Little Italy and the subway. Hotel lobby & lounge was welcoming and very comfortable. Will definitely stay again.

This hotel is conveniently located for Soho and Chinatown, but the actual location on Canal street is very down market.The hotel itself is fair but has a number of drawbacks. It is located on a very busy intersection and the traffic noise at night was bad. In addition, one the of the reasons I choose the hotel is that it had a bar and restaurant. Sadly the restaurant was virtually empty the whole time I was there (except at breakfast). The reason, I suspect, is that it lacks any atmosphere (think funeral parlour) and it is over priced. Similarly, the bar seemed expensive and the wine selection was not great. There is a quick take out option for breakfast but again this is overpriced - I would suggest popping to either of the two Starbucks that are 5 minutes away, or the shops next door.On a more positive note, the staff were great!

I have a long connection and booked this hotel to wait it out and nelson I believe was his name at the front desk was amazing! He checked me in really fast and helped with my late check out so that I can recharge after my long flight and before my next one! Hotel and rooms are clean, could not ask for more

This is my second time staying at the Sheraton Tribeca. Just like last year it's a pleasure to stay here. I NEVER had any complaints during my stay. Our Bell Team Guy Carlos Salazar, was OUTSTANDING. We remebered him from last year and ironically he remembered us. Everyday we saw Carlos he made sure that we were ok and that ANYTHING that we needed was taken care of... Carlos came to know us, so there were times it was as if he read our minds and knew ahead of time what we needed and Volia!!! there it was... Thank Carlos.. He is a Keeper... See you next year for My Annual Cousin trip.

Positives:The 5-7pm small snacks and drinks which was perfect after a long day and a good way to socialise. Also the happy hour from 3-7pm, hotel location (close to a few subway stations) and finally the 21st floor terrace for great midtown views.Negatives:The buffet breakfast was frequently under stocked with delays in getting food/drinks replenished - if at all. Also overcrowded at times as it's a small space.Overall:Great hotel and thoroughly recommend especially if you get a good rate.

I showed up after driving five hours to NYC and arrived just after midnight to check in. Hotel found my reservation—but said they “clear” out reservations after midnight as DNA (Did Not Arrive)—they put someone else into my room and they had no rooms available. Really? No warning! Nothing in confirmation stating they would do this! I demanded a refund and night desk manager refused. I had no place to stay (and was unable to find another room anywhere). This hotel is not customer friendly. I called Marriott (i had booked through their web site—and I have elite status). No help whatsoever. Book here at your own peril if you have travel delays—they will give away your reservation, even if prepaid.

Great location for walking to SoHo and Tribeca. Rooms had some rusty metal in bathroom and could use some refreshing. Ate at lobby bar one night and service was not great. Gym had everything you need. Busy hotel -- not great/not terrible.

First off it's in a busy area so getting to the front door was tricky. They need to hire more bell/valet help. The young man was pleasant but appeared to be working alone so we took our bags up. Front desk was great, especially Sal. He was able to accomodate my request for a bigger room being a gold member. The club level king rooms are very small. They do have a large window which helps to not feel too claustrophobic. The website boasts a rooftop lounge area for club level guests which is now open to everyone on weekends making it impossible for club level guests to enjoy. They also moved the club happy hour downstairs to the "dining room". Basically a bare room with tables and chairs put in. Definitely not up to Sheraton standards. We did order food 1 day. The Cuban sandwich was very good. The crepes were not crepes. They were pancakes. The breakfast in the club lounge is disappointing. I've had better at a Residence Inn. The bar in the lobby is nice. I was surprised the bartender didn't know how to make an apple martini! She did make a good chocolate coconut one though. All in all it is a clean hotel with nice people. They just need to put in a little effort to decorate the dining room, up the quality of the club breakfast and give the rooftop back to the people paying extra for the perk.

We walked everywhere...great restaurants, the World Trade Center Memorial, the business meetings we needed to attend. I felt safe and the hotel itself is lovely! The rooms were perfect for resting after the long days we put in as business travelers.

We booked the Sheraton Tribeca Hotel for 4 nights from the 7th August 2019. Our room rate had no restrictions.This was a return visit as we enjoyed our previous stay. I sent an email to the hotel advising them that we were celebrating a special birthday, unfortunately they did not acknowledge receipt of my email.The ground floor needs upgrading. There is an old coffee bar near the bar that is not longer in use. The staff were using it as a meal room. Due to family reasons we had to cancel the last 2 nights of our stay, Friday 9th and Saturday 10th August.I advised your reception desk in person on Friday 9th August at 930am of the cancellation of my last 2 nights and will check out around 12noon on Friday 9th August.The gentleman (Raul) who attended to us advised that it will be fine and I will only be charged for the 2 nights.I checked out at 1130am with Raul and he advised that my account will emailed to me and for 2 nights only. He confirmed the last 4 digits of my credit card.I left my 2 suitcases with the bellman and returned to collect them at 145pm.When i received my account account folio the next day i had found that they had charged me for the night of 9th August for Room "RT716", when in actual fact I checked out on Friday 9th August at 1130am from Room 2006. I was actually back home in Australia when I received my account. I called the hotel from Australia, Saturday 10th August 707pm (New York time) and spoke to Kimberley and Room Supervisor Star. Star advised she will look into the discrepancy.I received another email that evening with the same invoice amount.The following day I received another account folio charging me for a 4 night night stay. 2 nights in room 2006 and 2 nights in room 716. I asked myself, How is this possible ???????It was so difficult to get an email contact address for the hotel. Very frustrating. I finally managed to get an email address for Room Supervisor Star Mc.....So I emailed Star again, this time with a copy of my Flight itinerary and boarding pass to prove I had actually left New York on the 9th August. It felt like I had to prove my innocence. Very uncomfortable. Star replied to my email on the 14th August as follows "Good Morning ,Hope that your having a great day . I have spoken with My manager and she approved for me to give you back one night. As far as the other nights being that we were never made aware that you checked out early unfortunately we wouldn't be able to refund you the rest of the nights. I will send you over a folio with the refund amount . Sorry about the inconvenience and if there is anything else that I can help you with please feel free to reply back to this email. "I thought to myself, I am wasting my time corresponding with hotel over charging me for the 10th August for a room I never stayed in. So they charged me for 3 nights for a 2 night stay. They quite obviously don't believe in customer service or satisfaction. It would be great if I could discuss this discrepancy with the Hotel's General Manager, but unfortunately I am unable to get those contact details.I have used Sheraton Hotels for over 30 years around the world, this experience has left me extremely disappointed.

Going to NYC for 20 years,loved staying @ Sheraton Tribeca very safe,staff was accommodating,helpful. Happy Hour was the best, Roof Top amazing view, food & drinks FREE!! Stay there you will not regret it.

This hotel is unkind and not professional with there customers!!! It is not aceptabel that I was not welcome!!!I hope that there are follow the consulting hotel projets, so there can help more there customers.

Great hotel, very clean and quiet. The staff is just amazing, everyone is friendly, smiling, and very helpful with questions and directions. The location is great as well. you can find different types of foods whether you are looking for cheap or expensive, its all there

I can't express how pleased I am with the quality of service at this hotel. I was greeted with a smile every time I exited or entered the hotel. Raul has an amazing energy which make you feel so welcome. Damon at the bar was so attentive and genuine. When you are traveling alone, it can be tough sometimes. But not this time. I felt so welcome and would definitely return in the future.

The best thing in the hotel was the Bell Team assistance, provided by Carlos Salazar. Everything that I needed, he was ready to help. Great service!The hotel is well located. The premises are old but confortable

This hotel is along Canal st., a short walk away from Little Italy and Chinatown. The hotel is well-maintained with clean rooms and comfortable beds. The elevators were fast. The lobby is comfortable with a restaurant and a bar, but it was very dark with very little natural light penetrating inside, only coming from the main door. I did not see any windows in the lobby. There is a roof top bar at the hotel but we did not get the chance to see it.No complaints on the service. Breakfast was good, food overall was average. There are a lot of good restaurants within walking distance from the hotel.I could stay again.

I was on a girls trip in New York City and I had a great stay at the Sheraton. The customer service was exceptional. Teri helped us when we had problems with our key card. Teri Singh was fantastic with all of our needs.

Visiting NYC on family vacation and the Sheraton Tribeca was wonderful! Clean room, friendly staff and a spectacular view. Teri Singh was extremely delightful and helped with all of our needs. Definitely will be back!

This is probably the hardest review I have ever written. I had to be in NYC for a quick morning meeting and I like to stay in walking distance to events I am speaking at and the Sheraton Tribeca was the perfect location. It is a great business hotel, easy in and out, great staff and the manager wrote me a couple of times to make sure everything was the way I wanted it. Great front desk staff and I had room service twice both times fast and food good. I flew SFO-EWR because this hotel is literally a couple of blocks from where the Holland Tunnel starts and ends. The issue, it was 9/11 and while I arrived around 8 PM I had goosebumps the entire time I was a mile or less from Ground Zero and the lights that night were over powering. I was in SF on 9/11 but the emotions I felt 18 years later being near that hallowed ground were as if it happened all over again, very, very emotional for me and I have to say the hotel staff was prepared and I was not the only person having these feelings. Very high marks at every level of this hotel on a most emotional night and also thank you to the manager who wrote me to make sure things were OK not many people would do that so again highest marks from me.

I can’t praise your staff enough for the wonderful weekend and am very pleased once again with every moment of the great hospitality that they have always welcomed me with . From the front desk check in to late night welcomes. Your staff is definitely at the top of their game . This was my first booking , but my third visit and each and every time they’ve welcomed me as a friend and not just another guest ❤️The room had a great view , Damon at the bar was extremely friendly, Sal always has a smile and will take the time to ask how I’ve been , and David is always right there asking me where I’m heading to tonight :-)My only 1 thing and I wouldn’t say it was big , but my room had no mini fridge . So I wasn’t able to keep my leftovers from all of the amazing restaurants overnight to enjoy the next day . Once again ... I would stay at no other hotel than your facility when visiting NYC ❤️Your staff is the best . Dan Easter Kansas City , Mo (Room 2009)

From when we first walked into this hotel, they made their first priority our satisfaction. For one, the hotel is in a great location. We were walking distance to many metros, China Town, Little Italy, and many more. When we were given our room, we realized we would like a better view of the city. We went and requested it, and they upgraded us within seconds. The room was clean, spacious, and of course had a great view of the city. The hotel itself had an amazing rooftop with music and drinks. The all over vibe was amazing. Carlos on the Bell Team was the cherry on top. He directed us to awesome restaurants, nightlife, made sure we had drinks, and many laughs. He was always there as we entered and exited the hotel, making sure there was nothing we were in need of. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone who would like to enjoy the city with a peace of mind of their accommadations.

If you're Platinum with BoyVoy, don't expect them to roll out the red carped for you at this place. When we checked in, I asked about the possibility of an upgrade and was told: "Here you get a breakfast." No mention of gift of points or other amenities was offered. We were given a smallish room looking over a building. I asked called and asked for a room with a view, and the next day we were changed. In a nutshell: Negatives: No special treatment by staff to BoyVoy Elite members, small rooms, so-so breakfast, expensive for what you get. Positives: Location. Some rooms have great views. Housekeeping staff were friendly and nice. Great view from terrace on the near the club. We will not return to this hotel.

This hotel is in a great location if you are going to be exploring lower Manhattan. We stayed here over the Labor Day weekend and were mostly concerned about the location and were not disappointed. Canal St. itself is not great and be prepared to be accosted by someone every few steps trying to sell you fake pocket books and watches. However, it is easy to walk both north and south. There is a very nice rooftop bar. The two biggest downsides were that our bathroom was super tiny, even by NYC standards. Also, the elevators were incredibly slow. We added 10 minutes to the time we needed to be leaving to account for the length of time we might have to wait. I would also ask for a high floor since there was some road noise.

Dog barking in room next door until 2am. When I called about this, they made me move my room and said they couldn’t open the door to check on the dog.Left items in the first room during the switch that they were unable to recover, including some pretty expensive pants.Bar was the oddest experience, as though they didn’t want to wait on anyone. Realized why afterwards; mandatory 18 percent tip on all bills. Guess they didn’t care to work for more than that.Think I’ll find a new hotel next time given the price.

While the hotel itself is ok, traffic and the steel plates on Canal street means that I cannot get sleep on any of the five nights I am staying there. The sound of cars driving over these plates are awful and go on the whole night!

The rooms were fine and we were comfortable but will not stay here again. Our TV wasn't working properly or connected to the internet. We called and someone came to look at it but couldn't fix it and there was no follow up. The internet is NOT FREE. They advertise complimentary wifi but then we had to pay $10 for 24 hours. Someone came into our room while we were gone and left a cheep $6 bottle of wine. We were concerned as to someone was in our room unannounced. We called and they didn't care or again follow up with as to why there was wine in our room. Just not really friendly or helpful staff. There are plenty more hotels in NY that we will visit next time we are in town.

Stayed in NYC downtown on Canal St. at the Sheraton Tribeca. The staff of this hotel were fantastic -- great customer service, friently, & happy to provide assistance. Great French restaurant around the corner too. The hotel concierge suite was very good with a wonderful outdoor patio and view.

When I tell you this hotel went above and beyond to make sure my 1st experience was my best they did above and beyond. Every time we called they came. Warm smiles day and night. We also had the pleasure of meeting Mr. Carlos Salazar amazing amazing trip advisor. He was very open about any and everything we needed to know. Even enlightened us on a cheaper and quicker way back out to the airport. Rooms spacious and we had an amazing view of the skyline. Make this your one stop shop when choosing a hotel.

During our business trip to the US, I spent three days at this hotel, with my wife. The hotel is very well organized, maintained and clean. Rooms are nice and very comfortable. The sleep quality is excellent. I’ll be back next November!!

We couldn't have picked a better location for our 5 days in New York. We had a warm friendly welcome from the check in staff, who couldn't have been more helpful. Our rooms were more impressive than some of the hotel photos show. Our room was spacious, clean, and nicely decorated. The added bonus of the safe being free, as is WIFI, ironing boards & irons as standard, and tea and coffee making in the room along two large double beds made it a really comfortable stay.We accessed the breakfast from the upstairs breakfast bar. Choice was plentiful and suited most palletes. The bonus was the outside roof terrace that gave spectacular views of Uptown Manhattan. A lovely view at breakfast or of a late night drink.Any enquiries, at reception, were dealt with immediately and efficiently.The location of the hotel is great for accessing everything that New York has to offer. The Subway is less than 5 minutes walk and gets you anywhere in the City. Surrounding the hotel are a great choice of restaurants too. Anything from the Italians in Little Italy, to the Chinese in Chinatown or the bistros of Greenwich Village. All are within walking distance and offer great choice.Despite the location, on a busy New York street, the hotel is very quiet and sleep was no problem.

Of course it is a big chain hotel they would never disappointing you!! :):) Location is fabulous! right on China town where you can find reasonable and tasty foods included Italian. The room is clean and cozy! Big enough the bathroom is too big enough! Clean!then it's not far from Soho Tribecca and the monument for the World trade center memorial.. If you were a good walker you would enjoy this area! as you know China town has all kinds of restaurant and stores!

My wife and I spend about a third of the year in hotel rooms for business and pleasure. I have stayed at many hotels in Manhattan and will stay in the Sheraton Tribeca on my future visits to Manhattan. The hotel is in a great location in lower Manhattan. The rooms are sizeable by Manhattan standards and updated with a nice ambiance. The staff is very friendly and accommodating form the front desk to the valet and the housekeeping team. The restaurant is excellent and has a reasonably priced menu. We loved the rooftop lounge on the two weekends we were there. The fitness center is very adequate to get your workout in. TMMMJM

I've stayed here before, and tried some of the new ones. I like this place. Ciara P was very helpful and professional in setting up my stays. The location of this hotel is excellent. The rooms are very nice and a nice size.

I had a surprisingly great stay at this hotel.For Manhattan, my expectations were low. I arrived pretty late via the Subway - around 11-11:30 p.m. I booked last minute and got a great rate.Check in was quick and efficient.The hotel lobby was very nice and modern.My room was surprisingly big for Manhattan! While the room was very slightly dated, I had plenty of space around the bed to move around as well as a decent view of the city. No complaints!There’s a subway stop around the corner from the hotel - you don’t even need to cross the street! There’s also a pretty good deli next door.The street the hotel is on isn’t the best, but within a couple blocks, you can reach Soho or several other subway lines.After check out, I was able to hang out in the lobby for a few hours, enjoy my bagel from the deli next door, and get some work done (utilizing the free WiFi) before catching my train.I did not have a chance to visit the restaurant or bar.Overall, I enjoyed my stay and will definitely consider this hotel on my next visit to NYC!

Stay was good enough for me to take the time to go on Trip Advisor and let others know that this hotel is very clean, staff is great and it has a fantastic location to some great restaurants as well as being a just a couple STEPS from the Subway. Concierge Level is fantastic! They have a great Terrace plus the Lounge fr breakfast and happy hour have a great view too!!

Sherritan TribecaBooked this hotel for its 4 star status, location and club room facility. You’d miss the entrance if you weren’t looking closely. Modern built hotel. Nice foyer. Staff in reception helpful. We weren’t pestered by the porter wanting to take our cases, I’m not into the embarrassing them waiting for a tip afterwards thing. Our check in was 3pm but the room wasn’t ready for over an hour despite the receptionist telling us it would be 10 minutes, after an hour it was another 10 minutes! However the receptionist was lovely, sincerely apologising & offering us 2 free bar drinks each! We liked her, she did her job well.Our room was on the 21st floor and the receptionist assured us we had a good room with good city views. Well we liked the room & the view was terrific, looking towards the Hudson River. Minuses of the room include being cramped near the wardrobe, the TV could do to be wall mounted instead of being on top of a wooden plinth on a consul table & the fact we could hear the lift when awake. We slept well & the lift didn’t waken us! If things like that disturb you then ask before you book or mention on your booking not to be near the lift. Handy for the subway, area felt safe.Would we go again, probably but so many other hotels to try.

Great location, close to subways and walking distance to restaurants and shops. Comfortable, clean rooms and friendly service. Book a Club level room to enjoy a nice complementary breakfast and sundowners on the rooftop every night. Special mention must be made of fabulous staff member Deon Simpson who runs the sundowner bar ( all by himself) like clockwork!

This is our fifth time staying here on the club level. We can not say enough good things about this hotel. The rooms are amazing and the view is just gorgeous. We could sit out on the deck all day :) The location is perfect because its so close so shopping and great food... and just a subway ride from Time Square. We will be back over an over again....

I was going to stay across the river at a Bonvoy property in Brooklyn, but a local recommended this hotel instead. It was an excellent choice. The Sheraton (Now Bonvoy) Tribeca puts you at the intersection of Soho, Chinatown, Tribeca and Little Italy meaning there's something happening 24/7 and you have your pick of great eateries and nightspots. In addition, the property itself was comfortable, the rooms were well sized by NYC standards and the rooftop lounge gave a fabulous view of the Manhattan skyline. The staff was friendly and helpful. I'd definitely stay here again.

Centrally located, nice staff, clean rooms. I was impressed with the quality of the stay. Nice rooftop bar especially in the summer. Club access isn't really worth it from what I can see. Nice downstairs bar area.

Nice hotel - the staff here was fantastic. They helped us with everything, including tips on how to get around the city quickly. The hotel is in a perfect spot - close to everything - within walking distance of the World Trade Center and Little Italy. Many restaurants in the area to choose from. Can easily navigate the subway system from here if going further out. The room has a safe to lock your valuables. Beds were great and room was clean and air conditioned with a great view of Empire State Building. Enjoyable 3 night stay.

Average hotel in Tribeca on a very busy street. Pay attention when crossing the street, it was constantly jammed with cars. Walls are thin - we could hear the baby next door crying. Tiny rooms. Open the door and you are practically on the bed. Only one office chair for seating in the room. Breakfast lounge is way too small and cramped, making for an unpleasant morning experience. There is a nice balcony area off the lounge which was nice. Music blasting in the lobby area 24/7 is not necessary. Would not stay here again.

We stayed for nine nights during early July including the 4th in a Executive Room on the 19th Floor. Overall the staff were very helpful and always offering a greeting and advice when requested. The Executive Lounge on 21 was full most mornings and nights due to the holiday period. Due to special events the evening drinks were served in the lobby restaurant over the holiday weekend. The lounge staff were always polite and helpful. Guests sometimes pushed them a bit given the number of people wanting to be served but they did try their best to accommodate all. When the numbers reduced service was excellent. Food choices were limited but overall reasonable variety and quality. Was great to be able to get a water and soda whenever required.As expected the room was not the largest in the world but good enough for our needs. Great views of Empire State Building and Times Square area from room with better view of three sides from the Executive Lounge Balcony. The location was great for local restaurants in Little Italy and Chinatown with a good coffee shop, Italian and Japanese restaurants within a two minute walk of the hotel. Also great takeaway pizza place for late night snacks within 50 metres. Access to the subway was excellent for visits to Chelsea, uptown and Brooklyn.

Spent 2 nights (Fri/Sat) in a King Patio room on the 2nd floor. Normally, I don’t like to stay on lower floors due to the street noise of sirens, honking cars, etc.. But the patio rooms are on the back side of the hotel overlooking a side street, with very little traffic.The patio rooms are the way to go, if you can get one, there are only 4 of these rooms. While the room was small with little space to move around, the patio was very large with seating for 4. I think the patio was bigger than the room. It was nice to have a private outdoor space just to myself to relax after a day of activities. Just wish there was a table on the patio.  The room consisted of a standard bathroom with shower, king bed, wardrobe for storage, safe, desk with chair, and TV. The room was a bit dated and could use a refresh, however, the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was adequate with excellent water pressure in the shower. One issue we discovered is that the thermostats are off by about 10 degrees, we set the a/c to 63 get the room cool. I noticed in the concierge lounge the thermostat was set at 60 and the lounge was comfortable. The concierge lounge is accessible 24/7 with access to a rooftop patio that faces uptown. In the evening, a bar was setup on the rooftop. In the morning, we had breakfast which consisted of eggs, sausage, potatoes, toast, yogurt and pastries. It was a bit crowed in the morning, with folks waiting for seats. We ate around 8 am. The hotel is conveniently located near multiple subway lines. Several restaurants within walking distance. The price was very reasonable at $190 a night and no destination fee. I tend be more price conscious in large city given the amount available hotels. I would stay here again, if the price is right.

Stayed at the hotel for 6 nights in June. The room was small (as you'd expect for the location), but clean and properly cleaned everyday. One bottle of free water only which I find quite stingy in comparison to hotels in Asia/Europe. The truly disappointing part was during and after checkout. I was on a business trip hence requiring my invoice for claims. I agreed for it to be sent via email. I also confirmed with them upon check out that they had my Marriott Bonvoy membership number - they confirmed this and reassured me points would be credited 1-2 weeks later. The invoice never arrived, my emails were not answered and so I had to go back after 4 days to follow up on my invoice. It is three weeks now, I am coming back from various business trips back-to-back, and I haven't received any loyalty points either. As I did my claims I checked the invoice and it didn't state my membership number leaving me to follow up with Marriott Bonvoy to get them credited. Again, hotel was fine, location is great, but service was disappointing.

Nice size room, comfie bed, so much street noise even on 11th floor. Gonna try ear plugs tonight. But hey, it’s NYC, right, what can you expect? No blankets or comforter but it’s a heat wave so that might make sense but I like the weight of a blanket. Friendly staff, 24 hour .99 cent pizza on the block and nice bodega too. Great price for clean, comfie room. Nothing unique or special but gets the job done. Valet parking $65-$75 a night which was less than I’ve paid.

We just returned from a weekend stay at the hotel. Our first time at this location because we wanted to explore this part of NYC instead. Location is excellent with lots of shopping and restaurants all within walking distance. However the hotel is really average. The King bed was too soft and lack support and the covers literally comprised of 3 sheets. We requested to change our room to 2 Queen beds instead the following day with the hope of a better supporting smaller bed. Also the pillows are totally soft and flat when you lay on them. When I called to request for a harder pillow , I was told their pillows are all the same. So needless to say, we did not sleep well at all for the 2 nights that we spent at the hotel. I also cannot say the room was very clean as I found 2 long hairs that we stucked on bathroom walls . It was not a pleasing find.

Stayed here for world pride. I would NOT recommend this Marriott. The lounge was slammed with not enough people able to work it properly. The gentleman who served the wine/beer was beyond rude and made it seemed like the owned the hotel, he was in charge and he was NOT afraid to let people know. His customer service was disgusting. The elevators also took a solid 15 minutes sometimes 25 to come to you. The hotel is tired and needs a face-lift.

As a lifetime Marriott Platinum member, I decided to give this hotel a try as I had stayed in so many other Marriott NYC properties over the years. The location is great, the hotel and service was a major let down. We had two significant issues during our four night/five day stay. The first issue was our room AC did not work. Our room was a good 10-15 degrees warmer than the hallway. The first night we were tired from our travels and slept ok. The second night we both woke up in full sweats as room kept getting warmer, We visited the front desk the next morning and we were told it would be fixed or we would be moved to another room. Later that day when we came back to the hotel and it was not fixed. A new front desk person then told us she had no record of our morning report and that she had no other room for us. She sent up maintenance and he played with it and then said not to open the curtains the rest of our stay. We hardly slept the next two nights, we made an effort to not stay in the room at all during the day. It was miserable, I made two reports to the front desk and never heard back until I filled out a random survey after the stay and then they said here is 6,000 points for not sleeping. The second issue was the club lounge. They could not handle the crowd and made no adjustments, Two of the four mornings they ran out of hot breakfast an hour before closing. They were consistently out of bottle water and soft drinks. The entire experience in this hotel was poor. With so many Bonvoy options in NYC we recommend you skip this one.

We had a wonderful room 2020. Amazing view of the Empire State Building and city. I have to give the staff a heads up. Our room was not ready when we arrived but Sal Angioletti the front office supervisor let me look at some of the rooms that were and as soon as I saw our room I knew we had scored a great room. He took so much time out of his busy day to make me happy and I could see he did that for all the guests he helped - it was wonderful to be made to feel at home in a hotel we were about to spend the next ten days. I cannot say enough about how helpful the staff were (especially Sal) they helped in so many ways and everyone was so pleasant. My only complaint is that the Buffett in the lounge was pretty limited as was the Buffett in the restaurant however the staff in the lounge worked hard to keep it stocked and keep a busy lounge flowing smoothly. I have been a Marriott member a long time and most of the lounges supply more options for hor’dourves and breakfast. The other issue was the fire alarm went off at 9:00 am and there wasn’t an announcement made quickly so people were confused as to what to do and the elevators were shut down (as they should be) but still not working at 11:00 long after it was determined there was no emergency (which was the only time I regretted being on the 20th floor.) I would say the Buffett is a small issue and it’s not often an alarm goes off so neither would stop me from staying here again!

We have just returned from a 14 night stay at the Sheraton TriBeCa. From the moment we checked in it was all positive. My wife had emailed them previously and told them this was in effect our honeymoon combined with our wedding anniversary as we had been unable to take a honeymoon when we got married. We were very kindly upgraded to a higher floor with club access and a fantastic view out over the city to the Empire State Building. How awesome is that for a first visit to New York!Check in staff were lovely and welcoming and very helpful. Our room was great. Not huge but certainly big enough for our needs and was clean and tidy. Only thing I’d say was missing was a fridge. Especially as the weeks we were there the temperature was between 28 and 34 degrees. But other than that we could not fault the room at all. As part of our upgrade we had breakfast included in the lounge on the 21st floor. What a wee gem this place was. Breakfast was great with a pretty good selection of food and drinks and to top it off aRooftop terrace with fantastic views of the city and the Empire State Building. This lounge and terrace also has a happy hour every night between 5 and 7 with drinks and snacks and a bar out of the terrace on a Friday and Saturday night. Nothing nicer than a cold drink sitting out on the rooftop on a nice warm summer night with views of New York City all lit upThe Location Of The Hotel on Canalstreet was perfect too. Close to a host of Subway stations for the various lines on the subway made travelling anywhere easy. Also situated just outside Chinatown, Little Italy and Soho making allOf these places accessible with just a short walkEvelyn from housekeeping was fantastic. Very friendly and helpful she kept our room spotless and kept us well well supplied with water and the usual toiletries and towels etc. A real credit to the SheratonCheckout was easy and again the staff were helpful. We had to check out at 12 but our flight was not until11 that evening. They stored our luggage for us in a secure room and this was no issue for them. After we went some last minute sightseeing we spent the time in the hotel bar. The doorman arranged a car to collect us from the hotel and took us straight to terminal 4 at JFK airport taking all the stress of getting there with out cases out of our handsDownsides to the Sheraton? None as far as we were concerned. All positive. We wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again and would highly recommend it

Near Chinatown and its many restaurants. Close to many subway lines.Club lounge is too small when the hotel is full. It was understaffed over the busy 4th of July weekend. Josh did his best to take care of the breakfast crowd and stayed pleasant, but we would expect better staffing from management. It has a small rooftop terrace with a fantastic view of upper Manhattan.

Great hotel. Close to the subway stations. Very friendly staff. Reception staff greeted us every time we entered or left the hotel. Rooms are comfortable and well maintained. I would highly recommend this hotel for your next visit to New York.

Sal, Raul, and Angelique were extremely kind, professional, and helpful! We were treated like gold and it made us feel so welcome. They even offered to hold out bags while we went to the happy hour and brought them up to our room right away. They all deserve a raise and we’ll definitely be back! The rooftop is also gorgeous.

Great location, with easy access to the subway. Lots of great restaurants in walking distance. Highly recommend the Club Level rooms. The actual rooms are no different (I don’t think), but the use of the Club Level Lounge for a complimentary breakfast and happy hour each day was excellent.

It was a pleasure to stay at this hotel and we will surely return. It was our anniversary and they not only selected a room with the best views of NYC, they also left us a complimentary bottle of wine in the room. they are details that show that a hotel cares about its customers. we will always have this memory of the marriot club! Thank you!

Sheraton SOHO Canal St Seemed like a good price for a small room until we went to dinner at the Roxy around the corner which has fabulous food and atmosphere. There rooms are more reasonable but we didn’t actually see one.As happens often, pictures don’t show size very well. Sheraton SOHO service was excellent as we requested early housekeeping 4 days and it was done, although Sunday Pride parade day it wasn’t. The shower and a/c in room 1720 was excellent. One of the few rooms where the A/C was quiet, efficient and didn’t blow directly on you.No dresser drawers just tiny cubby in narrow upright closet. Difficult to organize your stuff after a couple days.Comfy non squeak king bed.

Never tried a Sheraton until the Marriott/Starwood merger and wanted a place close to Soho so gave this this property a try. 2pm check SAT check in, our room wasn’t ready so we dropped off bags and went out. 6 pm return 16th floor standard king room with bland lower east side view, room was small but spotless and toiletries are nice, didn’t get any upgrade but Marriott Platinum gave us lounge access which was a big plus. Free beer/wine (no chardonnay) and nice substantial breakfast next morning, since guests are able to buy into the lounge expect it to be crowded. The subway is at back of hotel and Soho is a 5 min walk. I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

The room was decent size for the price. View from the room was great, same from the rooftop bar. Staff at check in and check out was helpful and nice. The floor in the room felt kind of dirty and the comforter was in need of replacement. Something seemed off about the bed and on the morning we checked out I realized it was the horrible condition of the comforter. The fluff inside of it was all worn down and almost nonexistent. I was pretty surprised they would put that on the bed. Second picture is of the comforter held up to the sunlight, which made my wife and I jump out of the bed.

Our room with the view to the city was fantastic, the staff is nice, but I have to mention that the margarita pizza is disappointing related with the price/time and room service; without this I had an incredible experience.

Having status with Marriott there is concierge Lou he access which is for the upstairs rooftop! Beautiful views weather permitting. There is also a cocktail hour in the evening which I believe is for all guests. The concierge lounge can all be accessed for a daily fee (unsure of the amount!) There are no microwaves or refrigerators in the rooms. I’m sure they can be requested. The lobby is nice and has a restaurant and bar within it. This hotel has a little sandwich and pizza shop next door that also makes excellent fresh pressed juices! MAX Restaurant ( 134 W Broadway) is a short walk and delicious Italian food! Lulu lemon and Drakes OVO United States store are located on Bond St. which is within walking distance. I’d like to acknowledge Angelique and Star - both ladies work the front desk and were extremely kind and helpful!

Nice hotel in a very trendy part of the city. We usually stay in Brooklyn or mid town, but tried something different this time. Lots of shopping and great restaurants very close. SoHo has a ton of things to see. Just around the corner from the subway terminal where you can get to uptown or downtown and/or transfer anywhere. Nice bar and restaurant on the property too. Rooms were spacious and quiet for a weekend. Thumbs up!

So, we stayed in an upgraded room for more money that was smaller than you can ever imagine. But, for the money, we had an outdoor patio. Fast forward to the outdoor patio. Cigarette butts, trash and dirty floor. The least they could have done was clean the place up! Shame on you Sheraton Tribeca. As a loyal SPG fan, there is no way I would come here again. Also, if you are over 50 years old, you will be totally invisible here. Again, shame on you Sheraton Tribeca.

I stayed here over Thanksgiving a few years back ad found myself here again for a quick trip for work. The staff is friendly and the location is convenient. Very close to some great Chinese food in Chinatown. The Rooms: Rooms are what you expect for a Sheraton. Clean, standard and well kept. They charge more to face the city, otherwise you'll be facing the US Post Office building. The Hotel: There's not much too the hotel other than a rooftop bar and a little place for coffee. The lobby is pretty straight forward and doesn't have much for entertainment.My only concern was my bags were stored in a door near the main entrance. I noticed at one point the door was unattended and luggage was exposed to the street. Kind of felt weird that anyone could walk in off the street and snatch something. Maybe they've fixed this by now? Overall I recommend this place if you're just looking to have a nice place to stay and a clean room.

I would gladly recommend this hotel to all my friends because of the awesome roof top, and the only reason I'm not giving five points is because the rest of the hotel is quite underwhelming. We paid for a club level room which comes with access to the roof top terrace and a free "bar" every afternoon. If you are a club level guest, breakfast is also included. The price was pretty high, but we ate and drank enough for it to even out. The most awesome thing about the roof top wasn't the free drink and snacks, but the amazing view of Manhattan. People pay good money for that kind of view, and there we were, having free drinks and enjoying said view. I suspect the club level rooms are bigger than the rooms in the rest of the hotel. This was very nice as it allowed us to spend some time in the room when we needed rest. We had a great time at the hotel because we had club level rooms, but the rest of the hotel was unimpressive. The reception lounge was cold and uninviting and there weren't really that many comfortable places to hang out on the first floor. There was a dining room that served breakfast, but I never saw any people in there. It just seems that the hotel focuses mostly on their Club guests. At first I thought the location of the hotel was quite far from everything, but the VIEW makes it all worth it. It only takes about 25 minutes to walk to the cooler nearby neighborhoods.

The Sheraton brand is rarely my first choice but this property was great. Fun roof top lounge. Fantastic location that was in the heart of Tribeca and near soho. The rooms were small but nice and the staff was great.

Sheraton Tribeca is one of my favorite hotels in NYC. I absolutely love it (especially the roof top club). The service is always perfect. The rooms are larger than your typical NYC hotel. The subway station is just minutes away.

This hotel was very clean, well maintained, and conveniently located for walking or the subway.This staff was very helpful from the moment I walked through the threshold of the hotel until my departure. I stayed for 4 nights.The bellmen were helpful in holding my bags while my room was being readied. They also asked me each time I departed if I needed a car or help with transportation. The front desk greeted me each time I returned. A man cleaning the elevator was friendly and welcoming and insisted on stopping his task until my ride was complete. There was also another man putting down a fresh mat near the elevator prior to the start of a rain storm.
