The concierge was wonderful in giving recommendations and directions. And we couldn’t have made it with out David! He got us rides so quickly, carried our heavy boxes and made sure our packages were safe and in our hands at the time we needed them. David and the other guys made the customer service at this hotel incredible.

I stayed in 10th of 4 and 5 stars hotels all over the world , for business and for pleasures and this is one of the poorest and the most disappointing oneWe are staying at a club room (highest category) it's very small and crowded (much much smaller than the size mentioned in Expedia) and poorly equipped..I'ts noisy and you hear the corridor as if it's inside the room. The free breakfast at the lounge is not some thing to write home about. House keeping always forget something and you have to call them and ask them to bring it and more...I would expect for more from the Sheraton Brand.not recommended at all.

Second time I've stayed at this hotel. Both times we were exhibiting at a trade show. We always have so many boxes coming in and at the end of the show going out. Many of them come up to the room to be reorganized and sent back down again. The bell staff are unbelievable! They are so helpful and never seem to get tired of all the heavy lifting and detailed package movement. Special thanks to Dave and Fery for taking such good care of us during out stay!!

We stayed at this hotel for the Indie Beauty Expo. The hotel was clean and nice. What was really amazing was the bellman, David. He helped us tape up our boxes from the show and he dropped them off at UPS for us. I could not get over how helpful he was. I would definitely choose to stay here again!Great location close to shopping in Soho and lots of great restaurants nearby.

Used to live in NYC and have always hated paying for a hotel when I visit. This one is reasonable for the city price-wise and worth paying to have club access/roof access/wifi included. Great views from the rooms on club level and the roof etc. Staff was always super friendly. Breakfast was much more substantial than we expected with eggs and sausage in addition to the usual continental fare. The communal areas of the hotel could have been cleaner, but it was very busy and probably hard to stay on top of at all times. Thin walls so you could hear the 4 am drunk tourists coming in at night, but that's just rude travelers and we were next to the elevator. Would request a room further away next time. Overall great stay. Short block to the E train to the airport for those who don't want to take a cab/car. Canal street will probably always be a meh part of the city, but being directly above tribeca and below soho with every train stop nearby makes this super convenient.

We checked in early and were given a room right away along with an upgrade to Club level when I told the young man at the front desk that it was my daughter's birthday. I am so sorry that I can not remember his name as he could not have been any friendlier. Our room was a little on the small side but clean and comfortable. My only negative would be that the walls are a little thin.The Club Lounge has beautiful views and a nice breakfast. The location of the hotel itself is ideal! Right by the Canal Street subway station and a stone's throw from lots of shopping in SoHo. Would definitely stay here again!

I was lucky enough to score a nightly rate of $160 for a king bed suite. The room was a great size, I had amazing views. Staff were always friendly and helpful. I would however not pay $300 a night for this room (I was travelling alone). But was very impressed with the price considering that I was staying here over July. Location wise it’s near two subway stations which gives you the ACE (closest) and JNQR line which takes you uptown or down to financial district in a flash. This is my 5th time to New York and I can say it was hands down the best hotel I have stayed at so far (again helped with the price being so low)

Staying for four nights. Bed comfy and good location. Some excellent nearby bars and restaurants. Bar service poor, gin and tonic a challenge. Room service poor, no bath towels. Would not stay again. Normally stay in Hilton hotels was expecting something better from the Sheraton, disappointed.

What can I say ... rooms are perfect for pleasure or business ... views are spectacular. Staff is right on top of their game ... location location location and a club level which can’t be beat for outdoor view ma if Manhattan. I consistently give the Sheraton Tribeca all stars.

Go for the Club levels - upper floorsThey come with many perks:Access to the terrace facing uptown (fabulous view on the Empire State Building)Free wifi - yeah, I know, wifi should be free for any accomodation in any hotel...Free breakfast - delcious French pastriesFree evening snacks and wine - again with this awesome view from the terraceAnd if you’re lucky enough your room too will be with the same views.

The hotel is modern and clean. Walking distance to most of the sites in lower Manhattan.The concierge was excellent. He found a cigar bar for me within walking distance of the hotel. On the day I was leaving he flagged down a cab for me in a downpour.The one negative was the breakfast buffet. It was $20,00 with taxes. While the pancakes and bacon were great, the scrambled eggs were two different colors of yellow. Do yourself a favor and go next door to Tribeca Bagels if breakfast does not come with your room.

I really enjoyed my stay at Sheraton Tribeca !All staff members are very professional and friendly. Check in was smooth and welcoming and I chose to upgrade to a Club room, being able to enjoy the nice city view from the Club terrace. Amazing at sunset !Rooms are large and they are equipped well with all amenities you expect at a Sheraton. Very comfortable bed and linens!Very good cleaning and friendly housekeeping staff.I loved the location with only 10 min walk to SoHo and just 1 min walk to the Subway station taking you to Midtown in approx 20 min. I can recommend this hotel for both business and pleasure travels to NYC.

My wife and I stayed the weekend at Sheraton Tribeca and we had an absolute phenomenal time. The staff was extremely pleasant which made the weekend just more enjoyable. The terrace was very calm and relaxing with an amazing view of the city. The manager, Mairovi went above and beyond to make our stay as perfect as possible.

We really enjoyed our two week stay here. The front staff were friendly and accomodating to our requests. We stayed on the 19th floor Club Room with a great view facing west, overlooking Canal Street and Tribeca. Our King room was very spacious, well appointed and had excellent WiFi. The Club Lounge is very good, providing a light breakfast, evening snacks and drinks. It has stunning views of the Empire State Building from the terrace and is accessibleto members 24/7.Excellent location - well served by a number of different subway lines, and is an easy walk to pretty much everywhere below 14th Street.Overall: great value hotel with nice rooms, great club lounge facilities and very friendly staff. We'll be back.

My daughter and I have visited NYC for the past three years for her birthday. This year, we chose to stay in the Tribeca area to be within walking distance to many different attractions. This location is WONDERFUL! There are so many great places to eat within walking distance and so many things to do close by. The hotel is clean, the staff are super friendly, and just in the perfect location. The rooms were nice size for a NYC hotel and the bathrooms were great. I highly recommend staying at the Sheraton and will be booking this same hotel when we return next year!

Hubby and I arrived in NYC to celebrate our anniversary. The trip may have been a disaster but Sal and his team totally gave us a most enjoyable experience and took all the stress off.Our initial flight was delayed by storms so we arrived at the Sheraton a day late and somewhat grumpy. Upon checking in we found a most unfortunate situation in our room. Upon bringing this up at the from desk Sal was more than understanding and did everything to make it right, although he had no available rooms to move us to he did have one free for a few hours which he graciously allowed us to get cleaned up in , even though it meant more housekeeping for his facility, the next day he made sure to promptly move us , even offering to help move the bags. He left a personal message before leaving his shift to ensure we were happy and looked after. The cheerfully faces and genuine warm welcomes from all members of the staff as we came and went throughout the weekend made us completely forget our bungled journey from in getting there. We were even given complimentary drinks for our anniversary. The hotel has fantastic location, great rooftop patio but it's the staff that will bring us back!!!

This is my fifth stay at the Sheraton in Tribeca - the first part of this particular trip I first stayed at the Mondrian Park Ave and decided mid-way through that I needed to go back to our faithful favorite in Tribeca. One large tip: ALWAYS spend the extra money to stay on the business floor. Why? Because you get access to the rooftop that not only has incredible panoramic views of NYC but also offers a quiet respite after a long day. There are unlimited snacks, water, coffees, teas and sodas available to you there throughout the day and night - and a breakfast spread in the morning. This is also with NO additional cost. The best part though is the rooftop happy hour that offers wine, beer and cheese for several hours as the sun sets. After spending $20 for a drink most places - especially in Tribeca or the neighboring Soho - you will be delighted to enjoy a few beverages with this particular view for “free” ... and nice wines at that. Deon - who has been there for nine years - is phenomenal during the Happy Hour. The rooms are pleasant but pretty standard. The staff is very kind and quite attentive in my experience. I have thoroughly enjoyed that I have always been given the same room each time I’ve stayed - I’m not sure if that’s coincidental but it feels very comfortable every time I arrive. Finally I highly recommend 5 Boroughs pizza across the street if you are looking for a cheap but delicious snack. This neighborhood offers endless possibilities. Enjoy!

I had 3 different stays within a short amount of time planned at this Sheraton, including one I had booked for my parents. Overall, I found it ok but below what I expect from a SPG/Marriott hotel at that price point, and apart from the lounge access I didn’t feel like my platinum status was recognized. The service was a sloppy, and employees were doing the bare minimum while making you feel like they were doing you a huge favor when they were just doing their job. For instance in 2 of the 3 checkin occurrences, there was no shower gel in the room when we entered the room. I also asked for them to bring and prepare the bedding on the couch for the one night that I had planned to sleep in my parents’ room, but I had to ask 3 different times for them to only bring the bedding to the room and not even prepare the bed. There were a couple more instances where service was lacking but let’s move on to other annoyances: elevators take forever in that hotel (it can take more than 5 minutes to get to the lobby or the lounge), and it just feels a bit old in general. The rooms are small but that’s ok, I’ve never had a huge room in a New York hotel. The breakfast is also disappointing, very few options and the ingredients don’t seem to be of the highest quality. On a more positive side, the location is very convenient to visit the city, and right by a metro station. The happy hour from 5:30 to 7:30 for platinum members is nice and the terrace is great when the weather is good enough.

We stayed at the Maxwell the first part of our trip, which is located uptown. For the second part we stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca. Nelson & Luis are indeed a great asset to this hotel, They were beyond helpful and wonderful! The room was clean, king size bed and great view of the Empire State Building from our room. They have the green program which we participate in. The hotel and room where wonderful, its the area getting to and from the hotel that is questionable, especially at night.Lots of homeless people and drunk/drugged persons along the sidewalk coming up to and when leaving the hotel. Made us uneasy several times. The location is a 8 or so minute walk into Soho, which is great for the shopping and the restaurants. I personally prefer staying uptown and using the subway to get to Soho for the days I want to visit there, but I doubt I would stay in this hotel again. Personally just preferred the Uptown hotels area for staying at.

Stayed there for 4 nights booked two rooms for my self and kids , as a SPG gold member they checked me into the smallest two rooms in the hotel It was my worst experience dealing with a hotel manger , requested a pay upgrade for rooms that were available online for purchase yet Front desk manger KK declined every request she was very rude and non understandable , very rigid when it comes to dealing with guest , she will definitely benefit from customer service course that may improve her communication skills , on the other hand all other front desk staff were great Breakfast ends at 11 am , I was present at 10:45am they claimed that the chief left and this will not be able to provide breakfast

Room was good, Nelson and Luis the overnight front desk staff, were amazing, they went out of their way to be very helpful to very tired traveller. They made us feel very happy that we chose the Sheraton TriBeCa. Will recommend this Hotel to others, because of their friendly, helpful manner. Keith and Sandra 507

Nelson & Luis were awesome! The hotel was beautiful and I’m a great spot. The morning buffet was not impressive but if included is an easy choice. Close to shopping and trendy areas. Near to subway too.

We booked this hotel to get together with old college friends. it has an excellent location in TriBeCa with a lot of nearby restaurants and bars. Service was extremely pleasant and helpful, breakfast was very good, and the room was very comfortable. It was overall a very good experience, I am a little baffled by a few negative reviews I saw before I stayed there

Carlos in the baggage area as well as Nora at the bar were absolutely accommodating and super helpful! Carlos helped us arrange a ride, made great recommendations on places nearby for dinner. The hotel has been great so far.

As soon I walked onto my floor there was multiple people sitting on the floors on the hallway on their laptops and talking to each other is if it were college dorms. Not sure what that was about. I asked to change my room because of the noise... still waiting... 30 mins into my stay I get a knock on my door to get a shade put into my room. Front desk did NOT notify me of this. They left my room because they did not have the part to install it. 10 mins after that (WHILE IN THE RESTROOM) they just walk back into my room WITHOUT KNOCKING and I come out to 3 of their contracted workers in my room. Not even hotel staff. Room was clean, bed was comfortable. Only reason they get 1 star.

We had a great stay at this hotel. Its centrally located, 5-10 min walk to the subway, within walking distance to the shopping district in Soho (lower manhattan), restaurants in Little Italy and China Town. When we arrived in New York there was a heat wave and the hotel had an amazing aircondition which we appreciated. Our room was big and spacious for tow people with big suitcases and lots of shopping bags. The room, linen and bathroom was clean.The hotel has a roof top bar which had happy hour (free drinks & snacks) between 5 & 7pm, fabulous bonus.The WiFi works everywhere in the hotel.We loved the hotel gym, which we used. Its not big, it has a few equipment and gets busy if you dont go early in the morning.The hotel offered cold breakfast (muffins, croissants, cereals & yoghurt) at the rooftop restaurant. We preferred a warm breakfast (eggs, bacon, sausage, fruit etc) which they serve at the restaurant downstairs. They served the same type of eggs (scrambled) everyday. We also had complimentary water in our rooms everyday.I would stay here again!

We had such an amazing time with Felitta!! She is so professional and welcoming! She made our time here truly pleasant! Thanks Felitta, can’t wait for you to move up in the ranks! Youre awesome!!! The hotel room was so clean and the staff was very accommodating.

The hotel is tired and needs an overall refresh. As an SPG well traveled Platinum member, I was not given an upgrade and made due with a connecting room (could hear tv in the adjoining room) on a high SPG preferred floor. The bed (photos attached) was lumpy with deep indents (photos attached) but the room was clean. No refrigerators in the room (disappointing) and the bathroom is well worn but clean and functional. The most attractive aspect of this hotel is its location. When you walk out the front doors - to the left is Tribeca, to the right is Chinatown and Soho is in front of you. And the rooftop club lounge - there is a fantastic outdoor space attached but the lounge itself (food/decor) is mediocre and small. They do have sodas, water, coffee available and a ho-hum breakfast. I suggest getting food and a bottle of wine and eating on the outdoor rooftop. I would stay here again purely for the location and relatively decent price for a Manhattan hotel.

Alexis from the front desk was exceptional. Alexis was very professional, she handled me with care, attentive to my needs and went above and beyond to make my stay more comfortable. I appreciate Alexis.

The Sheraton Tribeca has it all if you are able to find a price that pleases you for the Club levels.Location: perfect to visit NYC.Half way between UpTown and Wall St. With a subway station right around the corner.The area surrounding the hotel is very quiet, no noise at night which is very unique.The Club:Free breakfast, free snacks in the evening, with wine. And free Wifi - ok, I agree with you that Wifi should be free in any and all hotels...The view from the terrasse of the Club: imagine an unobstructed view on the Empire State buildingThe team:Everyone was so nice with us. Ok, the bartender was not a very smiling lady but she was the exception.

I have stayed here several times for work. I usually don't have any problems. At one point, they were updating their key card system and struggled to get me the right kind of card for my floor, but we got it worked out.The elevators are not the fastest. From the lobby there usually isn't a long wait, but from your floor you may need to buffer in some time.Service in the restaurant is fine, the food is pricey but tastes good.The location on Canal St is convenient, but I don't love having to walk down Canal to get anywhere so I cross over into SoHo as quickly as possible. During my last visit, there was something going on at the radio studio next door and people were lined up for a few hours waiting for a glimpse of some celebrity. I was several floors up, but the noise was still considerable. The room is small but comfortable, toiletries are nice, and the spaces are all clean. If you can get it for a good price, it is a good hotel.

We visit New York a few times a year and the Sheraton Tribeca has become our New York address. Immediately across Canal from the entrance is SoHo and immediately to the rear is Tribeca. Two of our favorite neighborhoods. Within 2 blocks is access to every major subway line with Greenwich Village and the Theater District just short rides away. Over the last decade or so, we’ve stayed around Manhattan, but no hotel has been able to compete with this location. Theater is the primary reason we visit, but we HATE Time Square and adjacent (convention) hotels are way too busy. Within blocks is world-class shopping and less touristy restaurants. Green Village and Washington Square Park are an easy walk up West Broadway which is right outside the front doors. This hotel is a great value with room prices that are very competitive for NYC. The staff is very friendly and accommodating including housekeeping which left us notes every day. This is not a convention hotel. The rooms are typical NYC rooms, which is to say smallish, but very clean and adequate. There is no concierge but the desk staff work hard to meet that role. On our recent visit, my husband was celebrating his birthday. He loves chocolate cake so I contacted the hotel in hopes of securing a small chocolate cake. They could not accommodate this request but they sent someone to a nearby bakery for a large slice of chocolate cake (at no cost to us) that was waiting for us in the room with a very nice note. Get out of Time Square and enjoy NYC as the people who live here enjoy it. Spend a day walking around SoHo and Tribeca and you will never stay in Time Square again.

Stayed here for a week in August of 17. Rooms were clean and spacious. Modern and comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpful. There's a bar downstairs where you can kick back. The location is perfect. Canal street station is nearby, some great pubs in the area (Nancy Whisky Bar is awesome) and you can grab a tasty bite at one of the restaurants around. Perfect stay.

This hotel in an excellent location, near Canal st metro, so you can easily move around the city by metro . The bed was comfortable bur room very small, free Wi-Fi and printing service. Not very friendly staff, problems with deposit.

The Sheraton at Tribeca, is your best option if you want to be near to most all important attractions in NYC. Little Italy and Chinatown are within walking distance, there is a metro station around the corner. Parking is just across the street.The rooms themselves are very comfortable, not spacious, but confortable, they have a gym, and breakfast is great, scrambled eggs, potatoes, sausage, bacon, pancakes. Their service is top notch, I was upgraded to the lounge area, and was given a bottle of wine, upon checking, big shout out to Nelson, the attendant on duty. I will definitely stay here again, highly recommended.

The location of this hotel is fantastic! Its easy to get anywhere including China Town, Little Italy, SoHo, the Village, etc...The rooms are a bit small, but well appointed and comfy. The club lounge offers a nice breakfast and a pretty ok happy hour. The best thing though about the lounge is the outdoor patio and view. There was only one negative we had about this hotel and that was the noise level. At night we could hear cars on the street, and people if they were shouting. Despite that though, we would stay here again.

This place was unreal. Very welcoming enjoyed every minute. The rooftop view was incredible.The staff were great especially Raul. But so we're the staff at the front desk.Highly recommended. Location was ideal. Pricey but what would you expect from New York

I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. 1 of the 3 elevators was not working so the wait times were quite long for elevators.Even though I was given a room facing backside of the hotel it was quite noisy. There were some fans outside that were generating a lot of noise. There is no body wash/bath gel in the bathrooms. The only have solid soap which I did not like. The hotel was not very well maintained and quite run down. I would probably not stay at this hotel again as there are other much better hotels at the same price point.

The hotel has a good location and a relaxed, easy-going atmosphere. Our room was on Club floor with access to the Club Lounge. The Lounge is a good place to grab breakfast or pop in during the afternoon happy hour for a snack and glass of wine. The fitness room is very nice too. I can warmly recommend the Club rooms on 20th & 21st floors; I’m already looking forward to my next visit.Don’t forget to tip the Club Lounge “bartender” to keep your wine glasses full! ;)

We booked an Executive Club room for a really reasonable price and it's worth every penny of it.First of all, when we arrived for a one week stay, the young lady attending checkin, told us that the room we were attributed was with very limited view. So she offered us to transfer the following day to a much better one.We are now in room 2020 and WOW! We have an unobstructed view to all of uppertown, including the Empire State.And tonight, 4th of July oblige, we will watch the fireworks from our king bed.Now, about the Executive Club.It includes a free breakfast with excellent French pastry and the usual sausages and omelette. Coffee is Starbucks and orange juice in real fresh, not from concentrated.Plus, all day long you may access the Club for coffee or fresh drinks.Plus, plus, in the evening you have a free buffet with a selection fo wines.And the view!The terrace is just above our room, with the same awesome view.Where else to have your breakfast looking at the Empire State building?The room is very comfortable, large enough AND QUIET, which, in NYC, is a luxury.Bottom line: for the price deal we had we are totally enthusiastics about what we got.

Stayed at this hotel with a friend for pride weekend, we both really enjoyed our stay. Great drinks at the bar and a wonderful happy hour in the lounge. Room service was great, and the manager and staff were were very kind. After checking out I realized I left one of my AirPods in the hotel room, and they promptly located it and assured me they could mail it back to me states away, excellent customer service! I will definitely be staying here again!

We were in New York for a wedding. About an hour before we were supposed to leave, I realized the room was missing a hair dryer. On its website, the hotel states that the rooms come with a hair dryer. Called the front desk multiple times. Each time they said the hair dryer was on the way, but it never arrived. So I was forced to attend the wedding with wet hair. Will never stay at a Sheraton again.

I stayed here last week while I was in town for the AIA conference. Last week was a high occupancy week in NYC between this and Pride events. My travel plans came together at the last minute, and I missed out on advanced booking discounts. This hotel was one of the few that had rooms in my date range under 400.00 a night. In a panic, I booked and was eligible for the AAA discount, so my room was 312.00 before taxes, discounted from 380.00. Checkin was a disaster. The CSR, let's call her "Twinkle" with the platinum wig, seemed angry from the start and rushed through my checkin. When I asked to verify the rate and the perks offered by the AAA booking that I made over the phone a couple days before, she rudely retorted that no such deal was in the system, and that my room was 379.00 before taxes, and there was no city view, no access to the lounge level with breakfast and cocktails. I showed her my confirmed reservation email, and she said there was absolutely nothing she could do, and that was just how it was going to be. I then asked for her manager, and she angrily stormed off and found her supervisor who took over the checkin process. Well Twinkle kept interjecting while the supervisor attempted to locate the reservation that showed my deal. I eventually complained about her attitude to her supervisor. Neither seemed pleased that I went there. Well miraculously, a room with the specifications promised to me appeared on the system...but I was made to feel this was a grand favor being granted to me, and something was mumbled about a failure of their system to have synced with the central reservation system, or some such excuse.This hotel is old and dated, but the room was immaculately clean. The breakfast and cocktail hour buffet in the 21st floor lounge was excellent, and redeemed my stay. I had dinner in the lobby restaurant the first night as it was very late. Terribly overpriced for a micro slice of frozen salmon with veggies. I paid 70.00 for that meal and one glass of red wine. Cafeteria quality for fine dining prices.I cut my four night stay in half, and moved to another hotel (Dream/ Chelsea/ See my review) which was incomparable at a rate of 389.00. Do not be fooled by the proximity of this hotel to SoHo. Crossing Canal street from SoHo to this hotel take you into another world...one of whinos, and the stench of weed, urine and garbage combined. You will not feel safe walking here at night.

The Sheraton is a difficult brand to understand as it could represent a super luxurious hotel/resort, or a basic, small, simple, old minimalistic hotel. This is the case of the Sheraton Tribeca at Canal St. it’s small and simple and very basic. However, they have a great view up on the 21st floor lounge which serves 24 hour Coffee and Soft Drinks. I was recognized as an SPG Platinum member and was upgraded to a bigger room so, I’m giving it an extra star for that. Anyways, don’t expect too much and you’ll have a fine stay here. Rooms are clean and bed is comfy.

We stayed over the weekend and had a great stay. Front desk was friendly and extremely helpful. Our room was a typical Sheraton room. A little small but that’s expected in NYC. The club lounge is amazing! Love the huge roof top deck. Deon was great! Such a hard worker and so friendly. He runs around non stop! I’m lifetime platinum with Starwood and I’ve been to lots of club lounges and this one is definitely one of the best! The hotel is in a great location too. We’ll definitely be back!

I stayed in room 302 in your presidential suite. My stay was from June 22- 25. I have been staying at the Sheraton for 15 years with a combined 536 nights. I had the pleasure of meeting the most curteous, inviting, charming host by the name of DEON from the club lounge on the 21st floor. I rarely find myself writing reviews. When one receives such superior service as I did I feel it’s only fair for all of New York and the world for that matter know about this hidden gem. Located on the rooftop with a panoramic view of Manhattan you can be sure to be in aw. Meeting Deon and having the luxury of being a guest in his club floor was my best club level floor experience yet! I must have been to over 50 different club lounges in my years and this one has exceeded my expectations. Bravo to Management for recognizing value in such a wonderful man like Deon. After all my years of travel to New York I have finally found my home when I’m here and it’s definitely thanks to the hospitality I received by this gentlemen. Thank you again and we can’t wait to see you again. JR

Enjoyed our 3 nights at the Sheraton TriBeCa. Well located in SoHo within short walks of great stores, Little Italy, Chinatown, other good restaurants. Very friendly and helpful staff in all positions. Room was spotless, not appearing worn at all for the obvious busy-ness of this hotel, NYC small in room size. Very comfortable bed. Room rate not outrageous. Had to stay in for dinner one night due to heavy rain, and ate in lobby restaurant. Was expensive, but very good. Would definitely stay here again.

As I have mentioned before this is my FAVORITE hotel on. My stays in the New York City area. This is based 100% on the very efficient and professional staff emoyed at this hotel. Upon check-in I have the pleasure of being greeted with warm welcome by Front Desk Associate Nelson who has already has my room assignment and access key ready. Bellman Lewis has the newspapers ready for me and offers me help with my luggage. The all of the staff in the Club Lounge & Terrace make me feel right at home on every sine stay at this premise. It is always a joy to be welcomed by PM Associate Deon always with a smile and a very, very sincere and warm greeting. All of the staff that works in the Antica Ristorante, where I usually have my morning breakfast always welcome me with a gracious and welcoming '"Good morning Mr. McKaney". I have been there in some very busy mornings and they handle the breakfast rush like a well-oiled machine! I am always amazed at how easy they make the customer service end of the business run so smoothly every single morning. These are some of the many reasons why I will continue returning to this hotel on ALL of my New York City stays. I hope that the Marriott organization is aware of how lucky they should be that they have acquired this very professional venue with the complete professional staff that it encompasses. Keep up the great work Sheraton Tribeca New York Hotel!

I was pleasantly surprised by my recent stay at the Sheraton Tribeca. From the moment we arrived until we left, staff was extremely helpful. We arrived and had about twenty minutes to check in, get to our room, change, and leave for our anniversary dinner. The front desk staff could tell we were in a rush and got us checked in and on our way in record time all while being courteous and friendly. It was incredibly hot for our weekend stay and every time we came back to the hotel, the front desk had water bottles available for us. When we checked out, we asked for a cab to Newark Airport and they got us a private car in less than 5 minutes for a flat rate fee. It may have been a bit more expensive than a cab, but the driver got us to the airport in a half hour during rush hour.We booked a Superior King room and were put in a room right next to the elevator. I was concerned about noise but we only heard other guests one morning and it was after 8am. The Superior room was spacious with a comfortable seating area and room to move around, which is hard to find in Manhattan. The rate was below other hotels in the area that would have offered a room half the size.Location was great - easy to get to JFK and EWR, as well as being walking distance to the Village, Soho, Tribeca, and Little Italy. There is a subway stop around the corner, too, which made it easy to get to Williamsburg and Midtown.It's not as stylish as other hotels in Soho might have been, but between service, location, and price, this was an all around great stay.

Its been a while since it was the staff that MADE the stay. From Everyone at Reception to Dion, who takes care of the Club Floor Lounge. If you stay here, get to the CLUB FLOOR and go visit Dion! Reception staff.. Sal, Precious,[yes that is her name], and Fritta,,,FANTASTIC. Smiles, friendly, GENUINE and I was on site in April and when I got home I made my next reservation at this same property. It was so fab I almost forgot about the bartender who really needs to do a little less texting and look up more often :-)I completely suggest this property to anyone!One thing, note to the F & B Department> If you are going to charge that much for the breakfast buffet, you better amp it up, or drop the price. DEFINITELY not worth it.Someone seriously needs to re-evaluate this.

Fabulous 3 day stopover. Location could not have been better. Clean and on trend. Staff could not have been friendlier and polite. Ticketed all the boxes. Will make it my mission to recommend this hotel to everyone I know!

This was the last time at Sheraton TriBeCa. As a SPG member. I paid for staying at club floor (loyalty program). This includes access to continental breakfast buffet. But most of the mornings we meet an empty table. One morning the complaint was meet with a voucher for breakfast in the restaurant. But the other mornings nothing was done. In the reception we was promised a discount on our prepaid room. But nothing happened. In the afternoon a snack would be served in the club floor lounge. The waiter was very nice but the snack were poor quality carrots out of a plastic bag, cheese (I don’t eat cheese) nachos out of an other bag. Before there was served small warm snack and everything was mush more delicious.The general standard has fallen over the years. This you se in the furniture, at the floor, the bed and the towels has seen better days.You might think that the SPG loyalty made difference but no.Sorry to say never again!!!

We stayed in a room with 2 beds and there 3 adults. The room was big enough as lets be honest you don't spend a lot of time in there but to sleep. It had a desk and great view of the city and the bathroom had a shower bath. The bed was comfy with lots of pillows and I could hardly hear a thing from the outside world which is rare in NYC. It was big enough for what we needed which was a room to sleep in and it still fit in 3 very large suitcases. There are also bathroom facilities for guests to use on level 2 which came in handy. All the staff were very friendly greeting us every morning we left and every evening when we came back. The free wifi was great.We had the breakfast on the 22nd floor which is like a continental. Some croissants, muffins juices coffees etc. Better than most hotels however there was nothing gluten free for me so I couldn't eat there. The hotel is right near the subway and there are a few little cafes close by, in fact one right next door which we used often. It was a great base for us for NYC. I would definitely stay here again the next time I visit NYC.

Loved the Sheraton Tribeca. Stayed there for 4 nights with my family (husband and teenage son). We found the location to be very convenient for shopping, dinning, night-clubbing and sightseeing. Short walk to subway. We will stay here on our next NYC trip. The best thing about our stay here was the Happy Hour in the rooftop club. Drinks al fresco with a 180 degree-view. Make sure to say 'hello' to Deon for us, our fantastic host. He took care of us as if we were royalty. Excellent service.

Enjoyed the roof top terrace! It’s peaceful and not very crowded when I’ve been there. There are great views and it’s in a great, central location. One of my favorite NYC hotels in Tribeca with a nice standard room for NY and affordable rates.

Upon entering the hotel I was greeted at the front desk by Felitta. Not only did she make the check in a great experience, but she continued with her exemplary service throughout our stay. I hope that this hotel recognizes that they truly have an amazing employee in her. Thank-you so much for making our stay for my bday that much more enjoyable Fellita. We hope to see you next time!

Great location. Many subway options near by to go both uptown & downtown in Manhattan. Walking distance to Soho, Chinatown, Little Italy, even the World Trade Ctr area. Not the most beautiful street tho. But I guess it’s part of the NYC charmRoom is very standard. Absolutely nothing special about the room. TIP: Ask for a room @ high floor with bigger window facing north, you’ll be able to see Empire State Building. Lounge is substandard. Breakfast & evening reception offering NEVER change! Basically just coffee, bagel, pastry in the AM & chips, dips, few selection of wines for the PM.View from lounge is beautiful. Worth going there just for the view.Lobby is small & elevators are on the slow side.Cleanliness can also be improved.Concierge staff ( who also are bellmen, doormen ) are super nice. By my second day, they all recognized me by name. Front desk staff are all just average, none of them went extra length to male my stay great.Other than the barely there lounge, basically no more benefit or being SPG Platinum member.

Have given this review 5 stars as I simply could not fault the hotel. From check in to check out every member of staff we encountered was friendly. The reception, lifts, bedroom was exceptionally clean too. Room was a good size, worked perfectly well for myself and my husband. Perfect base for 'Downtown' - Chinatown, Little Italy, Soho, Tribeca etc. All within walking distance. Already looking to rebook for Christmastime.

My daughter and I had a great stay here. We chose it for the location, but the staff was wonderful. They were very responsive and helpful. Felita was the best! She cared very much about making sure we had a great stay. Her customer service is superior! Sal was also a stand out. Thanks so much!

I stay here every week and love it. Great staff, awesome 21st floor roof deck view from the concierge lounge, great gym. Shout out to my man Deon in the lounge, that guy is the best. He knows all the regulars and really makes it feel like home.

I cannot say enough about the staff at this hotel. I travel 90% of the time and this is my favorite place to stay. The staff is absolutely amazing.... and a shout out to Nelson, Sal and Lena! This is the only hotel that I stay at for both business and pleasure!

We stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca for a long weekend. It worked out well for heading up to Broadway for shows, whether by subway or by taxi, and for wandering around Tribeca and Soho. The front desk staff were very nice. The room is not too small and it was very clean. However, I recommend asking for a room away from the elevators, because there is definitely a lot of noise when people come in late and/or are waiting for the elevators to arrive. And wait they will, these elevators are very very slow. The neighborhood is ok, with a short walk to the trendy shops and cafes of Tribeca and Soho. However, you will be constantly accosted by people trying to sell you fake purses and watches along Canal Street. Overall, I recommend the hotel if you can get a decent rate.

My experience of staying here was good. I reached the hotel way before my check in time. The reception staff was courteous and offered me a free drink coupon and followed by an early check in there after. The hotel is located in the heart of NYC with prime sites like 5th, Times square, Trinity church just a walk away. Room windows can slide open if you need to smoke. The rooms are fully equipped with amenities and also have complimentary Starbucks coffee which was such a life saver. There's also a grocery store where you can buy really cheap dinner and it's open 24*7

My wife and I were in New York city for a few days and we opted to stay at the Sheraton Tribeca as we wanted to be close to Soho and we generally like the area. Our first impression coming into the hotel was not so good as it was quite chaotic coming in and the lobby area looked old and worn out. The lady at checkin was also particularly unfriendly. We probably ended up on someone having a bad day as all our other interaction with staff were good... Once we got to our room everything was fine. It was small by all standards but this is New York so it was ultimately fine as a base to explore the city.I probably will return when i'm back to New York city.

My stay was perfectly fine, but afterwards I noticed an extra $75 charge on my credit card. I called the hotel and they told me it was for overnight parking. Only problem, I did not have a car. Several times I called the hotel and they told me they would issue a refund and neither time actually did. I've been trying for a week now and am still working getting the $75 back. So beware.

I stayed here 3 weeks ago....had a wonderful time and came back this past weekend with my daughter....worst experience ever...the hotel was sold out and was given a corner room that was so small...compared to the room I had 3 weeks ago on the 19th Floor with beautiful view...This was not the room I paid for and the lady at the front desk advised sorry thats all she had....so disappointed....will not stay here anymore.

Staying at this hotel at our first day arrival in NYC. Dropped out of the shuttle from JFK, and walk into the reception. Stefanie the front desk was trying to help by saying the room should be ready by an hour past mid-day of our reservation was done at Executive King Room at 21st fl. The same level as the executive lounge. In fact we have to wait until the room ready almost by 14.00. An hour from the agreed time at the firsti time we met the front desk. Room has quite good size compare to many other in europe, it has amenities we need and the access to large window facing to the manhattan down town. The area are safe to walk, even at midnight. There are a bagel 24 hours next door serves salads, bread, and some chips with affordable price and good size of food. The breakfast at the hotel can be done at 21st floor and enjoying NYC scenery from the downtown. It serves bagels, croissant, chocolate croissant, apple, coffee, juice, water etc. Very standard minimal for breakfast. But do not expect a warm protein being served here. Compare to other Sheraton hotel in Asia, Sheraton Tribeca are a way behind in variety of menu in breakfast. Hospitility wise just enough and efficient, like other New Yorkers. Nothing to complaint, but the one that stunning are the bell boy Fery; American Chinese who always look after and attentive to any guest at the Hotel. This is much appreciated. He asked wheather we need to storage our luggage, or looking for a taxi. he even call for the taxi from the street for us. Amazing attentiveness and create happy experience after in a "four star" hotel experience.

Me and my wife stayed here for 6 nights, MTS Metro station just around the corner to get to downtown etc,We booked a club room on 20th floor but could still hear traffic and sirens,We had access to the club lounge or as I would call it a cafe had all the usual tea coffee bagels cheese and biscuits,And Wine only yes wine only ???? which was a stark contrast to other Sheraton club rooms we have booked where in the lounges we had access to hot food and beers wines spirits etc,I spoke to a member of staff and they informed me that they did serve a variety of drinks and hot food until 2 years ago which stopped because the restaurant and bar on the ground floor was loosing customers because they were eating in the club lounge and these are not even owned by the hotel ? So people who are paying extra for club access are getting short changed because of this,Apart from this the staff were all pleasant and hotel was clean, but We would probably not visit again because of the disappointment of the facilities that accompany the cost of the club rooms.

The staff was incredible! Kudos to the HR team for hiring the vibrant and energetic staff at the lobby. I would like to acknowledge Carlos, Felita and Precious for being welcoming and helpful and incredibly kind. I had only to ask and my requests were met with prompt and satisfactory answers. They operated as a seamless team and provided an excellent guest experience. The entire team from the front of the house to the housekeeping staff was wonderful. I will definitely recommend the Sheraton Tribeca to my friends and co-workers. The rooms are very comfortable and perfect for a mini stay-cation. The staff elevated a great business trip to an awesome and unforgettable experience. Thank you, thank you, thank you! I hope to see y'all again!

Stayed here to attend a wedding in Brooklyn. As always this hotel was perfect... short cab to Brooklyn and near many great lounges and spots to eat. No complaints... plus for NYC the rooms aren’t tiny. (Not huge either but functional) A solid choice...

Although we only spent 1 night at the Sheraton Tribeca, the service of the staff as well as the hotel room was great! The room was spacious enough for two and had a stunning view of the city! The bedding was fresh and the king size bed was super comfortable! The location of the hotel was good too - found it very easy to get around. Amazing experience and definitely gets a thumbs up from me!

Amazing staff. The hotel staff are very nice. And the restaurant staff are great :) You can’t go wrong. If the greats agree. Sting and Shaggy enjoying Antica Ristorante at the Sheraton Tribeca New York New York. Enjoy your time at the hotel.

Spent one night here in order to be close to meetings early next AM for business. Property is located in Tribeca and very close to the Holland Tunnel. Short 5 mins walk from the NYC Subway Lines A C or E. Exactly what you expect for a Sheraton. Guess that is good since you know what to expect and who likes surprises when traveling? But corporate feel and lacking some pizzazz, Price was exactly what you expect in a city in NYC. Great Belgium waffle place next door! Check it out!Hotel is great for business if you can expense the room rate but if I were to visit for pleasure, I doubt I would stay here even with SPG points. Lots more options even within the SPG family with some character in the city,

My husband and I were delighted to meet Deon, the Club Lounge Manager during our stay last November.  While the actual lounge was closed for renovations, the temporary location was wonderful due mostly to Deon.  His kind, gentle, warm and friendly demeanor made our lounge visits some of the most enjoyable we have ever had as Platinum members.  Kudos to the Sheraton Tribeca for having such a wonderful and valuable employee!  Can't wait to go back!  Diane and Blake

Frankly speaking, the facilities of the hotel are okay. Check in staff and bell man are nice. However, when it comes to the room assignment and members recognition, its a disaster. After checking in, I found the key card holder was for Gold member, so I wondered if there was any misunderstanding as I should be a platinum and should be entitled for an upgrade to best available room (I know, subject to availability). Hence I verified with Front Office. The lady who assisted me was just arrogant and unhelpful. She didnt even ask my surname and just said: There is no upgrade available. For me, its totally fine. However her attitude was so unwelcoming. She added: there is no membership on profile in 1 second. Oh come on, there were 2 registered guests! Obviously she just checked the profile of the one who was not a member. So I stated my surname and asked her to check again, she finally confirmed that I am a platinum. This is really awful. At night, I found my room is very noisy due to the mechanical sound of the lift nearby. I should have quiet room preference on file! I called to guest service and the lady just: There is not any other room available tonight within 1 second. The lady must be very familiar with their room situation. Alright, but, how come I can still find different room type available to reserve in official website? So now I am typing this review in the noisy sleepless room.This is all already addressed to the hotel and i am glad there is a front desk supervisor return email to say they would like to follow up. However, it is disappointing that i still not receive any reply from them. It has already been three weeks. How awful the service it is here!

I have now stayed at this hotel many times (5+) and always choose to come back for my regular business trips to NYC. The rooms are on the small size (but good for central NY) however the beds are the most comfortable I can find anywhere. I recommend taking access to the lounge as this provides a good quick breakfast and happy hour drinks in the evening. Deon who works there in the evenings is always smiling and super efficient. The hotel is well situated and the valet staff are always very helpful. I'm always happy here!!!

Sheraton at Canal Street have a great location.Amazing to explore dowtown, tribeca, soho, little italy and nolita.The staf are professional and have great tips for lunch and dinner.Confortable and new hotel!

We stayed here while we were in NYC with my wife. Location I'd great. Check-in was very easy. Room was very comfortable. WiFi connection was easy and good. Very good cleaning. Comfy bed. We paid for our breakfast in the morning but the breakfast quality was poor. For the money that they charge it definetly does not worth it. Parking place was really expensive. Check-out was problematic because of inexperienced staff. Overall I recommend this hotel for the room quality and location.

This trip was a sisters weekend and we splurged and stayed in a suite with concierge access. Our suite was wonderful. Very clean and modern. And almost all of the staff goes out of their way to make you feel welcome. The only place that the staff was cold, not so much rude was the concierge lounge. I would say, hello or good morning with no response. But, the outstanding staff of everyone else in the hotel more than made up for it. I love this hotel and plan on going back in October.

Service was wonderful. Room was comfortable and staff was accommodating. Location is extremely convenient to Holland Tunnel. Right off the Canal Street exit. Would definitely stay in this hotel again.

I love this hotel. The staff is super nice, the rooms are very roomy and comfortable and the price is reasonable. I would recommend this place for anyone visiting from out of town or just want to spend a fun night in the city.

Clean and very nice hotel. The walls are a little thin. I can hear the people next door talking as if they are in my room BUT the rooms are really nice. This hotel is right next to Little Italy and Chinatown. Great location!

Our family of 5 is currently at the hotel in 2 adjoined rooms. Rooms are very tight yet fine. Each room has a small wardrobe with 8 hangers. No other spaces for clothes. I have called the front desk 3 times asking for additional hangers for our 4 day stay. Finally, on the 4th attempt, I was told that I asked for too many hangers and there weren't enough to go around.

The location of this hotel is great, the subway is right outside and you can get to anywhere in New York reasonably quickly. Unfortunately, when we came only one elevator was working and it was very crowded inside. The food was terrible and the breakfast looked stale. The rooms are quite small so we booked two interconnecting rooms which worked well. Don’t have high expectations for the gym either, it’s very small and not useful. However, the rooms were great and the beds were comfy. If you traveling alone and don’t mind not having luxury, you should stay here. If not, this hotel is not for you.

The staff is very friendly and helpful. The room was a bit small, but clean and comfortable. The only issue during our visit was that not all the elevators were working and there was usually a wait/line. The location is near a few different subway lines.

I knew that as a Sheraton it wouldn’t offer a boutique look, atmosphere or service but it was still a surprise at how lacking it was.The very small rooms don’t contain a fridge (which for someone requiring medication to be refrigerated is an issue). I never thought to ask as it would’ve unheard of in Australia and Asia for a hotel not to have a small fridge.The club floor was crowded and often needed cleaning as they were understaffed. Breakfast was pastries and sweet cereals and the afternoon array was dip from plastic bags and orange cheese - nothing that looked like wholesome food prepared on premise. They did serve wine which I understand is unusual.A couple of blocks away from the trendier area.

Rooms are too small, and breakfast is not that good... Don't make reservation with breakfast included, it will be a waist of money...Although the beds are of a good size, the rooms are really small, the bath rooms are old...

Staying in this hotel for 3 nights went really well. Since it was my birthday we received a really nice and warm welcome from Nelson (thanks for the drinks vouchers!!). The room was amazing and the view most definitely! The mini bar however was empty, but free water and coffee were just fine. I really have to point out that the bed was like HEAVEN!!! We got in early all nights of our stay just because of the quality of our bed... We also had entrance to the club lounge, which was fine. I do wonder if all the guests there were allowed to make use of the lounge (annoying drunk young-adults from a few floors down also had access, though I was told only guests from the 21st floor should have access...)The Front Office team have been super helpful all the time!! Special thanks to Felitta Hakim for working with such passion!!! Just talking to her could brighten up your entire day!! But... There is one thing I feel strongly disappointed about... I have never seen such negative and unwilling staff working in the hotel bar... Ordering a drink was answered by a sigh and eye roll, and we actually rather went having drinks somewhere else or take our drinks up to the room than staying there. I was told these employees are outsourced, but remember; they are also the business cards of the company!!! So PLEASE replace them by more kind and hospitable people like the guy from the Balkan (I can't remember his name well). He was the best of them all!

I have stayed here more than a few times over the last few years. The location is great. The people are great from the front desk, housekeeping, and the employees in the club lounge. Not excluding anyone else, but since I've been here a week I've noticed how hard Deon has been working during happy hour in the club lounge. He always had a positive attitude and sometimes the room was overflowing with guests. He was always moving either cleaning, serving or preparing. My only concern is that since I've been coming here a few years, I have noticed the quality in some areas decreasing. Specifically, the food available in the club lounge. Breakfast used to include eggs, bacon, etc. but now it is strictly stale pastries and fresh coffee not even available at 7 when they open. In the evening they used to serve beer. Now it is just wine. I was given a coupon to try the breakfast buffet. They also open at 7. I was there at 7:15 one morning and the eggs were already extremely dry and sausages burnt. I'm hoping this isn't an example of Marriott's influence in buying Starwood. Again, overall a good experience but you may want to make food choices elsewhere.

Have stayed here before because of the location and the value. Now worth even more as they have renovated rooms. Great location for Soho, Greenwich, Tribeca, and the World Trade Center area - walked to all. Front desk and concierge were very friendly and helpful.

Stayed for a week at this excellent located hotel.Upgrade to executive room which really was a good idea.Executive lounge well run by Deon,wine and nibbles really went down well.Roberta our maid was lovely and did an excellent job.Only down side of hotel is the bar downstairs.Hard to get a drink service is not good and very drafty.

We stayed for almost one week. Our experience was as follows;- The location is great! If you look at the Manhattan map, it's between the financial district and Greenwich. Easy walk to the train/subway stations. Short walk in one direction to China Town or the other direction to Soho where many lovely shops and restaurants are. We explored around Soho some nights and found some great restaurants and also walked down to China Town one night. - During our stay, we experienced a mix of services from the staff. I like to give a shout out to FERY WONG who works in the concierge section. Fery's sunny and happy demeanor is contagious and he was always ready to help. When I had an issue with a package, he went out of his way to help me and made sure the package was redirected promptly. His warm greetings always brought a smile to our face. MIA at the front desk, she was always very friendly and efficient. The staff worked in the lounge area on 21st floor was also excellent (pity I didn't remember their names). Our disappointing experience was with Alexis. As we had two separate reservations we had to switch rooms one day. Before we went out for the day I went to check the approximate time frame we could switch the rooms. Alexis was unfriendly and her attitude was best described as testy. In the end what she said didn't matter but how she said it tainted the whole experience. - The hotel amenities are average. The breakfast options in the lounge is very limited.

The location is good but at this point I may have to move hotels. I am travelling for work and WEEKS ago when I made the reservation I requested a fridge to store my breastmilk that I pump. 10 days before the trip I called and made sure they have noted thay I need a fridge for my breastmilk and I was told it should be no problem. Today I get to the hotel and upon checking I verify if I have a fridge in my room. I am told that they don't have one because they are all given out but should have one by the afternoon. Fine I try to stuff my milk as much as I can in the ice hockey that can only hold one 16 oz water bottle (not fully covered) and wait till the night. At 8 pm I call and ask about the fridge and am told they don't have one and may or may not have one tomorrow. I asked to at least get a bigger ice bucket and was told I can only have the one in my room. So now my hard pumped milk is slowly spoiling as it doesnt fit in the tiny bucket any more. Will have to go out and buy a cooler so it doesnt all go to waste. For a 4 star hotel this is pathetic.

This hotel is in a great location because of its proximity to Canal Street Subway station. The staff is excellent, especially Star at the front desk. She is always friendly and helpful. Deon, in the concierge lounge is superb! He really takes care of his people.

We opted for a room that gave us access to the Concierge Lounge on the 21st floor. It was an excellent decision. We began and ended each day with a stop in the lounge, either for coffee, a snack, or a glass of wine during happy hour. Deon, was one of the staff members who went above and beyond to make us feel welcomed. His customer service was exceptional. He was genuinely warm and welcoming and kept the space clean, even during periods of heavy traffic flow, like happy hour. The staff here has overall been great.

So much to love about this hotel--the location, the patio on the 21st floor, the views, the friendly staff. If they could figure out how to get the wifi to work in the rooms and step up the food at the breakfast in the Club Lounge, this place would be a 5 star in my books. But good enough that I'll be back!

We loved this hotel. The hotel is close to many tourist sights such as China town, Little Italy and 9-11 memorial. We were offered a free upgrade including breakfast. Good beds and excellent Lounge thanks to Deon (picture). Ask for Sheraton Preferred at the desk.

I stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca for a weekend family visit. The room was clean and the beds were very comfortable. The staff was very help and nice. The doormen were especially kind and welcoming. I would stay there again.

Although I am not a fan of the immediate surrounding area around the hotel, it does enjoy a great location for both leisure and business travelers alike. If you are traveling for leisure this property is excellent for walking through Soho. It sits on Canal st. but almost corner W. Broadway and walk down and you immediately find 6th Ave. A huge plus is having a Subway stop behind the property towards Broadway Ave with access to Blue and Orange lines.If you are a Business traveller you can easily walk to many Tribeca area office towers and also have access to Subway.However, I did not like the property itself. Yes, its a small hotel but it felt dated and dark...almost dungeony...and although I like dark lit spaces, if its the intention of the design...don’t think its what they were going for...As for the room, our room was facing an adjacent building that seemed to be under remodeling. Having a view to the wall of another building is quite normal in NY...but if the room is also dark and small it just adds to the feeling....of feeling cramped.The front desk staff were very good, very attentive. So that is a big plus.In sum, very good location, however there are other options nearby, as the property itself is a bit disappointing.

I went up for the weekend to visit family that lived a block away, wow what a great location. There was everything you could want with in a few blocks.The room was ready early at about 1 right when we got back from Katz’s deli (always my first stop in the city)The room was fine, a nice soft bed and pillows the manager gave us breakfast coupons since this place only really has one type of room and couldn’t get an upgrade. It’s a nice hotel in a good location for a very low price for the city. It’s not the Ritz yet nor was I expecting it either.I will defiantly stay here again

Stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca with my wife and children (aged 12 and 9) between 20th and 28th February, 2018. It's fair to say the service was excellent from our late night arrival (very prompt and friendly check in) through to our departure. I travel a lot with business and this is one of the most friendly environments I have experienced. As pointed out by other reviews the hotel is a little tired in areas but is exceptionally clean with reasonably sized rooms for NYC. We stayed on the club level (room 2213) with great views from our room and the lounge/roof terrace on level 21. I can not recall meeting any member of staff who did not make the effort to speak to us and this includes maintenance, cleaners, reception and bar staff. The lounge service was excellent and with continental breakfast and evening nibbles including wine, it seriously saved us a lot. We were initially reticent about using the metro but it worked well with access to most lines within circa 150 metres of the hotel entrance. We could be at Times Square in 15 minutes, Central Park in 20 minutes and it was nice to break away from busy mid town to Tribeca/Soho area at the end of the day. I would definitely recommend......!

I first reviewed this property shortly after it opened five years ago, and after multiple recent great experiences, I've decided to upgrade my review from 4 to 5 stars. The main reason for this is the service. I've found their team to be more than just service with a smile (which is obviously a great thing). On my last trip, I encountered one minor issue that's not even worth mentioning, and Mia quickly and wisely resolved it, overdelivering in the process. I'll look forward to staying with you again!

With three tube stations just round the corner, the access to all sights is so easy. The room was comfortable and the staff very attending. However, the windows need to be updated. Staying on the 8th floor, it was impossible to have quiet. The street noise was unbearable at times. Especially during rush hours, early in the morning and around 5-8 in the evening. Overall, it was a good stay.

Next to the metro station Canal Street, so has very convenient access to JFK airport by taking A line. Upgraded to a room in the highest floor with stunning view. Club Lounge and outdoor terrace has a very good view of New York skyline. Happy hour and breakfast in the club lounge did not have any hot food items, very limited and poor. Staff was very helpful and friendly.

We made a quick one-night trip into NYC. I previously lived in NYC for a decade, so I know the city and it’s hotels very well. We checked in and were given the keys to a room on the top (22nd) floor. We went upstairs, opened the door to “our” room...and saw it filled with another guest’s belongings. Never in my 35 years of traveling have I ever been given the key to someone else’s room. We were lucky we didn’t walk in on someone naked or get attacked for “invading” a room. Totally inexcusable breach of security. How can Sheraton not have a system for preventing this? We went downstairs to tell the front-desk clerk. She seemed not to believe us, and had no idea what to do. She quickly ran into the back office. She came out and asked us to repeat the story. She disappeared into the back office again. A different clerk came out. She checked the computer and had no explanation as to how this happened. We told her how upset we were. She apologized and said all she do was give us another room and 5,000 Starwood points.We went up to our new room and worried the whole time that some stranger would be given a key to our room. Also, this hotel’s club was tiny, hot and crowded. Not worth the extra money. It might be nice in warm weather when the outdoor terrace is usable. But in winter, the club is worse than the bowels of Penn Station.

A little late to the review however as it was such a fantastic experience- better late than never! My artist and I had such a wonderful stay at the Sheraton Tribecca. The location was great and made getting around NYC easy. The facilities were all fantastic and we loved our room view. There are perhaps a couple of things that could be improved however the hospitality and energy of the staff is what would make us come back. Big shout out to the amazing - Raul, Sal + Alexis and everyone else who were so helpful and really made us feel welcome.

Clean rooms. Pleasant staff. Quiet rooms. Convenient access to the subway and good neighborhoods. This is not the trendiest hotel and the rooms are somewhat dated, but they are clean and spacious (relatively for NYC).

First time staying here and the cab ride commute to Javits was super quick! I have never had this comfortable of a bed anywhere in NYC so I’m very happy with the comfort, water pressure of the shower and cleanliness. Will def be back!!!

This Hotel is very nice. It has a good restaurant. Ask about the Roof Top Terrace and Club Level Access. The views are fabulous. They Have a happy hour in the evening. Don't forget to leave a tip. Good Snacks. The rooms are modern - European Style and size. There is good access to the Subway system. Nice area with lots of things to do including restaurants.

Stayed here on a Saturday night for a fun night out in the city. Great location. Check-in was effortless, quick and pleasant. Every employee we came in contact with at this property had a great attitude and seemed genuinely happy to be working at the hotel. We traveled with another couple and we both had rooms on the 7th floor next door to each other. We both payed the same price but their room was a bit larger than ours. Our room was small but extremely clean and very quiet. There was a coffee pot, iron and safe in the room. Not one complaint about this place. The elevators were always available and the bar had a great atmosphere and it was the perfect spot to start the evening. We were each given a complimentary drink coupon at check-in which was a really nice touch. We didn't eat at the restaurants but they looked pretty good. The area was bustling and it was a 10 minute walk to our nightlife scene on McDougal Street.Great stay and we would definitely return if we were in the area again.

We were very happy with this hotel stay. It's off-season (January) and the price was great! The location is right on Canal St on the west side, near the Holland Tunnel so there is a lot of traffic and outside noise. The interior is clean, comfortable, and bigger than a lot of other comparable downtown hotels. Close to subways, restaurants, shopping, and other points of interest.I thought they had an on-site garage but I was told to pull up outside for the valet. However, the cars were stacked 3 deep and double parked into the middle and right driving lanes so it was impossible to pull over! I circled the block a few times, then gave up and found a nearby garage. The woman (Alexis) at the front desk was super nice. She had great positive energy, gave us two comped drinks, and a buffet ticket for breakfast. We had a room on the 10th floor with a view north, of midtown and the Empire State Building. Lovely! We requested a room away from the elevators and they were able to accommodate us. The room was a good size for a downtown NYC hotel room! We even had a chair to relax, a desk area, and an armoire. The bathroom was nice as well, with a shower, no tub. Be aware that you are staying on Canal St, and you can hear traffic/honking/sirens/people all night. But it's not a big deal if you travel with ear plugs/white noise apps.It looks like there is access to a Planet Fitness next door as well! Sadly, I did not have time to go, but it is available. I would definitely stay here again!

Location is central as one can easily walk to the Canal street Metro station and connect to the world.Rooms are bit dated but bathrooms were quite well done We were given a room on the 3rd floor which though at times noisy was quite spacious.Staff was extremely polite and helpful.Airport access- try to schedule your departure to the JFK early to avoid evening traffic congestion.

This hotel is highly convenient for my needs, and the staff is abundantly helpful. The in-house exercise facility is a nice addition. The beds are comfortable, the bathrooms are roomy, and the rooms have a desk for those late-night workers.There are several meal options within walking distance.

Super location for shopping, Soho is walking distance. We to visit friends in the West Village, great view of the Freedom tower ( may want to request a room on the scenic side of the hotel). Room was very nice, nothing over the top but had everything we needed. We stayed on the club level and LOVED the view and gorgeous outside patio. The club level breakfast was fantastic with cereals, juices and coffee, pastries - super convenient and clean. The evening happy hour and snacks were also great. I can't wait to go back in the Summer and sit outside with my wine and enjoy the beautiful skyline. Top notch service all the way around from the front desk, room service and the front restaurant and bar areas. I definitely recommend this hotel if you want to be in the Canal Street/Soho/West Village area.

The hotel is in a favorable location in New York. You can reach the subway easily and can get to Uptown easily. The view from the balcony is absolutely stunning, and sitting there to eat your breakfast or to enjoy an evening wine is amazing. In the mornings you can eat breakfast up in the balcony area, however I think you have to book that option additionally. I'm not sure about that.

It appears to be a nice hotel, but I didn't take advantage of all it's amenities. I received excellent service from the staff. The king sized room was cozy, but definitely doable for 2 people, and everything was clean. The pillows weren't that great for sleep (could only have been my room), and I had a poor view, but I was on the 4th floor facing a building so that was understandable. I live in NYC, so the area wasn't difficult to get around; close to public transportation and walkable to everything. Overall, I'd stay again.

Well first at all I would like to thanks to the hotel for one of the greatest experience that I ever had in a hotel.We have been there for 11 days so before the trip I texted the hotel asking for things to make my stay awesome. And they did it!! Just once I got there when I saw the room I was so happy!! It was so beautiful with the perfect views and the perfect floor!! They team from the front desk were so nice and the team from the Club Lounge were so friendly until the last moment. Next time I go back to New York I will stay with them 100% for sure!! I am really excited to go back there. Once again thank you so much for everything!!SEE YOU NEXT TIME

At first it looks a bit "oh no!" since Canal street after all isn't the most charming street in New York, BUT This first impression is put to sleep as soon as you enter the Hotel. All internal service is warm and precise. Did not try the breakfast, but if you do, I'm sure its ok, just be aware that the hood has some brilliant offers within some minutes by foot. The location and the easy accessable public transport system and walking distance to "it all" (sounds weird, but actually true...), makes This Hotel a Great choice! And Talking about sleeping; their beds Are top quality, the rooms Are spacious, its clean... love it!

I stayed at Sheraton Tribeca three times in January 2018. Each time I visited the king sized rooms were mostly clean, except for one of the rooms that had several coffee stains on the mattress. I have attached photos so hotel management can see them. You need to treat the stain or get a new mattress. The hotel workers were courteous, laidback, and polite. I never met a rude or grouchy employee. The club lounge service was wonderful as well. The engineers were great too. Keep up the good work Sheraton Tribeca. I will visit again and recommend your hotel to others!

Only bad part of our 5-night stay here in October: it is not the best part of Canal Street. BUT a very friendly and helpful staff makes up for the location. It is very handy to several subway lines, and just north of Canal there are kinds of great shops and restaurants. Rooms were clean. We had a quiet room.

I have been staying at the hotel for a week now, and I have been blown away by the front desk team and their connection to the guests. I had a miscommunication with when I was supposed to check out and the front desk supervisor Sal handled it with such grace and made my stay very special.The hotel is in an incredible area, I could walk to Soho, around Tribeca and the Village from the hotel. It is a vibrant area and easy to access from Newark airport.The rooms are no frills, but very clean and comfortable. I would recommend staying at this hotel to anyone coming to visit New York, especially for the staff and location.

I’m a 10+ year SPG member who has stayed here 4 times, but this will be my last. I booked 3 months ahead, but they did not advise that the rooftop or SPG floors would be closed. We complained about a very loud party happening at 11 pm on the floor above, nothing was done. We had asked at booking for a quiet room on a high floor, but we were put beside the icemaker and elevator on a low floor and told there was nothing they could do as I had prepaid. The king room itself has no dresser or room for clothes besides 2 tiny shelves, and living out of suitcases on a chair for 5 nights is unacceptable. Time for a new hotel chain, and time to dump SPG.

The hotel is very clean and convenient. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Mia, the Front Office Manager, was extremely helpful at time of our arrival to ensure we were pleased and satisfied (as Platinum members). Dion from the Club Lounge is to be commended for his excellent attention to customer satisfaction!

While not the poshest of hotels, the Sheraton is clean, well-managed, and a great location - close to downtown, midtown, soho, west side, tribeca without all the hassle. Sal is awesome...make sure you meet him! Rooms tend to be much larger than average...

I stay here for business. It is clean, updated and convenient. The staff is always courteous especially Sal, who works nights. If you want a room with less traffic noise, ask for one on the Chinatown side but event if you get one on Canal, it is not that bad relative to typical NYC hotel rooms. The restaurant, while limited in size and somewhat out in the open, has decent food too.

My sister and I spent a night at this hotel with our daughters during the Christmas holidays . The hotel is beautiful and has a rooftop view that is amazing ! Also, the staff was wonderful , especially Starr, she went above and beyond to make our stay amazing!

This is the second time my partner and I have stayed at this hotel!It’s super convenient to the subway and getting into Soho, Tribeca or West Village - even easy to walk down to the Financial District!Easy easy location, safe and in walking distance to anywhere you want to explore. The club room is worth paying for just so you have access to level 21 club lounge! The afternoon vinos and canapés are well worth it. The view is amazing too - this is our first time here in winter but in summer - the rooftop is great to sit out on and enjoy your wines. The rooms are getting a little outdated but you are truly only here to sleep.It’s clean, comfortable and a good size for an NY room. Love our stay here and would recommend to all
