The room is clean. Better place for a short business trip.One thing was very upsetting. We stayed on Dec 25th. The room 515 was freezing. By freezing I mean my daughter had to cover herself with a wool coat on top of the blanket. My wife and I had to wear couple of layers of clothes to feel more comfortable in a cold room.

As I said in the heading, the Sheraton Tribeca New York Hotel is my "favorite NYC hotel" when I am staying in Manhattan. This rating is based on 95% of the Associates that are based at this particular location. The pleasure begins upon my check-in with Front Desk Associate Nelson. Always pleasant and extremely welcoming upon my arrival. He makes every effort to take care of my requests if it is at possible. If not, he takes my cellphone number to call me when my room is ready. As I have access to the Club Lounge & Terrace at this venue, I must direct my praise to the PM Associate Deon. Again, he always has a very pleasant attitude and everytime I am staying at this location I get a very warm welcome. He makes my feel right at home. I have found out that the Antica Ristorante is not a part of the hotel per se. I would just like to say that again, every one of the staff in the moring for breakfast treat me like a king. Again, always a warm welcome. The staff always take care of any special requests that I may have and the overall service is superb. On my next stay and review that will follow; I will make a better effort to include all of the names of everyone that treats me so well. As I said, there is not one Associate that does not go out of his or her way to make my stays a total pleasure.

Comfortable bed, nice linens, hot shower, club level, complimentary breakfast and cocktails, pretty much all we could ask for for only one night. On top of that, very friendly staff. Easy spot to grab a cab on Canal and convenient to several neighborhoods.

This was at least our 15th stay at the Sheraton TriBeCa. We arrived early for our weekend reservation and they were unable to give us a room. Usually they have one put aside for us, but we were prepared to explore the city anyway, so off we went.Returned around 11PM and they gave us a slightly larger room than normal (normal rooms here are TINY), with extra room to spread out and lounge access. The lounge food at night and in the morning are not what they once were, but it's nice to have the option, and the open air roof deck is always a treat.

The room was small but there were 3 of us. The beds were comfortable which is what is most important to us. The staff were very helpful and awesome. Rooms were clean. The only thing was the stopper in tub did not work but they were willing to send a repairman or change rooms so not really a problem. Would stay here again.

In all honesty the hotel is perfect! But I’m so annoyed today as I’ve paid for breakfast and for two days they have been fine but today they have tried telling me I hadn’t paid for it in my package when I have paperwork stating it from booking.com!! The funny thing is that there’s an advert on trip adviser from booking.com for this hotel saying breakfast included hahaha. They put me on the phone to booking.com but to be honest I’m unsure it was actually them. I just had some American women refusing to talk to me about the situation!! If this is the case I won’t stop at management!! All in all the situation had been handled poorly and as it’s only buffet style breakfast they should just offer it me anyway. This is my first review I’ve ever done I’m that annoyed !! Room 1808 if you’d like to rectify the situation before I leave on Xmas day I’m more than happy for that to happen and I will remove my review. Failing that once I have confirmation of breakfast a bill will be sent for $22 per person per day for the breakfast I haven’t received

I have been coming to this hotel for a year, now. I truly appreciate the professionalism of the staff. In the club lounge, Jason, Steven, and Deon take excellent care of me on every visit. (Three in the past 12months). Dionne is a welcomed addition to the club lounge service staff. Raúl the bellman takes care of my luggage as if it were his own! I can't forget to mention some welcomed additions to the front desk. May in management is always smiling! Colin takes care to thank guests by name! (I LOVE THAT!) Sal and Alexis make sure your every concern is addressed.Last but not least, Roberta in housekeeping made certain that my stay was comfortable.With new faces since my last visit, I was slightly apprehensive. This staff has gone above and beyond! I am wowed and excited to return. Great job Sheraton!

I stayed here for business. As an SPG member, I booked on points. I then called the hotel & received excellent service from TRINA. On arrival, everything met my expectations. DEON & STEPHEN are great Club Lounge hosts. COLIN, STAR, SAL and others at the Front Desk and Door were pleasant & offered assistance as needed. Hotel is located right near subways. Easy to get to Times Square / Broadway. Top restaurants just blocks from the hotel. Upgrade to the Club Lounge. Lots of amenities — continental breakfast, beverages, snacks throughout the day & nightly wine & hors d’oeuvres from 5:30 - 7:30. Fantastic views of NYC from the Lounge & Patio. Already booked a return trip to arrive on Christmas Day!

The Sheraton Tribeca was the perfect place to stay in Manhattan! More perfect than I could have planned.The staff were fantastic! We flew into NYC on a red eye flight from Las Vegas with our 23 month old son. We were all exhausted and really wanting to get into our room, despite knowing that we weren’t due to check in. The lady at the front desk was lovely, she said that housekeeping had just got in but was organizing our room to be cleaned first so we could get into with our little one and get some rest & freshened up. It was a lovely gesture and made for the perfect start to our stay.Housekeeping were great in promptly bring us a crib and an extra pillow for our son. The hotel had everything you needed! It was close to walking distance to SOHO and Little Italy. It was quite central in my opinion to get around Manhattan. The hotel staff were brilliant and more than helpful with holding baggage and even organized a car to take us to New Jersey when checking out and going to pick up our rental car! Thank you to the whole team for a lovely stay! Looking forward to staying again in future!

I hardly ever write reviews, but I felt like our stay at the Sheraton Tribeca so unpleasant I had to address it. I booked this hotel at a premium price thinking I would get at least a decent experience. Our heater in our room was broken when we got in, it’s the peak season of winter. Our room keys suddenly did not work, which was annoying since we had to go back down after just receiving them. One of the nights, we had to wait 15mins for an elevator because Two out of the three elevators were not working. The bed we slept on was slumped to the point we could feel the springs against our backs when laying down. We requested a new bed, but they required us to move at the moment (We had dinner reservations) or else they could sell that other room. We ended up being late to our dinner reservation and had to wait even longer, throwing off our plans. On the positive side, the place is clean(expected), the front door gentleman’s were very nice/accommodating and location is nice. I’ve stayed in many Sheraton hotels, but this one just did not meet the standard of a Sheraton hotel. It’s all the little things that were annoying that could’ve been solved with simple maintenance.

My travel companions selected this hotel for its location and SPG affiliation. Rightly so, the location is good. Close to three different Metro lines with walk-able entertainment while being outside of the insanity of midtown. Unfortunately, this is a substandard Sheraton.Check in was completed by a very friendly agent (the only good service I had). However, my SPG status was not recognized nor was I offered an upgrade (the hotel was not full). The rooms are standard NYC rooms, small but comfortable. The hotel is clean as would be expected at a Sheraton. Before heading out for then evening, we wanted to enjoy some cocktails at the hotel bar. Enjoyment was not possible. The bartender was rude, barely seemed to care we were there and seemed annoyed every time we ordered a drink. The tab was extremely expensive ($25 for a double vodka and soda), which I can understand due the location, but I would expect the service to match price. The next morning comes around and I was woken by slamming doors and chatter, which went on for hours. Again, as expected in NYC, noise does occur; this was excessive. It turns out the problem is twofold, 1. My neighbors were coming and going all morning, and 2. The room attendant staff is loud and my room was positioned next to service elevator and entrance.While cleaning rooms, the attendants come in and out of a room, allowing the door to slam each time and not propping the door open. I called down to the front desk requesting to move. The agent on the line was rude, did not apologize, offered no compassion or compensation, telling me I was already on the quiet side of the hotel. When I requested to move anyways, the agent sounded exasperated and put me hold. I was given a new room, however I would have to go to the front desk to get the keys. My new room was similar to the previous, as expected, except it includes old towels with holes and frays. Also unfortunate was that the noise and slamming doors of the room attendants was not better. Overall, the hotel is fine. But the service, lack of attention to detail and treatment of customers is borderline terrible. I get the impression that management does not care or is not present.About the reviewer:36 year old single male, well-travelled American. Marriott Reward Platinum, SPG Platinum and lifetime Gold, American Airlines Executive Platinum. Frequent user of the Marriott Rewards Visa Signature and American Express Platinum cards.

I stayed here for a night and the room was very comfortable. Staff at check-in were awesome and I had used the SPG app for mobile check-in so was able to pick up my key and head to my room within a few minutes.Very close to Canal Street station so easy to get around, very quiet in the room.

The view is great on the Club Level deck! Great staff! Deon is a particularly excellent and fun in the Club Lounge! My wife and I also appreciated the location in that there is easy access to great places & transportation.

Thank you, Sal & Nelson for the warm welcome after arriving late last night. Extremely friendly and was very professional but more importantly personable. Thank you for the making my experience so welcoming!

Great staff. Deon who served at the club level went beyond others. He was very friendly and made sure everyone there was satisfied. The young lady who served at the dining area was very helpful and did what she could to keep us satisfied.

Staff great, room ok, clean and fine. But, come on. Paying $10 for 24hrs wifi? Idiots! Why not charge for water and electricity as well? About time you realise it's 2017 and not 1977. Last time I'll stay with you until you get your act together. Luddites!

Great location friendly and helpful front desk. We were on the 3rd floor facing Canal Street - there was a lot of road noise (horns and car alarms) all night. But overall a good place to stay. Breakfast was quite reasonable for the area.

We don’t have the highest expectation of personal service in a busy New York hotel. But somehow the Sheraton Tribeca is an exception to the rule. Starting with manager at reception Sal and his wonderful offsider Janilsa we’ve really received excellent service here. Our room while not big is not too small and we’ve fitted in all our bags full of our recent shopping. The walk-in shower we requested was waiting for us. Wonderful. There is a coffee maker in the room. We requested a kettle for tea and it was delivered within 5 minutes. And not by someone holding their hand out for a tip. If this is the part of town you want then it’s great value and highly recommended

Recently had a thanksgiving break at the Sheraton Tribeca. The rooms were of good standard comfy beds and quiet, no street noise could be heard, we didn’t have the best view that’s in all the images of the hotel that comes with the $30 price for access to a club room it was a picture I wanted and not the food or drink on offer we found out on asking where the balcony access was the only downside that wasn’t really clear that the lounge access and balcony access are one of the same.So I saved my $30 and used the money to go up to the top of the rockerfeller centre instead.Overall a good experience for the price paid and staying out of the madness of midtown this time in NYC made me love the city and this new location a little bit more

My wife and I decided on a quick trip to NYC but wanted to try to score as much as possible on points. We had some SPG points saved and the only or one of the few properties we could apply our points was the Sheraton Tribeca. We went for this since we had been to NYC numerous times but never experienced this area -- so for us, it was a cool first. Some cool shopping spots are about 10-15 min away on foot and other places we wanted to see like the Brooklyn Bridge were about 20 minutes. The property was decent -- quiet, clean and not overwhelming. Staff was attentive, friendly, courteous and knowledgeable about the area. A few spots nearby to get food, beverages, quick meals, etc... Fitness space was small (3 treadmills which were full) but pretty standard for a property of this size.Elevators were a bit slow and not every staircase allowed you to exit on the first floor so it took a few minutes regardless. Overall, a nice stay in an area we never experienced so it was much appreciated. Not the most aesthetically pleasing property but perfect for this quiet (and cheap) getaway we were looking for.

My family and I stayed in a Club Double Room for three nights and we had a great visit overall. I would describe the Sheraton Tribeca as a mid-range hotel, with average-size rooms and amenities. It is perfect if you are looking for an economical place to stay, that is modern, clean, and has friendly staff.Check-in: At the front desk Kaylene (I'm pretty sure that was her name!) greeted us and helped us get checked-in. Although we were early, and our room wasn't ready yet, Kaylene made sure we had access to the Club Lounge so that we could go ahead and have breakfast. Fantastic! We checked our bags with the bellman, ate, and went out for several hours to explore the neighborhood. We returned later to pick up our luggage and headed up to our room on the 19th floor with a fantastic view. Club Lounge: On our first night we also made it back in time for the nightly Hors d'ouevres in the club lounge. Now, I realize that Hors d'oeuvres is a fancy french word, but you shouldn't really expect fancy, French (or otherwise fancy) food; again, this is a mid-range, economical hotel. What you will find are a good selection of cheeses, crackers, chips, dips, fruit and, most importantly, wine! Perfect for us, and we actually had "dinner" at the club lounge several evenings during our stay. And I want to add that Deon, who staffs the club lounge in the evening, provided excellent service. He's very friendly and helpful, and can get you what you need if something isn't available that should be.The lounge space is actually very small, and does get crowded. But it is attached to a fantastic rooftop area that is pretty cool to visit (weather permitting). The lounge is open 24/7, and always has water, pop, and milk stocked. Snacks may or may not be available depending on what time of day it is.Room: Our room seemed normal-sized to me. We had a decent view (not sure which direction) and the beds were comfortable and clean. We did discover two issues with the room once we were a few days into our stay. First, the tub drain was very slow, which meant that water backed up during a shower. It got to the point that we would turn it off to let the water drain out before continuing with our shower. Second, the dehumidifier fan in the bathroom was not working. So the room often ended up being super-humid and hot after several people showered. And the shower curtain was not completely drying and had a smell to it as a result. We had to keep the air conditioning blowing to solve the problem. So, you might want to check your shower/bathroom fan before settling in. We'd been there for a few days already so we just tried to make it work.Neighborhood. It's Tribeca folks. Not Times Square. Not Central Park West. Not kiddieland. If you need something to do the best tip is to research the neighborhood before you go and plan out your activities accordingly. To me, it really wasn't a "walk outside your hotel and find all these amazing things to do" kind of area. And if you end up walking the few blocks down the street towards Chinatown, yes, you will absolutely run into some sketchy characters (and maybe get a contact high). But, that could happen anywhere in NYC, or probably your 'hood too. If you're into artsy stuff, there's lots of independent artist spaces, pop-up shops, boutique clothing/furniture spaces a few blocks over. If you want to do serious shopping, there's a great mall at One World Trade Center that is partly underground and partly above ground where the designer stores are located. There are two playgrounds that are fairly close but we only had time to visit the one at Pier 21. My kids had a great time there and even jumped into a pick-up basketball game. There were sit-down restaurants but we didn't go to any. We did visit the Black Burger (a tiny burger joint), which was just aiight, and Billy's Bakery for some cupcakes and brownies, which were good.Staff: I've already mentioned Kaylene and Deon. There were a few bellmen and another front desk person who were great as well. Was everyone perfect? No. Was the cleaning lady a little cranky? Yes. But I cut her some slack because I had to bother her for like 17,000 towels after one of my kids got sick and I understand that she probably wasn't expecting to use all the towels on her cart in my one room. :) Overall, people were friendly and happy to help us get the things we needed.Whew! In sum, have realistic expectations for the price you're paying and the neighborhood you're staying in, and you will enjoy this hotel. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.

I travel about 60 nights a year. I've never had a Bellman this helpful. I admitted to him I was to timid to jump out and grab a cab on the NY streets - people kept stealing them from me. Carlos walked 1/2 a block and got in the middle of the street for quit some time trying to snag one for me. I really appreciated that. Who knows how long I would have been at that corner!Overall hotel is good. Was on top floor and elevators were very slow. The blinds did a good job cutting out the light, but didn't shut completely so it was hard to sleep with the shard of light hitting the bed. Clean, spacious rooms for NYC. Exec lounge is nice with a beautiful view, but the breakfast was pretty sad.

The location is great to walk around to get a quick bites and a couple of minutes walk to catch a subway. The room is fine and a bit small but understandable. It is in New York! The staff there are very friendly. Deon was awesome. We will stay here again.

I️ stayed here for 2 nights on business. As a gold spg member I️ was given club access. Check in was easy. My room was fine - clean , good WiFi, quiet for nyc. Gym was adequate although I️ suggest running along the water I️ f you can. Location is great for tourists too. Checkout was easy. We toook hotel car instead of cab to lga. Much cleaner and nicer.

U would probably walk by the property at first glance. Very comfortable; excellent staff! Sal and Mai were awesome. Christie and May, bellman David real nice. The Sheraton Club Host Deon is a true host! Will refer my friends and business associates to the Hotel. Thank You!

My family and I love this hotel. What a Gem for New York. I can’t say enough about the staff. They were top notch and above everyone else in the area. We checked in at around three in the afternoon and was greeted by a polite young man. Sorry I forgot his name. When we got to our room, it was definitely a wow factor. The view that we had was so spectacular that my two kids were all smiles. Never mind the wife. She was just taking it all in and loving every minute of it. We were on the 22nd floor at The Presidential Suite so we got to use The Club Lounge on the 21st floor. The drinks and snack in the club lounge was decent. The free appetizers at night was a nice touch. Now to the area that we were in. It was the best hotel for what we needed to do. SHOPPING!!!!! SoHo is just around the corner from this beautiful hotel. So my new word that my two boys taught me is HypeBeast. What is it you might ask? Well it means whatever kids or pop culture wears for there style. You follow suit to what there wearing too. So there are plenty of stores around there for that type of clothing. But it comes with the price tag. $$$$$$$$$$$$$ the stores that are around there is BBC, Palace, Stadium Goods, Off White, Nike Lab, Supreme and KITH. And we went to all of them and spent a lot of $$$$$$$$$$ doing so! We will be back to this hotel in the early future. Thanks for a very memorable time in New York!!!!! P.S. I wish I remember the other guys name that upgraded us to The Presidential Suite. Thanks My Man!

We stayed here for a few days while my daughter was attending a dance intensive. Our experience with New York is really limited so I had no idea about the area. The hotel is super close to the trains - maybe 2 blocks - so that was super convenient. We didn't realize under a day or two in that if we walked in the other direction, we would be in a much nicer neighborhood - live and learn.I will say that we upgraded to the club level and that was a tremendous waste of money. We went up for appetizers every night and there was basically just crumbs. Same with breakfast - a could of sad bagels and bruised fruit. They didn't even have waters laying out for us to take - we had to ask for them and then they were the tiny, child sized bottled water. It certainly was the most poorly stocked club level I've ever stayed on.The room was nice sized and the bed was super comfy. I would absolutely stay here again, I would just save my $$ and skip the club level.

We stayed 3 nights here in November 2017 during the NY Marathon. This hotel is convenient to all the major attractions, as well as near to numerous subway lines. Please note that at the time we stayed here there were quite a few people selling knock-off handbags and watches along Canal Street near the hotel. This was quite unnerving at first, but all you have to say is I'm not interested and keep on walking, and they stop heckling you. We stayed on the club level and had access to the club lounge which offered sodas, snacks, coffee and tea 24 hours a day. From 7 am until 10 am they offered continental breakfast, and from 5:30 pm until 7:30 pm they offered hors d'oeuvres and wine, all of which were very tasty! While talking to the gentleman setting out the hors d'oeuvres, he offered us a complimentary pass to enjoy the breakfast buffet the next morning in the lobby, such an awesome gesture from a dedicated employee! And finally the view from the club lounge and rooftop deck are AMAZING! We would definitely stay here again!

We went driving from Miami and it was a great experience to rest comfortable in this hotel. We had a lot of options of restaurants to dine nearby as well as a great shopping area with exclusive brands. Walking to the world trade center or Brooklyn bridge is easy. At night the best is to walk to the village were all the jazz clubs are located. The staff is very nice and helpful to provide directions, ideas and were to find things around. They were really super friendly making us feel at home and enjoying every moment we spend there.

We stayed in the hotel for 15 days in August 2017.Positives:1. Location: Pretty much in the middle of all action in New York; very close to Holland Tunnel, and walking distance from many of the tourist spots of the city.2. Staff attitude: Friendly, unobtrusive and prompt attendance to requests3. City view: Excellent view of the city from the rooms on the upper floors.4. If one just wants to stretch one's legs a bit and don't care much about other comforts, this is a decent place to go to.Needs improvement:1. Rooms and decor: Badly need facelift. 2. Maintenance: Purely business-like and no effort to give a thought to what could be done to make the stay a bit more pleasant. Least impressive. In the 15 days that we stayed, not once were the bed linen changed. No attempt to study our habits/likes/dislikes and structure the service accordingly.3. Breakfast: A rip-off. Package said breakfast is included. What we found was a lounge-based cold breakfast offer, just packaged cereals, croissants and coffee vending machines. Even fruits were missing. There was no kitchen so you won't get cooked food.4. Price: The hotel is definitely cheaper compared to the other hotels in the vicinity, but only after staying there did we realize why. Having said that, the price definitely wasn't worth the experience we had. We shouldn't have gone by the brand name of Sheraton. The hotel certainly didn't live up to it.

The hotel in general is quite old. The rooms are dated. The bed was comfortable. I believed that we had B&B but no-one could confirm to me if breakfast was included in my deal, in the end I gave up as the breakfast looked a bit rubbish and went to some of the excellent restaurants locally (Bubby's and Antique Garage get a plus from me). My girlfriend was sick one day and I got charged $45 for a bowl of rice and a ginger drink.Location is pretty good with nice cafe's.

Have stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca on 2 occasions within the last 5 months. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are quite small and, as with many NY hotels, the lighting leaves much to be desired. The location would be my main reason to stay there again. During my most recent stay, the air conditioning failed on the 3rd floor. By 3AM, my room was very warm and humid making a good night's sleep impossible. My prior stay was much more comfortable. Overall, the hotel itself is nothing special, but the staff was engaging and helpful.

A very enjoyable 8 night business trip at the sheraton tribeca with special thanks to Sal who was very friendly, attentive and took care of our every need.The hotel clean, comfortable and is located in a convenient area with four subway stations nearby and 5 mins walk to the trendy areas of soho, little Italy, Chinatown and close to ground zero / world trade center.Looking forward to my next stay!

I chose the hotel based on price, location and my membership in SPG. It's not that fancy from the outside but I was greeted by the bellman who could not possibly have been more helpful. The airline had torn a wheel off my suitcase and I needed a new one: boom. He gave me directions and also suggestions for clothes, that I desperately needed to buy. I got a room upgrade and it was a nice size and quiet. Every employee I encountered was outstanding. The black mark was the restaurant. I'd also factored in the Italian restaurant when choosing the hotel, and the menu that I'd looked at on-line. It looked fantastic. But when I got my chicken dish, it was inedible. All I could think was Podiatrist Convention rubber chicken. It had some yellowish sauce on it and the asparagus was chopped into little pieces so it looked like it was covered in pickles. I will most definitely stay here again and I will most definitely avoid the restaurant.

The location if very good, on Canal St. across the street from SOHO, and at walking distance to Greenwich Village, Little Italy and China town.Confortable rooms. The place has a Sturbacks in the lobby and place for breakfast and dinner close by at Tribeca.

Just to note that Steven Hemlall and all the lounge staff do a great job in extremely cramped quarters. It's not easy to keep restocking and refilling while a dozen hungry people mill around you and he did so with efficiency and good humor.

This hotel was a value for the rate charged, considering it is in the Tribeca neighborhood. I must admit, usually every other place we go, hotel rooms are a bit larger. This hotel was very convenient and was within walking distance to most of the venues we had to go to,The staff was very attentive and Sal, who checked us in was very personable and always had a hello and a wave during our 4 night stay, We had an issue with our first room, and it was changed the next day with no fuss or bother

I have been going for years, and their lounge was one of the attractions. In the evening, a great terrace with Hot food and complementary alcohol (Wine & Beer). First they killed the hot food and replaced it with processed gmo infused cold cuts (yes, in NYC!). Now they killed the beer....only wine.The ONLY thing that makes the lounge worthwhile now is that they have kept Deon as the guardian of the lounge. He is the hotel's true ambassador. Hope the management is taking care of him.....he goes the extra mileS!!!

This was our first time to NYC and wanted to see all the great history and landmarks. We chose the Sheraton based on location, price and reviews. The hotel is easy to get to from Newark using either uber or the subway system. We took uber from airport and regretted it...Traffic is horrible and the drivers are scary. The subway and train was easy on the way back to Newark and took about 35min. There are 2 subway entrances on the back side of the hotel. It was nice so you don't have to wheel luggage to far.We walked to Chinatown, Little Italy and the 911 memorial. We took the subway up to central park and times square bc it would have been to far of a walk both ways.Hotel staff is amazing! Super helpful with directions etc. The 21st floor is a great view and the breakfast and coffee in am was nice. There are several coffee/bfast places within a block of hotel as well.We had a king bed on 10th floor and was happy. The room was a nice size and super clean. Bed was comfortable and the noise was tolerable at night. Mostly the honking and traffic was during day which didn't matter to us. There is a bar/restaurant in the lobby. The food was amazing and the tap beers were cold!

After reading reviews of this location prior to our arrival I was not disappointed. Every positive review previously written was right on point. The staff provided excellent service the bed was comfortable and location was perfect. This is definitely out of the hustle and bustle of Manhattan yet the Subway is easily accessible and a quick ride to Time Square or the water front. We were checked in by Janilse who was professional and knowledgeable. The front desk staff for the duration of our stay were friendly and ready to assist. We did not introduce ourselves to each one personally but that didn't matter since it felt like weve known them forever. In the evening Sal always had a pleasant smile and answered any questions and assisted with any room concerns or food options. This hotel is conveniently located in the Tribeca area and our room was well appointed (BEST BED EVER the Sheraton bed was AMAZING) and faced Canal street. I highly recommend upgrading to the Club Lounge where you have beautiful views, sunrises and sunsets and another FANTASTIC STAFF member of the Sheraton DEON performed his duties exceptionally. In the evening he serves delicious snacks and various wines plus sodas and water. The Club Lounge also serves a continental breakfast and is available 24 hours a day with snacks, sodas water fruit etc. and did I mention the VIEW ...Fabulous! We head out on October 23rd for a cruise and Carlos our bellman helped us to arrange transportation to Bayonne NJ. (This was a welcome service since 5 years ago we left our hotel via taxi to Bayonne and the taxi driver got lost. Big Bucks for that trip.) We chose this location since its close to the Holland Tunnel and it is closer to Bayonne. If you want a great room and exceptional service book the Sheraton Tribeca.

We’ll stay here again. Every person we interacted with was helpful and friendly. They accommodated our early arrival and held our bags after we checked out. The room was clean and updated. Very comfortable bed and space for NYC.

It is a normal hotel, the reception is cool and the rooms are old, the positive point is that is close to little Italy and China town if you are aiming for Chinese food,massage or do you nails.There are better boutique hotels at the same area.

This was my first time staying at the Sheraton Tribeca -it was in a good location for restaurants and out of the main hustle and bustle of Manhattan. The room was on the small size but very comfortable overall. Staff was very helpful

One nighter - nice room although pretty tight ! But that's manhattan. Nice amenities and locations great for subways and getting anywhere in lower NYC. Couple small things. NO Water cooler in gym. That's a must and a no brainer. Shower head was pathetic... all else good

We, 2 adults + a teenage daughter, stayed at Sheraton Tribeca from 2 - 9 October 2017 and it was just perfect. We had the wildest room with a fantastic skyline view and the room was very clean. We had our breakfast on the top roof every morning and also had snacks and wine every afternoon. We also want to thank you, Deon, for your pleasant and kind welcome every morning when we came to have our breakfast or snack in the afternoon. We think Sheraton Tribeca is the perfect location for a visit in New York and everything worked perfectly.

I choose this hotel primarily for price which included the concierge lounge that has a spectacular skyline view on the 21st floor and 24 hr access. The rooms were a good size for New York City. We stayed in a king room. It was clean and there was a walk in shower. The lounge has complimentary breakfast in the morning with bagels, pastries, hot oatmeal, juice, coffee, tea. They also have evening appetizers and complimentary wine, plus you can access it 24 hrs if you need a drink, or snack. We did not have to buy bottled water or snacks our entire stay. They are always open. They also have a microwave you can use to warm up your leftovers. I know it may cost a little more but I believe you are actually saving more $ with the food. And the sky view was amazing in the morning and night. Everyone was very professional and friendly. The location is perfect to walk to Chinatown, Little Italy, Tribeca and Soho. A few blocks you are in chinatown. Across the street you are in Soho. There are so many places to eat, around the area. On the weekend, there is an outdoor food market just west of the hotel. I would stay there again.

Nice neighborhood but the hotel needs an update. Small room, very nice matrass but again, the room really needs an update. We slept on the 11th floor but even there we could hear the traffic, very bad isolated. Room wasn't cleaned very well but when I mentioned it , we got a free breakfast. So...nice staff.We chose this hotel because of the rooftop terrace but we never had red that you'll have to pay an extra $ 30/ day/person for the use of it and...it even has no bar! So we did not see it once...We think it was too expensive for what we got!

Not a bad stay. Comfortable beds. Larger room than other places I've stayed nearby. But furniture is showing wear. And lobby vibe is more like an office-park hotel in the midwest than a Manhattan hotel. Perfectly fine stay, just not my hotel of choice in that neighborhood.

Great location, good panorama from city view rooms, roof terrace worth the extra if you're having a lazy day. Very comfy bed and nice shower. Best thing is it's just round the corner from New Yorks best dive bar , Nancy Whiskey Pub.

Hands down my favorite hotel! Having stayed over 90 nights there this year, I return for the comfortable beds and friendly staff. From the moment you step out the cab, Dave, Ferry, or Carlos greet you with a smile. Colin, Mia, Sal, Megan, and the rest of the front desk staff check you in like family. Dione up stairs in the club lounge takes pride in ensuring your comfort and satisfaction. Plus you can't beat the view from the rooftop deck. This is my "go to" hotel in New York City. I recommend that my family and friends stay there. Close to shopping and great restaurants. Around the corner from the subway. It's convenient and comfortable.

Despite what other reviewers say, I absolutely loved the bed. It was so comfortable and soft. The room was a good size. My room was close to the lift, which made a really loud screeching noise on my floor. When I asked to be moved, I was moved to a room further away the next morning. There are a lot of hotel option is New York, but for me what made this one stand out was the rooftop. In pictures this rooftop looked bigger than the other hotels with rooftops.When I went to reception asking how I get in, they advised I had to pay a $30 USD entry fee, which is what it costs to get into the top of the rock at the Rockefeller centre. I was extremely disappointed by this, because have I had know I wouldn't have booked this hotel.The bagel place next door is amazing, and was my breakfast go to each morning.

My fiancee and I come to NY about once a year and have stayed at numerous hotels, airbnbs, etc. Lately we've been staying at SPG hotels more due to our status, but this is the first time we've stayed at Sheraton Tribeca. The start, the location is great. As long as you know how to navigate your way on foot or on subway, you are easily connected to the rest of the city. Getting around by car is tough with the all day traffic. The room was small, but it was well maintained and comfortable. The real highlight of our stay was the service. The night manager, Nelson, really went above and beyond to make sure we were taken care of and had everything we needed. Service was quick and accommodating. I didn't have any interactions with the day managers, but my fiancee mentioned that Sal was also extremely helpful and polite. We didn't really take advantage of the rest of the amenities, bar, or restaurant in the hotel since we were out and about for the most part, but coming back to attentive and helpful service is always a great feeling.

We stayed here for 4 nights in August and another 4 nights at the beginning of September and were very satisfied with our choice.I had read negative comments about reception staff however, I couldn't fault them. At all times the staff were friendly and helpful especially Meghan. We asked for cars to be arranged twice for a transfer to the airport and both times there were absolutely no problems.The rooms are a reasonable size for New York and the Hotel is located near three different Subway lines.We stayed in a Club room and it was great to have access to the Club on the 21st floor with the outdoor area and the beautiful view towards uptown.The complimentary breakfast and then drinks in the afternoon were great. These are included when you book a Club room.We really enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay here again when we next visit New York.

We stayed at The Sheraton Tribeca Hotel in Canal Street. Super hotel and we had a good view of the night life from our hotel room. However the view from the roof the following morning, with a cup of coffee was exceptional.Good room and helpful friendly staff.

Meeting planner picked the hotel for a business meeting. Terrible traffic to get there.Rooms typical, nothing special or memorable.Leaving was a nightmare - no cabs would drive by because the gridlock was so terrible Had to walk 3 blocks to get one that would stop.

I paid 370$ per night for a very small single room (comparing to cheaper single rooms in other hotels in New York.The hotel is located in Canal street which is a very dirty street. The only advantage is that it is close to SOHO and to Greenwich.The bath is poor.I will not book again at this hotel.

We spent three nights here prior to leaving on a cruise. We upgraded to a club level room on the 18th floor, which had a nice view of mid-town and the Empire State Building. Our room was quite small--really more suitable for a single person than a couple--but it helped to have the access to the club lounge on the 21st floor, which was quite comfortable and had a spacious deck. We enjoyed the continental breakfast each morning (good fresh bagels and pastries; would have been nice to have some fruit each morning), and the happy hour offerings were generous enough that we made it our dinner each night. The attendants in the lounge (and I'm sorry I didn't get their names, because they were perfectly lovely) were attentive and friendly, as were the front desk staff members--especially Janilsa, who was always there and always helpful. Nice fitness center (if a bit on the smallish side), which would be improved with the addition of some real yoga mats, and the replacement of the existing foam exercise mats, which have seen better days. The location is great--lots of good restaurants in the area, and an easy walk to the tourist sights to the south, plus a subway station just a couple of blocks away. Our room was quiet, and the bed was very comfortable, but I miss having a dresser so I can unpack.

Upon entering the room, it smelled of stale air and was very muggy almost like the smell of a pool house. The bathroom was relatively clean but not as clean as you'd like from a hotel. My sheets also had a stain on them. The most frustrating part was probably how thin the walls are. I could hear everything from my neighbors to the outside noise. They also only offer free wifi to members which I thought was a little weird. I'd only book this if you're looking for a hotel on the budget and they're offering a good price.

Booked a club level room on a Sunday night. I had to come in for an early morning business meeting that Monday. I cannot believe how loud it was overnight. I woke up many times to the sounds of my neighbors voices, and especially their doors opening and closing. Even though it's a decent location I will try to not stay here again. My online booking reservation called this a 'recently renovated' room. This was not the case either.

Trafic to reach the place is awful , recommended traveling after 7pm or in the early morning.The place don't look wonderfully but the whole place is a mess. Personal fine , easy and quick.Room not so clean as you suppose should be in a sheraton at tribeca.Insulation from noise acceptable. The internal restaurant is a pleasant surprise in the american standard since they are able to produce a real italian cooking (that said by an italian).Location is remarkable because the position it will be useful to reach easily manhattan or the museum area , no to speak of the theatre one.

2 club level rooms for 1 night stay. Very friendly/easy check in. Bell hops VERY helpful in suggesting close by restaurants and went out of their way to hail cabs for us (I was traveling with 2 elderly folks!). Rooms comfortable and clean. Visited club room for a quick snack and grab some rooftop photos...nice selection of softdrinks, wines and munchies. Deon was working his tail off and was very accommodating! Beds weren't the most comfy, but for the 6 or so hours we needed them, they were fine. Also great location!

This hotel is very close to the Canal Street subway, and a good base. It's about a 15-20 minute walk to the World Trade Centre and Irish Hunger Memorial. I didn't have many interactions with the staff but they were very helpful whenever I did.

location is not bad, there are restaurants and bars walking distancethere's a nice outdoors bar which is in the lobby & outside of the hotel rooms are very small the room next door was very noise and we heard every single bit of it

This is the second time staying here. Love it! Friendly staff. Close to everything. Roof top lounge for Club Suite is super nice! Planet Fitness next door. The BEST 24 hour bagel store also next door!

Managed to picK this little beauty up for 1/2 price on a booking site, $242@day AUD, great for NYCand location. Quiet,Quality accomodation ( extremely comfy beds) and right next to sub line A C E. Cute bars and restaurants all around and short walk to Greenwich V. Lovely helpful staff which Sheraton is known for, big thumbs up

Took my daughter and her best friend to NYC for labour day weekend as a Graduation gift and stayed here. This hotel experience was one of the best I've ever had. The location was beyond perfect, felt safe, subway station around the corner, shopping on Canal street, Soho seconds away and a short ride to get uptown! The staff was friendly and helpful! If any of you have the opportunity to meet Sal, call yourselves very lucky. He not only helped us find free parking a block away but he gave us excellent advice on where to go and how to get there. A huge thank you to Sal and the team at the consierge/luggage desk!! You guys were the best and we will most definatly be back!!!

Deon in Club lounge is the best!Corey - MGMT & front desk also welcoming & accommodating!I stay here for work & pleasure - location is convenient to Tribeca/Soho & all subways. Deck on 21st floor - incredible views & Deon runs the lounge perfectly.

I stayed in a double room for 4 nights here and really liked it. The room was small, but still enough space for two people and our luggage. The bed was amazing, really comfortable, one of the best beds I have ever stayed in! The bathroom was nice and very clean. The shower was also very good.The location is great, only a 2 min walk from the closest subway stop and about a 5 min walk from other subway stops on different lines. There are loads of good places to eat and drink within walking distance.Would highly recommend this hotel if you're looking for somewhere to stay in NYC!

This was my 7th trip to Sheraton TriBeCa, and it is always a fabulous experience. This is due in large part to the friendly, courteous staff who truly appear to love serving their guests. They are not just friendly, but they get to know you. When you repeat visit you are greeted with a knowing, recognizing smile from every employee and are greeted by name (even hugs) from those you really have the most contact with. And I really mean this about every employee. The hotel is also in a great area of the city. Easy walk or train to the downtown area, NYU campus, Chinatown, Little Italy and Soho. The hotel is also located at a major subway stop for most trains.My daughter attends NYU, and we will be booking the Sheraton TriBeCa for every visit the next few years!

As far as I am concerned, my experience was really good with de amenities and the service. The place was really clean and the Lounge was a good option when you arrived really tired.Deon [at the Lounge in the 21th floor] was really helpful and nice, as everyday in the afternoon he makes as feel really welcome in a very confortable environment.We will come again!

The breakfast in their club lounge used to be a hot breakfast, eggs, potatoes, etc...now it's a continental breakfast. The type of breakfast that even the cheapest of hotel chains offers all of their guests is what they now offer their preferred guests in the club lounge. This sort of level of reduction in services being offered to their preferred guests seems to be happening everywhere. Thanks Marriott.

I was eagerly anticipating this trip to NYC since my husband was taking me to see a Broadway show for my 40th birthday. We picked the Sheraton Tribeca due to its close proximity to the Holland Tunnel so we wouldn't have to spend eons of time sitting in traffic on our way out of the City. If you want quick access to NJ, easy access to the Subway, and a clean and basic place to stay, then this hotel will be enough for you. If you expect more, then keep reading!We requested an early (12:00 pm) check-in. We arrived at the hotel at 1:30 and our room wasn't ready. We'd been upgraded because we were celebrating my birthday. Therefore, we decided to wait the hour for the room. We returned 90 mins. later to find out our room still wasn't ready. I was unhappy since we had to get ready for dinner and the show. Therefore, the front desk manager scrambled and found us another room. When we got upstairs to room 1809, we discovered it was directly across from the elevator (which is counter to what my SPG profile says) and it was hot and stuffy in the room. We called guest services who advised us to turn down the temperature and place the unit on auto fan. We did this, but it was still warm when we left 30 minutes later.We arrived back at he hotel around 11:15 pm to discover our room was still hot and stuffy. We requested a room change. We were given room 1706, which was also warm, and significantly smaller than our previous room. However, by 11:30 pm, we just wanted to go to bed. By the time I turned in after midnight, the room had cooled a bit, but the air was blowing directly on my neck in the bed. I was bone tired so I sucked it up, pulled the covers up to my chin, and went to bed. Unfortunately, my neck was still when I woke up thanks to the Ir blowing on me.Our stay wasn't great. In fact, I won't stay at this property again due to the two room issues we had.

Great location, nice staff! Near major transportation hubs. Soho and Tribeca are fabulous neighborhoods with shopping and dining galore. Rooms are decent size not big by any standards but above average for New York.Enjoyed my stay!

We stay at the Sheraton Tribeca everytime we are in NYC. Fabulous location, rooms and amenities. The Club room offer a fantastic view from their roof top deck. Sunsets are incredible with Empire State building in the background. Deon makes happy hour truly happy. He is so helpful and professional. Makes all feel welcome.

This is a small, boutique style version of a Sheraton Hotel in lower Manhattan. As a Sheraton, there was nothing super special with regard to amenities. This location is well maintained, but is definitely worn down a bit in the rooms and in the gym. Could use a renovation. Also since it's NYC, you should expect small (rooms are tight and the gym is minimal) The check-in and front desk staff were terrific. The best part is the location. Just off of West Broadway, you can walk to great restaurants and shops. It's close to everything in Soho and Wall Street and just a few easy blocks form two different Subway lines.

Came in with doubts got out with convictions: Hotel is clean, located strategically close to SOHO/Tribeca. Staff is awesome Nelson is amazing warm hearted and welcoming. My place for the next visit. The only thing missing...a pool.

We have been coming to the NY Gift show for years and used to stay in Times Square at the Westin. Several years ago we switched to the Sheraton Tribeca as Times Square is not very nice anymore since (the area) and we found the Westin to not be a great value. Since then, we have stayed here every time we come to NYC. The rooms are small, but clean and the staff are always helpful and generally pleasant. We LOVE the rooftop happy hour and so glad that Dion (Deon?) the Jamaican man is still there. He is always so friendly and really runs it very well, keeping all the food fresh and well stocked and the areas are always cleaned and tables cleaned. I was in the restaurant biz for many years so really appreciate the attention to detail. The only thing we miss is the buffet breakfast in the rooftop lounge. See you all next time!

The Sheraton Tribeca was clean, quiet, and comfortable, with helpful staff. The TriBeCa location was excellent (right by the Canal St subway station - served by the A/C/E trains; 10 minute walk to SoHo, Chinatown, Little Italy). There was no free wi-fi in rooms, but good wifi in the lobby. Computers were also available. No refrigerator in rooms. We stayed in early July, and the price was excellent. Extra special thank you to housekeeping, who did an outstanding job.Great value in Tribeca.

Stayed last night for our anniversary. Check in was smooth, room was very comfortable and clean. Great location...a few minutes walk to water and great restaurants. The staff was very welcoming and friendly. I will stay here again in the future.

I've stayed at this hotel several times because it is near a location I frequently visit for work meetings. While it is conveniently located if you want to be in lower Manhattan, particularly Soho and Tribeca, the experience is unbalanced. The rooms are very nice - NY-small, but nice. Checking in has been annoying several times - especially after 8 pm. There typically is only one person on and there is inevitably some issue with the person ahead of me, so it has not been fast or smooth. I've called for a Wake Up Call and had the phone ring for an extended period of time without being answered.The restaurant is old-school Italian at night, with nice food on the high-priced side. The breakfast buffet is uninspired and not worth the price. Both the Starbucks and restaurant don't open until 7 - which I find late for a business hotel.This time the bar was hilarious - absentee bar tender and no other bar staff for most of the time. But when she did show up at random occasions, the service was fast and pleasant.The elevators are slow - my colleagues have had to resort to walking down at busy morning times to avoid missing a meeting.I feel like I'm in an altered reality when i stay in this hotel.

We stayed 4 night this past weekend for a family event.Pro’s:The room rate was very reasonable for NYC and the location is good. We booked direct and utilized their online price matching program. We enjoyed the club lounge each morning for breakfast and enjoyed happy hour in the afternoon. We loved the outdoor seating area and great views.Our bed was relatively comfortable and we loved the view of the empire state building from room 2018.Our request for a mini fridge was granted and the maintenance department was quick to deliver.We loved the convenience of Tribeca Bagel located next door.Con’s:It took over an hour for our luggage to be brought up to our room. I called down a second time to inquire and the bellman was in our room in less than 5 minutes. Perhaps an oversight.The cleaning service was hit or miss. Some days we had a very clean room, other days we did not.The customer service staff throughout the hotel was also hit or miss. Some were great, others were less than average. The coffee maker in the room made only single serving cups. Coffee is key to survival for most. A one cup maker was frustrating.The club lounge could use an additional toaster and better-tasting coffee. The coffee tasted old and burnt.

Very nice people at the bar, nice hotel convenient walking to all great NY places, However we were put in a tight corner room w/ the neighbor that had a infant (why) when we were a marrurd couple that had NO children are pets with them!?no refrigarator or microwave find that very surprising for such a well known hotel

Sheraton Tribeca is a reasonably priced hotel with very good amenities and service. They do not charge a resort fee unlike many other Manhattan hotels. What sets them apart is the location. IF you are traveling via subway for your vacation AND wish to stay close to Chinatown and downtown Manhattan, this hotel is 2-10 min walking distance to 5 subway station lines (red, blue, yellow, green, brown) and you are minutes from Chinatown any time of the day/night for food!

I recently stayed at this hotel back in July and Sal was so good to me. I called the hotel in advance because I had so many questions, and he answered every single question and he was so patient with me. When I arrived at the hotel his hospitality was AMAZING !! He made sure I had everything I requested and he even recommended things for me !! Super friendly!! If you are staying at this hotel I recommend you ask for Sal! I enjoyed my stay but he made it even better! THANK YOU SAL! I will definitely be staying here again .

Well located for the sights of lower Manhattan. Many different subway lines within a very short walking distance.Staff were friendly and helpful.Canal Street is extremely busy at all times of day or night, expect a lot of street noise.There was an issue with our booking where for one of the five nights (which was booked later) the credit card was declined. The hotel honoured our booking but downgraded us from the room type originally booked charging the same amount as for the higher room.

As lifelong New Yorkers, we are pretty tough with high expectations. We recently rented a block of rooms here for a big family wedding. Starting with Bash who greeted us and watched our car and May who checked us in, the service was friendly, warm and professional. Rooms are not big or luxurious, but they are clean and comfortable. We slept well. The views from the upper floors and the "Club" lounge on 21 are worth the price alone.

We booked this hotel for its location and its very reasonable pricing and we were not disapointed. We had a good view over Chinatown from the 16th floor. The room was clean and the bathroom was well appointed. The staff were pleasant and helpful. We spent £475 (inc. tax) for a family of four for two nights, which for NYC is remarkable.

Every person we encountered was very friendly and helpful. The location is great for shopping in Soho, eating in Tribeca and walking to the 9/11 memorial or Chinatown. The rooms were spacious and clean. This will be our go-to hotel when visiting the City.

My wife and went to NYC for an extended visit to see our son. The staff was outstanding particularly Deon in the Sheraton Lounge. He was attentive, professional while juggling multiple customers at the same time.megan(sp) was extremely pleasant and helpful during both our check-in and check-out and made us feel at home. Lena at the bar was also great . We did have one problem with the a/c in the room but the gentlemen(did not get his name) was through and fixed thre problem and offered to come back later that day if we had any more issues.

This is my go to hotel in NYC. The location is perfect, easy Canal street walk to Soho shopping, FiDi for work. NO TOURISTS, thank goodness. But above all, terrific staff. I have never seen such hospitable front desk staff, and everyone from housekeeping to bell boys are the friendliest. They recognize everyone by first name. It truly makes it worth coming back to every single time. Dion in the club lounge is also the best server who delightfully chills with conversation while providing wine and snacks during the hotel happy hour (which in itself makes the trip worth a stay). Always a pro!

We booked from Friday 04/28/2017 to Sunday 04/30/2017. We arrived around 10:30pm to 11:00 pm.We were tired from driving for over three hours to get there. Our plan was to crab a quick bit, go to bed and have an early start the next day. I have a habit of checking the sheets before I jump in. I found hair and stain on the sheet (see pictures). This is suppose to be clean sheets. Look at how crinkled they were. Looks like someone rolled in it for at least a few days. It was disgusting!!!! They didn't even try to hide it. It was just there... very obvious. Personally, I think there should be a law against hotels renting out dirty rooms !!! Someone needs to pay. Right now there is no recourse. We paid for the club floor (higher floor), the manager said he would move us to the second floor without refunding the difference. At this point, we did not feel comfortable anymore. What if they move us to another dirty room? We decided to book a different hotel - we ended up at NoMo SoHo. It was more expensive but more out scene and a much better location. We were refunded but what we went through was a major inconvenience especially for that time of night. This hotel needs to overhaul their housekeeping team. People need to be fired on the spot for pulling a stunt like this. I feel they are giving the guests a big middle finger. BTW... The phone was dusty too. As for my fellow travelers, be vigilant!!! Staying at a $700 a night hotel/resort...check the sheets, unless you don't care. Unfortunately, I've been disappointed more times than not.

Had a great week at this hotel; rooms were clean and the staff, especially Sal at reception, were super friendly and helpful. The location is great for the subway and for strolling through soho and lower manhattan! Canal st is a really busy street but you couldn't hear the traffic noise from inside. Booked through booking.com and had free wifi in the rooms which was ideal. Only downside was our room didn't have a fridge which would have been nice however there was an ice machine and also a deli right next door to buy drinks etc! Overall I'd recommend this hotel as the perfect base for exploring New York!

We stayed here for one night and best thing is the great location. In only few minutes you are in Soho with many stores and cafes. The rooms are newly refurnished but very small. The towels need to be renewed, many were torn. The breakfast buffet was a big disappointment and not worth the money.

If you are looking for a fancy and luxury hotel you can stop reading now. But if you want to stay in a nice hotel, with helpful staff and a cosy roof top lounge and you do love Soho and Tribeca, this is the perfect place to stay. Make sure you book the Club rooms, then you have a simple breakfast included and afternoon drinks and snacks for free. It was very nice after a day in New York, coming back to the hotel, visit the roof top lounge, sipping a glas of wine together with cheese, nachos, guacomole etc. All served by Duane, who was very nice and serviceminded.

The first day found one bathroom towel frayed for 8-9 inches and a good sized. Hole in it. During our 3 nite stay we never obtained a bar of soap for shower, ran out of Kleenex, and although the burnt out shower light bulb was replaced they obviously did not try it after replacing as that too did not work. I had to place a towel on the ironing board as it's cover was stained and dirty. Those things aside, the rest of the room, tho small, was fine. The hotel itself centrally located, and employees nice.

Check InWe opted to spend a week in this hotel for a special occasion. I found the hotel was clean and tidy on entry. Jamie on check in was the first person to greet us and she was really lovely and had us smiling even though we where tired from our travels. She managed to check us in really quickly without any problems. I spoke with Sal a little after check in regarding a delivery I was expecting and he did a great job helping me with that and the subsequent follow up that was required, after the delivery firm made an error. It would have been nice if that had made it to the room however it was all a little thrown out by the delivery error. The RoomThe room was a good size for NYC and the view was amazing from the room. The only issue was the toilet flush tended to be a little intermittent, and on a few occasions I had to fix this myself, I'm sure had I raised the issue it would have been sorted. However for me it's quicker to get stuck in and sort it out. Victor was looking after our room each day and he did a great Job I can't thank him enough. He always took the time to say hi to us and crack a joke as we passed him, a really nice guy and he was always working really hard whenever we saw him. Club LoungeThe club lounge was tired and didn't have a toilet on the same floor we found this a little odd. You had to go back to your room if you needed the loo. The outside club veranda had the best views you could want in NYC easily on a par with the Empire state and Rocker fella, however it was in need of a tidy up and a few $ spending on it as it was tired and dated, I expected more from a big NYC hotel in this area. The evening snacks where very basic. Little things like bringing cushions in when it looked like rain was going to come down, background music and modern lighting would have been good. Possibly a wind-out canopy and power wash the floor. All small relatively low cost things that really would make a difference.The club staff did a great job at breakfast and of an evening. Deon and Alexia (I think her name was) really went out their way to keep the lounge tidy and well stocked in the evening even when really busy. Both really lovely people and put a lot of effort in to checking in with us to make sure we had everything and give us advice on the city. On a few occasions people seemed to be using the club lounge to hold personal gatherings for friends or associates that where not staying in the hotel, that was a bit off putting as we paid for that privilege, and the bar should have been used for that type of gathering especially when busy. LocationOverall a great hotel and location sitting on the edge of China town and Little Italy. This offers fantastic transport links and access to subway lines within a block or two. E line subway takes you uptown to time square within 15 mins and down town to the trade centre within a few stops. Loads of places to eat and drink around the hotel all within a walking distance. We stayed just off Time Square last time and would never do it again after staying in the Sheraton Tribeca 100% better quality and the staff actually acted like they care. RecommendationTry dining, we stopped in one evening and decided to eat down stairs. The restaurant was quiet and the service was really good from both the guys. The food was spot on, the rib eye steak was cooked to perfection and even me being a fussy eater enjoyed it. It was quite big as well. The Lamb dish was also very good. And the cost was the same as local bars only issue the meals could have come with a few more sides. 100% recommended.Bad PointsThe lack of beer in the bar on arrival. We got told a few different things and only two beers ended up on draught by the end of our week. The club lounge had no beer at all after our fifth day of being told no beer we got given a few beer vouchers. This meant going down to the bar and carrying the beer back up to the 21st floor. I was really disappointed with this and the solution provided by the hotel on the whole. Although the staff did their very best it was just not acceptable for a full week, I ended up drinking wine however it was not that nice. I'm sure management must have been aware of the issue and see no reason a few crates could not have picked up from the store. This was the most disappointing thing for me during our stay.

Great hotel with roof top lounge and views.Breakfast was a joke as the staff never put anything out unless you asked for it. I had to ask most of my 7 mornings there could I have cereal and the staff would go into store and hand you out one. They seemed to do this to all people wanting breakfast .I was miffed as to why they just didn't put the cereals they had out .I also had to asked for boiling water every morning too to make my tea as water in the flask which said hot water was only ever like warm.I noticed the staff were too busy texting in their mobile phones to replenish the breakfast items as they ran out.Even getting a plate was difficult as they put out about 3 at a time. Also breakfast was suppose to be at 7am but never ever anything ready at that time and my family wanted to eat early to get out early as a lot to get in on the holiday . Also there were 4 of us in room but towels were always lacking. Left 2 hand towels for 4 people and got face cloths one day but were never replaced again once used .I never saw a cleaner once and also wasn't left toilet roll so had to ask for that . Every thing just seemed to have no regular routine to it . If these things were all addressed it would be a good hotel as in great convenient location for tubes one minute walk away.

This hotel is located in a great place. Ideal for China Town, Little Italy and the subway. The staff are friendly, especially Colin, Sal and Mia. The club room gives great views. Try to get rooms.. 19 and.. 20 on the upper floors.

I visited during my normal work week in NYC. This is my new favorite hotel, for one reason: the rooftop bar (accessible through the lounge) which has views on three sides.Rooms were OK as well, and there's a decent bar and restaurant downstairs. Walking distance from the metro, 2 or 3 blocks away.

When I first checked in, I was welcomed by a nice lady named Lama who was so nice and helpful. My room wasn't ready but she made sure to contact me as soon as one became available. She allowed me to go up to the club lounge and enjoy the spectacular view from the top floor! Great service and nice rooms with plenty of room considering it is NYC!

This hotel is centrally located, close to Soho, Chinatown, and Little Italy. The rooms are small, but updated and clean - the beds are extremely comfortable. Be sure to upgrade to the Club Lounge - definitely worth it! "Neon" Deon is the best host at the Club Lounge! We've stayed her two years in a row now and will be back. The view from the Club Lounge patio cannot be beat!

It is very clean functional hotel with all you need for a stay in lower Manhattan. All the staff are extremely helpful and make a difference. Mia Fowler at the front desk checked us in and remembered us as we came and in and out. I needed a boarding pass and although she was about to go home she immediately went back to her desk and printed it out for me. This hotel has all the basics you need with great staff at a competitive price in NY

clean, even though canal street is not the nicest place, it is a block away from tribeca and a block away from the train. The rooftop from the executive lounge has an amazing view. Hotel staff is accommodating and helpful.

I generally don't enjoy small NYC hotel rooms and crowded lobbies but the staff at the Sheraton Tribeca make it a joy to stay at this property. The view from the Sheraton Club is amazing at all hours of the day or night. DEON MANS THE LOUNGE IN THE PM and makes it so that you have an amazing experience by having fresh clean food out from 5pm to past 8:30pm every night. He is attentive and makes sure the lounge is always maintained clean and welcoming. He is an amazing person and I honestly only stay at this property because he works there and makes me look forward to NYC with his attentiveness, attention to detail and customer service skills. He should be providing training on how to manage a club lounge across the SPG brands. He is an example to be followed.

Deon is a gifted person that the Lord has put him on the right place. He made sure you are well taking care off. he will go an extra mile to assure the costumers are given the service they expected.Deon is a pleasure to meet he made you feel as if you knew him for ever. We need more Deons on this hotels.

Just around the corner from the E train, we were impressed with the great customer service throughout our stay. Our 17th floor room was quiet and roomy for Manhattan. The gym was stocked with water bottles and headphones and had a nice variety of equipment. We loved the view from the executive lounge on the 21st floor. Breakfast there was ok, but just a continental setup. The evening snacks were nicer with fruit salad and vegetables along with other snacks and beverages. The walk to Chinatown and Little Italy is quick and easy.

Centrall located So for the point of getting around and food stores, pretty good Rooms are very mediocre, not to any of the other Sheratons I have stayed inSmall rooms with very limited towels and bathroom accessories No fridge or in room minibar Minimal tea and coffee making arrangements So from a access point of view a good hotel but was quite mediocre in other aspects. Was expecting more from a Sheraton perspective

This was a perfectly nice hotel with a starbucks in the lobby and a nice co-working space however the room was much too small - i had to get rid of the desk chair to walk between the desk and the bed, rendering the desk unusable - and there was no convenience-type store in the lobby, which most hotels have, to pickup simple things like a bottle of water. The location is good in terms of access to coffee shops & subway stations but beware the tunnel traffic which comes to a standstill in front of the hotel every afternoon, making commuting difficult. The hotel provides a hotel shuttle which is REALLY reasonable.

Great location in lower manhattan. Good shopping in Soho. Nice restaurants. A walk to Brooklyn bridge. Over the course of 5 days the maids only got to our room twice. The maids seemed to try to come at 5:00 the other days and of course we just get back. Strange to clean rooms at 5? Oh and don't eat at the hotel restaurant. $25USD for shrimp cocktail (3 prawns). Crazy expensive and not great. No pool either. But AC and a view is not bad either. Oh and CafÈ Bene next door is fantastic for a quick bite. Or if you have time. Eat the waffles with banana and caramel and bacon!

Lammah was extremely helpful. This was our first time staying here and she made us feel welcomed. She's amazing! Place is great too!!!! Great location! Spacious rooms too. Im ready to experience this city!

Since I am a platinum member of SPG I thought I couldn't go wrong staying at this Sheraton in Tribeca. The location is next to a subway station so it would be easy to get around the city and the price was under $200. What could go wrong? Well for one thing we had to ask for towels every single day of our stay and when we did get them (sometimes after multiple calls) they showed up thread bare and all ragged! The other thing that was weird is that the Club Lounge had an odd character manning the lounge each evening. He would tape signs all over the lounge saying on he could pour drinks! It just made the experience feel very low end so I would not recommend this place unless you can put up with having to make a lot of calls for basic things.

We spent 4 nights during 4th of July week-end. CI was quick and all personnel at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. Good bed - nice towels - shower worked perfectly. Room was cleaned in the morning so my husband could take a nap in the afternoon ... we would definitely go back ! Good price too !

Overall the hotel was ok, not bad given the price, but you expect more of a SheratonThe location is great, easy to get around by nearby subway or simply walkingAs always in America, the staff were friendlyThe interior and rooms are in need of updating

We are currently staying at this hotel on a 4 night vacation from Canada. I would never give a hotel a bad review but what hotel runs out of towels? When we checked in on June 30th the room had no towels. Called guest services and they brought two up to the room. The next day we spent the whole day out and returned at 6pm to find that our room still hadn't been cleaned. Called guest services and they said that they didn't know why it was missed. We left the room and came back an hour later to see that the room was cleaned but we had no towels. Called guest services again and they said that they would send some up. After two hours no towels. Went down to the front desk and they said that the hotel had no towels because they weren't delivered. They told us they would send some up as soon as they arrived. It's now 1am and still no towels! We now have had to have two showers and dry ourselves with facecloths. Hopefully by morning there will be towels. This is not what I expected when paying this much for a room in a brand name hotel. Was expecting a lot more for my first trip to New York. Other than that the front desk staff are very friendly and the room is nice. The rooftop patio is great!

Recently had a 4 night stay in the Sheraton TriBeCa. Have a SPG preferred level. Checked into the hotel Monday early evening after an all day travel from Florida. One representative at the front desk, 7 people inline. 15 minutes later it was my turn. Asked for a quiet room on an upper floor was greeted with sorry, we had a lot of late checkouts. It was 6:45 pm. The guests before me were placed on the 14th and 12th floors respectively. I was told they had a room on the 6th floor or I could wait an hour. Had an early call and was dead tired. Took the room I could check into then. To my disappointment it was above street construction next to the elevator! There was one bar of soap and a single bath towel.The soap and the towel situation was reminded at my request by housekeeping the next day. My company is located in TriBeCa, an easy walk, and I thought I would follow the Sheraton brand., which is why I booked there.With so many choices in the area I would offer, the hotel is a disappointment and not worth the loyalty points.

The hotel experience was good. Bathroom was big and clean. Club lounge was less than I expected. No hot options were available. I know the hotel can't control this but cars were honking almost nonstop for an hour. Crazy traffic going into the holland tunnel.

Located on Canal Street, right next to the ACE and the 123 subway lines, this location is perfect to move around the city quickly. The bed was very comfortable! The decoration of the room was very traditionnal, with a lot of brown and beige tones. I was also given a room for handicaped people (accessible room), so the bathroom was not convenient at all. Everything was very low, included the shower head. They also charge $10/day for wifi access, which I feel is ridiculous in 2017. Finally, even if I was staying for 3 nights, the cleaning lady didn't clean the room on one of the day. She also knocked on the door at 9am and wake me up on the day of my departure to see if I was still there. That was very irritating since I was still sleeping and didn't have to leave before noon.

I am not one to leave to many reviews, however one of the hotel staff members at the club level patio was amazing and I had to give him proper recognition for his enthusiasm, kindness, and dedication to his guests. Deon made sure everyone that walked in was treated like gold. He worked his butt off with 20+ people on the roof top keeping the place spotless and making sure everyone was comfortable. His service plus the amazing views made this stay truly a pleasure. This is going to be our go to NYC weekend home for all of our future trips and definitely going to chose more Sheraton properties in the future. I'm sure there are fancier places, but I couldn't be happier with the value, staff, customer service, and quality of rooms Sheraton has put together with this location. The only, and not critical thing I would have loved to have was a small fridge in the room, but not a deal breaker. Good job Sheraton TriBeCa!

I was in town for my son's high school graduation, and the hotel provided the perfect location. We were able to attend the celebration, which was within walking distance. The hotel rooms are a bit outdated, but the staff's attention to their guests makes up for it. They were very gracious at the reception desk, and the afternoon bartender was very knowledgeable. Our housekeeper was great, and the bellman, Carlos, was helpful with directions on were to eat. It was a lovely experience.
