My next-door neighbors were very noisy late at night: I phoned the reception and the issue was resolved quickly and efficiently.I'm used to staying in the Upper-East Side or Midtown hotels. I had this (apparently privately owned) Sheraton booked for me by mistake (instead of the Midtown one)... But didn't regret it one bit: It's much cheaper that it's where-it's-at competition. But it's not the main point. The main point is the quality (and the price) of food in the area. In the Upper East Side etc., the food is lousy and/or very expensive. But in Tribeca one has an excellent choice of all kinds of excellent restaurants at very reasonable prices. In fact, right around the corner from that Sheraton there is a superb Japanese restaurant (I'll review it... in Italian... :))) that would've been prohibitively expensive only 6 miles up north. So, this hotel is not fancy but a decent place to stay at. Lots of youth stay there.

Room was recently renovated and felt upscale and trendy (as was the lobby). Bed was comfortable and room, though small, was not terribly noisy (saying a lot for NYC hotels). Staff were very friendly. Located right next to subway and many restaurants. Great rate from Hotel Tonight app. Would stay again..

The hotel was great. Location could not be better if you like to visit Soho, China Town, Lower Manhattan and anything else down there. very close to the N and R line for travel uptown. My one piece of advice is to get a room that does not face the post office. You can hear the trucks backing up. Nicholas at the front desk was great. Picked out the perfect room. All in all a great stay.

A trip to NYC isn't meant to be spent in your hotel... I mean, if it were spent in your hotel, why bother traveling to the greatest city in the world? So what do you look for in a hotel then? Safety. Convenience. Cleanliness. Cost. This hotel is great on all of them. Is it FANCY? No. Does it have a world class fitness center and spa? No. But is it near every major subway? YES! And can you walk out the door and hail a cab in about 35 seconds? YES! And was it clean, safe, and a reasonable price? YES! YES! YES!If you want to stay downtown and visit the Village and TriBeca and SoHo then this is where you should stay. Plus you get Starwood Point!!! You're welcome.

“Keep doing what you do well now. Front of House staff all very helpfull, great location and easy access to the subway, good bar area and computer access, all very user friendly and would definately stay again when in NYC. The best out of the 3 Hotels we stayed in over the 2 weeks.”

Good and clean with good privacy. PC:s with printer in reception area, perfect for printing boarding pass. Go for the club rooms for a little extra, but you will have access to club floor with breakfast and gym with great view from the 20th floor. Also free wifi. Club rooms are also on the top levels. Ask for the Empire State view. The card readers in the elevators can be annoying as you need to run it quite a few times before recognized and it is required every time. Never tried the restaurant, but why not go around the corner to the the very nice Italian restaurant Pepolino

Spent one night at the Sheraton Tribeca ... So sorry didn't spend more time there ... The location is great ... Super close to Soho (great shopping) and other cool places ... Room was very nice ... Small but very nice ... Got late check-out at no cost ... Will definitely go back!

Located on Canal Street, on the edge of SoHo and Chinatown, it's very convenient. Two subway stops are located within a couple of blocks, so access to the A/C/E or the 1 subways are easy. Not a lot going on late at night in the neighborhood, though, so if you're traveling alone, just be wise. Rooms are tiny, but average by NYC standards and well maintained. Great soundproofing (I was on the 17th floor). Large, clean bathroom. And, exceptional service from the front desk - smiling, sincere and welcoming, fast and efficient. I got a great deal through the Sheraton website that was the same price as hotels.com and other non-Sheraton websites. I would stay here again if I can score another good deal.

On my early January trip to NYC we stayed at the Parker, the Element and the Sheraton Tribeca. In order of client care, room quality, interesting location, nearby great restaurants and actually being appreciated as a many year Platinum guest - Tribeca Sheraton was AMAZING. The Parker was nearly 3x the cost and not good. Give Tribeca Sheraton a shot - subway close to the hotel front door and really is only a few stops to Times Square or down to Financial district.

Stayed at the Sheraton TriBeCa for a weekend business trip. I was permitted an early check in, which made my life so much easier in terms of preparing for an afternoon meeting. The arrival was quick and smooth. My room was spacious and comfortable (truthfully, it was better than expected). The hotel location was ideal, close to two metro stops and an easy walk to shops and bars. During my stay I enjoyed the buffet breakfast and Starbucks coffee at the Link Cafe, and had a couple of drinks at the bar. Drink and food menu was good. Although I didn't order any food at the hotel bar, from the looks of what people around me ordered everything looked delicious.

We spent one night at this hotel while visiting NYC for the weekend. We arrived at the hotel hours before check-in time and they allowed us to check in early. The front desk attendants were very pleasant and seemed to enjoy their jobs. We were in room 617, which was a corner room with a street view. It was a great room for NYC, much larger than expected. Everything was clean and the bed was comfortable. We had breakfast included with our room rate and it was a full breakfast buffet with eggs, meat, potato, yogurt, waffles, etc. The hotel's location is very convenient to public transportation. We had breakfast at Bubby's on our first day in the city and it was fantastic and only a 7 minute walk from the hotel. You can easily walk to Chinatown and little Italy from this hotel as well. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to NYC.

Lovely hotel- clean, nicely decorated, good location (good transport links to everything but as a walking family we used our feet most of the time). Our room wasn't ready when we arrived but that's because it was in the morning so we didn't expect it to be. There was somewhere to leave luggage so we weren't hanging around and could explore the city straight away. Would definitely stay again.

This is my second review of this hotel - the first was a couple of years ago. Still highly recommended for location, room size, cleanliness. But the big point is the proactive helpfulness of the staff - housekeeping, concierge, front desk and management. Really makes a difference. They will take care of you in both big and small ways. (Which is nice if it's the crazy busy holidays and your flight out gets cancelled at the last minute and you need to extend your stay at short notice!)

Great location for exploring Soho. The rooms are a nice size and clean. The lobby has a Starbucks for the morning and a cozy bar for the evening. The staff is great and they were very accommodating for an early check-in. Would definitely return!

Stay here for 3 nights in Mid Dec 2014. Overall experience was good. Check in process was fast. Room is clean and consider well sized. I would rate 5 star for the location of this hotel as it is near to the subway station - which you can easily access to many places including the JFK Airport. You can also find food and shop easily near the hotel. Some food shops around this hotel are open 24 hours.Hotel provides free wifi in the lobby and also free printing service. There is also a Starbucks in the lobby.

Excellent location away from the typical tourist heavy areas. Close to many subway options so easy to get to all areas of New York. Modern and well sized room. Starbucks in lobby was convienient but would also recommend the bagels from place next door. Fitness room has plenty of cardio options but no free weights. Staff were helpful. Would recommend and stay here again myself

The Sheraton Tribeca is a great place to stay. The staff at front desk are always friendly and helpful, especially Andrea, she is very sweet and paitient.The room is not big but it is very clean. The location is very good, you may walk to China Town and Little Italy, the traffic is also convenient as the subway is right at the corner.

Everyone here was committed to providing excellent service during my stay. During the holiday season the hotel was very busy but the staff didn't show any stress and continued to address every request. The hotel is well organized with clean rooms and conviently located to both TriBeCa and China Town. I would definitely stay at this hotel again any time I needed to be in lower NYC.

I'm writing a book and a character lives in TriBeCa, for this reason I looked for a hotel in the neighborhood to spend New Year's Eve and try to understand him. I ended up at the Sheraton TriBeCa. Never imagined that it was going to be such a great experience: several inches higher than the Sheraton on 7th Ave, this modern hotel on Canal offers great rooms, nice lobby and restaurant, and great pillows; all at walking distance to the financial district, great art galleries and the emotional tribute to the victims of 9/1, as well as to Chinese, Italian restaurants, jazz and all SoHo. I felt really comfortable, and promised my fictional character to return and make this Sheraton my working place before the book ends. Great value, location and service!

The Sheraton Tribeca is a great place to stay in lower Manhattan. This hotel is not fancy but it is very clean and the staff cares about their work. Both are often hard to find in NY. I would say it is utilitarian and affordable. The rooms are small but that is to be expected in the city. Within walking distance of all transportation, Soho, very near Battery Park, WTC, Wall ST. The cafe is not so good. Morning coffee maybe but I don't recommend purchasing a breakfast package. There are a million options just outside the door, don't waste time and money here. The only other challenge is timing of the elevators. Be sure and give yourself plenty of time when you are leaving the hotel. The wait for the elevators can be really long in particular in the morning. There just aren't enough of them to cover the demand. Plan and it won't be a problem. That said, you won't find a better place to stay for the money. If you are visiting with a student at NYU it's a great location relative to the school and access to Brooklyn.

HOW CAN I GET A 10. This is the button worn by the employees at this hotel. The service is impeccable. Every employee we met during our 5 night stay seem to be committed to providing top notch service. I stay in hotels almost weekly and I will say again that the service makes the hotel. From the greet at the front door, the efficient front desk, the helpful concierge and the clean rooms and facilities this hotel loves to pay attention to details and all the employees are on board. What a pleasure, we will return for sure! Thank you Sheraton!

Stayed here for 7 nights with my daughter from the 9th Dec to 16th Dec and had a truly wonderful stay. People complain about the room size but compared to the Holiday Inn 5th Avenue the room we were in was huge. Ok there are no drawers, but there are plenty of shelves. We had no problem with storage for our stay. The room was spotless, the bathroom plenty big enough and the toiletries are really good quality. Michael, Michael and David you are wonderful, cheery, smiley and so friendly even at 3 am when I was going out for a smoke. These guys are fantastic, no question too stupid, saw some really rude people at the desk but the boys kept smiling, My daughter and I have started saving to come back to the Sheraton Tribeca Dec 2016. The only thing I would say and this is directed at the management of the hotel, you have a huge roof terrace why don't you let smokers use the terrace, even if it was for the hours of midnight to 6am surely that would not annoy non-smokers but it would safer for smokers, rather than have them standing on Canal Street at silly 'o' clock. Bearing in mind that the hotel is on Canal Street and a few smokers are hardly going to affect the air quality. Any-hoo, Thank you for a fab stay and we can't wait to come back.

We've enjoyed our stay in December. Close to shops and sights. Soho just around the corner and sights not far away. Subway station(s) just around the corner. Just like every hotel in NY they seem to be squeezed in a block of buildings. Our room was small with no view but with a hefty price tag. But that's what you tend to get in NY. Compare like-for-like and this hotel delivers on cleanliness, location, decor and comfort (beds are great). Dissapointed with their gym (a box room with no useful equipment to use (I lift weights....there were not dumb bells, barbells or anything close to what I need to use).

Great night here; a Sheraton that performs better than some Westins. Try to get a west-facing room for great views of scenic New Jersey. Canal St is an imperfect location, but the area is gentrifying quickly.Shoutout to Nick, who went above and beyond at the SPG counter.

When we looked for space to put our clothes (like underwear ) we did not find any drawers. We called the front desk and they said they would send up extra hangers. Not good for a 5 day stay. As an SPG member they did not give newspapers at the door. Most days I found a USA Today in the lobby but not every day.We thought the restaurant was over priced and under valued. However the Tri Beca Bagel next door was great and proceed right.The concierge was very good and the front desk people were friendly.Great for a one night stay. Location is good.

What can I say about this property. First we didn't even know this property was down in tribeca. Let me tell you we have a new place to stay when we travel to the city. We like to have weekend getaways as we are only in PA. Before we arrived the GM Anthony personally sent us an email to see if we had any special requests. We are are not frequent travelers so we were excited. While we were there we were excited to find out how close we were to china town, little italy, and the subway. Thank you to Anthony's team we had a wonderful stay and will be back in the new year.

Stayed there for a 7 night stay in October. Staff helpful and friendly. Best place to get food is the delicatessen next door which we used a lot and ate in the hotel as the menu in hotel not very enticing. Room had 2 double beds so a little small but was clean and fresh towels daily. Close to subway so would stay again, One area that needs improving is the bar!! On arrival one evening asked if we could have anything to eat and waiter said no . There appeared to be only one waiter serving at all times so you had to wait and when people ordered food he also served it !!!!! Lovely restaurant just around the corner but watch the restaurants when they see you British they automatically add tip to bill so check before you give a tip. Bought tickets from front desk for trip to outlets to do shopping thinking this was quicker only to find when got to station to get coach had to queue to get that changed to another ticket to get onto the coach so there is no benefit to getting ticket at hotel and it same price. Hotel is OK but think the bar person needs to be more friendly, dress more professional and not in trainers and the food menu needs to be updated and could be promoted more so people would eat in more which would add more atmosphere to the hotel.

The hotel location is technically just almost TriBeCa but it does make downtown quite accessible on foot as wellas the Subway. The staff was good and efficient. The lobby is small but has convenient amenities. The only real problem I had was the room size. Very small even for a single traveler. Even just finding room to open your suitcase is a challenge.

We chose the Sheraton because we earn points and it wasn't as expensive as others in the area.It is located close to 3 useful subway stops, just up the road from Chinatown, and Little Italy. It is just blocks away from good shopping and the Ghostbuster Firehouse is around the corner. It is just a quick subway ride away from Manhattan.The staff was very nice, the room was average NYC size (small) but updated and had a good view of the Empire State Building.

Quiet, comfortable, and reasonable, with a brilliant concierge service and friendly staff, the Sheraton Tribeca would rate an excellent except for the truly dreadful bar and restaurant. Drinks at the bar are so watered as to be pointless (at ~$14!), while breakfast at the restaurant defies brief description. Coffee was brought with no cream/milk followed by staff disappearance (finally went and got some ourselves). Tea was "brewed" in lukewarm water, resulting in slightly off color tap water. Orders were half taken by two different people who didn't talk to each other. Once recovered from this ordeal the delivered food was 3rd rate at best. The "ham" was briefly sizzled sandwich meat. The doughy bread was not toasted but grilled (OK, if right), with unwarmed bread between black, burned tasting grill marks. The "hash brown potatoes" were tater tots, fresh from the bag. If you come here, enjoy your good sleep and the excellent concierge. Stay away from this bar, the hotel restaurant and Tataki sushi on the other side of the block. Don't order a cocktail at Nancy Whiskey Bar around the corner, but plain drinks are cheap and strong.

Very pleased with this affordable, central hotel. Close to subways, Chinatown. Great area to stay in. The room was clean and a fair size. I booked far in advance (a year) and got an amazing deal through Priceline. There wasn't any real view to speak of, but we didn't spend much time in the room, it was just used for sleeping, too much to see in New York to spend time in the room!

Stayed almost 2 weeks at Sheraton Tribeca NY. The Good:* One of the more affordable hotels in the neighbourhood with relatively new rooms (much newer than Holiday Inn which I spent a week in previously)* Well connected to the metro (3 lines serving the Canal station just a short 5 min walk)* Club lounge offers nice warm breakfast (scrambled egg etc) with a nice open air rooftop sofas with a distant view of the Empire State Building* Nice complimentary wifi and printing stations on the ground floor lobbyThe Bad:* Patchy front desk service. The two ladies serving the front desk was pleasant and nice, whilst the gentlemen serving the frontdesk (night to morning duty) was condescending and curt* Was offered a low floor room despite paying for club due to "overbooked" room - though I managed to get that changed after 2 nights* Drastic difference between the lower floors and higher / club floors - from basic thing such as lack of shower gel (only bar soaps) for the lower floors to an older bath vs newer bath / vanity area* Patchy laundry and housekeeping service - laundry took more than a day (despite my punctual "submission" before the deadline), and the housekeeping or laundry service didn't bother to replace the laundry bags every day despite my usage of the laundry service (I can understand if the hotel chooses not to replace laundry plastic bags for guests who "took" the bags without using the laundry service, but not replacing the bags for guests that consistently uses the laundry service is unbecoming for a starwood hotel)* Getting charged hundreds of dollars for making local calls (which I noted to be a couple of cents per minute, not couple of dollars per minute). Bill was sent electronically to be after checkout and hence no chance to dispute; I guess I can get some additional starwood points for the extra hundred of dollars paid for the local calls* "Green" effort for starwood points not honored - despite the instruction to leave the card for no housekeeping for 2 days (to save the environment and to earn some starwood points or vouchers, none was offered)Overall a mixed and patchy stay. Decent value for money in my view.

This is not a top of the heap hotel in Manhattan but it is certainly a good mid-priced option for those who want to be near SoHo or Tribeca. The front desk staff is very kind and helpful. We enjoyed the club level with the instantly available breakfast and cocktails. The bed was very comfortable with cozy duvet. Our view of the Empire State building was quite nice and the room, while certainly small, was well equipped and pleasant by New York standards. It is very close to two subway lines which is also an advantage. All in all, this is a great place to stay.

The outside of this hotel does not impress but do not let the facade deceive. The staff is friendly and welcoming and the room, though small, provides plenty of space to relax, nice amenities and a great bed. Even better, despite being on noisy Canal Street, our room was quiet. The hotel is pet friendly, and our little dog Sazerac loved his free dog bed. And a minimal pet fee, thank goodness!You can't beat the location, convenient to Tribeca, Soho, Chinatown and Little Italy and two major subways.

This has become our new favorite spot to stay in NYC. The staff was very friendly, hotel nice and clean and great location for us! Because we have more options with flights to Newark, this spot is very convenient. Also located in a nice, clean safe neighborhood that never seemed too crowded. We walked to the 911 museum, and it is right on Canal street for bargain shoppers. Walkable to SOHO for the designer shoppers, and in the middle of many wonderful restaraunts! The price was great compared to some other boutique style hotels we have stayed at....

Let's just start with the entrance way to the hotel. The plastic entrance is crazy and it collects trash as the wind is always blowing because of the surrounding buildings. The staff at the front entrance are very junior and have not a clue how to handle seasoned customers, seems they have a script to follow. I was told I would have breakfast included in my rate (not the lounge) and when I showed up the breakfast in the resturuant the breakfast was so bad that I went back to the lounge ( and that breakfast is bad). I would suggest you close the resturuant and make that into a bar to serve your customers with a light menu....Every time I went to the bar NOBODY was tending bar he was always off finding or getting something. The food in in the lounge is stale and just bad nothing is fresh and that is unfortunate because the view is fantastid. As for the cleaniness; check the elevator dirty rugs, papers on the floor, elevator tracks dirty, carpet on the floor I was staying on has not been cleaned for some time, even the way they vaccum did not pick up the dirt, my room was OK not great dirty floor in the bathroom, towels small and old....You need to pick up your game I travel 150 night a year and 50 of those nights at Starwood and I doubt I will stay again at this hotel even though it is close to my work and I paid over $400.00 per night. You need to figure it out and invest in your property.

I stayed here on business for 3 days. Room was comfortable and I particularly liked the bed and the great view of the Empire State Building out my window. The street the hotel sits on looks a tad sketchy on a major thoroughfare but walk north and you're right in SoHo, walk south to the Financial District, and proximal to 3 subway lines -- cannot complain about the location.However, the breakfast service started 15 minutes late (normally 7am) during one night of my stay and hotel internet did not work in my room the entire time. In addition my room was not cleaned on one of my two days in the room. For a hotel charging $400+ a night for business travelers, these mistakes should not happen.

My family stayed at the Sheraton Tribecca as our home in NYC was being fumigated. Sheraton Tribecca easily accommodated us when our original choice of hotel (also Starwoods) was full to capacity despite having a confirmed reservation. Sheraton Tribecca also price matched our original rate from the other Starwoods property. Sheraton Tribecca is a much better property with much better trained staff in handling our situation. They went above and beyond compare to the staff of the lower grade Starwoods property in the near vicinity.

Great location for Soho and Tribeca. Excellent and friendly staff that genuinely made an effort to help and please. Comfortable and clean room.Could probably make more of the bar and lobby area (no restrooms at lobby level).I would recommend and stay again.

I am a weekly business traveler, and during the time that I started staying at the Sheraton TriBeCa I had been working for a client in the Financial District but wanted a change of scenery. The hotel is a short metro ride from downtown NYC, but the restaurants and nightlife in the area are a little more bustling than in FiDi. Since I prefer Starwood hotels, I came across this location and decided to give it a try - was very satisfied with that decision. Doesn't hurt that the clientele at this particular hotel skews a little more international, which makes for a cool atmosphere, especially during the film festival.The rooms are always clean and cozy, and this Sheraton in particular has one of the best Club Lounges for those who are SPG preferred. The staff is incredibly warm and welcoming, but I have to give a shout out to the night manager, Michael, as he has repeatedly made my stays convenient and snag-free. Even more than most other hotels I have stayed at in recent memory, the staff and management make themselves highly available to the guests and really want to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. When it came time to host my best friend's bachelor party in Manhattan, we decided very quickly to stay here just knowing that we could rely on a good time. 5/5

Have to say I was extremely impressed with this hotel from our stay here last night. Hospitality here was amazing! Checked in, and we were upgraded to a bigger room immediately, we were given complimentary bags with water and granola bars, and she even upgraded our room, to a room with the skyline view! (See pic I posted) It is great because I live in Jersey, and the Hudson tunnel is right around the corner to head back home. Restaurant Pepolino is around the corner and they have some amazing Italian food! (Look at my review for that) Overall extremely accommodating, clean, and convenient! 5/5 Stars from me!!!

My room was very comfortable, great bed and bathroom, all very clean and had everything I needed. My only real complaint about the room would be about the noise from the traffic during the night. I believe the windows could have been more soundproof to help this.The hotel lobby seemed to be under some construction work, and the layout felt quite temporary and badly worked out.Other than those hiccups I enjoyed my very brief stay there, above all else it was very comfortable, I was only there one night.

I got a great deal on this hotel and the prices are good for NYC. I love the location close to Soho great shopping. The hotel is basic nothing glamorous but we were never there but to sleep rooms were clean and beds comfy. Décor was modern and nice. I loved the club level the breakfast was really good. They have a really nice outdoor deck with gorgeous views that would be great when the weather is nice. I would stay here again.

We stayed on the Sheraton Tribeca from 12/5 through 12/7, and were disappointed. Our room - a standard King - was very small, but the the greater problem was that there was no place to put our clothes. The closet was very narrow, and there were no drawers - just a couple of small shelves, about 14" wide. The bathroom had two thin towels, one with a large stain on it. We left our towels on the floor, wanting new ones the next day, which we did receive, but the cleaning staff did not remove the used washcloth that I left in the shower. Nor did they clear the used drinking glasses.The bathroom fan - necessary if you wanted more than a minimum of lighting - was unusually loud - loud enough to wake up someone sleeping in the bedroom.We did not have a remote for the TV, so we called the front desk. Someone brought us a remote within 10 minutes, but we still could not get the TV to work. Since it was late, we did not pursue this further.Our friends were in the room next to ours, which was so small that you could not open the closet/armoire and walk between it and the bed. Parking, which we understood to be $55, was actually $65 per night, as we didn't have a compact car. All in all, we were disappointed and would not recommend the hotel to others. For the record, we and our friends had booked more than seven months in advance, and our room rate was $ 427 with taxes, not including parking. We did not consider the rate to be excessive, given the popularity of the weekend after Thanksgiving, however, we have stayed many times at other hotels in NY at this time of year, and this was the least satisfactory experience we have had.On a positive note, the bed was wonderful!

Well what can i say, This hotel met and exceeded our expectations. On arriving at the hotel around 5:00pm after a dreadful taxi ride and almost getting ripped off by a polish woman taxi driver Gggrrrrr . We was greeted by david who collected our luggage and placed inside hotel . we Checked in ( ME , My COUSIN And His Wife ) haha no funny business happened , was just more cost efficient to share a room.Both ladies on the desks were lovely ( sorry i cant remember any other names :-/ ) we were given a free upgrade on wifi , which was very nice . The hotel its self is very nice and clean and modern , starbucks and a bar and restaurant, also free internet with computers in a sectioned area which is good.The rooms were lovely and clean , lcd tv on wall , also a coffee machine with complimentary starbucks coffees. Beds were to die for :) so cosy , We had a bath with shower , that was great nice and powerfull.Rooms were cleaned and beds maid everyday.Now the area of tribeca is great , so much to do in close proximity of hotel .Shopping , resturants, bars, and sightseeing . ( Canal street at night has lots of moody gear being sold :) if u like a bargain lol ...last but not least we were recommended a nice little cafe (Cupping Room Cafe on 359 W Broadway) MUST try the Traditional Eggs Benedict w/ Canadian bacon and sausages . $17 but OMG the best iv eaten .And last but definitely not least the 24hr Bagel shop next door to the hotel (Tribeca Bagels)They bake all in house the place is unreal Try the Number 6 on the board, Bagel with pastramiI had that poppy seed Bagel and also ask for salad and mayo mustard mmmmmmm lol and its only like $8 I will be uploading pictures and a video of hotel soon as i can :) Hope this helps someone , and im always here to answer any Questions From Luke(Me) and my cousin and his wife lol Room 813 P.S Sheraton Staff see you next xmas with my daughters :) hope to be looked after again lol

I stayed here multiple times and because of this, I did notice the inconsistency in the quality of rooms. Some weeks, I'm in an well-maintained room, other times, the age of the hotel is showing. Not all king guest rooms have an armchair, some rooms are slightly roomier, broken coffee maker, scuff marks on the wall, etc. Rooms are smaller than your typical king guest room, which is what you will get in New York. I didn't particularly like that there are no pull out drawers, just open shelves. Starbucks coffee for the in-room coffee machine is much appreciated.Overall, I am pleased with housekeeping, but did experience some inconsistency. Once or twice, in-room amenities were not replenished ex. disposable cups were not replaced.The bathrooms are designed for the small space - walk-in showers instead of tubs, a descent sized sink with a small amount of counter space. It's good enough for a short stay, but definitely not impressive. The lobby was great, and the business center was very modern and well-designed. It had lots of Win 8 desktops and multiple printers/scanners are available. Very convenient, and was a lifesaver when I needed to scan and send a document urgently. The location may look sketchy, but I felt pretty safe walking back to the hotel at night. It's not easy to get a cab, but the doorman will help hail a cab at the corner street.

Very comfortable, good service and quite convenient for visiting SOHO,China Town, Little Italy. Parking is quite expensive, but is available (was $55 for my car for one night). Wifi was free and TV had lots of showtime stations.

This was a Thanksgiving (6 day) holiday stay. Stay in many Starwood properties for work and travel. Have certain expectations for basic qualities (not high) for smaller Sheratons; certain expectations for smaller-than-average rooms for NYC hotels. Rooms are not lovely: something weird with fitted bottom sheets on the bed--that didn't fit and popped off each night to reveal the mattress cover, and a not-so-clean boxspring. The desk chair was something unavoidable to bump into in the night. After requesting on my a feather pillow on my rez, and again after a first night on rock-hard foam, I did get a nice one. We had 'Club Floor' breakfast included: Scrambled eggs that had last seen the inside of an eggshell a long time ago--was the most costly item. Breakfast capped off by an indifferent staff (watched silently as the espresso machine sprayed milk on me, then quietly removed it's empty canister without a word--like an apology). Staff in elevator mentioned 'everyone was new' and I would add, inexperienced and untrained.

very friendly staff, clean and comfy room. Pretty simple rooms, but perfectly adequate. The building front was going under some remodelling, so hard to tell how good the lobby was. The area is a bit rough.

We had a quick trip to NYC with our family of four. The pull-out couch plus king bed made the Sheraton the right choice for us. Room had a mini-fridge, good sized bathroom (shower only, no tub) and closet for storing luggage. There are 3 fast elevators which minimized the wait time in the lobby. Overall, we were satisfied with the stay.

Good location, nice staff, small rooms, but nicely done. Most comfortable bed I've ever slept in! Reasonable rates too! Close to Chinatown, soho and the village. Easy to get a cab in front. Skip the restaurant, there is a great little shop with hot tasty food right next store. The bar is quite nice, with high end selection and a very good bartender. Extremely good value for the city!

I am a tourist, not a business traveler so this is intended for those on vacation. Tribeca is in lower Manhattan away from all the brouhaha of Times Square. If you are not afraid of the subways it is convenient and easy to get to from the airports because of the reduced traffic compared to Times Square. The A C E subway lines are literally right around the corner while the N Q R are about a half block up. the street. Chinatown is 2 - 3 blocks up Canal Street and Little Italy another two block. The hotel is convenient to all, Times Square and theater district, Chinatown, Madison Square Garden and Little Italy. Some walking, some subway. The rooms are New York rooms tight. We had room 1703 which had a window but it looked right out at another old building, no view. It was perpendicular to another room which meant that whenever they left or came in it sounded in our room that someone was opening or closing our door. The service staff was inattentive at best we got two towels a day and on the final day of our 4 day stay we ran out of both toilet paper and tissuesI think that is inexcusable..Beds were comfortable andslept well except for the opening and closing of the next door room.. Didn't try the restaurant in the hotel. Door to the bathroom stuck and was another noisemaker. I'd stay again due to the location and front desk staff. I think the cleaning crew could use a pep talk.

My wife and me frequently visit NYC for any of the holidays, staying at one of the ritzy hotels at Battery Park. We decided to stay near the SOHO area, and by chance, picked this one.We booked a club room for 4 nights. We had all the ammenities that we are offered at the other hotel: fitness center, breakfast, room with a view (OK;smaller), and attentive staff. Walking distance from SOHO, Chinatown, Little Italy; and subway sations 1 block away to everywhere. Our godchild and my brother also stayed at this hotel; we all had a most wonderfull stay. We booked a Stay better night that offers a 40% discount every other night. Therefore, with the savings, we enjoyed a Broadway show, Thai; Italian, and Cuban meals. We are THANKFUL. We are planning our next visit for EASTER 2015, to REJOICE.

Reservation staffs were terrible. They gave away our room [with Patio] that we've booked 3 months in advanced. We were in our honeymoon, they suggested to give us another similar room [without Patio] with 2 single beds instead as replacement, how messed up were they? The manager said she has upgraded us to another room with an Empire State Building view. When we got in, the room was so small and $30 less than what we've paid originally, imagine $30 x 7 nights!!! We will definitely not recommending friends or anyone to stay. After screaming back at them, finally they upgraded us to a bigger room on the Club level. But our feelings and experienced staying there as not as pleasant from a start, especially we only want everything to be easy and special on our Honeymoon.

The Sheraton is in the perfect location for where we wanted to go. We had a party to go to at M1-5 and we wanted to go to Little Italy and Chinatown. Perfect walking distance! We stayed in a Traditional King hotel room looking out at the Empire State building. The room was cozy, however I do wish it was a little better maintained. One of the lamps had a dead light bulb, There were black rubber line marks on the walls, the phone was dusty, the hairdryer was dirty and dusty so I used a tissue to hold it, I did not want to touch it. There was residue on the outside corner of the shower... but the staff was pleasant. :)

We booked this hotel because of it's location and easy access to public transportation. We had a terrible flight experience (lost luggage) and thought that our vacation was going to be ruined. Well, our luggage never appeared but the staff of the hotel went out of their way to help make us comfortable. I have had years of experience with hotels and the service and great hospitality was second to none. The price we paid was well below what we received in accommodation. We will definitely return to this hotel in the future. A few weeks after our stay, I received a personal email from the manager asking about our stay. I thought that was extremely thoughtful.

My husband and I spent four nights in mid November, and had a fabulous time. Great location, wonderful staff, and beautiful hotel. We were upgraded to a deluxe view room on check-in, which was a bonus! If you are looking for an amazing dinner, Pepolinos is just around the corner on West Broadway - AMAZING!

Good size rooms with nice bathrooms. Top two floor have amazing views and have access to the Starwoods "club room" that offers daily free breakfast and self serve coffee and soda all day. Access to a fabulous terrace is also available to top floors. Only a short 10 minute walk away from great shops and restaurants. Located in a very busy street. Much closer to Newark airport than to JFK.

I was in NYC for business and needed to stay in close proximity to where our meetings would be held. I took a chance and chose this hotel for its location and I wasn't disappointed. The rooms were clean and spacious, and the concierge very helpful in providing tips for area restaurants. It is in walking distance to all of the great shops- Chanel, Louis Vuitton, Prada... so if you are looking to shop and avoid the crowds of 5th Avenue, this is a great hotel. We had drinks at the hotel bar and the bartender was fantastic and made some of the best margaritas I've ever had. It was quite a fun atmosphere! My only complaint- the elevators could be a little slow and it seemed only one was working at a given moment.

Whenever I can, I will stay at this hotel. This is probably one of my favorite Starwood properties in the US. The location is perfect for Manhattan - walk to Soho/Tribeca/West Village and subway access to anywhere uptown. It is pet friendly. The staff absolutely loves dogs (we have a Boston Bulldog). The friendliest of New Yorkers. The rooms are fairly spacious by NYC standards - ask for a high floor with a view. The bedding is very comfortable. The bathrooms have great water pressure and space. The wifi also works very well. Everything you need is at your fingertips or just a few steps away. Keep rocking it Sheraton Tribeca!

Location is easy to get to from Newark, but took a little longer to get to JFK. Excellent places to go to eat nearby (Felix is a 5 minute walk), and a decent womens fashion shop straight across the street from the hotel which was handy as my girlfriend forgot a few things.Rooms are smallish but well appointed, and the bed was very comforitable. Had a great sleep. Electric sockets built into the bedside lamps was a great idea too. Room service food was pretty poor quality to be honest, and expensive. Ordered some snack food and they brought way too much quantity, all of pretty low quality. Didn't eat in the restaurant as we went out, but this is a nice hotel for a weekend in NYC if you don't want to break the bank.

While the rooms were small by normal standards, I thought they provided a good value for NYC. The hotel was very nice, clean, and convenient. The bathroom was modern and clean, which is important at this pricepoint. Our room, on a higher floor, was very quiet.

I walk by this property every month on the way to my office but have never stayed. However, because of a large meeting, we were booked here on a group rate. I had a spacious room on the 10th floor, larger than typical NYC rooms and thought I would be high enough to avoid most of the Canal St. noise. However, the windows are not stout enough and you need to ask for an inside room or go much higher to avoid the noise. The hotel staff were very warm and friendly - Lenore at the front desk is the best! Nice bar area off the lobby. Never ate at the restaurant. Overall a good experience.

I got 2 rooms for myself and employee. We got an awesome deal through Hotwire and booked last minute. Great location if you want to be in TriBeCa. Walked to Nobu Next Door for an unbelievable sushi meal.

The standard rooms here are very, very small.I arrived early and was given an early checkin but the room assigned was tiny. It was so small, they kept the desk chair in the corner of the room because if placed at the desk you could not walk by! After some time I was able to move to a slightly larger room but it was still quite small. There was only one person working the front desk most of the afternoon, making for long waits. The club lounge is a nice space and the balcony has great views over the city but it (inside area) was often overcrowded. One night the entire lounge was taken up by a childs birthday party, there was literally no seats available. Breakfast in the lounge was a decent spread but again the room was crowded. The location is great, close to transit and many good restaurants. Overall, I probably would not go out of my way to stay here again but if I needed to be in the area would return.

This hotel is located on Canal street which is very busy and may not be the best choice for a woman traveling alone. I selected the hotel because I needed a clean, safe hotel close to good food. The hotel is decent, very clean and fits my basic travel needs. Although when I arrived I found a few other hotels that I should have tried and will when I return to the city. Breakfast was sketchy as you can try the buffet or made to order which is the same cost. Staff need help in being more attentive, but it was functional. Overall, rate this hotel as average.

Two nights here and that was enough. The hotel is located on very busy Canal Street, not far from almost as busy Sixth Avenue and as such is incredibly noisy with traffic roaring by all day and all night. The entrance is particularly bizarre with kind of a temporary shelter contraption you have to navigate to get inside. Lobby is comfortable and kind of cool, but feels a bit too much like Sheraton trying to be Tribeca hip, which it isn't. The hallways are narrow and shabby for a new hotel with scuff marks and soiled carpeting abounding, and very poorly conceived. The ice and soda machine protrude out into the hallway itself, are not enclosed, and generate a tremendous amount of hallway noise - whoever designed that should be fired. Rooms are smallish with little space to move around. I expected better and certainly wouldn't rush back.

How much time does one actually spend in a room in NYC? Not much, but the time we did spend inside was very pleasant. Very clean room, friendly staff upon arrival, modern bathroom. Yes the room was "small" (while I've stayed in much smaller before), the closet almost inexistent and the ironing board made for a doll house, but the view from the 8th floor was nice and we liked the fact the window opened somewhat. The bed was very comfortable. We got free Wifi by joining SPG to save on the $10/day fee. WiFi is however free in the lobby. It did get noisy Saturday night (doors aren't as sound proof as I'd like), but nothing white noise coming from the opened window couldn't cover.

We stayed four nights and this hotel is walking distance(20-25 minutes) to 911 memorial and Century21 shopping mall(great bargains).Also quaint shops(shoes,clothes) right on Canal street.Staff were very helpful with any questions,provided us with umbrellas and hailed cabs for us.Buffet breakfast for $20 included tax and tip.Try Becco in Little Italy(awesome chicken parmagian).The rooms are nice,bed comfortable and walk in showers and little noise heard from the street.Overall great stay!

Walking distance to Chinatown & Little Italy if these are your destinations. Front desk staff is very helpful. Concierge can be more knowledgeable about local attractions. Rooms are small but clean. Housekeeping left us a 1/2-torn bath towel & did not provide creamer or sweetener for coffee on the 2nd day. If you walk, be sure to go back before dark since the path on that part of Canal St can be eerie when the shops are shuttered at dusk. The picture shown as a rooftop bar can be accessed only if you have club privilege but worth a visit on a warm evening since I didn't see any heater outside. 3.5 star

We stayed three nights at the Sheraton Tribeca recently. This was the first time staying in Tribeca when visiting NY and it was a pleasant surprise. The hotel is on Canal Street which is busy and far from beautiful but it is well located and quiet inside. We were in walking distance from several great neighborhoods, galleries, restaurants and the west side greenery. We were also close to two subway lines. Overall a great stay and thumbs up for the Sheraton.

Stayed recently over the Haloween and NYC Marathon weekend with my wife and 2-year-old daughter. We had booked a superior king room with SPG points (no status) and requested an early check-in of 1pm on Friday. No problems with the reservation, but not only was early check-in not possible (certainly understandable) we had to wait over an hour past check-in time (and long past my daughter's nap time) to get into our room. They claimed this was to honor late check-out requests (presumably by those with SPG status) which is believable and the front desk staff was very apologetic and provided us water, snacks, and free wi-fi use throughout our 2 night stay for the inconvenience. Though annoying, I felt this was handled appropriately. The superior room was decent sized for NYC, with room for the king bed, an open pull-out sofa, and a small dining table. The bathroom is small, but not as tiny as some as I've had in cities. Note that the superior rooms (I believe on all floors) are right next to the elevators, so though we weren't bothered by mechanical noise, you will hear everyone on and off the elevator. Otherwise, we were on the 14th floor, and didn't have any significant noise issues - even considering the Halloween parade and revelry on Canal St. just below us. If street noise is an issue for you, go with the higher floors. Location is excellent, as others have noted, both in terms of neighborhood and proximity to the A,C,E Canal St. subway. There is a small deli/convenience store on the corner a half-block west of the hotel for drinks and snacks. Otherwise, nothing stands out about this property for me. The other frustrating service aspect came when our room hadn't been serviced on the second day by 2pm when we returned after lunch. When we went back out around 4pm, we specifically stopped at the front desk to request that the room be made-up as we were now going out for the evening - nobody ever came to service the room. Although the staff seemed to all work hard and were consistently pleasant, my impression was simply that they were overtaxed in the number of people/jobs they had to manage. Overall, little overtly negative to say about our stay, but very little outstanding either. I would stay here again, but also wouldn't hesitate to look elsewhere.

The hotel was very nice. I only stayed one night as a little night out in the city with my boyfriend. we only live half an hour away so we didn't need much. the pillows were without a doubt the best pillow I've ever slept on I even bought it. the bed itself is so comfortable. it's a nice affordable hotel if I traveled to nyc I would recommend. my first time staying here I had a basic room with a king bed it was pretty small. another time we had the room with a couch and table it was so much more spacious and much nicer. I recommend this room it was great. they say they have great views and a rooftop deck but every time I had a view of a brick wall. the rooftop patio is also only for certain guests and I wasn't allowed up. it's 2 blocks from the train but canal street itself is pretty dirty and if you aren't used to the nyc lifestyle it's a lot to handle.

Excellent location in Tribeca/SoHo area. Within easy walking distance to Greenwich, Little Italy, Chinatown, and close subway access. The staff is amazing, especially the concierge who helped me with my multiple touristy questions. Room was very nice and comfortable. Very clean

The location is good between Tribeca and Soho. The hotel has a nice reception area. Our 'deluxe double king' room was basic and dated and the bathroom disappointing. The bath is not really a bath as it is very shallow and uncomfortable. We were kept awake by a beeping smoke detector. Amazingly all the smoke detectors are battery operated so if you are unlucky enough to be in the room when the battery runs out you will be kept awake all night. I find it incredible that it is even legal for a hotel to use a battery operated alarm. The staff didn't seem concerned about our complaint. I presume it is a common problem.

We often stay in lower Manhattan and the Sheraton Tribeca is reliable, very clean, and perfectly situated. Staff tries hard to do a good job. Highly recommend it. Right on Canal so parking is no great but near by .

We got a deal where we stayed in a club room and had access to the club lounge. The room was spacious, clean and beautiful. The location is perfect and we walked a few short blocks to the amazing shops of Soho. However, the service is definitely subpar here. The club lounge was always out of breakfast items (namely coffee) and the level of service there was poor. The staff at the front desk was average and didn't seem to go out of their way to ensure high-quality service. I would recommend staying here, but just know that the service is only average.

super nice and helpful staff. Shout out to Monique, but everyone there is super helpful with a smile on their faces. Room was reasonable for ny. Clean, comfortable. Nice bathroom. Good tv. All good. Enjoyed our stay.

So if you read my previous review, I had a terrible experience start to finish. The genuinely apologetic managment at the Sheraton Tribeca reached out to me and invited me back for a second stay. I was hesitant at first, but I had a friend visiting me from Vancouver and Columbus day weekend presented a great opportunity for a long weekend in the city. Everything was smooth sailing from check in, check out, and especially our room which had a great Empire State Building view. The room was clean, had a working phone, and the friendly housekeepers left a nice note for us the next day. The wifi was spotty in our room--but worked well in other parts of the hotel (lobby, club room), so I don't know if it was just our room's proximity to the routers--for that reason I certainly would not pay $10 a day for it, and thankfully we didn't have to. The club room was a great perk--it's accessible 24 hours a day, so if you're not quite ready to call it a night, it was a great place to unwind--wine and spirits are extra, but at $7 or $8 a glass it is not cost prohibitive. The area is easy to access from the A,C,E--which if you came in through Penn station like us, it's a straight shot without changing trains. It's walking distance to great neighborhoods, we had lunch and dinner in the west village, went out dancing in meat packing, and strolled the high line--all on foot. Sheraton Tribeca has won me back over, which is good because I've enjoyed staying at Starwood properties.

My wife and I spent a long weekend in NYC and we were pretty delighted to have stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca. The room was very clean as well as all the amenities offered at this hotel. The location was ideal for walking to SoHo, Little Italy, Chinatown and east and west villages. The front desk was very helpful and friendly. Our room was quiet in the evening even though there was a lot of activity outside.

Sheraton Tribeca gets it right. Location: Tribeca, Subway 1 block, in Chinatown. Service: Always very helpful - and it is with every employee from check in to check out. Staff is very well trained and their management is just as helpful. Property: well maintained, clean, if there are problems - like I needed a battery for the remote - 3 minutes...Directions: Staff "knows" the NYC and Tribeca area and can direct you with simple instruction. I can stay in any hotel or Sheraton Hotel in NYC and keep returning here. Remarkable experience.

We really enjoyed our time at this hotel. They were incredibly accomodating, moving my sister and I to a larger room when it emerged there were no twin rooms. Andrea (I think) was super helpful and very friendly. Great staff, said from a bar maid who had a bit of an attitude. No problems with noise at all, very comfortable bed, plenty of room. What more could you want!

Just came back from 2 nights at the Sheraton Tribeca in NYC! After living on the outskirts of NYC for 60 years, we decided it was time to celebrate in the Big Apple!! The room was so clean, the bed comfortable and inviting, the shower great and I loved the makeup mirror!!! The view from the 17th flr OUTSTANDING, with floor to ceiling window! The view was incredible....Couldn't even hear our neighbors in their rooms! Extremely responsive employees, warm and friendly. Would definitely stay there again and have been posting my pics on line with extremely positive responses. We loved the neighborhood, great places to eat, no problem cabbing it uptown, although I understand there are subways all over the place as well. I only wish we could have stayed another few nights : ). Wonderful vacation, birthday celebration rolled into one!

Nick Amato completely made my stay worth it as a SPG member he made my loyalty with SPG seem completely valued.The sheraton tribeca has a great view in their rooftop as well, of the entire city skyline

The hotel isn't in the fanciest or nicest place in the city but the price was right so I booked the room. There's a Starbucks in the hotel lobby- a major plus. Staff was friendly enough- nothing exceptional. Hotel is close to the N R subway and the ACE subway stations. My room had complimentary water bottles and also had a coffee maker with Starbucks coffee. The room was adequate for my needs. Bathroom very, very small. The view from my room was spectacular- The Empire State building! I don't care for this part of NYC, so not sure if I'll stay here again.

The location is perfect, subway is close and all the stores however the rooms are a very small, bathroom is a good size however. Bed is very comfortable. Some parts of the hotel allowed you to see the fireworks for the 4th of July. The staff were very friendly, great hotel for a weekend in NYC. The elevators are very confusing. Overall enjoyed the stay. Swift check in.

Just want to say the service and staff was amazing. Will Olivera assistant manager made everything so smooth for us from our check in to check out. The view from our room was spectacular. Anyone thinking of staying in TriBeCa this place is a hidden gem. Location is great everything you would ever need or want is steps from your door.

We arrived early in the day, after a red eye. Milly wasn't able to get us a room right away as the hotel was full. When a guest checked out, she immediately called housekeeping and asked that the room be prepared for us. Since we were hungry, we left for breakfast. We didn't have to wait long before Milly personally called us back and told us the room was ready. When we arrived back at the hotel, we walked in and Milly handed us our access cards. We didn't have to stand in line - she remembered us and was able get us in the room quickly. I really appreciate her thoughtfulness and that she followed through with getting us in to a room.

Well located near Soho for easy walk to shopping. Comfortable shoes & clothes were no problem for fitting in style. Nice rooftop to enjoy scenery. Comfortable bed & updated bathroom. Rooms a bit small. Housekeeping & front desk staff very friendly & kind.

On arriving at this hotel after talking to a very helpful Jackie the day before we were greeted by a very unfriendly young man who was very off hand in his manner-not a good first impression. The room was clean with a full bathroom but the hair dryer didn't work.I had to make an important overseas phone call that couldn't be made from my mobile and once again the wonderful Jackie helped me out, she is a great asset to this hotel.Breakfast was slow on starting and one young man was trying to look after the whole area which was full of people trying to make an early start, he did a great job.Most of the staff are an asset to this hotel and I would like to think they are recognised for their work

Stayed for 2 nights, room was clean and fairly spacious for an NYC hotel. We were upgraded to the SPG floor as SPG gold members and had access to the club room. The club room serves breakfast and they also had appetizers in the afternoon which was really nice after walking around all day. Staff was friendly. We would definitely return.

My sister and I stayed here for a week in September. I cannot recommend it enough. Firstly, location; the hotel is very close to Canal Street subway station which is a stop for most of the main lines in Manhattan. Bottom line being you're not too far away from any of the main NY attractions, Times Square, WTC, Empire State etc. Secondly, the staff on reception are outstanding, they could not have been more helpful and the main barman was also excellent. Finally, everything was very clean and beds were lovely and comfortable. Take me back!

My wife and I have just returned home after 5 fantastic nights at the Sheraton Tribeca. All the staff are wonderful, most helpful and friendly, especially Monique at reception and Dwayne who worked in the Club Lounge. We were in room 2019 facing Canal Street with a great view of the Empire State Building. The breakfasts were great and having access to the Club Lounge and terrace was a real bonus - worth paying a bit extra for this facility (join the Starwood Points programme)! The lobby, bar, reception area was very relaxing and gave us great free access to the internet from the computers near the bar and also had a Starbucks located in the lobby. The location of the hotel is great for Manhattan access, close to subways, walking distance to Tribeca, Soho, Little Italy and Chinatown, loads of restaurants and bars to choose from nearby. Our room was certainly big enough and extremely clean and tidy. Housekeeping were excellent. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

We stayed in this hotel for 1 week in mid September with our 3 young adult daughters. This was their first experience of New York - what an incredible stay! New York was everything we expected it to be but the hotel and staff exceeded all expectations. From the moment we first entered the hotel until our departure, we were treated like Royalty. At this point we have to single out Kinga and Minny for their warm helpfulness and consideration.We have never experienced a welcome like it. I have to add that we found all the staff to be helpful and friendly. During our stay we used the rooftop for breakfast and early evening hors d'oeuvres as the weather was very pleasant throughout our stay. The views from the rooftop are fantastic day and night and to think that prior to our visit I had spent hours researching where we might find a rooftop restaurant.....we did find one but it didn't match up to the Sheraton's panoramic views of the City. The hotel is ideally located particularly to Lower Manhattan, Little Italy, Soho (where our daughters liked to shop) and Chinatown. I would definitely stay in a Sheraton hotel again after this experience but doubt if anything could ever match the very personable approach of the Tribeca branch. Once again, thanks to all the staff from the Irish family.

Quality hotel with fine and friendly service in convenient downtown location. South side of Canal Street, on edge of Tribeca, easy walk to Soho, Village, Chinatown, WTC, Little Italy, Chelsea and more. Living Room style lounge with nice wine by glass selections.

This was our 3rd visit to Sheraton Tribeca and will not be our last ... Service is as usual, outstanding (Jackie at check-in was outstanding). Hotel is in the best location, breathtaking views, best club terrace I've ever experienced, clean common areas and rooms and good wifi. The rooms are not spacious by any means but given the location and the great common areas (and the fact that you're in nyc and shouldn't be in your room) it's not a big thing ... Just book accordingly if you're coming with a bigger group.

My stay was fine, the room was clean - linens were obviously clean, but worn out a bit (some small holes). The room was small with doors that interfere with one another. I stayed on the 8th floor, road noise was still a problem. This was my first business trip to NYC, so it may just be that I am not use to some of these factors. Breakfast was fine, nothing special. Pretty convenient - everything I needed was in walking distance Wifi was a huge disappointment with frequent disconnects and slow connections in the evening.

I stayed here for a recent business trip. Check in was easy, they offer bag check which is nice to have a place to store bags before check in and after check out. The service was great, I had room service one day and food was decent. The bartender was great. The number one best thing was the bed, it was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in! I'll probably stay here again on my next try to NYC.

I travel to New York 4-5 times per year and regularly stay at this hotel. It is relatively new, clean, and in a great location steps from Soho. The rooms are a good size for NYC compared to other hotels. The staff are great and treat guests very well. I highly recommend this as the place to stay in New York.

My stay was awesome, the staff was friendly, rooms were very spacious and the overall facilities was very inviting. Only thing missing is a pool.The evening view from the common balcony on the 22nd floor is awesome and very peaceful.Ralph D

Hotel is very nice.. Could use better windows..lol NYC decided to rip up the side street overnight and you could hear the jack hammer most of the night. Hotel is close to china town and a little Italy. Wonderful rooms..

This hotel was very clean with a nice welcome. The beds are awesome, so comfy and big. The shower was very good as was the Starbucks.It is a shame that the area is not very nice but then the hotel is a welcome break from the hussle and bussle.

Good hotel, got a somewhat small room though (don't know if this is the case for all rooms?) but very clean and nice. Only the best of compliments to the staff who where friendly and forthcoming. Good location for this "lively" part of the city. Had a great sleep, no noise from the street.

Stayed here for 8 nights in August. Had a great room with an awesome view of Canal Street. The room is spacious, beds comfortable and nice clean bathroom. The staff were always very friendly and helpful, especially Fery. The guys in the bar, Gypsy and Mo were amazing and we enjoyed our evening drinks with them every night. The only negative is the breakfast is not good value at all. The hotel is close to a Subway so it was easy to get around. Would definately stay here again.

I come to New York pretty regularly, and often stay at this hotel. It's away from the noise of the touristy places and sandwiched between Tribeca and Soho. It's also very close to numerous subway lines. The staff here is quite friendly - as opposed to to many other places - and generally smile and say hello as I walk past the reception. This includes front desk as well as staff at the door. As a frequent traveler I am fortunate to get access to the Club Lounge, which has a wonderful terrace facing Midtown - great views of the Empire State Building. When the weather is nice I'll go outside during breakfast before heading off to work. It's open til late - a great refuge. Rooms are fairly standard Sheraton rooms. As it's Manhattan they're not going to be all that big, but enough space for me.

Came in to discover a dirty towel on the ground which immediately loses a star for me. Rooms and common areas kept extremely cold (60) and very very small. That said, we obtained room through Expedia so had a tiny corner room where we stacked the corner table on the chair so we were able to see out the window. The noon checkout is amazing the the staff are friendly and very helpful. I would return as the location borders soho and TriBeCa so is allows easy access to lower manhattan.

We recently stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca while in town for a wedding and wanted to be close to the wedding venue. Although the rooms in the hotel are a bit dated the staff more than make up for it. We have stayed uptown in much more expensive hotels but have never experienced such good customer service as we did at the Sheraton. Carlos at the front door was especially helpful in getting us cabs, with directions, and helping with luggage. We come to NYC often and won't hesitate to stay at the Sheraton again! Thank you for making our stay so enjoyable!The view of the Empire State Building from the 17th floor is incredible at night!

Had some of the nicest service. I stayed there with my fiance. THey were so nice to us at the hotel. I loved the Sheraton Club, too. We got there early and they took great care of us. This is why I am very loyal to the SPG chain! Absolutely loved our room!

We stayed for 2 nights before embarking on a 5 day tour of East coast cities. The room was fairly small but clean and modern. It is a short walk from Battery park and the 9/11 Memorial. The surrounding area has plenty of restaurants , bars and cafes to choose from. If you can, get access to the Club Lounge on the 21st floor. The views are amazing.

visited NYC for labor day weekend and the US Open. Was able to get a great rate at the hotel. the location is great. Close to the subway and within walking distance of shops and restaurants. The lobby is excellent and the room i had was average size and the bed was very comfortable. I was on the 19th floor was a spectacular view. Definitely recommend this hotel.

First, the location cannot be beat--away from the crazy tourist areas but on multiple subway lines, walking distance to Tribeca, SoHo, Chinatown, Little Italy, LES, World Trade, Greenwich Village, and much more.Second, extremely comfortable good value. (this is a two-fer).Third, the people are great. It does not happen often, but I have stayed enough that I have encountered some problems--and the hotel ALWAYS resolves quickly and cheerfully. The bonus, do whatever it takes to get access to the Club Lounge--the deck is the best view of the city. It is a great place to start your day, finish your day, or as happened once when I was there and a bit disabled, I stayed the (virtually) entire weekend on the deck and really enjoyed it. I probably visit NYC 10x/year and stay at the Sheraton Tribeca 7-8 of those times. Every time I am unfaithful I regret it...I miss the deck, the location and the cheerful people.One note, although the rooms on Canal are considered an upgrade, (great windows), I find them noisy--I am not out late so the late night noise is disruptive. The east-facing rooms although considered standard are much quieter and bigger.

I stayed at this hotel during a business trip. The room and stay is average and nothing to write home about. Nothing really bad to say though about the service and comfort level. Disappointing pay-for-wifi in the room but that's hardly unusual - free in the lobby.I very rarely use earplugs when I sleep, but this hotel was the exception as I had a room facing the busy Canal Street and there's notable street noise already from early hours. Kind of boring breakfast.

Stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca for three nights. The Good: Staff was friendly. There is a 24-hour convenience store right next door that has most everything you could want. The Disappointing: It's August, so busy time of year - got it. But paying over $300 a night for a room reminiscent of a decent Holiday Inn seemed a little extreme. Rooms are small. Desperately need to update the carpets on each floor. Walls are thin, so you can hear your neighbors pretty clearly. Elevators are slow and annoying.

Overall good stay. The Starbucks kiosk in the lobby was not dependable, but there is a dunkin donuts a block away with good coffee. Staff was friendly. Hotel was bright. Rooms are clean and a good size with a decent sized bathroom. The bed was very comfortable with good linens. Didn't have a view, but our 4th floor room was quiet and clean and clean smelling. Didn't use any of the restaurants. Parking garage is expensive, of course, but right across the street. I would not mind staying again.

The stay started off great. The area is very convenient to lower Manhattan, close to numerous subway lines and many restaurants and shops. The staff were initially very helpful and kind, but at the end of our stay everything changed. We had arranged a driver to take us from the hotel to Newark, as we had 5 pieces of luggage and needed a big car. The woman at the desk told us it would be $85 in total, including tolls for an SUV to take us. Perfect! We booked it. When we went down at our reserved time, the driver of the vehicle immedietely started complaining, saying that the amount of luggage we had was going to cost more. He was blatantly rude and then at the airport, after reluctantly taking us, he tried to tell us the tolls were not included! He started yelling at us at the drop off at the airport, trying to get more money. There was obviously a misscommunication somewhere, but it did not lie with us. After arriving at the airport, I phoned the hotel and spoke to the same woman that told us the price initially and she confirmed once again that it was $85 for a large SUV including tolls. The driver should have taken this up with the hotel and NOT the guests.We are also still waiting to here back from the general manager about an item we left in the room. We are trying to arrange it to be sent to us and the manager has been very flakey with his replies and everytime we call he is 'not available'. Very strange. Surely we're not the first people to have left something in a room?

Located in lower Manhattan on Canal Street, this is an older property with typically smaller New York City sized rooms. But the price was unbeatable at 2:09 on a weekday in August when other similar properties were twice the price. The restaurant didn't open for dinner as advertised, but who needs it when there's so much else in walking distance. And by the way we walkable neighborhood.

Spent a week here August 6-13 with a friend - we loved it! It was our first time to NYC so we weren't sure what to expect. The hotel was clean, the room was clean, quiet, bed was good. It was a typical room size...didn't spend much time in it so it didn't matter to us anyway.From the reception staff (Milly, Monique, Kinga) to the valet guys (Nadir, Theron), to the cleaning staff to the breakfast bar maintenance staff (Duane, Raul)....everyone was friendly, helpful and just great to see each day!The lobby was convenient with free access to about 5 computers and wi-fi, some seating area, a coffee bar, a restaurant and a bar. The second floor had a fitness room (actually didn't use it but it looked nice!!!)The best thing was we were given access to a lounge on the 21st floor where there was a help-yourself breakfast bar in the am - bacon/sausage, scrambled eggs, home fries, toast, yogurt, fruit, peanut butter, cream cheese, coffee, cold cereal, access to soda and water...there was limited seating but it was never crowded. There was also a tv, and sitting area by it, a computer and best of all, an outdoor terrace with patio furniture where you could have a drink and enjoy the view towards either the Hudson or uptown city view. The hotel was conveniently located near Canal St subway access, a short walk to a small Chinatown and little Italy (so beautiful at night), about a 40 min walk to Wall St area and Battery Park area.It was right beside a great deli where you could get a fresh, reasonably priced sandwich ($6-8 for a big sandwich), juice, soda, salad bar, pizza...and a block from the hotel, a convenience store that sold beer, coolers etc; beside that, a pizza place where you could get a basic cheese pizza slice for $1! Other slices were $3-4 - was good pizza.It was a safe area to walk around - us 2 females never felt concerned walking back there at night. Sure it's not a "glamourous" area right there, but it's New York! A big, busy, expectably dirty city as all big cities are subject to. We love Sheraton Tribeca - the staff made us feel welcome, they always had a smile for us and they are hard-working and professional. Love you guys!! : ) (From the Canadian girls!)

I can't believe the negative review complaining the rooms are too small and blah blahWe need three rooms in August 2014 and decided to upgrade to the club roomsThe rooms are twice as big and definitely modern compared to anything you would see in Paris or Rome. People forget in New York City rooms are small try to Walcott if you want to see a small roomWe felt the rooms were more than adequate and of course each room add the Sheraton heavenly bedOur room was 2020. One of our friends room was 2019. Both rooms had a spectacular view of uptown New YorkBoth rooms also got us access to the roof where we spent every evening enjoying the beautiful weather from the top of the hotelService from the staff was always very professional we never had a complaintI had one complaint at all it would be that there were so many people that hit the free breakfast it ran out quicker than we would've liked. Or at least the attendant couldn't keep upI'm sure that the next time we stay in New York we will stay here again

This hotel cancelled my reservation for a double bed room and tried to squeeze 4 people in a room for 2 people without any compensation.They cancelled without telling me and worse, it's illegal put more people than the facility's maximum capacity. This hotel think more about the money than the safety.I would avoid a hotel in this conditions!The hotel is at chinatown in a street with a lot of dirty and cheap stores.I needed to spend much more money and walk around ny with all my luggage to find a new hotel. That never happens with me!AVOID!

The room is a bit small, as many NYC hotels, but bright and well maintained. The King size bed took up much of the room and the bathroom was small, yet modern. The workout facility was average size, but I was disappointed they did not have any free weights. The elevators are a bit slow and can get crowded. The hotel is on Canal Street, which is very busy and lacks any charm. But once you get inside it is efficient. There was no doorman to help hail a taxi when needed, and the traffic on Canal Street can get really backed up with cars heading to the Holland Tunnel. Easy walk to Soho, the Village and of course Tribeca. If I had to stay in that area again, I would stay again despite it lacking charm. I liked that it was bright and clean.

I booked this hotel for a single night due to its location between Chinatown and Little Italy. How bad could one night be.....pretty bad!!!!! The physical plant and location are a problem. The hotel is poorly laid out with small rooms and very narrow halls. The halls become echo chambers and sound carries throughout the floor. The hotel is also right next to a USPS station with the sound of trucks arriving and leaving all night and banging mail skids makes sleep impossible. Add to that the street noise on one of Manhattan's busiest streets and you can forget any thought of a good night's sleep. In a 10 minute span at midnight I heard a police car siren, 3 mail trucks beeping as they backed up, mail skids banging - metal on metal and a drunk guest laughing in the echo chamber as he tried to open his door.Arrival was sterile and cold and I received a warmer welcome from my DI in Marine Corps OCS. The clerk did not bother to direct me to the elevators which are hidden in the rear corner of the main floor. I was sorry that I disturbed her afternoon.The hall carpet on my floor was badly stained and the hall was blocked by a pile of dirty sheets and maid's cart. The rooms are about 150 square feet and are clean and attractive. No place can be all bad!I tried 5 times to schedule a wake up call since the clock radio was broken. I finally got a real person who told me the wake up call was scheduled but the call never came in the morning. It was a good thing that sleep was impossible or I would have missed my flight. My advice to anyone contemplating a stay at this hotel is to drink heavily before you arrive and if you are lucky enough to get arrested for public intoxication;;you will rest better in a police holding cell...it certainly will be quieter..

My wife and I just stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca from Aug 4 to 8th. This was my wife's first visit to NYC and wanted this to be very special. The hotel has some great amenities, especially the view from the upper floors and the Club lounge.
