It is very close to the Canal St. subway stations that take you both to Times Square, Empire State Building and Central Park to the north and the World Trade Centre to the south. Little Italy and Chinatown are a short walk away where we enjoyed and excellent dinner. Very nice accommodations including the comfortable king sleeper bed. Very attentive staff from the front desk, Concierge and maid service. I would truly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to NY City for business or pleasure. When we visit New York again we will definitely stay at your hotel. N & C from Toronto Canada

On first glance we were worried that the hotel was in a dodgy part of town. We went to the bar to drown our sorrows and grab some food when the lovely barman advised us to try some local cuisine and cross over the road into Soho - We did and it was amazing. The hotel rooms are very big for NYC and paying that little bit extra for the Club Lounge was well worth it - especially for the views. We ate out every day and can recommend Dos Cominos - their Ice Margaritas are gorgeous. The staff are so friendly at the Sheraton - especially house keeping. We are looking forward to returning in the near future and would recommend this hotel to everyone!. Best holiday ever!

Hotel was good in terms of good value of money for NY standards. The hotel is situated between Chinatown and Tribecca, towards the nicest/quietest side of Canal street. Walking distance to Chinatown, Little Italy and Soho and with variety of options for restaurants and shopping. Besides, it has very closely 2 tube and train stations -plus a few buses stops- with direct access to most of the city tourist spots (Time square, Wall Street, Central Park,...). It's also a 15 minutes ride from Brooklyn.Staff was really helpful. At the moment we arrived there were no 2 rooms which could accomodate 3 beds as booked, but the manager diligently fixed it and replaced it by 3 double rooms instead which probed to be more convenient seeing the rooms size is not big (i didn't find them too small either as some other reviewers commented; they were average and fine for 2 people staying for a week). Besides, they assist us with getting a wheel chair for a couple of days for a family member that got injured. They were especially nice and kind to the kids.There's complimentary coffe and tea facilities in the room plus ice machine in the corridor.Rooms have no free wifi which would have been good. There's free wifi in the lobby plus free access to some computers. We didn't make use of the gym or restaurant facilities so cannot give opinion on that.

Our family of four wanted to experience TriBeCa for the first time. I booked the Sheraton TriBeCa per the good reviews on TA and was not disappointed. The location is great. TriBeCa is a vibrant, beautiful area. There is so much to do, see and eat in Lower Manhattan, and there are two subway stations around the corner so uptown is just a short ride away. The hotel in general, and our room were impeccably clean, elegant, and comfortable. Housekeeping was great. The staff accommodated every little favor I asked for with a smile. They even refrigerated my Little Italy left-overs and delivered them to my room hot and in room-service style to my room the next day. I cant say enough good things about the Sheraton TriBeCa! I will stay here again and again.

We stayed in room 1217, which had a nice view of the Empire State Building, at the end of the hallway. Absolutely silent, we heard no noise from hallway or other rooms. The room is small. Bed very comfortable. Room was very clean, housekeeping was fine. Only possible complaint is that there is very little storage for folded clothing. One cubby in the closet and one under the desk. The location cannot be beat, walking distance to Soho and the Village. Access to subways approx 1 block in each direction. I would stay here again.

Very nice and clean rooms. Rooms are slightly on the smaller side, but then this is NY. Very helpful staff, housekeeping is on the ball, Club service is excellent, views from the 21st floor are breathtaking. Early morning airport limo showed up right on time. Cons - they didn't list early check-in on the reservation or the club level booking. However, when I showed them the email confirmation, Monique addressed both issues promptly.Overall - Hotel property is very well managed.

Travelling around the US our journey ended in New York and on this hotel.A wonderful place, good location, very kind staff and a very nice room. Absolutely a plus that there was a Starbucks in the hotel. Only thing I think should be changed is free internet for guests staying longer than a night. We used the free internet in the lobby, but it would have been great to have it in our room without having to pay for it. If you stay at this hotel you will not be sorry!

I stayed with my husband in Sheraton Tribeca for the 4 of July. The location is good, but after five days, I left the hotel with a bad feeling. I think that we were misled, manipulated and discriminated as tourists. I paid for a room on the executive floor, however I was assigned supposedly to a deluxe a room on a different floor to satisfy my request for a "good view", but the cleaning service was lousy and the general impression of attentions, very limited. I had even clean the armchair with disinfectant to remove dirt in the arms! Both the room, and the carpet of the halls didn’t smelled clean and fresh, and the extreme smallness of the room was really an inconvenient. Outside the hotel we enjoy our vacation and anniversary as we had planned it. But inside the hotel the experience was different as expected! Is a three-star hotel; nothing more.

Picked this hotel for its location. When I made the reservations, I asked for a room with a view since it was my husband and my anniversary. What a room! Great view, nice and clean, with a comfy bed! The hotel delivered a complimentary bottle of wine for the occasion which was a nice surprise! I only wish that the rooftop lounge would be available to anyone and not just "club members" as it is such a beautiful place to see the city skyline and relax. Thank you for a wonderful anniversary night!

This was our first time staying somewhere besides Midtown...great decision! I loved the proximity to Chinatown, Lower East Side, SoHo, subway, etc. Very knowledgeable front desk staff, bellman, etc. (Example: We were advised to take a limo to LaGuardia rather than a taxi because it was cheaper, something we never would have guessed.) Our room was small (hey, its NYC) but quiet and impeccably clean. Because our room wasn't ready, they voluntarily comped us free breakfast on the "club" floor for our 3-night stay -- a generous gesture that we will remember...

After traveling all day and finally arriving at the hotel after a debacle cab ride, I wasn't sure what to expect when I arrived at the hotel. WOW! Was I ever pleasantly surprised! Andrea welcomed me and provided the best customer service I have ever had! She knew exactly where to send me to decompress, Nancy's Whiskey right around the corner. Excellent recommendation and what I needed. Thank you Andrea. She is a true asset to the property with excellent customer service. It was a wonderful business trip. Again thank you Andrea. Be sure to ask for her!!!!

Stayed here four nights at a good rate I was able to get through Priceline. Asked for and received an upper-floor room with a nice view. Also received excellent restaurant suggestions from front-desk staff and doormen. All in all, this stay was a big winner. I highly recommend the Sheraton Tribeca.

While we only stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca for a night, we really enjoyed our stay. The taxi/cab drive from the airport seemed to take longer than a trip to midtown/east due to the nature of downtown. Check-in was both quick and friendly. The elevators were located is an awkward tiny corner of the ground floor, and it was impossible for two guests with suitcases to pass each other. The hotel was in a great location for the downtown attractions. While the hotel does seem to be located in an unfriendly neighbourhood, it’s only a short 3 block walk to Broadway with lots of shopping nightlife. The queen bed size room was a little smaller than usual, and equipped with two phones (one was cordless which is pointless given the size of the room). More importantly, the room was clean and modern. I would recommend this hotel to friends. Catch a taxi/cab to the airport, and do not accept a black hire car (offer by staff) to the airport as they avoid the tolls, fall asleep at the wheel, and take the long way.

I never knew how much being a Platinum Starwood member makes a difference, until I travelled for the first time without one. I have stayed at dozens of starwood properties around the world, and it has always been great customer service, free couples massages, early check in, late check outs, etc. Gave no thought to how I would be treated as someone who "booked through a third-party travel website" --in this case Travelocity. Oh to experience how this hotel treats the regular folk was horrifying to say the least. So my friend and I get in around 1, so we think no problem let's drop off our bags, precheck in early, gave the front desk clerk my phone number to call me if the room is available earlier, and we go to lunch and come back at regular check in time--3pm. We come back at 10 minutes until 3, and now the lobby is packed. Check in time, right, did not think about that ever because like I said before always travelled with a platinum member on points so never had to wait until 3. It takes us 10 minutes to get to the front, she asks for my name and credit card again--i explain to her we already gave her my credit card etc. She checks on the room and says it is ready, but they are just checking to make sure it is inspected--no more than 10 minutes. 10 minutes go by, oh there's a bulb that needs to be replaced, 10 more minutes. 30 minutes go by, I am at this point agitated and very tired and the manager checks on the room and voila it's ready. So at this point it's 3:35, I am exhausted just want to lay down and check my phone which was in the front pocket of my backpack that i checked. I open up the pocket, and hooray the phone is cracked. When i last used it on the train, it was fine. Now it is cracked. I try to call down to the front desk, but the phone is broken in the room. So then I call them from my cell phone, and explain the situation and they tell me they will send an engineer to fix my phone and security to take down a report about my phone. Engineer shows up, fixes phone, security does not show. It's 6pm at this point and I am flabbergasted that they haven't sent anyone up. So i call down again, the front desk is not apologetic and just tells me flat out they've been busy. As if because I am on vacation and I have all the time in the world to sit in the hotel room waiting for them! I tell them I have dinner plans and they need to send someone up ASAP. So the security guy shows up, Luis, he is actually very nice and takes down the report. Says he will investigate and get back to me. I do not hear a single thing. The next day as I am leaving for dinner and after I paid $65 to have my screen fixed, i stop by the front desk. They manager Aldo is very confrontational, almost accusatory, as if I am trying to scam the hotel out of paying for my phone repair. Do they think that someone who is paying over $200 a night, and is on vacation, in some crazy scheme to have my phone fixed would come up with this story? He was unapologetic, completely rude, and said that they offered me free club level access and that's all they could do. Free breakfast and sodas a $75 value. 1. they never communicated to me that i had this club level access offered to me to appease my terrible experience at this hotel. he claimed they did not have my number or email--to which i pointed out i gave my cell phone number at check in, and they emailed me the confirmation so that is a flat out lie, 2. i tried to go to the club level access the next morning as I was leaving, and my key didn't work!! So he either lied to me, or the club level access was for a day that I didn't even know about because they never communicated it to me. ABSOLUTELY insane experience. Will never stay here again. My friend who has a block of rooms reserved for her wedding is now reconsidering. I have never been treated so poorly and rudely by a manager ever. Maybe it's because i wasn't with my Starwood Platinum companion, but I am a starwood member and now I will think twice about getting status with Starwood as opposed to Hilton or Marriott. Their loss as I travel frequently for work and vacation!

I stayed here 5 nights and I think my title summed up my experience.The hotel itself is situated in a good location where everything isn't too far. Though the good things end here.Its got very small rooms. Yes, small even for NYC.We chose to stay at a Sheraton because of my positive sleeping quality in past stays at other Sheraton properties. No not here, the windows do nothing in blocking traffic noise in the middle of the night. If you are a light sleeper you should stay elsewhere.As a SPG Gold Member, we were given no perks and was not given an enhanced room, even when the hotel was obviously not at full capacity, which was extremely disappointing.We also had an Wifi connection problem, the operators on the phone could not help and suggests that "YOU can call the toll-free number for technical support" and not proactively help us with the problem. We spent literally hours talking to the person on the toll-free number. It ended up to be because of an administrative error at the hotel's end, this was only because we met one very helpful staff at the reception who was willing to spend time looking through our record.It's a shame, this property can do so much better. I will choose elsewhere the next time I am in NYC.

I recently inadvertently booked an online reservation at this hotel on the spg.com website. I instantly cancelled the reservation or thought I cancelled it. I did not have any idea the reservation was still active until I received an email asking if I was planning to arrive. The problem was, I did not receive the email till the next day. I contacted platinum concierge services and they were unable to get me a refund. As a long time platinum member, I am disappointed and surprised that this hotel would rather not waive the fee for one of its best customers, never have the decency to send a reply email, and risk losing multiple visits from myself and others. It speaks to what type of hotel it stands for and if they treat their best customers this way, how do they treat others? There are far more friendlier and accommodating hotels in the area. I fully recommend the element hotel in Times Square.

Our most recent visit to New York City found us searching for a hotel in the Soho/Tribeca area. We have never stayed in this particular part of NYC in our many dozens of Manhattan hotel stays. We purchased our hotel reservations via Hotwire as we wished to stay at no less than a 4 star hotel. The Sheraton Tribeca did not disappoint us in the least. The normal small Manhattan room is present but very well appointed, comfortable with excellent linens, very sleep worthy bedding, and a staff that takes very good care of you with a smile. The location is OUTSTANDING and within a blocks walk to the Subway, several blocks one way is China Town, and walk to the left of this and you are on Mulberry Street, the central hub of Little Italy restaurants. If you arrive on Friday evening you will find ample FREE Street Parking. So save a lot of money and go spend it on some fantastic food.

It may not be the smallest hotel in Manhattan but it's definitely on the small side for a Sheraton. But in a city where the square foot comes at a premium one might want to forget about the size of the footprint and the lack of a view and concentrate on the cleanliness and the location: You are downtown with Soho, Chinatown and TriBeCa as your neighbors, lots to do and away from the touristy hustle and bustle of Midtown. Just stop by the front desk and ask of Aldo. You'll be amazed by all the possibilities.

Only used this hotel because our tour started from here. Many cheaper hotels have free WiFi and free breakfast. This hotel has free WiFi in lobby. There are some basic breakfast places nearby. Staff are friendly.

Five of us were travelling together and decided to walk from Penn Station to the hotel. Of course it was a loooong walk and when we arrived at the hotel it smelled so wonderful. Andrea at the front desk was super friendly. We wanted connecting rooms but there weren't any available at the time so we checked in and right away went for the evening appetizers. It was lovely and tastey.The outdoor patio was amazing and had a wonderful view of Manhattan and the Empire State Building. Very charming and again the staff was so accommodating. Michael gave us great dinner commendations and we ended up at the 5 Napkin Burger, one of the nights. We walked over to Soho and looked in the stores. Everything is so close including to subway stops to uptown or downtown or Brooklyn. When we got back we stopped by the front desk and thought we would ask about the connecting rooms and Aldo immediately checked and found that there was something available.He arranged to have our luggage moved and took care of every little detail. Amazing person and so accommodating. We decided to eat at the hotel and the food was great and Moe was helping us. I found that everyone at the hotel was always working together and as we ordered our food late, Martha the chef and Moe served us together and really impressive.The location, the patio, the rooms were clean and awesome beds. I have been to New York so many times and really loved staying downtown.The general manager made my day when he called to make sure everything was going well. I have never had that happen and I felt like I was staying with friends with family. Super feeling and much appreciated.I would recommend this hotel to anyone who likes a quiet but exciting getaway.............I loved the hotel and the staff so much that I am bringing my husband and kids next time!!Thank you .

The location of this hotel is very good -- close to many subway lines. It was very clean, and the staff was most pleasant. The room was small, typical in NYC. For a four night stay, I would have preferred a dresser with drawers instead of the desk with desk chair. The design is more for business travel than tourist. Beware of their "green" option. It means no maid service at all. This is a little much for an extended stay. Also, I felt being charged ten dollars a day for WIFI in the room was silly. It's free many places these days. Of course this was NYC.

This was a nice hotel. The only downside was that you have to pay for Wifi in your room but it is free downstairs. For the price we paid I think it should have been included. The front desk staff was amazing and an employee named David ran to and from the corner multiple times just to find me a cab. He also did great loading and unloading our bags. All the employees were great but he stood out to me! The bartender served a very generous amount of alcohol for our drinks as well!

I slept like a baby at this hotel, the bed was amazing and the pillows so comfortable. The bath room was a good size for NYC with a nice shower. They were also incredibly accommodating as I flew in on the red eye, called from the airport to book a room and they let me check in at 8am for some rest before enjoying the neighborhood. It's a busy area with a lot of street noise but my room was high and away from the street which mitigated all the issues. If you are looking for a good night sleep, stay here!

Hotel looks new and modern. WiFi is good. Housekeeping staff are friendly and helpful. Room is clean and comfortable, although small.No room upgrade or alternative benefit for SPG Gold member.The reception staff seemed always busy. The check-in and check-out waiting time was long.Room has no minibar. Elevators require room key to activate.The hotel is near Chinatown. If it's your first time to visit NYC, I suggest you to stay in another area, for example, near Grand Central Station.

I had seen some other reviews about this hotel and almost changed my reservation. I am glad I didn't must say some of the other reviews of this hotel were very misleading. I found the staff friendly and professional and the hotel was very clean. The clubroom and patio on the 21st floor was outstanding. The hotel was also located near multiple subway stations which gave you access to lots of subway lines to go downtown or uptown. I do have to say that the general location in China town is a bit too touristy for my business needs and some of the shops around the area were a bit aggressive with wanting to sell their wears. But, all in all, a very nice hotel.

Great location and ideal for NY a bit far from the heart of time square but close to soho and tribeca which is much more quiet. A bit noisy due to canale street nearby and room are a bit small. Staff is nice, many restaurants around. Good price for value

Get away from this hotel bad in every directions you can imagine !1-Room were small. Feels so chrostophobic!2- Beds were NOT comfy and NO closet space at all! 3-Shame on be part of Starwood member so I try to stay at Starwood properties when I travel.4-Rude Manager he did not care at all but he offered me free WIFI :)

I am SPG member, traveling a lot and usually very happy staying at the SPG hotels, however, this was not one to remember:1 Stay was good overall however, due to a late flight and the fact we are traveling with a baby we requested a late checkout. The hotel staff insisted that they cannot accommodate the late checkout request (2pm) since the hotel is full that day however, they suggested we pay extra (half a day) for give additional 2 hours. I am wondering, if the hotel is full, how is it possible that the hotel can't accommodate late checkout but they can they accommodate late check out with a fee?2. Location - Close to SOHO but not close enough, Close to Tribeca but not close enough. Situated on the dodgy part of Canal street, room was modern and clean but too much noise from the street all day and night.3. No help of a bell boy to help with the luggage at Check in.

While the room was small everything worked and it was quite and well maintained. The staff was helpful and the location interesting. The Cast Iron area just across the street has interesting shops and a number of very good restaurants. I had never stayed in the part of the city and don't know that I will again but proximity to China Town and the Cast Iron district was a plus as the latter was certainly worth visting.The only downside I see to this location is it can be difficult getting a cab and when you do the traffic coming off the bridge makes for very slow progress. On the other hand two subway lines are located a very short walk away and provide easy no change access to most of the East side of the. City. .

I Travel to NY several times a year, normally I stay downtown but my son lives here in Tribeca and he suggested the Sheraton. My first night was a little rough...no fault of the hotel. My room was next to a family with three loud kids, screaming at 7:00am is tough when you are on pacific time. I went down stairs and talked to Monique, I normally don't like to complain but I thought it may be a long week in that room! Monique was so friendly and understanding. She moved me to a beautiful room with a view of Empire State Building. Michael D. moved my belongings...super nice guy! Checked the room to make sure I didn't forget anything. My stay was great...friendly staff...very clean! Thank you, Sheraton Tribeca!

Sheraton Tribeca is perfect for a short and sweet Big Apple trip. Location is awesome. 5 to 10 minutes walk to the heart of Soho and 2 minutes to subway. The hotel itself is very cozy. Starbucks at the entrance is very practical when you want to start your day with a full stomach and a cup of coffee. Check in is fast and the staff is helpfull. The room is a bit small and might be difficult to fit in for 2 but it is definetely ideal for a businees trip. Decoration and equipment looked new and modern. Air conditioning was just fine. Overall great for a business trip but i would also suggest this hotel for couples.

I've been staying here for the past month or so and it has been very pleasant! About a month ago I change my stay from midtown to this area because getting to work was easier. The hotel is nice for many reasons:1. The front desk are all lovely people and very hospitable. I usually forget my toothpaste and and they always have some for me when I check in. 2. The club lounge is amazing with spectacular views of NYC. 3. Housekeeping are very nice people4. Gym is adequate and cleanThere is 1 small con and 1 mishap:1. The room is tiny unless you get a suite or one of the king/queen sofa rooms. I compared the sq ft from the sheraton times square and sheraton tribeca and I am 100% that the sq ft is less at this property than one at times square or the westin grand central although they list the same sq ft. 2. One night they had the fire alarm blaring for quite some time. Initially people were scrambling to run down the stairs and literally 10 mins later and halfway down 15 flights of stairs they decided to tell people that they are just testing the alarm. This was at 10PM at night.

Like most NYC hotels, the rooms were small. Beds were comfy and the rooms were clean. The hotel is near Chinatown, Little Italy, Greenwich Village and SoHo--which makes it a big plus!The staff was kind and inviting. I am a Starwood member so I try to stay at Starwood properties when I travel. I would stay here again.

It's a normal standard business hotel near both Soho and China Town. Staff are friendly and helpful. The room is ok size considering NYC hotel average room size. Breakfast at $16 is buffet but with very small basic selection which is just for a for corporate guests who only need a quick breakfast. Wifi is complimentary as part of a corporate contract deal but usually chargeable for non corporate guests.

Stayed here for 2 nights and got upgraded to a room with a huge terrace on the second floor. Rooms are tiny though, and difficult to maneuver around in. Ideal hotel to stay in for a night out with friends. The reception area could do with some renovating though. It looks very dated.P.S. The hotel bar serves amazing burgers.

The hotel was chosen as a change from the 42nd to 52nd Street Area to the up and coming Soho, specifically for restaurants - shops and old buildings, many of which are being renovated with care with retention of the heritage.The hotel frontage was unappealingThe bar was in the lounge, as apposed to an nice intimate bar, with a central zone for lab top - internet devotees. Here was limited restaurants facilitiesThe rooms were small, without a bath, and without shower gel or shampoo during my entire stay On one occasion the coffee machine was left uncleaned and milk used was not replaced.Unusually the bed and bathroom towels were changed dailyThe exception to the disappointment was the concierge porter was cheerful and most helpful at all times

Our overall stay at the Sheraton was acceptable. We had a larger room on the Club Level (21st floor). Comfy bed, nice views of the Hudson River, excellent air-conditioning, and the bathroom was certainly up to par. The club level lounge has an outdoor deck with an amazing view. Not crowded either. The complimentary hot breakfast was a nice morning touch.The poor girls at the front desk were having a tough time. We had to wait about 30 minutes for our room. The girls must have said "We're sorry for the inconvenience, we will...." a dozen times to various guests. The issues ranged from incorrect billing, wait times for a room, no bartender, valet not answering their phone, and engineering not responding to a plumbing issue. I really felt sorry for them. Also, regarding our wait, check-in is supposedly 3:00 PM and we arrived at 4:30. One of the receptionists said our room was just being inspected and we should wait in the lobby and she would bring us our key shortly. After 30 minutes I left the other waiting guests and asked the desk when our room would be ready. She then handed my our key and said we were good to go. So my advice would be that if you find yourself in the same situation, wait a bit, and just go back up to the front desk and ask again.Other reviewers raised issues with the elevators. There are three elevators. They all worked fine. We never waited more than one minute and the elevators were never crowded.The Avenue of Americas (AOA) bar attached to the Hilton Garden Inn around the corner is a great sports bar.I would guardedly recommend the Sheraton.

Sheraton is a nice business hotel, rooms are nice, very comfortable. Bathrooms are nice with a big shower. You are not going to have a view, but that's common in most NYC hotels. The downstairs bar is very blah, there was never anyone there....it served as an overflow for people trying to check in or waiting on their room. There is a little coffee shop in the hotel which is nice, they have a breakfast restaurant which is okay. There's also a 24 hour shop next door that has pizza and sandwiches and your standard convenience store items.

We were a family of four and stayed in a double bedroom. Size of the bedroom was small but not a surprise for a NYC hotel. Staff was very welcoming and polite. Beds were comfortable, room was always cleaned. Free wifi in the lobby only. Location was great for us; close to a few subway stations and literally steps away from soho and Greenwich village (great for Friday and Saturday drinks in soho- no cab required!)Highly recommend but be ready to have a small-okay room

I stayed in this hotel many weeks for business. Pros: The staff is extremely friendly (everyone from room service, to check in, to those that help you hail a cab), and the hotel is very clean. The club lounge outside area is a huge plus and very nice for NYC. You can get tons of hotel points here because they participate in make a green choice. Also, very close proximity to subway and downtown if you are working on Wall St.Cons: Small rooms that seem very standard w basic amenities. I have stayed in many NYC area Starwood properties and my biggest complain with this hotel is the room service and the limited 'quick healthy food' options in walking distance. The room service menu is very limited, and as a business traveler that worked long hours, I was normally too tired to go out. I am also not a huge fan of the area as it seemed kind of sketchy at night, and it was really tough to get a cab (nothing against the bellmen- they were very nice! just not a lot of cabs that come down the street that are empty). Gym is also very small and hotel is SMALL and slow which makes it crowded and it takes a long time to get down in the morning with luggage.I would definitely stay at this hotel again for business, there are a few other Starwoods I prefer in NYC though.

On a beautiful June day, I chose to walk from Battery Park area to the Hotel. I walked by the hotel twice because the hotel entrance is well marked due to the street vendors, small shops and traffic in front of the hotel. The Plant Fitness sign on the wall didn't help either. The hotel is located in an evolving area but vibrant area. I felt safe walking the streets even at 11 PM, but others may find it a bit unsettling; the police station is a block away.One inside, I found a the hotel to be very nice and comfortable. I did not have any service issues, rather the personnel were very welcoming. My room was adjacent to the (which I agreed to in lieu of a room at the end of the floor) but I did not hear any associated elevator noise. The bed, desk and bathroom were clean and well apportioned. The TV was hung on the wall thereby saving space. The bathroom had swinging doors which were a bit clumsy to use since they had to be closed to access the sink or use the light switches. The hotel restaurant apparently only serves breakfast which I thought was odd, but there are many dining options in the area..

Just got back from a 2 week stay in this hotel. It is a brilliant hotel, the staff are all friendly and welcoming, the rooms are gorgeous and our view from the 18th floor was breath taking. The beds were comfy and coffee maker in the room was a great touch. We had breakfast every morning in the SPG lounge which was great every morning and the staff in there were all friendly and helpful. It is in a great location with subways close by to everything.Thank you for making my birthday trip even better than I could have imagined.

The Sheraton Tribeca is a great little gem of a hotel. Situated on Canal Street inbetween locations like Tribeca, Soho, Little Italy and Chinatown nothing is too far away with 4 different subway lines just inches from each other.The rooms have everything you need and are clean too. I am a huge fan of the Starbucks coffee maker in the room replenished everyday for me to enjoy. Plus there is always bottled water provided daily, which is great when you're on the move.I especially liked the little messages left by housekeeping after cleaning the room as they out a smile on my face each time.The rooftop terrace bar is amazing to have a tipple after a long day out and seeing the sunset from there is just breathtaking. It may not be the Top of The Rock, but it sure does give you a spectacular view of the Manhattan skyline.As for the staff, Aldo, Monique and David have been very helpful whilst staying here and other members are warm and friendly. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

The hotel is located on Canal street, surrounded by traffic and street vendors. Upon arrival at the hotel, I was informed that our room had been given to someone else, and that I would need to wait an hour. Luckily, the manager was very nice, and upgraded my room to a higher floor. The room was small, even by NYC standards. Came down to the entrance to ask for recommendation for dinner, and was recommended a place known for its breakfast. Then asked about the location of a certain site, and was referred to the wrong location. A few days after our check out, a random charge of over $200 appeared on my credit card. Had to call the hotel, to dispute the charge. Luckily the accountant was very nice, and reversed the "unknown" charge, immediately. It's your typical cookie-cutter Sheraton hotel Would have rated it lower, had it not been for the courtesy and attentiveness of the manager and accountant. My company always has me stay in Sheraton hotels for work, but I may have that changed.

You better hope you don't have to deal with any issues at this hotel because if you do, good luck trying to get anyone to help you out! Especially management! I had an issue with being overcharged, and I've been chasing their staff to get it sorted out for 3 months. Stay wise the rooms are small and stuffy. Not all rooms have tubs either so make sure you watch out for that. The temperature in the room was impossible to control.

What a nice hotel, stuck in the middle of a somewhat run-down area of NYC. Stepping into its foyer is an immediate impression of elegance and good maintenance, especially when you just walked past dilapidated storefronts and Chinatown souvenir shops. The neighborhood feels safe, just a little rundown.The staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful, and both times I stayed the room was clean, odor-free, and elegant. Everything worked and it really was a pleasant two stays.The workout center is nice, with several treadmills and flat screens, with hookups for either you own music or theirs.

Against my better judgement, I stayed here because it was for one night and convenient to a meeting. Everything was just "wrong" about this hotel.First, I ordered room service and with 10 minutes to delivery (after almost an hour), I was told the food would be an additional 15 minutes (total of additional 25 minutes) because there was a problem with the ordering system (read: someone forgot to put my order in). After a long day, I was ready to rest but couldn't because the sheets were DIRTY. It took almost an hour (and two phone calls) for someone from housekeeping to come change them. I should have learned my lesson from room service the prior day but received cold food with no condiments (dry toast, no ketchup for the potatoes, etc.).Two stars are for the front desk who was very nice at check in and for the happy hour on the club lounge. The Lounge is amazing (rooftop) and the woman working was a delight and so attentive. Other than that, I would say stay at the one in Mid-Town. Much better experience.

Good location, walking distance to neighborhood restaurants and smaller shops. Bright & airy, modern lobby. A nice place to come back to after a hectic day sightseeing. All of the staff were very friendly however the breakfast restaurant and bar were minimally staffed. We are a family of 3 and stayed in a studio, it was a good size for New York, newly renovated bathroom with a great walk in shower - no tub. Negatives- our room on the 3rd floor looked out on he elevator shaft. Breakfast not great.

We selected this hotel for its proximity to Little Italy and Chinatown, great selection of restaurants and a more local feel than Times Square. Close to metro station. I wouldn't bother buying the breakfast option, very poor

My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights 2 weeks ago. Good: Deli next door.Subway around the corner.Very clean.Staff was very nice and very helpful.Elevators were fast and and all three were working.Starbucks in the hotel!TV got lots of channels.The window opened! Fresh air!8th floor was very quiet.Lots of outlets.The Bad:The AC thermostat was set on 60 however it was very warm in our room. The hallway was freezing though.We've travel to NYC quite frequently and this was by far one of the nicer hotels we've stayed in.

I have read the recent reviews of this property and with some, it seems like I must have stayed at a different hotel. This hotel was clean, modern, had everything one would need, excellent staff and convenient to some local deli's and restaurants. I actually checked in quite early only to insure I got a room request in for an upper floor and was told the room was ready. It was at around noon time. The room was cheerful, had a great view, a very nice contemporary bath, had the usual amenities and was very clean. My complaint would be, as it is in most NYC hotels, that the room was small. There are computers in the lobby, a bar, a restaurant which serves breakfast and a coffee bar. Unfortunately, when I went down to the coffee bar at 9 in the morning, they were closed, even though someone was behind the counter. That was crazy to be closed at that time. I did go next store and found a NY bagel and coffee, so no great loss. I would recommend this hotel and return to it without question. It is in an excellent location for lower Manhattan.

I had BED BUGS in my room. No one would create a report and/or follow up with me as they promised. Finally went through Starwood and they set up a complaint with the hotel. The managers took days and days to follow up with me and never followed up on what they promised. It was by far the worst costumer service I've ever had in my life. I've never written a review on anything before and was compelled to do so based on this experience. WORST hotel experience ever!

I have just returned from a 4 night stay with 6 of my girlfriends at the Sheraton Tribeca and I can honestly say what a fantastic experience. We travelled from the UK for my friends 40th birthday and to be honest I was a little concerned after reading some of the reviews here on TA however we have all come home with NO complaints at all. We were allocated rooms on the 18th floor away from Canal Street which if you're a light sleeper is definitely the best request. The rooms were small (this is NYC) however clean and the beds were super comfy. The SPG lounge was fabulous and the breakfasts excellent, a special mention for the young man in there who tended to our every need with a smile on his face. The front desk staff, especially Jaquie were friendly and super helpful. We did have to wait a while for our rooms to be ready however we sat and had Starbucks in the lovely reception area and as an apology we were given free wifi for the duration of our stay. Although the location on Canal Street may give some cause for concern it was so easy to get everywhere. Greenwich & Soho were within 10 minutes walk and at no point did we feel unsafe or get bothered by the street vendors of which we saw very few. Granted it isn't the prettiest part of town however it's super convenient and great value for money, especially when you'd rather save your pennies for shopping! Also worth a mention is the AWESOME bagel shop next door, the bagels were to die for and it's open all hours so very handy when you're on another time zone and feeling hungry at silly oclock :) Overall our experience was brilliant & I would really reccommend this hotel to anyone looking for a convenient, comfortable good value place to stay in NYC. Yes it's busy, yes communication can be lost sometimes but the staff's willingness to help out and do their best was lovely!! THANKYOU ST XX

We stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca the night before the BikeNY Five Boro tour. Unlike some guests, we left our bikes in our parked vehicle rather than cart them into the hotel.Issue 1 - Front desk. We arrived before check-in time so we gave our luggage to the valet to store it. He was doing great work hustling around and dealing with a dozen people at a time. If only the hotel could clone him and put him to work at the front desk. When we arrived back later, there were two lineups of people checking in - one at the SPG desk and one at the regular. The lineups moved infuriatingly slowly. It was taking 5 to 10 minutes per person, and then there would be extra holdups with guests going right to the front asking where their laundry is or some other pointless question, which the front desk people would then deal with while the lineups grew. Anyway, even though it was 4 or 4:30pm, we heard the front desk people telling people their room is not ready, so we heard this conversation multiple times: "But it's after 3pm! I'm sorry sir. I've waited in this line for 40 minutes! Sorry sir, the room should be ready shortly." A third line near the SPG side opened up briefly and he seemed to be giving out rooms while the other two were telling people their rooms were not ready. When we got to the front of the line we were told our room wasn't ready, and I pointed to the clerk giving out rooms and asked how he is able to do it, and without hesitation we got a room. It was just weird and annoying, and we spent nearly an hour in the cramped lobby.Issue 2 - Elevators. The issue is that there are not enough of them, or not enough working ones, or something else that involves waiting and waiting and eventually it shows up and it's full. You know something is wrong with the elevators when people are carting suitcases and bicycles down 7 flights in the morning thinking that's a preferable solution to waiting. We were the ones carting the suitcases, two men behind us were each carrying bikes (nice workout before the tour!), and a father and young child were behind them - and we were all from the 7th floor.Issue 3 - The little things. We were offered a free breakfast as part of our BikeNY deal. That's nice! Breakfast starts at 7am. Hmm, ok, well we need to be on our bikes, with helmets on, ready to go at 7:30 in the Financial District. How does that work if breakfast starts being served at 7am? Try 6am and we'd be happy.Our room was great! Nice king bed, clean, modern design, obviously recently renovated. Nice bathroom. The shower was really nice (no tub though). The location is pretty good. Canal Street is a little busy, but the subway is right around the corner and there is lots of stuff nearby.If they had elevators you could use in a reasonable time and efficient front desk staff, this would be a 4 star review. I was going to rate them a 2 but that seems a little punishing because we did like the room. This Sheraton seriously needs to rework their front desk processes and training. It should not take 5 to 10 minutes to check someone in - that is unacceptable. I joke about cloning the valet, but someone with his temperament, customer-handling abilities, and willingness to get the job done quickly would be a better face to the customer at the front desk. Then they need to do something about the elevators.

This is a very mediocre hotel. The decor is so tired. The location is good for Soho etc but noisy. The reserved room for twin beds was unavailable at check in so one of us had to sleep on a fold out first night. And it was expensive.On check out is was overcharged on my card by >$1500 as the accounts department ran my card through twice. After several days of calls and emails there is still no return of my money let alone suggestions of compensation for inconvenience.This is a hotel to avoid and Starwood should come in an replace management and accounts team with competent people.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one night. We're New Yorker's, but we spent the night out on the town for our anniversary. The room was clean and cozy. Buffet was okay. It was close enough for us to get around to the places we needed to go. The concierge was accomodating even after check-out time.

As a Starwood preferred guest since 1999, several years platinum , without a doubt, this was my worst hotel experience of any hotel chain!! Upon check in, I was given a room which I was not pleased. Upon return to reception, I was told no upgrades were available. When I asked to speak with a manager, he told me the same. I informed him that I will be checking out and go to the W New York, understanding I would be responsible for payment. Suddenly, the front desk manager pulls out a room map and suddenly reveals 6 available rooms on the club floor. I reviewed the room and returned to reception to find the manager with his coat on ready to leave(really made me feel like he cared about his position?!?). I did stay but even the club staff were unprofessional. I did receive an email from the asst.GM asking for additional details after I completed an unfavorable platinum survey but no follow up. One saving grace, " Ferry", the bellman! I understand reception may not volunteer an upgrade but to be lied about availability is unacceptable. I will NEVER return to that property! Sadly, I fear that is par for the course at this Sheraton :-(. However, the Starwood name still remains the finest brand in the business and I choose no other property!

I spent 2 nights at the Sheraton and had a great time. The hotel is a few steps away from a subway station, Chinatown and Little Italy. Rooms are comfortable, internet is free at the lounge and there are also computers available for guests. My room was next to the lift, so I had to cope with loud guests coming back at 4am (but I guess this is a "manners" problem, nothing to do with the hotel). I would, however, avoid those rooms. Would definitely recommend the hotel or come back.

Very pleased with our stay in Tribeca. Comfy room and bed, good view. Staff helpful and friendly, close to several subway lines and Broadway for shops.We went for breakfast in Cafe Crave just round the corner, good coffee etc. AOA bar/restaurant also round the corner is a decent place for relaxed food.

We had a lovely stay at the hotel which mixed both business and pleasure. The Hotel is clean and tidy and the staff are very friendly and helpful. The Deluxe King room was about normal size for NY but we were lucky enough to get a North facing room on one of the higher floors and the view was worth the money alone. At times the hotel was very busy which is to be expected, but the atmosphere was good and friendly. Overall we really enjoyed our time at the hotel and in comparison to the Soho Grand, across the road and which we stayed in the previous year we decided this hotel was less cool and chic but better overall. This was largely due to the use of the Club Lounge on the 21st floor which requires separate access, which is well worth asking for. This area has the open terrace which is relaxing and lovely and was a great place to sit back, look at the views and enjoy a quiet drink or nibble. Overall this was a very enjoyable stay at a very nice hotel. The good things: Great views for North facing rooms, The Club Lounge, West Broadway (trendy and great restaurants), close to many Subway stations, business centre (with Wifi). The bad things: No in room Wifi (2014?), Canal Street (busy and dirty), no in room mini bar/fridge, reception area too small.

Great hotel in nice safe location with decent price in NYC. Friendly staffs. Walking distance to Subway, Little Italy and Chinatown. We got nice room with Empire State Building view. Room was small, but it's the standard in NYC.

I booked this hotel online more than 6 months before travelling and I did so because it had a good deal on.Overall, it was a great hotel.The staff were friendly, the rooms were clean and the location was good if you like being downtown.There was free Wi-Fi in the lobby (not in rooms) which was useful.I did have some difficulties checking in and as a Gold Sheraton member I was surprised. There were 2 staff at the check in desk but neither were particularly interested in checking me in when I arrived. But if this is the worst thing that happens to you during your stay (and it was), things are pretty good.I would certainly recommend this hotel and I would consider staying there again in the future.Its probably a business traveller's hotel rather than a family hotel but that's what its marketing towards.

The room that my wife and I stayed in was small with no mini bar fridge but when you are only sleeping there because you are out sightseeing, what more do you need? The extraction fan in the bathroom was noisy and nothing flash about the bathroom but it was more than pleasant. The location was great with the nearby sub way station, Chinatown, Little Italy and walking distance to Battery Park and other sites.The staff there are friendly to say the least. We had trouble with the so called time we spent on the telephone making international calls, being required to pay an absurd amount, however, Milly at the front desk relieved any anxiety we had with a successful conclusion to this issue. Milly and Jackie at the front desk are a credit to their employer.An enjoyable stay was had.

If you can find a good rate here between $225 and $310 you're okay. But anything over that and you'll be disappointed. The front desk staff is truly good, as are the bell staff. If you tip housekeeping appropriately, the room is much cleaner and those folks are really quite nice too. But the bathroom fans are really noisy. And the food on the Club level is poor quality and poorly staffed.

I had stayed at the hotel a few weeks ago and noticed a lot of new faces from my previous visit. Even so everyone I came in contact with was very nice and friendly but I have to mention the restaurant manager Michael who went out of his way to make me a coffee after the cafe had closed. My only complaint was that my room was a little smaller this time than last but it was still ok for New York. Definitely enjoy this hotel and the staff and will continue to stay here.

Good hotel. I go to New York every chance I get and usually try a different hotel each time. We got a good deal and were very excited about the location. The gentleman at check in was very nice and was generous with a early check in and club access. His whole demeanor changed when I told him it was my friends first time in NY. Great welcoming and made us feel special, its the little things that I notice. We drove this trip which I never do) so we parked. The fee was fair for NY. We walked to SOHO and did some shopping and had dinner. We got lucky with a high floor room with a great view of Tribeca. With all due respect nothing unique about the hotel itself but they made it up with the comfortable accommodations, understated service, and a great place to stay which are what hotels are suppose to do. Definitely would be back if the price was as appealing as it was for this trip.

Stayed here for two nights at the beginning of May for a decent price. Great location - walking distance to shopping, subways and great food. You do hear the street noise but it didn't really bother me and we were only on the 7th floor (though away from the elevators). The air conditioning was on full and it was freezing in the hallways but the room was warm, clean and very sufficient with a king bed and good sized bathroom. Bed was one of the more comfortable I've slept in as far as hotels go. Staff was pleasant and helpful. Only annoyance was the elevators - there are only 3 to serve all floors and 1 was out of service which made for long wait times. Otherwise, this hotel does the trick. Nothing fancy but is clean and well located. We didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel anyway.

I stayed here several times over the last few months only due to location. Some of the rooms smelled of mold, and they were unable to move me. in general I have had issues with extremely spotty to horrid service: Specifically.. once the hotel staff left the security bolt so that my room was open! This was at 1am in the morning, I ended up walking in my room without thinking about security. When I called the front desk, no one answered. I was furious, but too tired to complain to the spg platinum desk. The hotel staff front desk often "ignores" the guests waiting for service while involved in private or personal phone conversations.

I would highly suggest not staying at this hotel. There are many other options that you money will be better spent at. This hotel is barely in Tribeca, many would call it Chinatown! At peak times it takes forever to get a elevator. You will most likely have to ride the elevator up to go down.... The rooms are the size of a walk in closet and should have a murphy bed inside them. This is one the worst SPG hotels I have ever stayed at. When you discuss these issue with customer service (Micheal Linde) Overnight Manager from the hotel you will not be valued as customer.

I will start with the only 2 good things about the hotel. 1.The location was walking distance to many great spots and is conveniently located downtown, 2. They had the usual comfortable beds that all Starwood hotels have. It ends there.First started out that they did not have our reservation. I booked using airmile points, I printed and had with me my confirmation but it was not in their system. They found us a room on the second floor, pretty lousy. They also took a copy of my reservation to keep for their records. I gave them my credit card for incidentals but explicitly stated that I wanted to pay for anything in cash, not to charge the card on check out. He said no problem. I also asked about wifi and although not free he agreed to provide it to me for free, I was happy about that as I knew I would have work todo while I was there. Throughout the stay the hotel was busy and very corporate, no personal service. That didnt really bother me but it wasnt appealing either. The lineups for the elevator everyday were ridiculous! And the stairs were locked so we couldnt even walk up to our room. On our second of three nights, my husband went out to grab a nightcap but forgot his key. I was fast asleep and was not opening the door. He tried explaining to the front desk staff that he was my husband and all he wanted to do was go to bed so he could enjoy the rest of the weekend with me and his in-laws. When the front desk heard that for some reason he thought it made sense to call and wake up my father at midnight and have him go to my room to wake me up. How does this make any sense??? Why didnt he just look to see that both our names were on the reservation?? They took a copy after all, what was the point of that. To finish it off they ended up calling the police on my husband and embarassed him in front of my father! The next day I called the manger to complain of how the incident was handled. I left a message as he was not in yet and asked to have him call me. No phone call.Finally on check out, I went to the front desk to check any incidentals. I also asked them to make sure to check that I wasnt charged for the wifi as the gentleman on check in granted it to me free of charge. They checked and saw that there were no incidentals and I was happily on my way. Well low and behold today I get a charge for $107 USD on my credit card from the Sheraton Tribeca! I called to check what it was and they could give me no answers other than transfer me to accounting. I cant wait to see how long this takes. This is one hotel I won't be back to.

Great hotelroom clean and comfortablebed the most amazing ever I have slept instaff kind and helpfulinternet access in reception for freenot in the heart of New York city - but we walked in and it was pleasant

This nice building sticks out somewhat among its slightly shabbier neighbors. The location is very convenient many metro lines (ACE, 1/2/3 etc.). Otherwise, there is not much in the area - some small shops and businesses. You can walk to Chinatown, otherwise the excitement is a short train ride away.The rooms are nice, if a bit small (we had a king bed, but were able to squeeze in a rollaway). On the inside, the decor is nice and modern - there is a restaurant and bar in the lobby. However, the noise can be a concern. Our room (5th floor) faced an alley, but we could still hear street noise from Canal St. You can also hear the doors slamming in the hallway.

I wanted to stay in Tribeca, but next time I'll spring for the Soho Grand (right around the corner). Room was spacious, but had no closet, no chest of drawers, no fridge. Very odd. The ice machine was broken on my floor. Gym had treadmills and ellipticals, but no free weights and no resistance machines (well, there was one, but it was out of order). ATM was out of order. It just wasn't a "luxury" experience at all. But it was fine. Bed was really comfortable. I won't be staying there again.

I was expecting the Sheraton Tribeca to truly shine, but it is simply an old building with unexceptional structures and amenities. One thing is certain, that the location can be particularly nice if you want to be in TriBeCa. I stayed here when I was SPG Gold and not SPG Platinum, Club Lounge is quite nice with the rooftop terrace. If I ever stay here again as a Plat, I'll be certain to check out the Club Lounge rooftop terrace.

Best things about this hotel:-Super-convenient to metro A, C, and E lines. It's about a 1-minute walk to the subway stop, and ground zero/WTC is just one stop downtown. -Located very near great SOHO shopping and restaurants.-Just a short metro ride to all the midtown attractions, and yet you don't have to deal with the mass of tourist crowds.-Clean hotel.-Starbucks in the lobby (not a "real" starbucks, but they can make a latte)-Friendly, helpful staff.-There is a 24-hour pizza/convenience shop right next door.-Very comfortable bed; we slept like zombies.Worst things about this hotel:-The lobby area is very narrow & cramped.-The taxi ride from midtown bus/train stations at rush hour will take forever (use subway if possible)-The surrounding area is old-school New-York-dirty. This is not 5th Avenue--expect interesting smells and trash blowing down the street.-Sadly, there was no pool or hot tub.

Stayed here for a weekend. Three subway stops within a block or two. Clean room. Decent size for New York. Staff were pleasant and efficient. Restaurant breakfast had a good selection. Enough to get you going for a NY weekend. If that does not satisfy you Cronuts are 3 blocks away. Note, I heard a lady complaining about the location. This hotel is not smack dab in the middle of Fifth avenue. But you can take a train to get there in 15 minutes. Oh and save quit a bit. Also if she had walked one block over she would have found the wonderful SoHo neighborhood. IMHO it is a gem away from the hustle of Midtown. Lots of unique shops/food in addition to the stalwart stores you might expect. Plan on coming back here(hotel and SoHo).

Loved the location, very clean and spacious room and bathroom, powerful shower, comfortable bed, great working desk, very helpful and effective staff, fast and reliable internet, excellent value for money. The only small minus were the elevators in the morning as well as breakfast (a bit expensive for what they offer). I would definitely return, especially in an upper floor room.

Booked a double room with two queen size beds for 2 adults and 2 children two months in advance of stay. At check-in was presented with tiny, tiny room with 1 double bed only. Receptionist insisted two roll in beds could fit into the room for children! Absolutely no way!!! Unless fitted cupboards and desk were removed, and NYC fire regulations changed, of course. Spent 3 hours arguing at reception desk. And witnessed at least 3 more families being subjected to similar down grades. Receptionist regretted that there had been lots of double bookings. A different member of staff told us that the Sheraton TriBeCa does this all the time. Bad bad style...... Do not accept a down grade. Ask to be moved to a different local hotel, fully compensated.

My ten year old niece and I had a fantastic stay here from April 12th - 16th, 2014. I got a great deal from Hotwire, but they still treated us very well. They gave us access to the club lounge and free Internet. The staff was super friendly and always went out of their way to help us out and make sure our stay was perfect. The lobby area was modern yet comfortable. There was a convenient pod of computers near the front desk and bar. We loved the club lounge. They had complimentary breakfast in the morning and snacks and beverages in the evening. There were absolutely beautiful views of the city from the rooftop lounge.I always love staying downtown in NYC, and the Sheraton Tribeca was no different. You can't beat the proximity to Chinatown, Little Italy, and the Village. You also have an easy walk to three different subway stations on Canal Street. I will definitely stay here again in the future...

This hotel is very well located near the subway lines. I'll probably miss some but it's near the A,C, E, R, N, Q, 6, and J lines. All are less than about a 5 minute walk from the hotel. There are lots of express trains to this location if you need to get to Union Square, Herald Square /34th St, Brooklyn, Times Square, etc.The hotel has a new modern feel.I've had a few questions reaching out to the general hotel email that I got quick responses from. The GM and on-duty managers both reached out to help accommodate my needs. They were extremely courteous in their responses. The front desk staff is equally awesome. They greet you when you come in and leave (even when it's 5:30 am and I'm on my way out the door).I'd recommend this hotel to anyone staying on business. The WiFi speed is good. If you have access to the lounge they have hor d'oeuvres in the evening and a great balcony. Near by there is lots of food including china town where you can experience some great food.The rooms, which it appears that I've somewhat skipped, are spacious by Manhattan standards. The room is organized efficiently to maximize space so you don't have to trip over things when you pack or unpack. You can even leave your suitcase on the floor and shouldn't have to worry about tripping over it if you don't feel like putting it away.Amenities including a free water bottle are nice. Water pressure is good even on high floors.

Spacious hotel rooms, by Manhattan standards, the hotel is within 2 minutes walking distance of the subway and the staff are very friendly among many positives. The only negatives are the price of the internet which is $10 per 24 hours and the fact that the street on which the hotel is located, Canal Street, is a very busy street which can lead to some noise at night. Other than the above, I would most definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Manhattan.

I will start by saying that if you are staying in NYC and plan on spending the majority downtown, this is a great location. Tons of bars and restaurants very close. If shopping on Canal Street is your thing, this place is perfect. Though, we did enjoy the location and the rooms are very clean; there were definately some hiccups!! My wife is a Platinum member of Starwoods and we knew this location wasn't a 5 star property, we still did expect 5 star hospitality. We checked in on a rainy Friday evening and were checked in by the night manager. Though, he was a very nice man; he barely acknowledged that we are Platinum SPG (I apologize if that comes across wrong; we are no better than anyone else but we are definately brand loyal and we that typically comes some benefits). He did not explain any of the hotel amneties, did not inform us of the Private Lounge and what the benefits of that lounge included. Again, we decided to stay at this property due to it's location and how it accomodated our needs for the weekend. After checking in and going to our room, which was nice and clean; we decided to go out for the evening. Again, only person on staffed was night manager, asked for directions and seemed as if he could care less to give us detailed directions. Instead, we had to brave the rain and navigate directions via smartphone directions. Also, seemed as if many times the staff during the days were working with skeleton crew; if/when concierge was on lunch/break there was nobody available for that particular hour to accomodate guests. I do want to give some kudos to the bellman and the doorman that were there on Monday night, they were the most professional people we encountered. Very helpful with bags and also secured private taxi for trip back to the airport.Again, I will conclude that this hotel is in a great location, clean and very good for a weeeknd getaway or business trip. My grievance with the property was at times the hospitality and service were lacking.

This hotel is in a perfect location. Away from the heart of Manhattan but very centric if you want to walk and explore. Is very close to China Town and Little Italy. Walking distance to the ferries docks and the World Trade Center area. The hotel staff is greate and very helpfull. The rooms are clean and neat. Breakfast is the best. I recomended to persons from all ages!

I've stayed in quite a few hotels in Manhattan and I really appreciated how helpful and courteous the staff were. Always calling me by my name. I ordered room service several times and while the menu was not expansive, it was really tasty. The rooms were nice and some have great views of the Empire State Building. The Club Level also has free breakfast which was nice.

I arrived last weekend and was promptly greeted by David the doorman. He was very welcoming and introduced us to Stephen who checked us in. He was really friendly and wanted to ensure we new all about the hotel as it was our first time here. Everyone we encountered from our maid, to the bartender really bent over backwards to ensure our stay was great. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Yes the room was small and the hotel is directly on noisy Canal street. These were all expected, and since I only stayed one night, I wasn't too focused on having grand accommodations. My biggest complaint was that I booked a room with 2 double beds for my family of 4. When we got there late Friday night, we were told that the only room left was a room with one queen size bed and a pull-out couch. They told me that the room listed on Expedia is not always the exact room available. Huh? The pull-out couch had a beat-up mattress with holes in it. My poor kids had to feel the metal bars and springs all night long. I don't know if there were bed bugs or not since I sprayed everything with my bedbug spray when I got to the room. I always do this in New York anyway. I found the staff friendly enough. They were very helpful getting us a cab in the rain, and when I came back to get my car and retrieve my checked bags.Pros:Appliances (good TV, lots of outlets, refridgerator, coffee pot)Clean, functional bathroom, enough towels toiletries, etc.Basically clean roomConvenient central location downtownValet ($50 for them to put the car somewhere where it can stay for 24 hours)A room safeCons:VERY small roomPull-out couch bed was disgustingCharge for internet

The staff here are unreal they just cannot do enough for you. I have stayed here several times now and have never been disappointed ! This a newer hotel (less than ten yrs old) The rooms are spotless , the lobby is cozy not to crazy and easy to relax at the bar. The assistant manager Steve Lamour went above and beyond He is always making sure your stay is ok ! Most importantly the beds are incredible....I may have to buy one for my own home !This is my hidden gem in downtown NYC

Reasonably priced (I booked a non-refundable room on Priceline), reasonably sized for a short stay in NYC. If your wanting to be close to Soho, Tribeca, Chinatown, Downtown this is a good spot. Rooms aren't big but if you're in NYC you shouldn't be spending most of your time in the room anyway. Clean and well kept. Quiet enough in my room on the 7th floor facing Canal St. The valet parking was handy.

Free Wifi & internet only in the lobby area. There is Starbucks outlet open in d morning upto noon only...haizz no chance of getting my hot Chocolate with whipped cream.Concierge service was good...left our luggage there for our Niagara Falls tour, we just carried our backpacks. Booked our Woodbury Common premium outlet tour with the concierge...nice guy changed our old $100 note at a nearby bank. it seems US have new notes n old notes are not well accepted in some shops.Love d comfortable bed n nice fluffy bath towels n toiletries. There is a coffee maker n Starbucks Coffee packs as well as tea bags. Daily complimentary bottled water but ...you have to pay $4 for the Spring Water.Checking in & out was a breeze...provided there is no queue infront of you.The location is convenient for tourist attractions coz subway nearby.

We stayed at the Sheraton for 2 nights and were very pleased. The room was a good size and we had a great view of midtown and the Empire State Building. It is located on Canal St in TriBeCa which is a very popular shopping street. We were within walking distance of Little Italy, Chinatown, SoHo and Greenwich village. The entire staff from the front desk, to the bell hops, to the maid staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel has a bar and a restaurant as well as a cafe for a quick coffee and pastry. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will recommend this hotel very highly.

The rooms are very small, even for New York City standards. We booked 2 rooms - 6 months in advance, so our rates were very convenient indeed for end of December period - however one of them was even smaller than what we had booked and received confirmation for. Elevators are slow, sometimes you have to wait up to 10 minutes to get in. Service at reception desk is not what someone would expect from Sheraton property. Not responsive to guests needs. I got feeling like they were robots - trying to be helpful however repeating all the time the same wordings and phrases and turning in circles. Location is very good, close to Soho restaurants and shops. If you come by car (we did once before) you should be aware that there is available only a valet parking in remote area and it can take 15 - 20 minutes to get your car. Plan in advance if you are in a hurry for show or performance.

This Hotel is located in the Tribeca area which is a very old, very dirty area. Heavy traffic and street noise keeps you awake at this Hotel. The rooms are extremely small, and ohhh! Yes, did I mention BED BUGS those come free with your stay. The parking is outrageous and the staff has a could care less attitude. It does not seem like the left hand knows what the right hand is doing. The food is not great at all and extremely expensive for what you get. You are better off getting a sandwich and a salad at the 24 little hole on the wall sandwich shop next door.The beds are very uncomfortable and fold at the edges, the housekeeping staff tries to clean stains on the sheets instead of changing them. what a delight of a place and all that at a price range of $280 to $350 per night in addition to $55 a night for parking, and by the way you can’t use your car while in the parking lot otherwise you will be charged an additional $55 charge. There are too many choices and this should not be at the top of your list at all. Are you Platinum member? have no fear it means nothing here!

We stayed at this particular Sheraton for the second time for a weekend get-away to NYC. We were attending an art exhibit at a gallery in SoHo. The initial draw for us was the inclusion of a full breakfast if you stay on the "club house" floor. For a nominal extra fee, you get access to a private lounge stocked with bottled water, juices, yogurt, coffee, as well as a hot/cold breakfast each morning and afternoon hot hors d'oeuvres. Most NYC hotels just offer a continental breakfast, if anything. The second time we stayed we were blown away by the staff- in particular the bellman, Eddie. Eddie was like our personal concierge from the moment we arrived with our cranky 3 1/2 year old son. He allowed my son to "help" him wheel the luggage to our room. We had brought food with us for dinner and Eddie made sure we had a microwave, fridge AND dinnerware to eat in our room. He personally helped my husband find a free parking spot ON THE STREET to avoid the hefty parking lot fee. He recommended excellent local restaurants. Anything we needed, he served with a smile- way above and beyond his duties.The hotel is clean, with luxurious beds and lovely rooms which are compact, but quite functional. One drawback is that wifi service in the room in extra, though it is available in the lobby. We will always choose this hotel when we need to stay in this part of the city.

Excellent facilities. Staff (nice diversity) are very helpful and friendly. Easy access to taxis (New York - duh!) and located close to the subway. Not very flexible on some rules.Meals were reasonable priced and good quality. Wine tasting adds a nice touch. VIP Lounge is very relaxing and an excellent addition to the stay. Should be even better in summer. Thumbs down for lack of inclusion of wifi, although internet service was available at lobby internet cafe. However printing was only via lobby agents, also a minus. The noise from ongoing renovations was irritating and staff could not even offer earplugs to assist in dampening the sound.

I stayed here on a business trip for 3 nights, picking it because it is within walking distance to work, a couple blocks to major subways, and SPG status. I did not book my own stay, but did get put on the SPG/20th floor upon confirming my status on arrival. The hotel looks and feels new, with really great corporate Sheraton decor. I really loved all the dark wood tones. It felt modern without trying too hard. But the lobby had only 2 reception desks (one with an SPG sign) right at the front entrance with little space to wait, and also blocking traffic in and out of the hotel. It could have been better placed. The rest of the lobby was a huge and very happening bar, plus a business area with computers and maybe printers?The room looked great, and had floor-to-ceiling windows that had a totally unobstructed view to the east. Not much to admire, but still nice in NYC nonetheless. I was disappointed at the size of the room, but impressed with the quality of furnishings. The room was so small, the only chair was a desk chair. And the closet was the TINIEST I have ever seen in my life. In fact, it was kind of useless, since it was already stuffed with a ironing board and luggage rack. Hangers barely fit in the doors. The room could have definitely accommodated a larger closet, so I'm confused why it was so small. The bed was super comfortable, and there were a choice of feather and alternative pillows, which is great, since I'm allergic, and so I did not need to ask for housekeeping. There was no street noise from the 20th floor, but you could hear people going in and out of adjacent rooms. Bathroom was probably my favorite part. Although small, it was totally functional, with enough vanity space for 1, and a large glass walk-in shower. Shower pressure was fantastic. However, there were some odd maintenance issues that took away from the experience. The key cards worked sometimes in some elevators but not others. It was like musical chairs seeing people get in and out, riding up and down without getting where they need to go. A minor inconvenience when this happens once, but troublesome when it's unpredictable and multiple times.Then on the last night, 2 of 3 bathroom lights did not work. These were all CFLs, and only 1 strip was working. I could not be bothered to call housekeeping for a fix, as there was minimally enough light, but 2 of 3 out at the same time seemed totally bizarre. Finally, the a/c unit was also kind of wonky. I don't know if it was the temperature I set (68), but some nights, the fan ran through the night. Other nights, it didn't. It was not disturbingly loud, but the air definitely hits the head of the bed pretty strong. I just could not figure out why auto fan was so inconsistent. Outside temps were about the same every day.I would probably stay here again if I had to, hopefully in another room, but I wouldn't go out of my way to request it. In conclusion, it was fine.

I used to live in NY and I've been to NYC since I left. I guess this hotel is ok hotel for me in NY. Location is convenient if you fly from Newark. Holland tunnel is near by. I send some packages to the hotel in advance of my arrival. I send several e-mail to ask about sending packages, but they never replied. Once I checked in the hotel, it took almost hour to find out packages and deliver to my room. I don't think I checked in busiest time. Nobody took the phone at front desk and customer service wasn't also helpful at all unless I called they repeatedly.If I pay what I paid to this hotel, I wish use another hotel in NY. There are more better hotel with the same price in NY.

Stay ten days at this hotel and although the price ($160/ night+ tax) , the service and the facilities: (free Wi-fi on lobby, bar and restaurant with decent menu and extended hours, Starbucks from 6:00 am to noon at lobby), are quit acceptable...the noise level day and night coming from Canal Street is overwhelming and unbearable... in summary.. unless you can secure an inside room or do not care about all night sirens, rubbish trucks beeping, etc... stay somewhere else.

Came for the Saints vs Jets game in November. We loved the young crowd that was all around the tribeca area. There's an awesome bar behind the hotel called M1-5. Ask for Lauren, shes an angel.
