I literally fell in love with her. That's rare. Hotel room was nice, but small. No rollaway beds, so 3 fairly large men had to share a king bed, but it was a bonding experience. We're a lot closer now. Lobby is really modern, with an internet center for free web use. Taxis were easy to hail and the staff was very friendly. They're not exactly Lauren at M1-5, but let's face it she's a gem. Takes about 10-15 minutes to get to Little Italy and there's a Subway station a block away. Great location, great fun, great Lauren.

Standard Sheraton, middle of the road hotel. Traffic is rough because of the Holland Tunnel nearby. I got a nice email asking for feedback on my first of 2 nights. I replied with a criticism on noise from the gym and I got no reply at all. No acknowledgement. So don't ask for feedback if you are not going to do anything with it. Kind of tells the story here. They are not trying too hard. Unless you're focused on SPG points there are better placed to stay in soho. Period.

I've stayed at quite a few hotels in Manhattan and I'd have to say this is one of the nicer ones when you compare the affordability rate. I usually stay at SPG properties and this hotel room was a fair size for NYC and it was pretty well up-to-date. The location was great and it's close to the subway so there is no problem getting around if you want to leave the SOHO area. I have to say the staff was very accommodating and friendly to us. I was traveling with co-workers during a snow storm and they provided us lots of tips and guidance for transportation methods, airport departures etc. The doorman was exceptional about standing in the street in the slush trying to convince a taxi to stop while we sat in the hotel lobby having a drink. Service wise this hotel exceeded expectations. I will return to this hotel for future trips.Side note: there is a 24 hour bagel shop right next door to the hotel. It's fantastic for food on the go!

The location is superb: a block from soho shopping and near the Holland Tunnel. The room was small, but who comes to nyc to hang out in a hotel room? Moreover, the king bed was incredibly comfortable and there were floor to ceiling windows with a fantastic view of the Empire State Building. I would absolutely stay here again!

I am a loyal SPG member and always stay at the Sheraton Tribeca whenever I am in Manhattan for work. The location is excellent (< 5 minute walk to my office in Tribeca and < 5 minute walk to SOHO). The hotel is very clean and modern. The rooms are a decent size for Manhattan standards. Depending on what room you're in, there can be some street noise, but this is Manhattan! You'd be hard pressed to find a hotel anywhere without street noise.The only potential drawback for some people is that it's right on Canal Street, which in my opinion, is one of the busiest/dirtiest streets in Manhattan (still a safe area though). If you can look past that though, the location is phenominal. Plenty of subways close by and as I said above, it's very close to all the shops in SOHO and everything in Tribeca, which are 2 of the best Manhattan neighborhoods. Staff are wonderful as well!

We chose this place because of its downtown location and because NY hotel rates were low, undoubtedly due to the recent bad weather. We were offered the choice of a street view or quieter back room. We chose the latter and all was fine until the noise started . . . at 4am on a Sunday morning. It sounded like a horde of tourists coming back after a night on the town and they apparently occupied rooms somewhere around us. Someone twice knocked on the ceiling below and I could feel it through the very thick bed. As I write this, I feel like I'm trying to sleep in the middle of a cocktail lounge. Yes, the current nightly rate was very low, but as they say, you get what you pay for.

Stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca in December 2013 for 3 nights while I was in town for business. The overall experience was fine - check-in before 3PM was a breeze and the king room was small but in all honesty, was slightly larger than most other NYC hotels. The room was clean and tidy, and the bed was comfortable.The only two gripes that I had were 1) When I opened my window, I was staring straight into the bedrooms of those who lived in the apartment building next door. Window to window, less than 100 feet would be my guess. --- Yes, I know it's NYC and things are practically on top of each other but the fact that one of the guys next door looked up and waved at me really made me feel uncomfortable. I kept my curtains closed for the duration of my stay. 2) The double doors to the bathroom (small but clean with a sizeable shower) were a pain in the butt - it wasn't very easy to open (got stuck) and I got tired of struggling so I just left one door open and slid in/out of that half.One of the positives that impressed me was the attention of the doormen. I was making my way to the front desk to check out and one of doormen greeted me "Good morning, checking out? Do you need us to hold your luggage?". - I was stilll 20 feet from the front desk and yes I would like my luggage held - efficient, pleasant and very much appreciated.

Not a marquis location. But walking distance from SOHO Shopping, Tribeca Restaurants, Little Italy, Chinatown….even Greenwich Village and West Village.Rooms are nice enough and have everything you need. (But maybe not heavenly)One maid per floor (19 rooms) means that room was serviced all through the day. I felt sorry for he heavily worked maid and timed generously. I chose to go outside the hotel for food, coffee, bar. But full service food deli right next door. and restaurants and bars all around in every direction. I wold stay here again if i were paying.

Did not go to the game. Attended the Direct TV party at Pier 40. The hotel was convenient to that location. Room was clean and nicely appointed. Great view from the 20 the floor. Greeted when we first arrived by a doorman named Eddie who made our stay more than enjoyable. Anything we need Eddie was ready to do what ever he could to provide it. The staff was accommodating and very knowledgeable.

Had really poor service at this Sheraton, almost entirely from start to finish. Doormen who were too busy chatting to hold the door for me with luggage (or for a woman with a crying baby in her hand in the morning, which left me to hold the door open for her). Club lounge attendant who was busy on her phone instead of stocking the food during evening meal hours. I called down for a sowing kit during my stay and it never arrived. Housekeeping ignored the do not disturb sign on my door and knocked in the morning, waking me up in the process. Had a phone call down to the desk to check in on my checkout time put on hold for two minutes and hung up on, my return request unanswered, and my third phone call picked up by somebody who very clearly didn't speak much English. One service issue is no big deal. Even two, I ignore. But I counted a half-dozen problems in a 48-hour stay, which seems unacceptable.The hotel itself is OK. I was upgraded to a junior suite, which isn't a room type listed on their website, but it was big enough to overcome some of my reservations about the size of the rooms at the hotel. Bed was comfortable enough. Bathroom was small, but not as small as other NY bathrooms. Hotel has nothing around it for a couple of blocks and is in a bleak part of downtown Manhattan, but outside of that range, you'll find a few restaurants and get to more exciting parts of the city. There is a 24-hour bodega next to the hotel that I did use a bunch, but outside of that, the front of the hotel faces what appears to be a row of derelict factories, which is strange for downtown NYC.Given the plethora of Starwood properties in NYC, I wouldn't stay here again.

Thanks for the good service at the Sheraton Tribeca. Got there late at night and check-in was easy (Monique I think?) Smaller hotel in Tribeca near the subway, and an easy walk up Canal toward places like Chinatown and Little Italy. I know there is a guaranteed late checkout for platinum guests but my special request for a 6pm checkout was not a problem. I don't like to take advantage but that was really nice of them to accomodate this time. Nice SPG lounge with buffet breakfast. Overall pleasantly surprised with comfy bed and great AC, nice views and natural light. My room was 1809 - right in front of the elevator!!! Slept right through the night without a problem though so I don't know how that happened. Someone was smoking when I got to the floor on check in. Called front desk and they kybashed that right away. Thanks for that. Very clean too. I think the cleaning staff deserves the credit here. Thanks.

I've stayed at this hotel several times. It's pretty basic but close to my office so convenient. This trip though I was extremely impressed with the concierge, extremely efficient and good. The slight draw back with this hotel us there tendency to overbook the club floor 3 times I've arrived and despite paying extra the club floor has been overbooked and I've ended up on a different floor by the lift. Annoying.

We just returned from a long weekend in NYC. We stayed here as there was a hotel.com deal for $127.00 a night for a king size bedroom. My husband stayed here for business and said it was nice - not the grand tribeca - but for $127 it was outstanding! What a great room for that price. It was tight quarters: trying to get around the bed was tight and there was no closet (just a small armoire). The bathroom was a full shower and was a very good size. The bed was comfy, the sheets were soft, Real cotton duvet. Showtime included on the TV. We had a nice selection of restaurants and we walked to the village and time square via the High Line park several times. It was a short metro ride from Penn and Port authority (direct on the ACE line get off at Canal). We could have easily walked to lower manhatten. Last stay was in Times Sq with the kids which is a totally different experience so I was glad to stay in a different location in NYC and have a new experience. Would return.

We pricelined a room here and had a great experience. The room was a normal, small size for NYC but was clean, comfortable, and safe. The bed was wonderful after a long day of NYC walking. We used the front desk and concierge staff several times. Each time they recommended absolutely outstanding places. Would definitely recommend!

Room very small and needed painting (walls very scuffed everywhere) new carpet (carpet worn and stained) and repairs (towel rack kept falling off wall, shade would not go straight up or down, no replacement of towels). Service was extremely slow, front desk staff not very knowledgeable, and billing inaccuracies. Plus elevators very small and very slow. Bed was very comfortable!

the hotel location was fantastic since you have easy access to so many train lines. it's also easy walking distance to chinatown, tribeca, and the world trade center sites. the hotel is still on the new side and it was clean. we got a fantastic deal on booking.com which is why we stayed here and we enjoyed our stay. the room is a good size for a manhattan hotel. one negative is that the curtain did not completely block out all the light in the morning.

Terrific value and really nice clean hotel with great views, service, and spacious (for New York) rooms. The club room suffered from some major understocking of breakfast items. Seriously, people were mad as they ran out of everything from food to silverware to chairs. And the attendant said it was normal when asked.Nevertheless, I'm not one who needs to be spoiled by a club room and the hotel was otherwise a home run. I loved paying about 60% of a midtown room and getting more space and still being very well located. On Canal Street near four different subway lines. Awesome. $10 for Internet. $65 for SUV parking, no in/out. Recommended, particularly if the location suits you.

I've stayed here several times and I've even written a flattering Trip Advisor review. I never could understand the bad reviews I saw on the site until now. My last stay here was bad from beginning to end and even after I left. I'm only hitting the lowest points so I don't have to write an entire bookFirst the room. I had an 'accessible' room and I have no idea how anyone confined to a wheelchair could ever navigate that room. It was undersized and arranged terribly. The only way I could use the "closet" area was to sit on the bed and then I had to close the door so I could get around it. The bathroom was equally small with zero counter space.The day after I checked in, I got an email from one of the managers asking how I like my room. I replied that it was barely usable and that my desire to ever stay again was minimal. More than a day later he replied that he was sorry but they were totally booked (they weren't) and that maybe they could help on my next stay.After I checked out, the valet offered to get me 'one of our cars' as opposed to a taxi for only a few dollars more. What they forgot to mention that it's even more expensive if you care to use a card. I found that out at the airport when it cam time to pay If the bait and switch wasn't enough, then the driver ended up writing himself an additional $10 tip after he dropped me off. I called to let the hotel know "their" driver ripped me off but all I got was voice mail and I never got a return call to acknowledge it.Then there was the billing. The original credit card charge came through for only 1 night. When I called to question it, the billing people were gone for the week (at 4:00 on Friday) and when I asked to speak to a manager or someone else, I was told that they were "busy with customers and probably didn't have time to talk to me." So, adding it all up - lousy room, lousy service, zero concern for customers. It all adds up to me never, ever staying here again. Luckily, my company usually offers more than one hotel option so I can choose something else and as a bonus I can always explain my choice by telling this story over and over.

Pros - Friendly professional staff, great location on Canal street, good eating close by, comfy bed, Wifi in lobbyCons - traffic on Canal can be crazy for getting around by TaxiWe stayed here last week when we were stranded in NYC because of the ice storm in Toronto. We booked the day we checked in and stayed for two nights. The hotel felt very safe and the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. We enjoyed some delicious Italian food nearby and did some shopping on Canal. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to New York.

I booked this hotel for 5 nights around New Years eve simply because it was the cheapest available that didn't have too many negative reviews. I wasn't expecting it to be as good as it was though. The hotel is on Canal street, just outside China town, right on the Soho edge of Tribeca, a short wall from a lot of different metro stops which means that you have easy access to all of New York. There are loads of nice restaurants and good shops less than a 5 minute walk away. So really, location is amazing even though we were not expecting this. The room was fine. Nothing amazing but clean and functional. If you chose to not get housekeeping in every day, they give you a 5USD voucher per night that you can spend in the Starbucks downstairs. Just make sure you have the card in your door before 2am ! We thought that was actually a good incentive to encourage people to be more environmentally friendly. We were street side so it was a little noisy but not too bad. The gym is pretty good : you have everything you need to keep in shape. Wifi is free in the lobby which is, I'm afraid, pretty standard for NYC but works pretty well. The staff was friendly and organized a car to take us to the airport which worked perfectly. So overall, we had a very good stay at the Sheraton Tribeca. That said, you don't spend that much time in your hotel room when you're visiting New York, so all you really ask for is a clean place, with a functional bathroom and a comfortable bad to come back to after a long day of sightseeing and shopping.

I'm not even sure yet how to rate the hotel. So many mixed feelings. When we arrived we were greeted quickly, and even given an upgraded room! I was thrilled. The front desk people were really great! The room was larger than your typical NYC room, and was quite clean. The bed was SO comfy, and the view was wonderful. Then there's the breakfast. For $16 we got barely any options (buffet style) and what my husband referred to a "typical [name a cheap chain I won't name] breakfast". So much wasn't available in the buffet, and what WAS available really was sub-par. We were trapped, though, as it was Christmas day and everything close by was closed. Housekeeping was bizarre. One day our room wasn't cleaned at all so I had to call for our next morning's coffee. One day we were given a lot of cups and another time only two. Sometimes tea was left, sometimes not. We ran out of toilet paper. We just didn't know what to expect when we returned to our room each evening! I kept tipping, hoping that would encourage them to be a little more attentive, but to little avail.I will continue to complain about the more expensive hotels charging more for internet use than the cheaper ones. I'm hopeful that some year they'll decide to nix that ridiculous fee!Still, I was happy with the room so I might return. I would probably just be sure to mention that we had issues the last time and hope they then made sure we'd have no problems. The price was worth the bizarre things that happened, and everyone working there was extremely friendly.

Nicely appointed but SMALL room..... King room had a comfortable bed, an upholstered chair, and a built in desk. Very small closet area for clothes. The room was tight, Staff was helpful especially getting cabs / helping with dinner suggestions.Not a very good section of town - edge of Tribeca / Chinatown / Little Italy. Expect several homeless outside the door as soon as you walk out and a ton of purse / watch vendors! Very sketchy location after dark.

We stayed here 2 nights in between Christmas and New Year's and were overall pleased. The hotel staff are very friendly. The rooms are fine and the bed was comfortable. Getting an elevator was a challenge. During busy morning hours we had to wait 15 minutes to get one because they were too full. This hotel is on Canal Street and as a result many of the rooms are very noisy. We could hear sirens and beeping horns constantly. They did subside somewhat in the middle of the night. When you walk out the front door you can be expected to be approached by many street vendors attempting to sell you counterfeit goods. If that sort of thing bothers you do not stay here. However, it is an easy and short walk to SOHO, Tribeca, Chinatown and Little Italy and there are several subway lines within a short distance making it a good overall location for downtown. This was booked for a very low price bid through Priceline making it a bargain. If we paid the full rate my review would not be as favorable.

We just returned from Christmas in NYC where we made Sheraton TriBeCa home and found the accommodation and service excellent. When our travel was delayed a phone call with Lee at the front desk gave reassurance our rooms would be available. When we finally arrived a full day late, Lee was on hand at the desk welcoming us warmly and our rooms were ready. We had multiple questions and requests for help through our stay. All service staff were accommodating and helpful. I highly recommend and will stay again without hesitation.

the best thing about this hotel is the location, we opted for a suite upgrade and was given a 'studio suite', sounds a lot better than it actually is! very tired decor, bathroom drab and in desperate need of an up-grade, furniture was shabby and chipped in places. The club lounge was clean and provided soft drinks and snacks in the evening, don't make the same mistake as we did and buy alcohol as you are charged a 'service' fee even though we collected it ourselves. The staff are friendly and the male staff on the front desk are cheerful and efficient. would look for a better hotel next time but the same location.

From the convenient location to the useful amenities my stay at this property was better than I expected. My visit was during the busy holiday season, so prices were a bit on the high side, but it was still more affordable than options closer to the Village where I'd planned to spend most of my time visiting friends. The staff were always courteous and professional. My room was well furnished with contemporary pieces and although modest in size, very comfortable. Several great restaurants and shopping establishments were within easy walking distance. I'd certainly stay here again.

This is my second time staying at this hotel & I love it. It is close to the office & shopping. The lounge & cocktail area are comfortable. The front desk staff are friendly and helpful. I just wish the Starbucks was open 24-7. This time we ate at the restaurant for breakfast & it was good and the service was good as well.

This was my second stay at the Sheraton Tribeca this year. My previous one was a disappointment, and sadly, despite hoping my last visit was a fluke, this one wasn't much better.First, I'd have to say this place if definitely overpriced. Sure, its Manhattan, but the return on investment just isn't there. With middling quality, service and amenities all around, its hard to justify the luxury price tag. Front desk/office staff really disappointed me. I needed to charge my stay to a new company card, which I didn't have in my possession yet, so I faxed in a credit card authorization form with the explicit request they contact me and let me know it was received and everything was in order. Having not had to do this before, I simply wanted assurance my trip fine and I wouldn't show up at midnight on a Thursday and find out there were issues with my booking/billing. It took the initial fax request, 3 emails, and 2 phone calls (over the course of several days) to finally get someone to reply and let me know that everything was in order.On checkin, the clerk was polite and efficient, but failed to notice my SPG status, and it took specifically asking for the check-in amenity (all I wanted was the points...) to get it.Room itself is very small, though generally well appointed. The bathroom is modern and, arguably, the highlight of the room. Also worth noting that the Sheraton beds are freaking awesome, and I slept like a baby tucked into it.There's a 32" HDTV mounted to the wall but, oddly, its at the far left side of the room, and doesn't have a tilt/swivel. So, the only place in the room where you have a direct view of the TV is if you're standing next to the window. From the desk, you have a near impossible angle, and from the bed its certainly watchable, but is still at an odd angle and less than ideal.In short, an all around average hotel that charges far beyond average prices... next time I'll definitely be looking for alternatives in the area.

Our room was of good size (at least for NY), clean, the staff helpfull. We had trouble conecting to the free wifi in the lobby so they offered us complimentary wifi in our room. Much appretiated! Only downside was the chaffeur service arranged for us to get to the airport. It took a good ten minutes from we got in the car until we went because the deiver was discussing something with an other driver! And on the way he spent the majority of the ride arguing loudly with someone on the phone... Later we saw that we could have taken the subway to jfk for under 20$ instead of the 65$ we paid the driver... But thats un us.

Okay. Front desk staff does try. Booked for four nights but had enough after two and checked out. Besides getting a room that went from being freezing cold to boiling hot with no relationship to the thermostat the room had no closet and was tired and cheap looking. It was full of oddly mismatched furniture that was more Salvation Army than Starwood. I sent laundry out which was not delivered to my room till I called for it at 10 pm and housekeeping was just plain lazy. The elevators take forever and they too are old and slow. While there we had a an all day conference and I can tell you that in a lifetime of bad conference meals this was by far the most odious. Turkey sandwiches with processed meat and a lobster bisque that tasted like corn starch soup horrible. I do want to say the front desk staff was friendly and efficient,,perhaps they should take jobs at nearby hotels There is a lot of new hotels springing up in the area..I can't see this one surviving in its current state much longer

This was a surprisingly great stay. Very accommodating to both business and personal travelers. Tough area to find a good hotel, but this is an exception to that rule. The added benefit is being in a great location for food...Chinese food!

Stayed at this hotel Friday evening December 6th. It is a little hard to find walking down the street. I was told by the front desk staff that signage on Canal street is strictly regulated by NYC. The room on the 10th floor was clean and quiet. Nice king size bed with comfortable pillows, mattress and comforter. The room is a decent size for a NYC hotel room. Same for the bathroom. No tub just a very big shower. Good black out drapes kept the room dark until it was time to get up.WiFi was a bit pricey -- over $20 per day. We did not use it.Good choice for this part of NYC.

This is a disgrace to the Sheraton brand. We stayed 2 nights and our room was never cleaned even though I made several requests via phone and in person. Closet is very awkward to store clothes and there were no drawers in the room. Bathroom was modern and spacious, but no shower cap or Q-tips. No in-room movies or checkout! Guest bathroom on the 2nd floor was dirty, toilet paper on the floor, trash bins overflowing, no paper towels. Very poorly managed hotel.

Lower older ground floor rooms expensive, drab, old. Club lounge good. Charge you for beer. Maybe higher rooms better. I'm Platimum but made no difference. Poor and won't be back. To charge over $400 for such a dismal room dilutes a lot of loyalty.

This is a full-service hotel. Rooms were clean and modern. No in room movies, some movie channels available. Room service was good quality food, presentation, timing, accuracy all fine. A nice perk is the free internet access and printing in the lobby. Building is close to Chinatown, which is more of a neighborhood you want to visit rather than stay. Subway access 4/5 blocks away along Canal St where there's nonstop bootleg everything mixed in with seafood vendors. Nothing in the immediate area worth seeing or doing after dark. All the action is going to be further uptown. Staff were especially efficient (Speedy Check-in, Room Service, Bell, etc) and pleasant.

Muy buen lugar justo donde empieza SOHO, limpio, bonito, muy amable los empelados, me parecio una muy buena opcion.Its a really good option to think next time you go to NY, small hotel, clean, friendly staff, bussines floor, and its ina great location, just where soho starts, nezt to hudson river so a morning walk o if you are a runner is a great option to go all the way up to central park.

Stayed here 2 nights just before thanksgiving. It's a Sheraton,so you know what to expect. What sets it apart is the staff. Never seen such friendly staff anywhere- and I've travelled a LOT ! Super helpful,and well run. I see a previous reviewer siad it was dirty? Couldn't disagree more. The area is not great however, that's not the hotels fault-it's just Tribeca! Want to but a "Lolex" watch? You're laughing, oh and fake handbags abound too..

thank you Sheraton Tribeca! i had originally booked to stay with them for 4 nights as i was in town running errands, but things got out of hand and i had to extend to stay 2 more nights. the sheraton team was really understanding and made the extension quick and easy, no room switching or issues. the concierge team was very helpful and friendly, always offering help with a smile. on my last day i had booked a van through the hotel to drive us elsewhere, and accidentally left my purse on the van. after frantic calls and rushing back to the hotel, i was welcomed again by the friendly and reliable concierge staff that reassured me right away that the bag was returned to the hotel and that they've kept it for me. i can't explain how thankful i was that the hotel and even its van service was sooo helpful!!! apart from the staff, the location was also great. i had to run around the soho, tribeca and FiDi districts, all of which were of walking distance. the hotel has free wifi in the lobby, plus computers for guests to use free of charge. it was also very helpful that they had printers as well. another plus was the starbucks in the lobby - the best breakfast option for us as we were in a hurry every morning! all in all we couldn't be more pleased with our stay. the only small complaint we had was the thermostat in our room wasn't working and the room was really warm all throughout our stay. we ended up having to keep the window open for air. but even still, sheraton tribeca was definitely our safe haven home-away-from-home during the stressed out week we had in new york. will be staying with them again the next time i'm in town :)

Room was very clean and offered a nice city view from the 14th floor. big flatscreen TV and more space then I usually get in hotels when in NYC. Right around the corner from subway access was a major plus. Cafe with snacks/Starbucks coffee right in the lobby which is convenient. Only negative was when we looked for the lotion in the bathroom which I come to expect from Sheratons it was not there.Overall highly recommended.

I found a last minute room here during a very busy Columbus day /Canadian Thanksgiving weekend. We stayed for 3 nights and was super impressed.The room was very small but extremely comfortable with everything we needed. A bit corporate but clean and somewhat stylish.We enjoyed the coffee bar in the lobby in the morning and the lounge after long days out. Great atmosphere and drinks. Always entertaining too...A great, comfy stay in NYC.

First time ever in New York. This property is 3.2 miles from Times Sqaure. The staff there are very helpful, and polite. Being car-less., the staff explained the subways.No problem getting around at all. Rooms clean but small, but your in New York, I wouldn't think your going to spend alot of time in your room. We sure didn't. I would recommend this property., it is also little less per night than if your were to stay in Times Square. Great customer experience. I'm hooked I gotta go back to the big apple. I gave the room only 4 dots only because of size.

I stayed at this Hotel twice in two weeks. This is the best Sheraton in the Chain. A lot of the rooms have a really cool view of new York. The rooms are spotless as are the corridors. Fast evelvators but what makes this hotel special is the employee's They make you feel at home. which is so rare at a chain hotel I would rank this as my favorite hotel.

Great location, clean, modern, staff is polite. Loved it there. The room was kinda small, but hey who cares? if you re in NYC you re there to explore the city !Definitely will stay again if I have a chance.

I was a little skeptical at first about staying in this hotel because it is right on Canal Street, which is so busy. There are so many hotels in cute neighborhoods that I thought I would not like the hotel, but I was wrong. The hotel is centrally located and really nice inside. The lounge area is very comfortable. We did not eat at the hotel, but the restaurant looked very busy. The hotel staff were extremely accommodating - Eddie and Dave to name a few. If you want a great location near Soho and Tribeca, this is a great hotel and it is reasonably priced.

Stayed here for a girl's weekend in NYC with my college-aged daughter. Great location and value with Hotwire.com Near three subway stations within minutes ride to Midtown, Times Square, and upper areas. Few minutes walk to Tribeca amenities, Little Italy, China Town, SOHO, & a short taxi (or subway) to the Villages. The Hotel is located right on Canal St. and very safe - good, discrete security. If you are from the Midwest, on your first visit to the city, Canal St. may freak you out - breathe through it slowly - everything will be okay, most likely. :)Upside: Consistency of a chain - Sheraton but still Tribeca feel, nicely decorated lobby & lobby bar, good restaurant for breakfast, and good Starbucks - no crowds or traffic flow issues in common areas. Check-in was quick and courteous, room was "Euro" in size but new, clean, comfortable, quiet, nicely furnished, well maintained, with a walk-in closet, good amenities, good bathroom, and a reasonable floor level and view. Good elevators (3) even during peak time. Staff greeted us when we enter and bid us good bay when we exited each time. Housekeeper was pleasant, helpful, and discrete. Food service staff were very good.Downside: One elevator had a key card/security issue. Possibly related to third party booking with advance purchase - the hotel required check-in each day of our stay because due to added nights - they were not capable of linking the reservations to avoid the inconvenience. On checkout, we discovered the hotel had triple charged the CC for the deposit - on arrival, on the second day, and on the day of checkout. The desk clerk was unable to find the charges on our folio, unable resolve it, and then loudly announced two separate times that we should take it up with Priceline - an excellent suggestion had we booked through Priceline and if Priceline had charged the three deposits but, alas, they had not. The antics were unprofessional. We patiently and courteously explained each time that we'd booked and paid in advance through Hotwire.com and showed the account charges for each of the three days made by Sheraton, but to no avail. A few days after returning home the charges were reversed, but the handling and the mistake were unnecessary and unacceptable.

I write this on my phone as I sit at their Link, which is complete with computers that lock-up when attempting to search google and that are covered in dust and stray hair. I am confused by the recent reviews that say it's a new hotel, it doesn't seem new to me. As I write, I see more and more hair, which reminds me of my bathroom, they actually have a stainless tray covering the drain, needless to say I regret trying to reattach it. Everywhere I look everything here is dirty and worn. The windows open in the room, but only a few inches, which alas weren't enough to cool my room as the ac wasn't working, I assume due to a 2 pipe HVAC system? The Starbucks server wasn't overly friendly, and despite milk in the cooler directly behind him, he refused to put milk in my coffee, instead instructed me to the self-service station on the left. I admit the rest of the employees have been friendly quick and helpful, the location extremely convenient, and the cable channels extensive, but that's not enough to make up for the dirty, well beaten accommodations.

This is a new property in an unambiguously urban setting. Canal street is busy and crappy (don't really know how to describe the industry here -- lot of fake purses, light bulb stores), but it's just uptown of TriBeCa, and just downtown of the West Village, so there is plenty of great stuff really close by.You're just a few blocks away from the west side highway, where there is a great bike path for running, or, gasp, biking.The hotel itself features smaller rooms which are super quiet with great beds -- really the best you could hope for in New York. There is a bar and a restaurant and a hidden starbucks in the lobby -- I'd normally recommend against the hotel bar in New York, but it would be a few blocks until you found something nice, and the bar always seemed full.Staff was mixed -- all super nice, some felt a little newer to their careers. All in all, I'd stay again and recommend to friends; the only downside is the location, but as it's close to a lot of cooler places, that's not much of a detriment.

Right on Canal Street, the Sheraton Tribeca is a clean, safe choice for NYC downtown. All of the standard Sheraton services to be expected. Very clean rooms with an attentive staff. Nice bar area in the lobby as well as a snack bar and decent restaurant. The only downside is that the traffic on Canal street can make hailing a cab pretty tough. The doormen are very helpful in any case and will run down the street to try and get you one.Rooms with an up town view are very nice with the Empire State building front and center. This hotel is highly recommended and you will be pleased with your stay for the value.Enjoy.

We visited the Sheraton Hotel last week on our first trip to New York .Our room was very good and the staff made our stay memorable.Dawn,Mo,Brandon,and Cory could have not been more helpful in every way .this is a well run establishment thankyou.

OK, this is a quite nice Hotel, not too much amenities but great location. If your looking for Gym, Restaurant and stuff you won't find it here but if your looking for comfort and the most strategy location in the big Apple this is your choice!!!We where there with friends, last march and it results in the best possible choice we could ever make. Subway station right in the corner ready for going downtown or uptown or if you prefer walking distance from soho, Chinese Town or Little Italy (every day is gettin littler) Great price but 4 people's rooms it's kind of tight, all in all great choice for walking around in Manhattan.

this is a newer property and it is stylish without being off-putting. if you want to be downtown this is a great value. although we booked this room on points the nightly room rate was not obscene! the room was small but clean and comfortable. had a great view of canal st and all of it's loud glory. convenient to subway and in a great area to walk around for hours. enjoy!

Very considerate, accommodating and also dog friendly. It is such a great experience to have that warmth in New York City.Room was spacious, beautiful view from the concierge terrace, and sumptuous breakfast. I will be visiting NY often and will definitely choose this hotel again.

It's a great location downtown. The rooms are very comforable - loved the bed and linens, fairly spacious for NYC, easy access to where you need to go. It's a very charming neighborhood. The staff is warm, friendly and helpful. I enjoyed the quiet my room afforded. I liked the security in this hotel. The main reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 was that it's difficult to stop in front of the hotel to take advantage of the valet. I'm not even sure they actually have valet. It took me a while to find a nearby garage and as charming as the neighborhood is, it's not the same grid pattern as most of Manhattan so it's a lot easier to get turned around. But I loved my stay and would stay here again.

Very nice down town location. Nice Roomy clean rooms. The Lounge on the 21 floor is great indoor and out door seating w/ TV ,Snacks, computer, it was a great place to gather and hang out . Some of the lower floor rooms have no good views, the Security was a bit much to get use to you must keep your room pass on you to go any where in this hotel, This hotel is close to every thing NY, Eat in C'town, Shop in Soho, sight see Tribeca and Battery park, Freedom tower, visit the American Indian Museum. and the subway to all over nyc.

My mom and I just stayed at Sheraton Tribeca this weekend and had a wonderful stay. This was my second time staying at this hotel. The staff is over the top with helpfulnes. Everyone from Cory to Eddie the door man. They couldn't do enough for us as far as haling cabs to recommending great bars (Ink48) and restaurants. The hotel is very clean, comfortable and great location. Would definltly stay here again. New Yorkers are awesome!!

We got one of those Hotwire Hot Rates where we didn't know which hotel we were paying for until we booked it, so really, it's a gamble, but man were we happy with this one! We were there for my boyfriend's birthday, and the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, helping us book reservations at restaurants and guiding us around the area. Shoutouts to the bellhop Fany (sorry if I butchered the spelling) and front desk guru Steve Lamour for being genuinely awesome.Our room was north facing on the 19th floor, so we had a phenomenal view. It was mostly taken up by the king sized bed (super comfy), but there was a little seating area and a desk. The best best best part was that we had access to the club floor, which means free breakfast and a free hors d'oeuvres thing from 5 - 8 pm, both of which were pretty awesome. The lounge led to a patio that was super nice, and we ordered a bottle of wine from room service (only 30 bucks, which is great for room service prices) and sat up there and enjoyed the massive city in front of us. The hotel is close to many subway lines (1,2,3 and A,C,E are less than a block away), and lots of good late night pizza shops, and walking distance to the New Museum and Soho shopping on Broadway. Sitting in the Tribeca park around the corner we saw Liev Schreiber and Naomi Watts with their kids. Also, Nancy's Whisky pub was just around the corner, and was a great little hole in the wall.My only quibble is that Wi-Fi is 9.99 per day in the rooms, although it's free in the lobby, so we didn't really mind, as we at least had the option of hanging out in the lobby to download maps and such before heading out. We could hear street noise up on the 19th floor at night, so I can only imagine what it's like on the 5th floor or so. Request a room up top, get the club floor, it's so worth it!

My wife and I spent a long weekend in NYC and stayed at this property. It is in a great location with easy access to all subway lines, walking distance to Little Italy, Chinatown, Tribeca and the Village. There are plenty of awesome restaurant options all around the area.The hotel is very nice with a great staff. They are always greeting you and making sure they are taking care of any need you have.The rooms are very nice. We stayed on the 22nd floor, so there was no worry for street noise or anything of that sort. Good size rooms as well for most hotels in NYC.I would say the elevators can take a little bit, but I have yet to stay in a hotel in NYC where that is not of some concern. Given the volume of visitors to NYC at any time of the year, I would believe this is always going to be off minor concern.We thoroughly enjoyed staying at this property and out of the hussle and bussle of midtown or Times Square. The streets are alot less crowded(unless you get further down Canal in the shopping) and the amount of traffic noise is less.I would recommend this property as a great value and a great location with easy access to anywhere in the city you want to venture.

I spent two nights at the Sheraton Tribeca. I would definitely stay there again. Because it's Tribeca, it's a little bit away from much of the Manhattan action, but the subway entrance is only steps away from the main entrance -- and cabs are easy to find. The room was comfortable, and for New York, not as miniscule as I would have expected. Staff was extremely warm and professional. Overall, I was very pleased. The room was clean and very comfortable and when I called to get extra bath towels, they arrived in about 5 minutes. (I am amazed, at other hotels of equal or higher quality, how interminably long such a request can take.) Bed was delicious. Minor issues are that the three elevators are tiny and slow. Be prepared to stand shoulder-to-shoulder with other guests any time you step in the elevator, but it tends to be a friendly crowd. More than once I discovered folks in conversation with others, only to separate when the elevator door opened -- indicating that they didn't know each other upon entrance.My only complaint is the restaurant. Skip it for breakfast, please. It was utterly chaotic; took way to long to get seated; the buffet is $16 but so are the handful of entrees on the menu, and honestly the breakfast buffet was equivalent to what you'd find at a Holiday Inn Express. In particular: the serving utensils didn't have an appropriate place to sit; the hot entrees are left to stand in unheated (albeit covered) casserole dishes so they are likely lukewarm by the time you get them -- and they are not replaced often enough so we were scavenging the bottom of the scrambled eggs and sausage plates even though it was 9am on a Saturday. Bagels appear Costco-bought, and the wait staff seems far more interested in stealing your plate the moment you sit down, and not at all interested in refilling your coffee. (When I went up to grab the newly warm eggs that had just been brought out, I returned to find our table cleared and my still-unread newspaper taken away. I had to go in search of the waiter to get my paper returned.)So other than breakfast, it's a great hotel, made all the better due to a very professional and helpful staff (breakfast staff not included in this compliment, sorry).

Staff is fantastic - proactive, helpful, friendly and efficient. Bar none the fastest, friendliest and most efficient check in I have ever had at a hotel (which is important after you've had a nightmare flight!) Very clean and comfortable room, and large for the price (for a Manhattan hotel.) Staff are terrific - friendly, fast, offer really good advice. and accept a tip without making you feel like it's owed to them, if you know what I mean. Location is great, easy walks to anything south of Chelsea, and within easy walk of three subway lines. It's on Canal Street, but shockingly quiet rooms - I slept great without earplugs. Preferred Guest lounge is really good - excellent breakfast and great light supper snacks, perfect before heading out to theatre. Also has a terrific outdoor terrace with a great view of the city north. All in all a great alternative to mid town.

I was very pleased with my recent stay here. Close to great shopping and dining in SoHo, walk to downtown, and a short cab ride to Bryant Park and Times Square. Had a great lobby bar with a nice selection of wine by the glass, and the staff was super nice and very accommodating! Our room was a double on the club floor, and I must say I was very happy with the accommodation! Spacious enough by NY standards, but the bed was VERY comfortable with lush bedding. Our room was VERY quiet with the exception of doors slamming shut, but we were out late and up early so it wasn't to bad for us. The club room breakfast had a very nice selection each morning of fruit, cereal, yogurt, bacon and eggs, toast and bagels.....I would absolutely stay here again and recommend this hotel!

From start to finish I cannot say enough good things about this hotel and more importantly it's staff. From the minute I pulled up to have the car valet parked, till the moment I checked out I felt like family.Room was a nice corner room, king bed, had a fridge sent up. Facing the Empire State Building. Room condition was clean, modern and just perfect except for the slow draining sink. Not a deal killer....Gym was tiny but managed to get in a few workouts, would like to see this improved for future stays.Lounge was more than perfect, the staff here were all just about the best I have ever come across. Just fell in love with them all and look forward to going back for a visit.Bar staff all really entertaining and good to spend time with. Location is great for work or play in NYC.Would I stay again, ABSOLUTELY and would I endorse this property, ABSOLUTELY!

Very good hotel. Good value for money. Please keep in mind that all hotels on Manhattan is very expensive. Location is very good. For WTC site we even walked no need to use metro or taxi. Hotel located near Canal Street metro station that is available on the most lines and express trains stops on that station. So we never need to change trains during our stay in NYC.Times SQ is about 15 min by metro from the hotel.There are two Wi-Fi networks in the hotel. One in the lobby and its free for hotel guests. However other network that is available both in the lobby and rooms cost about 10 usd per day. However it may be included in your reservation (for example in case you used your SPG card for eservation) so better ask on reception because that network is much faster then free one in the lobby.

I'm a regular guest at the Sheraton Tribeca. I've never been blown away (it's not a luxury hotel), but I've never been disappointed.I return frequently based on: good prices, lower Manhattan location, decent-sized rooms, cleanliness and very friendly service.A few notes beyond the basics. The Tribeca location is pretty much SoHo -- just across the street, no more than a five minute walk from the heart of SoHo. Being so close to the Holland Tunnel makes the hotel really convenient for EWR. Finally the lounge is really awesome. Great views, terrace for al fresco breakfast when the weather is good and good food.

I had business in town and needed a Starwood hotel with a good location, and so I booked this at the expensive rate $400 a night. For that price you would think the staff at check-in would be cordial but my clerk was very rude, rudely telling me my SPG status was expired (it wasn't, and she could have been less mean about it) and later, when I asked a question, flat out refusing to look at me. Aside from that the hotel was adequate-- room was comfortable though not luxurious, and the location of hotel easy to get around from. All in all I only recommend this hotel if you need a hotel in this area and don't want to go full luxury rate at a better hotel, or want the SPG points. Otherwise for just a bit more in room rate you could get a much more comfortable experience.

Staff is wonderful - friendly and accommodating. The club floor room was large by NYC standards and very comfortable. Few minor problems, but they were quickly addressed. The lounge off the club floor s great. The view to the north of mid-town may be one of the best in the city. If you need to be in the Tribeca area, it is a great place to stay

Good hotel, ideally located to explore New York and the surrounding suburbs.Our room was large and comfortable with 2 large beds, which seems common in American hotels. There was also the ability to connect to the adjoining room if you were a family. Strangely there was only one bedside table which was annoying. We ate out so cannot comment on the food other than the breakfast was excellent.

We took a short bus trip from Washington DC and wanted to stay away from Times Square noise and crowd. Although Canal Street is not very attractive for tourists, the location of the hotel is only a block away from SoHo. We had great time in and out, the front desk was very courteous and professional. When asked if we could check out half an hour late, they granted us immediately. Bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was renovated recently and still in mint condition. WiFi was available only at the lobby for free, but at the rooms with a fee. Still it was very convenient.

From the moment enter the hotel the front desk staff seem less than enthused to see you. They do help you check in with less than a great attitude. As am SPG Platinum member, they do not look at all to upgrade the room and give the standard answer that they have no availability.There is a line usually at elevators to go to the floors.The concierge food for breakfast is always the same and is of the poorest quality. They pour the eggs from a carton, and cook them in the heated warmer. Bacon is soggy and undercooked, sausage is usually undercooked and the breads must be older than day old.The price for the room is incredibly expensive for what you get.

I booked a patio room for over $400 a night in hopes of getting a great room and good service. Upon check in I was given a key to a tiny room across from the elevator. I had to go back to the desk and show them my online resevation. I don't understand why you have to fight to get what you pay for. This has happened everytime I stay at a starwood property. I did finally recieve the room I wanted but found several basic items amiss. The paper reminders about bed making, how to dial the phone, breakfast pre-order were all crumpled like theyve been re-used for a looong time. The clock was stuck on 3am and found nothing to stir the coffee with although with only one sugar left in the room there wasnt much to stir. The bed linens were crumpled and creased making me think they werent changed from the last guest. When I visited the front desk the next day I asked if i could get access to the clib lounge as i saw on the website it had great city views and was told because I was not platinum I couldnt go up there. Wow! I was eventually allowed after I emailed the assit gen manager but jeeez really? I am done with sheraton and starwood all together. I have since moved over to the Kimberly Hotel have a great room friendly service and for less money!

Pricelined two nites here during a very busy time in NYC. Loved the location in the thick of things and super close to a bunch of subway lines. Of course Soho and Tribeca are right there, short walk to the LES and a nice walk up Broadway to a million other things. Nice staff, good well-sized room, comfortable bed. Could hear a bit of noise from the 15th floor but not a big deal. No free wi fi but many computers available. It's a bit generic looking in the lobby, an okay lounge with no "scene" and as mentioned, the restaurant doesn't stay open but too many places to go to anyway. Super happy I got this hotel.

I frequently stay at this hotel when I'm traveling to NYC. It's very convenient and located near the places I need to be while in the city. The thing that sets this hotel apart from others is the quality of the service. I am always pleased with the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. The only downside is that some rooms face Canal St and are very noisy as a result. All the rooms I've had were very small but not unlike the size of rooms in many NYC hotels.So far as cost, it's hard to find a better value in NYC.

The service was excellent. Everyone was helpful and friendly. The rooftop terrace and the concierge services were amazing. The location is convenient. The room was clean with a comfortable bed and nice view. We have stayed here before and will stay here again!

The staff is unparalleled. We are close to Chinatown and Little Italy. The hotel is lively and sparkling clean. I can't say enough about the staff. Right outside of the Holland Tunnel makes getting back to Newark airport very easy.

I had read the reviews on trip advisor and other booking sites and actually decided to stay at another hotel across the road as it was supposedly 3.5 stars while Sheraton was 3 stars. That was before I stayed at Sheraton. In July when I returned to NY i booked at Sheraton to compare and discovered it should be rated much higher!My impression of the hotel customer service was excellent. Eddie helped store my bags for a while before check in and he went above and beyond my expectations to store and wrap cold items in that needed to be refrigerated. Thanks Eddie. My room was nicely presented and had an amazing view across SoHo. The hotel is in a great location and easily get around as several subway entrances are just out the door. I will stay here on my next visit for sure!

This hotel is ok and the location is great, but I booked it because I could get a suite (with a 2-yr-old who goes to bed at 7:30, it's necessary). But when I got to my room I found a single room, not a suite. This is what they call a "suite," the front desk said, and was all that they had. So here I am, at 8 pm, lying in the dark posting this. No room service and wine for my husband and I - we're being quiet so the kid can sleep.Otherwise, the hotel is just ok. The room is big for Manhattan, but the furniture is old and tired. It's clean, though, and the staff is nice.If it weren't for the blatant misrepresentation when I booked the "suite," I'd be fine with this hotel (although I would have stayed elsewhere on this trip).

I arrived with my family for a wedding. We were immediately greeted by the bellman David. The staff made me feel very welcome from the beginning to end. I had a request for early check in since I was traveling with my two children and my elderly mother. The girl at the front desk was very friendly and checked us in without hesitation. My only suggestion will be to have your restaurant open for dinner or more staff at the bar. Brandon was great , but seemed to be too busy without a help. My big thank you to your manager Yissel Fraterigo for helping us with special requests. We look forward our next visit.

We booked here because it had the best price in the city for a Saturday night (for a room that wasn't a closet). The hotel is oddly situated on Canal Street, which is horribly busy, all the time. The room was very clean and updated, missing a refrigerator though. The staff - from the valet to the front desk - were all really friendly. We've stayed in many NYC hotels over the years, and they were by far the nicest staff - no stuffy, or better-than-you, or rough-talking people here. Truly every person was just that nice. The location puts you close to the 1-2-3 and A-C-E subway, so if you want to get around without using a cab, this is very convenient. We valeted our car and were immediately told to give 45 minutes to get it back; it took only 30, but it was great to be advised of this up front. Even once we were upstairs, we asked for a larger ice bucket and a foam pillow, and received them within 5 minutes with a smile.I'm rating the Sleep Quality very good. We had a room on the 15th, but I'd imagine that a lower floor may have been noisy, an issue almost anywhere in the city.For New Yorkers, it's probably a really odd location for this kind of hotel, and for tourists it's not exactly in the center of the action... but if you know what you're doing and how to get there, I couldn't recommend this more highly. I'm giving it an average review for this, as it could be great for some and terrible for others.

Let me start with the good points: Very good location, between the two coolest New York neighborhoods (Tribeca and Soho). Nice, comfortable rooms (though on the small side), good & free internet connection, good value for money (for New York standards that it) Not so great: Breakfast (not worth taking, if not included, opt for one of the cute Italian cafes in the area or grab a Starbucks from the Lobby cafe), staff (OK, but nothing more than this)But overall, a good option for the New York leisure visitor

My husband and I spent the weekend riding bikes in NYC and stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca. The staff and accommodations could not have been better! We stored our bicycles while we were there which made things so much easier for us. The location of the hotel was perfect. There was so much to do in the area with Little Italy and Chinatown being just up the street. We got great directions and suggestions from the staff. They were all very professional and friendly. All our needs were met. Our room was so clean and so comfortable and our view was second to none! We cannot wait to return. So much more to do there and we only touched the surface! I recommend Sheraton Tribeca HIGHLY!

From the minute my family of five walked into the lobby, we were greeted with big smiles and felt a welcoming friendly atmosphere. Eddie took care of us from the beginning ensuring we were checked in, baggage taken care of, daily transporation, conceirge services. All of these folks that worked from the lobby to the fabulous club floor balcony suites , were completely accomadating and truly cared about us. Including our 3 highly active 9 year kids. thank you Eddie and your team, you all really helped us enjoy our time in NYC. Your friends Julie & Richard Folz, Molly , Kaseylee and Josh!

My husband and I just stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca and had a great time. You really can't beat the location, it's close to all the fun things. (Chinatown, LES, Soho etc) There are subway stops steps away from the hotel so it's easy to get all over if that's what you're looking to do.What really impressed me though was how thoughtful and attentive the staff were. We particularly appreciated Jessica's help. (She's their Club Lounge Manager.) Jessica gave us some great tips on local eateries and was always available with a smile on her face. She made our stay extra wonderful.If you want to be comfortable, close to the action, and be treated well then you should definitely stay at the Sheraton Tribeca.

This was a great hotel for a first-time visit to New York - really close to good bars/restaurants in SoHo, close to good shopping on Broadway, walking distance to Greenwich, really close to three or four different subway lines for anywhere else you want to go! And THE most comfortable beds (we had three other sets of friends staying in the same hotel and they all said the same thing!)

2 sisters, daughter and l stayed 5 days and it was a fabulous location. Walk out the door and China Town, Little Italy r on yr right, Tribeca, Soho, Grenwich to yr left and Broadway straight ahead. Best things being staff wr so helpful. Need to give special thanks to the concierge Corey, who really made our trip memorable. Missed out on Beyonce concert in NZ, he got us Beyonce tickets Motown the show tickets, recommended metro pass an pointed us in the right direction evry time we went out. Subway entrances all around us and walking was the easiest way to go. Beds were so so comfy we wished we could of brought them home! So good to collapse on them after a full day shopping and sightseeung and night out and around in NYC. Highly recommended and would love to stay here again.

We were booked in by our travel agent because it was our pick up point for the tour that we were doing, so I had done no research into this hotel, that being said we found the hotel to be in a great location, walking distance to china town , little Italy, soho and lower manhattan. The rooms are spacious by NY standards, and were kept spotless by our room attendant Zaleena. The room was very quiet compared to others we had stayed at in NY even though it was on one of the lower floors. The staff were polite and helpful and the bar was a welcome site after a big days touring. I would be happy to stay here again when I return to NY

With so many options in Manhattan, we decided to book the Sheraton Tribeca and we're glad we did. The prices in NYC are high, but this hotel was reasonable enough for Manhattan. Prior to our stay, we contacted the hotel and Mr. Cornelio Encarnacion responded to my email and made sure we had a room to our liking, that scored many points in my book. Thank you Mr. Encarnacion. I love it when hotels take time to do this for their guests. At the hotel, the staff was nice and efficient, no problems here. The club lounge had nice offerings, the terrace on the rooftop was spectacular! My room was small (but efficient), it was indeed the smallest room I've ever stayed in, this is NYC so it's not unexpected. It was very quiet for Manhattan and we were facing Canal Street. The area is well served by subway lines, you can be anywhere in Manhattan very quickly. You can also walk and bike around the area. As others have mentioned, some areas on Canal Street are a little seedy & dirty. I'm comfortable with any urban setting, but someone who is expecting the upper west side, might not...The only 2 minor negative aspects were: the hotel does get alot of volume & traffic, and it shows because there was alot of dents, scuffs, and scratches everywhere in the hotel, especially in my guestroom. The wifi was also quite slow sometimes.We had a great stay here, we would love to return and would recommend it to others!Enjoy!

I love tha location so I have stayed there many times.Walking distance to Chinatown and Little Italy makes me happy.However rooms and hallways are not a Sheraton level.Even Suites are so small.I don't know any Sheraton worse than this.This property should be a Four Points by Sheraton.But again, I love the location and I must go back.

Spacious,clean,comfortable room with super king bed,good shower and efficient aircon. Close to china town(scruffy and dirty)but also close to the more atmospheric Little Italy. We stayed overnight prior to going on a road trip. If staying longer in New York you,d do better staying further uptown in order to have walking access to the main sights

First off, don't get me wrong - this is not a luxurious property, and anything on Canal Street is going to be kind of loud. It's a discount hotel in downtown Manhattan and the rooms are far from the best you'll ever stay in. But that said, they're clean, they're new, and the service is great for this type of hotel. Extremely friendly lobby staff who offer you a bottle of water when you're on your way out the door. If you're a return visitor, they'll try their best to put you in the same room and do what they can to accommodate early check-in. I definitely prefer it to the Hilton Garden Inn down the street, which is competitively priced.

Travelled from DC to NYC and stayed at this wonderful hotel in August, I loved coming home to see the nice note left by my housekeeper.The location was perfect, very close to all the shops, the beautiful view of the hudson and not to mention holland park. The hotel is right across the train station which make things so convenient. I will certainly stay there next time I am in NYC. If you are looking for a hotel closed to everything, beautiful and where you can sleep at night in peace. This is the place.

Completely agree with the reviewer who refers to the neighborhood as "seedy." Do not even try to find a place to eat nearby...unless you're seeking McDonald's. On the plus side, the lobby is bright and comfortable with wi fi; the $16 breakfast buffet is worth it and pretty good; the room is clean and quiet. BUT, I was given a room (#704) that was beyond "cozy" and was downright tiny. For nearly $400 a night, I did not expect something so small. I took a picture of the space between the door and bed and posted it to Facebook: 18" is the space I had to work with! If the closet door is open, you are unable to cross the room to the other side. Crazy. I will not stay here again and do not recommend it.

I booked through Hotwire not knowing which hotel I will get until after I pay for the hotel. I wanted a 4 star hotel near the TriBeCa area. So I was pleasantly surprise when I found out I was given the Sheraton TriBeCa. I knew that the Sheraton hotel chain has a good reputation. But it turned out to be a total disappointment. First of all, when i called for direction to the hotel, i was told by the hotel receptionist that they were located on Canal Street and by the Hudson River. Wrong! It took me, what should had been a 15 minutes walk from the NY Municipal Building to the hotel, over 50 minutes on a hot humid day to find the hotel. Please be aware that the big traffic circle leading to the Holland Tunnel breaks up Canal Street from different directions, and the hotel is not by the Hudson River as I was told, but is by Wooster Street. Finally when I arrived with a friend, I was told by a not so friendly receptionist that all rooms were fully booked so my prior request (which I've made weeks ago) for twin beds was not available. Okay, as long as it was a non smoking room, I could live with that, after all, what choice do I have since it was Labor Day weekend, and I did get the discounted room through Hotwire. It was not my intention to spend all my time in the hotel anyway. That evening after a long day of sightseeing, I was looking forward to a nice hot shower and a comfortable bed. I have to admit the room although small, was clean as was expected for a 4 star hotel. But I was surprise to find that there was only one bath towel in the bathroom. ONE BATH TOWEL for a room with double occupancy! I called the receptionist to ask for more bath towel. And was blown away when they said they were short in bath towels and that one will be sent up as soon as they can get hold of extra towels. Can you believe this happening in a 4 star hotel! So I got to use the one towel left in the room while my friend waited patiently for more towels to be delivered. After half an hour of waiting, my friend called the receptionist again and was told the same situation. Another hour passed and again the same excuse. Finally around 11 pm my friend called a third time and asked that if they could at least deliver some hand towels to the room so that she could use them as bath towels. They readily agreed to do so. But none came. So my friend, tired of waiting, had to use the hand and face towels that were in the bathroom. No wait, they did keep their promise, because around 12:30 a.m. While we were fast asleep, there came a knock on our door waking us up, and behold, service presented us with hand towels. But wait, that was not the worse. The worse was the incessant noise outside in the hallway throughout the night. We did not find out until the next day that it wasn't even hotel guests that were making the noises, but the hotel staff. It turned out there was a service staff room right across from our room, and the staff were in and out of that room talking loudly with total disregard for the guests sleeping behind closed doors. As if that wasn't bad enough, Aound 3:30 a.m. the room message phone rang for no apparent reason. The next morning when I complained to the receptionist, all she said was "oh, that can happen to signify the phone is running out of battery." Can you believe this???when I told the receptionist all the problems we had the night before, all she said was " Oh I'm so sorry to hear that you had such a bad experience." And that was the end of that! What I want to know is did all this happen because we booked through Hot Wire and that the hotel felt they had no need to be accommodating because our rate was discounted? This was the first time I booked through Hot Wire and the first time I stayed at a Sheraton Hotel. In any case, I will not use either for my future bookings.

This hotel is technically in TriBeCa, however, it's on the edge and the main street for the entrance to the hotel is a little seedy. But, that's new york.I found the room well-stocked, if small. The bathroom was modern and well equipped. They were kind of stingy in giving us towels - we only had two in the room to begin with. Our TV did not work the first day and we had to have maintenance come fix it, which was annoying. However, when we asked for more towels or maintenance they were very prompt in their resolutions of the problems.The elevators were incredibly slow, and I think one was actually broken during our time there. We were on a very high floor so there was minimal street noise. However, we didn't get a very good view - ask for a room on the North or NorthEast side to get the best views.

The hotel is situated on Canal Street with subway station at walking distance. In few hundreds meters you can get Broadway and West Broadway (the South entrance). It is also not far from downtown and to middletown. The service is fair for the price paid and also the hotel facilities are in line with value proposed. The staff is enough friendly. This hotel can be a fair choice is you wanna stay in NY without spend too much.

Not much improvement on Management and follow up. Breakfast selection in the Executive Lounge is terrible. Bathroom was not clean when we arrived, and the room was not cleaned by 6pm when we returned. All in all, still needs help and not sure how it's getting good reviews. Try it for yourself!

Stayed in the Sheraton for half of our week stay in NYC, was a very pleasant stay in the lovely Tribeca, very close to some great food shops and subway stations. Was told we were upgraded to a suite, however we never got a suite which was a shame however we really enjoyed our stay.

We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights and we love it. It is close to Chinatown, SoHo district and Little Italy area, and all within walking distance. The subway stations that connect you to the Downtown and Uptown Manhattan is just around the corner of the hotel.The hotel staffs are very helpful and attentive. The room is clean and the bed is high and comfortable.

I stayed here for 10 nights in August 13 on business. I highly recommend this hotel.Great points:- Every staff member was always friendly and courteous. Not one bad experience in 1.5 weeks.- Room internet access (multiple devices) relatively cheaper than other hotels (9.99 per day).- Free internet access in lobby including pc terminals, with free black and white printing.- Very close to subway stations across Canal st to reach most of Manhattan ($31 weekly unlimited pass is so worth it)- Walking distance to Soho shopping, Chinatown and Little Italy.- 24 hour gym- Room is spacious enough (stayed on the 18th floor) and quiet.Not so great points:- Bathroom has 2 light switches, one for the bathroom in general and one for the shower area. The general one is also connected to the fan which is extremely loud so I only had the shower light on most of the time.- I stayed on the side opposite the lifts. I have heard that you can hear the elevator operating if you stay in the rooms next to the lifts (or the ones next to them).- A little far from most of the midtown attraction areas, but close enough if you don't mind a short commute.Summary- You won't go wrong staying here.

I changed my mind several times before settling on this hotel and I'm very glad I did. A fantastic base for disco vining New York with lots in the vicinity and the Canal street subway station 2 minutes away (left then left again). A couple of the previous reviews have been negative about Canal Street but I think it just adds to the New York feel of the place.If you can get a deal that includes access to the club lounge I would recommend it, the breakfast is more than adequate to set you up for the day and the views uptown from the 21st floor are great.

Stayed here one night on SPG points. I usually stay at the W Hotel on Lexington, but changed here to be closer to an appointment near Wall Street. Overall this hotel is OK. The highlights include the Club Lounge terrace on the 21st floor with great views of the city. The rooms are OK, but a cheap (temporary?) fridge in the takes away from the decor. If you're coming from Grand Central it's a not inexpensive cab ride or a schlep on the subway to get here.The nearby Tribeca Tavern was a good distraction with good local craft beers.

Upon our arrival we were greated at the door by Eddie who seemed genuinely happy to welcome us. He was a great source of knowledge. Hotel lobby was updated, comfortable and very clean. Starbucks coffee bar available for your morning coffee. Rooms were also very clean and had also been updated. White, clean, crisp linens and a comfortable bed. (I like when hotels are not afraid to use white bedding because you know it has to be fresh and clean). Very quiet location and had no trouble sleeping despite being in NYC. Bathrooms were also very clean and towels were in good shape (not grey and worn). Nice TV if that is important. As in all NYC hotels there is a charge for internet access, but they have computers/printers available in hotel lobby for guests at no extra charge. The location is in a neighborhood between Tribeca and Soho. Deil right next door is ideal for breakfast/lunch/ water and is open 24 hours. Or hotel is ideal for walking to dinner in Little Italy (Amici II - we had great food with local New Yorkers). Subway stations very close to hotel. You can walk to 9/11 Memorial or one subway stop away. Very safe area. The hotel was better than I expected. I was glad not to be staying in Times Square which was way too crowded, but easy to get to. Took subway to Yankee game. It was very easy to do from hotel. I will defintely stay here again when in NYC.

We decided to celebrate my husband's birthday with a weekend in New York this past March. When a snowstorm hit Manhattan and flights from Toronto were cancelled all day long we were certain that the birthday weekend would be a bust. I had a reservation with the Sheraton Tribeca and kept in touch with them throughout the day to make sure that our booking would be held although we would be late and, asked for a room with a view if possible. We finally arrived at 10 pm and although we lost an entire day at the airport, the staff at the Sheraton made sure we still had a memorable and romantic visit in an upgraded room with a view of the Chrysler Building! Every single staff member made us feel welcome and special, and exceeded our expectations in every way, including Yissel Fraterrigo in Guest Services who was especially courteous. We choose to stay at Sheraton hotels when we travel because they are well appointed and have such comfortable beds, but the Sheraton Tribeca is just outstanding. The hotel is chic, the location is perfect, the rooftop patio has gorgeous panoramic views, and the staff go above and beyond. This is the only place we will be staying when we visit.

Went for a bachelorette party and enjoyed the stay. Large rooms for NYC and good value. Clean and comfortable. Also had cars/taxis outside so you rarely had to wait to get around. Would recommend and stay again.

Our Hotel for a girly weekend, Prices were great, room was ideal (2 double beds), large bathroom, quick no frills stay and everything went very smoothly. Recoomend using their cars to get to the Airport. Great door service.

I work in lower Manhattan and had a dinner that I knew would go late, so I decided to book a room at the Sheraton. I found the price to be excellent for an NYC hotel (this was on my $) along with being at the north end of Tribeca, which would be convenient to get to work the next morning. I haven't stayed at a Sheraton for years and I was pleasantly surprised at this hotel. While the room was small, it was nice, clean, a comfortable bed and most importantly quiet. After making my non-refundable booking I realized it was right on Canal St which can be very loud. However I did not hear any noise from the street below which is much better than you can say about many hotels in NY. There looked to be a nice lounge in the lobby (didn't go in) that still had 15 or so people when I got back at midnight. There was also a Starbucks in the lobby which was ideal for getting coffee and a pastry the next morning. I'd prefer a larger room if I were with my wife, but this hotel perfectly suited my needs for the evening. Good job Sheraton!

The General Manager of this hotel, Lowell Beebe-Center is a great guy and has a highly guest-oriented staff! We were greeted with smiles from EVERY member of the staff! The Concierge & Valet Parking employees (wish I could remember their names) couldn't have been more helpful. The woman who hosted the breakfast in the Club Lounge, Jessica, was amazing! Although we got there late and could have been told that they were closing breakfast, she made sure that we had everything we needed and even brought out more for a few guests who arrived after us.
