She was charming and answered a few questions that we had for planning our day in NYC. Our room was immaculate and we had a nice view of the city. Once we figured out the Subway system, this was a great location to connect anywhere we wanted to go. The room was large for being in NYC. Very comfortable.

Very near Canal Street subway so ideal location - and not too far to walk to Chinatown, the Village etc. staff all friendly and happy to help. Stayed in a Club room and its worth paying the extra with inclusive Breakfast and access to the Club Lounge - which has an outdoor seating area with a great view. Lounge also offers free soft drinks/coffee all day and 'snacks' late afternoon. Free access to Internet in the lobby and lounge but you have to pay for Wi-Fi Really comfy bed ! Overall a good stay

This Sheraton hotel is a mini version of most others: small lobby, small bar, small rooms. But the staff was very friendly and the hotel is up to standards. Location is fine, and very close to two subway stations. Public transport connection to JFK is fine if you prefer that over a taxi. I would go again. US$ 200 for a room with two double beds, that's good value in Manhattan.

We had an enjoyable stay. Friendly staff and good service. Rooms not large but were clean and tidy and well presented. Location not the best. Would be more suitable for the younger set, looking for the trendy Soho and Greenwich Village areas.

This place was clean and in a great location that was close to the subway and lots of things to do. The staff all sported smiles and offers for assistance, and our room on the 15th floor was immune to noise from the street at night. However, there was quite a lot of noise that could be heard anytime anyone on the floor entered the hall, which included guests returning screaming and crying at 4 am and the maids loudly talking and banging about at 7 am. All in all, it was a good experience and I would return again for another night. The three stars is because it is a three star hotel and not higher, not because I left dissatisfied.

TriBeCa isn't the swankiest neighborhood in the city but this hotel is a very good value. Having said that Tribeca is far from a bad neighborhood too. The rooms are nice and clean and the staff is very friendly. Subways are just a block or so away which makes getting around the city a beeeze. If your unfamiliar withe the subways just use Hop Stop or a similar program to let you know when and where to get on and off. I used Hotwire and got about $30 off the rate on their website.

I was pleasantly surprised by The hardest working and most dedicated staff in any NYC hotel.Great SPG recognition, excellent lounge (amazing balcony), nice gym, and very good location. Arrived early and was immediately accommodated. I am a business traveler with more than 120 SPG nights a year and this hotel is my best SPG experience in the NY area. It is always a great experience and I have not been disappointed up to date. Strongly recommend

Why stat here!? We stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca for a work function. As a Starwoods member I was happy to stay at a Sheraton. I learned quickly that not all Sheratons are alike. My room key was demagnetized and I had to go back to the front desk after waiting forever for the elevator to go up in the first place. One I got into my room, it wasn't a double as I requested. they blamed it on my company and said I could move the next day. After a full day in a NYC heat wave I was able to switch rooms but before I could, I had to get my stuff packed up and go back to the front desk for the new keys. After waiting for the elevator for over 15 minutes(two were out) I decided to walk with my luggage up 8 flights to my new room. I was also told that I would have to switch rooms again due to my extended stay. The next day when I went to speak to the manager about staying in the same room for my final night I was met with sarcasm and rudeness. I was told that if I was to stay in the same room that I would be putting another guest out and that "it would be on me". It almost seemed like they hired a guy off the street to be a manager. OHHHHH...and then the room itself....I know it's NYC and unless you are staying at the Dream or the Ritz you aren't getting much, however, I would expect the water to drain from the shower and when you turn on the light there not to be an insane buzzing. The ONLY positive I can give this hotel is the bartender behind the bar. Would I stay here again....only if it's paid for and my company is making me.

This is my 5th time coming to NYC and my first time staying at the Sheraton Tribeca. I will definitely make a point of staying here on my next visits. The staff here are SO incredibly friendly. We had no issues with the stay at all. The rooms are clean and nice. There are a handful of Subway stops around the hotel so you can get anywhere in the city with ease.

We visited the hotel last summer. I wish we had made a better choice, we did not get any sleep since the room they gave us was next to the storage room where the cleaning staff banged the doors from 7 am every day. We adored New York city and since we were so tired every night we longed for a good night sleep. We sought assistance on the matter from the hotel manager, we called every day the front desk, but nothing changed. Would not recommend it.

I have tried this hotel throughout the years and always found it reliable and friendly. This last stay was better then ever. We had 6 or 7 rooms coming and going at different times and this hotel handled everyone perfectly...Their customer service from reservations to housekeeping to the ever helpful doorman was more like a 5 star hotel. Kudos to them all. We felt like we were welcomed "home" every day. The location of this hotel is right on Canal street. This is a strange street as it separates Soho from Tribeca. It is a major entry point to both ChinaTown and Little Italy as well. So from this hotel you are able to Easily walk to 4 major neighborhoods in NYC. This is impressive. Yes, Canal street is a little seedy, however this is easy to overlook as one block in any direction and you are standing in some of the most desirable real estate in Manhattan. This location is Flawless. You can connect to trains that take you Everywhere in Manhattan within a 5 minute walk. Location location location. Our rooms were smallish however had every amenity we could ask for. The Sheraton beds were divine and the pillows (all types) were plentiful. Toiletries were standard Sheraton issue Shine products. Shower was hot when needed and cold when not. Our room was always very clean and our housekeeper even left us a welcome note and a goodbye note. Nice touch. our view was towards the Brooklyn bridge and waking to the NYC panorama was fantastic. We had a connecting room and never heard anything through the door.We had Club level rooms. Please note that this club does not serve "free alcohol" but charges for this. They do however have an excellent breakfast spread with hot eggs and bacon as well as fresh raspberries and blueberries melons etc. For dinner time they had cheese, veggies two hot canapes of varying types and sodas and water complimentary. The draw to the lounge is the view. The lounge has a spectacular terrace looking north over NYC....unobstructed views to the empire state building and midtown....Wow. Couches and loungers and just sitting outside and taking it all in was an experience in itself. Someone was very smart in setting this gorgeous space aside. I normally stay at a higher end hotel....W's or Westins etc. This time around I was Very pleasantly surprised by this property. If it has one drawback, it is the smallish rooms. However the positives so outweigh the negative that for us, that was a non issue. This hotel was a great value hotel with a perfect location and friendly responsive service. We could not have asked for more. Is it the W Union Square? No, but it was 1/2 the price and was impressive in it's own right. We look forward to returning to this property in the future and wish everyone safe travels. Enjoy Enjoy and Enjoy some more! Cheers! NYC

We were greatly surprised at the wonderful service we received at the Sheraton Tribeca Hotel.This was our 45 Wedding anniversary trip to New York City. The hotel staff was great especiallyJessica in the club room for breakfast and snacks in evening. The meals were more that just continental. Also we found the subway around the block that got us to theatres, time square and other parts of N.Y. at such a reasonable cost and time savings from taxi services. Also felt very safe taking the subway even coming back late evening. Dennis & Sharon Delisle

This hotel gives the best service. Period. Every single staff member we encountered made us feel welcomed and at home, particularly the employees that help you with your baggage and arrange transportation if needed.They went above and beyond their duty, and really made our trip. The ipod docs in the room were a huge plus, and the room was quiet for being on such a busy street. Having to pay for internet wasn't ideal, but there were computers in the main lobby. I advise taking a shuttle to and from La Guardia. It is a flat rate of $50, including tip, whereas a cab can cost upwards of $60 with traffic (which there is quite a lot of).The location is quite central, and had TONS of awesome little unknown places to eat and shop (which was perfect for us because we wanted to do things that native New Yorkers do), but if you don't want to do lots of walking and don't mind paying more, stay at the Sheraton in Times Square. It is much more localized and touristy.

We have stayed at this hotel twice, and love the location. Eddie C, is one of the managers who really goes that extra mile for the guests. He takes care of any small issue with a smile and a guarantee of client satisfaction. It is people like Eddie C., who clearly love what they do, that makes the difference between a good hotel and a great hotel!

I had a room on one of the upper floors. The room was cozy, quiet, and had a nice view (although rooms facing the opposite way get a better view - Empire State Building). I enjoyed being able to dock my iPhone and listening to music. I did not enjoy having to pay for wifi.

Hotel and room was clean and comfortable accept for fact that room was very small. Size not typical for a Sheraton. Thought I was in Europe.The Sheraton beds and bedding are exceptional. The staff were helpful and friendly. The only really bad part was its location. Canal Street is a dirty shady armpit of Manhattan NYC. Fortunately there's subway options close by. Next trip we'll probably take our chances with a different option.

We found the Sheraton Tribeca last minute when we had a summer wedding in NY. Reasonably priced and also very reasonably sized for Manhattan. Very friendly, accommodating service. I recommend it highly.

It's the standard of 4* property that you would expect from Sheraton. Helpful staff and clean rooms to boot. There's also a Starbucks in the lobby.The hotel is in perfect proximity to Soho and TriBeCa but the immediate street, Canal street is quite dirty and a main thoroughfare to and from Manhattan so can get quite congested. Walk a few blocks in either direction though and you're away from that. It was a lot more reasonably priced than other 4* properties in the vacinity (Soho and TriBeCa Grand, for example).

Lots of great places to walk to in the area. Typical small New York hotel room, but it was clean and fine. Didn't typically have to wait too long for the elevator. Good option for Starwood. There are three subway lines that are easy walking distance (Red, Blue and Yellow), so anything north was easy to access. Coffee bar in the lobby. A/C worked good. You can definitely hear the street noise, but I would again say that is typical of any NY hotel. I would stay here again.

This is a great locale if you want a quality hotel and are not afraid or timid of using public transport in NYC. The food and liveliness of Chinatown is also a bonus. You can grab great Asian cuisine at lower than you expect NYC prices in the neighborhood.Rooms were small but very well appointed and spotless.The front desk easily honored our request for twin beds without a problem even though we booked on price line for a fraction of the rack rate.Subway is a three block walk. Plenty of dining choices in the area. Midtown was a short ten minute subway ride.

We spent 5 nights at Sheraton Tribeca over the 4th of July week. The service throughout the hotel was friendly, professional and very helpful. We did have a small room for a family of 4 however we didn't spend much time in it. We stayed on the 22 floor. Had fabulous views of the city and enjoyed the Club Lounge for both breakfast and evening snacks. We couldn't be happier with our stay at the hotel and would highly recommend!

Four adults stayed for a long weekend. Rooms are small but we didn't go to NYC to stay in our rooms. Location was fabulous. Centrally located, easy to get a cab when needed. I have to say it was the staff that did it for us. At check in on the 4th they gave us access to the "preferred guest" roof top lounge to view the fireworks. They had complimentary soda, water and hourduvers. Always a "good morning, can we help you with anything" when we came down to start our day. By the third night, bartender was asking if we wanted our usual, and we didn't spend a lot of time hanging at the bar, it was just the way the staff was. Everyone is their friend! Don't usually get that kind of treatment at a NYC hotel. Would highly recommend.

The Sheraton TriBeCa has a good location on Canal St. Several of my friends and I went there for July 4th weekend. The front office staff very unaccomadating. Rooms smelled musty. The business office printer didn't work. One day room was forgotten to even clean. Enjoyed NYC. The hotel's service lacked leadership. Spoke to manager who was unhelpful. Wouldn't recommend.

Two friends and myself wanted to stay in the city where the town people live, we chose TriBeCa. Being a Starwood member we took the Sheraton @ 370 canal street. Rooms were small and though we were paying for three we received only enough for two. One day we had no room service and returned to a dirty room without new towels. The management seemed uninterested in accommodating for any miss handling or errors on the hotels part. Breakfast was over at 11:00 but when we ordered off the menu (10:30) rather than the buffet we were told the cook would have to approve. Wimbledon was on and we asked if TV in breakfast room could be changed (no one was watching) we were told they couldn't change the channel. No service here!!!!! Look onward.

Found the Sheraton Tribeca on Travel site, and booked for its prime location near our main destination. Unfortunately, the web-site description did not meet the actual room description when we arrived to find the "suite" I had reserved was really a "Studio-Suite," meaning the size and space was not adequate for a mother and son. A King bed toe to toe with a pull out Sofa bed, dorm fridge (complete with energy sticker), $9.99 per day in-room Wi-Fi, and no additional floor space, was not what I expected from a hotel of the Sheraton caliber. I paid for a suite. I assume a suite, by definition is a 2-space/separated accommodation, and was very disappointed.In their defense, the Management at the Sheraton did all they could to rectify the situation by offering complimentary Breakfast & Club Privileges, they did not, however, have another room to offer us. The room was adequate, but out-dated decor, the bathroom was spacious and clean. It was overpriced for the space.Overall, just OK.

This hotel was highly recommended to me and I have to agree with them! I've stayed here both during the week for business and over a weekend for sightseeing. It's in a good location, right around the corner from a subway stop, and not down Canal far enough to be really creepy at night. I did not feel unsafe at night walking from the subway to the hotel. Unlike some of the other commenters, I thought the rooms were relatively large for Manhattan (I once stayed in one that was about the size of a shoebox) and well decorated and nice. We could not figure out how to hook up our laptop to the TV to watch a movie and called down, and someone came up quickly and showed us how to do it. We could get anywhere in Manhattan from here, not far either way, since Canal St is in a pretty good location in the city. The breakfast in the Club Lounge (I'm Platinum with SPG) was phenomenal, hot and fresh, and the happy hour/appetizers were good too, with a pleasant attendant working. Overall, a great hotel for a reasonable price in NYC!

We stayed here for a couple of nights in May before moving to the W on Lexington (see review). We booked via priceline "express deals" and for the price we paid, I have absolutely no complaints!Check in was super fast - front desk staff, bellman, etc - everyone was friendly. We were assigned a king room on the 9th floor. The room was moderately sized and super clean. The bathroom, while on the small side, was efficiently laid out and the water pressure rocked (no tub - which does not bother me because I don't take baths in hotels!). I did note that the towels were a little on the small/thin side, however. There were plenty of outlets for charging phones, laptops, etc., which I consider a huge plus. We only had one packet of regular coffee but had no problem getting more. Our tv was having some issues and within minutes of calling, maintenance was there to repair the problem. The bed was really comfortable, which made for very sound sleeping after a long day of eating, drinking and sightseeing. I don't recall street noise or door slamming being an issue. After all, it is NYC - it is a hotel - there will be some noise. I can live with it.This was our 3rd trip to NYC in less than a year and we really enjoyed staying here and exploring this area of New York. I did not feel uneasy or like we were in a "seedy" neighborhood - nothing like that. There are several metro stops in the immediate area, which made it easy to travel to other areas of the city as well as bars, restaurants, etc. The Sheraton Tribeca is a very solid choice for visitors who don't feel the need to be in the middle of Times Square. We would definitely stay here again.

I am a Starwood platinum guest, lifetime gold - so I travel a lot and I stay at a lot of Sheratons. I was upgraded to a room that was still incredibly tiny. The main issue was the AC came on and off several times an hour making it difficult to sleep. When is was on it *blasted* me in bed with arctic air, and when it was off the room was sweltering. Would be great of they could (1) direct the vents away from the bed, and (2) have the climate control be steady and reasonable instead of all or nothing. Also, the room was a little dumpy - the property hasn't had any investment in a while. Better value in NYC exist if you can break away from Starwood.

I stayed at this hotel for one night and left my blazer in the room upon checkout in the morning. I immediately called the front desk and security, asked them to pick up my blazer from the room and wait for my friend to come collect. When my friend showed up in the afternoon, however, the security guy (Dylan) told him that the blazer was picked up by someone else who presented exactly my room number, color of the blazer and what's inside the pocket. If this is not blatant theft, I don't know what is. Furthermore, when I called the duty manager (Michael), he simply said they followed the procedure and there's nothing they could do. Nice job Sheraton - at stealing from your customers.

Very good hotel, good service and nice staff. Canal street was a bit noisy, but the hotell was great. Location was good because we walked to down town and Soho. Also the pirs and Sky line was in reach.

Hotel was modern. Rooms were comfortable and clean. Service was great also. We ordered room service a few times and it came up quickly, the prices were reasonable and the food was good. Location is also great, with food outlets located close-by, underground with easy access anywhere in the city and also a few minutes walk from the Broadway Street shopping strip where you can grab some awesome bargains.

As one who travels often to NYC - I spend my time exploring the city. I don't spend too much time in hotel rooms. Not one to waste my money of unnecessary luxuries - for Manhattan, I only want a well located, clean room with a comfortable bed, good shower, and clean bathroom. Our room at the Sheraton was near perfect: it was spacious & clean, the bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was spotless, and the large shower had excellent water temperature & pressure. Also, the location was ideal for a weekend in SoHo - close to the shops, the restaurants, Chinatown, Little Italy, the boardwalk on the west side (Hudson River), and all the other gems one can find downtown. My one complaint was that the wi-fi in the room was poor. Upon check-in, they offered to waive the $9.99/night fee which was understandable since: (1) in my opinion, in 2013, hotels should not charge for wi-fi; and, (2) the weak signal in the room was constantly dropping. Upon check-out they tried to charge us for the wi-fi but when we mentioned that they waived it upon check-in (and that the signal is weak), they quickly waived the fee without incidence. I would certainly return to the hotel for another stay.

First time at this Hotel , whole in whole , nice experience, nice rooms although a bit small , nice Bar , good atmosphere ,not too bad Breakfast , the nice surprise was the staff attitude - Very welcoming ,helpful and smiling .

We were there for a special weekend and from the moment we entered the hotel until the time we left, the service was first class. The Front Desk staff is welcoming, the bellman are more than willing to help and everywhere we went the staff had a smile. To make my point about service, while i was standing on my floor waiting for the elevator, I was talking to another couple who were checking out and had their bags in hand. The room attendant walks by and says "come back soon" and then hands each of them a bottle of water for their trip. A small touch with a huge impact.The hotel is clean and well maintained and the guestrooms have all the amenities you will need to enjoy your NYC stay.We will be back and we will only stay at the Sheraton Tribeca Hotel.

I felt unsafe in this area and was approached with people leaning in close (too close) to sell fake bags etc. every time we went out to Canal Street. Others also stated feeling uncomfortable with cameras etc around their necks they felt exposed. Hotel clean and bed etc fine,but didn't get much sleep. Eventually rang desk in early hours and security came up to sort party in adjoining rooms. Police then called by them and after an hour peace at last. Handy to little Italy and China town. Coffee shop in hotel good for breakfast. Also deli next door.

Feels (and looks) quite corporate and dull. Rooms are typical 'travelling businessman' fare. There is a bar (with a very friendly barman), but it is large, open, uninviting. The staff were very friendly, and if you want to be able to walk into SoHo, this is a good spot. However, getting taxis is a nightmare (despite the valiant efforts of the door staff), although the Metro is only 5 minutes walk. The big plus is that if you are flying from Newark (particularly in the morning), this is a great place to stay, as it is very close to the tunnel - New York traffic can be brutal at that time of the morning, and getting from Times Square area, for example can be hell!). Overall; did the job, but probably wouldn't rush back

I would highly recommend this hotel if you want to retreat to a quieter setting in the evening after a busy day in NYC. It is very close to the subway, double decker bus routes and within walking distance to SoHo, Chinatown, and Little Italy. The hotel is very clean, beds are comfortable and has many other great little perks. What really made our stay great, however, was the personable staff. In particular, there was a staff member named Eddie who went out of his way to make us feel welcome and made our first trip to NYC so memorable. When there are so many choices of hotels, it is people like this who make people want to come back to this hotel. We can't say enough about his great service!

Let me first say that I actually signed up for an account on tripadvisor just to review this hotel - that's the kind of impact they left on me. This is going to be a long review so I apologize in advance. My husband and I are Gold Starwood members. We choose to stay at only Starwood properties all over the world because we love Starwood's member services and have always had great experiences at every Starwood property we've stayed at... until now. Please keep that in mind as you are reading my review. My husband is in the sports business. We had planned a media tour with some of our athletes and had most of our appointments in the TriBeCa area. We usually stay at the Sheraton Time Square but because of our back to back appointments near SoHo, we went online and booked 5 rooms at the TriBeCa Sheraton. In full disclosure, we booked rooms that were non-cancellable - Big mistake, I get that.Four days before our scheduled trip, our itinerary did a full 180. Due to this drastic change, 2 of our players were no longer scheduled to come and 90% our meetings were rescheduled in Midtown. The second we found out, we contacted this hotel immediately and asked if there was anything we could do to transfer to a different property or to even receive credit for future travel.One of our staff members called and spoke to a manager named Cornelio, who said they would have to get back to us. This was on a Thursday. (We were arriving late Sunday evening). After a couple of emails, there was no real response, so I decided to call myself on Friday to see if I could expedite our process of getting answers. Spoke to the night supervisor Maria (whom I have to say was the only person during this whole ordeal who took our concerns seriously) and told her about our situation. She told me that Cornelio was off for the weekend and would have to get back to me. Mind you, we were arriving Sunday night and didn't know which hotel we would have to stay at. As someone who came from management in the service industry, you don't take a day off. You may not physically be at work, but you should always be a phone call away for any emergency situations that arises. STRIKE 1.After several phone calls with Maria, she was finally able to get ahold of Cornelio and told me that a decision couldn't be made until Monday when that hotel manager was in. At this point, we had no choice but to stay in TriBeCa and commute back and forth from Midtown to attend our meetings. I asked Maria about canceling just the two rooms then and getting credit to future travel, but she told me again that it was up to manager. When I expressed my frustration in the lack of follow up, she understood and wished that she could help me more. I told her that this was a very special circumstance and I wasn't asking for money back if it couldn't be done, I just wanted credit. STRIKE 2When we arrived at the hotel, the hotel staff informed us that we had been upgraded to one of the nicest rooms in the hotel. It was a pleasant surprise. Thankful, we went up to our room and was blown away by how small it was and how run down it looked. I was so surprised by how a Starwood hotel could look like this. You could literally walk maybe 10 steps from one side of the room to the door. The bathroom (which reeked of mildew, mind you) wasn't even big enough to fit two people standing side by side at the same time and in order to use the restroom, you had to step aside to close the door. It was awful. I can not even imagine how terrible the room our Olympian stayed in was. I was utterly embarrassed. STRIKE 3On Monday, after a full day of meetings, I finally got back to the hotel and asked to speak to Cornelio, who I thought was going to have an answer for me on the credit. He basically told me that he couldn't get back to me because the hotel manager had to give the approval. SERIOUSLY?! To me, when someone says they need to get approval, that means under special circumstances, it's possible. Don't you? When I told Cornelio that we would have checking out the next day to fly to our next destination and wanted to speak directly to the hotel manager, he mysteriously was in 'meetings' all day and said he would have to "call me back". Needless to say, I didn't receive a phone call that day and didn't hear back until we were mid air to our next stop. He left a message basically saying he was out of the office that afternoon and was unwilling to issue any credit but when (yeah, sure) we stayed there again, he would try to "assist in offsetting some of the cost". STRIKE 4.To top this all off, we requested late checkout (2pm) because we had more meetings in midtown in the AM and wouldn't be able to get back in time. At first they told us they would have to CHARGE us for late check out. As if they didn't already charge us enough! After talking with yet another manager and finding out we were gold members, they finally allowed us to late check out 2 or our 3 rooms. STRIKE 5We will never stay there again. Not only because of the lack of attention received by management, but also because the rooms were small and unkept and the bathrooms smelled like mildew. In all fairness, they are located in a good location, but I would rather stay farther away than ever go back to this property. $1300 lesson learned.

I usually stay at the Four Points Sheraton in Soho which is about a 15 minute walk away. Four Points is a step lower on the Starwood portfolio (simpler but "high value") but checking into this Sheraton I really saw little difference between the two brands. This is a relatively new property but with little character - cookie cutter, out of the box, bland hotel. I have no idea what the Sheraton brand is all about in the US. They are premium in Asia but so hit and miss average in the US. Shocking. They also charge for internet here where Four Points doesn't. Ya, ya, so what about this hotel .... what can I say? It's pretty average. It's a clean room in a rather ratty location but the staff is nice and it's decent. So, if you get a good price, why not?Despite checking in with my gold card, I still got the worst room located just outside the elevator. In fact, I could reach the elevator button standing in the room. Good luck to try to get some sleep. Room was small and simple. No umbrella in the closet, basic amenities. Take a look at my uploaded picture - what's missing? What kind of maintenance do we have here?!I used the fitness room twice and it's a bit of a joke but not the worst that I have seen. Some lonely dumb bells but limited room to use them. Some pretty soak sweat cardio machines. Towels ran out, I called for more, after a one hour work out, they still didn't arrive. So this hotel is pretty average, basic and nothing special. If you got a better deal elsewhere, go for it!

I would recommend this Hotel because it satisfied all of my needs. It is 5 minutes to the metro, room was lux, very clean, nice sheets and bed.By the way it has a special room in case you want to leave your baggage.

This was our second stay at this hotel in 6 months. We liked it enough to come back another time. The location has excellent access to most of the city's subway lines. It is close to Soho, Chinatown, Little Italy and more. A drawback is the location on Canal street which is a busy thoroughfare with cars honking at all times but it didn't seem to bother us at night. I also really liked the proximity to La Colombe coffee shop just around the corner. Amazing coffee.The rooms are very comfortable and seem to have received a recent update. On this stay, we were in room 817 which faces Canal and even though its on a lower floor, it had a decent view of the rooftops of Soho. It was large by NYC hotel standards, small everywhere else. The bed was very comfortable. The room was clean. The bathroom was of decent size and nicely laid out. AC unit was quiet.Wifi is available free in the lobby only. Wifi in the room is an extra fee.Great friendly staff. Would definitely return.

Really beautiful hotel! Rooms are nicely decorated, very clean and spacious, the king size bed is really big and comfortable, bathroom is also very nice! Underground stations are close to hotel, so you can get anywhere in a short time, and Canal street is perfect if you wanna walk & explore Tribeca, SoHo, Chinatown or Little Italy. There is also a Starbucks coffe in the lobby and lots of food shops near hotel. Staff is the best hotel staff in the world, they were extremely nice and helpful! Sheraton Tribeca is my favorite hotel, and I would strongly reccomended it to anyone who wants decent and not so expencive hotel in NYC

Great hotel, stayed here for 1 night before leaving on a tour. This was the hotel our tour was leaving from. The lobby was completely organised so we knew exactly where our tour guide was and who could help us. Our rooms were small but beautiful, the bed was comfortable. We did book a room with 2 double beds and didnt get it, but that was our travel agents fault, not the hotels. Internet ran smoothly and was a great connection.All in all a great hotel not far from Little Italy or Chinatown.

Stayed here for 2 nights in early June '13 while on a business trip to NYC. I arrived early and didn't expect to be able to check-in. Not a problem at all - the front desk staff were super helpful and extremely efficient. My room was on the 20th floor - King Size bed, plenty of room, nice and clean and certainly a refreshing change to get a NYC hotel room that was a decent size! There is a Starbucks coffee stand towards the back of the lobby of the hotel and a decent sized bar area. Room service was quick, food was great and all in all, I would certainly recommend this hotel for anyone staying in this area of Manhattan as the transport links are good and the hotel is one of the best I've stayed in.

I was very satisfied with my stay at the Sheraton Tribeca, which is very close to Chinatown, along the busy Canal Street. Subway lines are less than two blocks away and the hotel was in great proximity to just about anything.Check-in was of the utmost in professionalism; the staff here appear to be on top of things. The doormen greeted me in a friendly way and I appreciated that the concierge allowed me to store my luggage prior to check-in. My room on the tenth floor featured some great views and was equipped with many amenities, from a large flat-screen television to an iPod player, mini-fridge, Starbucks coffee w/coffee maker and more. The plush king-size bed was EXTREMELY comfortable and I slept like a baby. The shower is large and tiled; great shower head. The climate was controlled by a digital thermostat, which worked well. Lots of pictures of Manhattan in the old days--nice touch.This is a great accommodation in an eclectic area of Manhattan. P.S.--try the food carts within a couple of blocks. Yum!

4/2013 - Prior to this stay I have always stayed in Midtown (Time Square) while those hotels are really nice - they come with a pretty price tag. And if you are in NYC why are you staying in the room? The city is 24/7! This trip since I was unsure of what the weather would be like I wanted something decently priced and near the Soho Greenwich Village area. The Sheraton Tribecca was perfect! It was walking distance to not only those areas but the Brooklyn Bridge and Little Italy. So this hotel gets an A+ on location. Yes the rooms are a little small - but it is manageable and extremely crean and modern. Note - The bed is heavenly here!The staff was extremely helpful and kind they were always there for questions and to wish you a great adventure or welcome you back from one. The staff + location + price give this hotel an excellent rating - I cant wait to go back!For more information and some picture see my blog http://goshrooney.blogspot.com/2013/06/new-york-new-york.html

Hidden in plain sight, this hotel and staff were great. Great room, big by NY standards. The exec lounge has a killer open air deck- only one I've seen in a NY hotel. Sleek, modern yet warm. I've stayed at the boutique hotels within walking distance- Grand, 60 Thompson- this hotel outdoes them for comfort and size, meets or bests ther service, but provides all the amenities of an SPG property. Very attentive, very friendly staff it was a great stay. I'll definitely come back. Will recommend to everyone. And now you get crossover rewards with SPG and Delta!

After a run of expensive, tiny New York hotel rooms, I was impressed with the Sheraton. Clean and modern, with a big lobby containing a Starbucks, as well as a bar and restaurant and computer area that's free for guests, it gave a great first impression. Check in was fast and hassle-free. Our room on the 15th floor was quiet, large and spacious for New York, clean, attractive, and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was also fairly spacious. Free Starbucks coffee in the rooms too. The location is good - just a couple of blocks from the Tribeca Blu, but the vibe outside the hotel is very different - it's properly in Tribeca rather than verging into Chinatown, and just 2 minutes walk from Canal Street stations. Easy walking distance to Soho, Little Italy, Tribeca, Chinatown, Financial District and the Lower East Side. Was really impressed with the location. And check out was speedy and unremarkable. I'd definitely return.

I usually stay in midtown when I travel to New York, but for this trip I needed to be near Tribeca early in the morning for a meeting, so I chose to stay at the Sheraton Tribeca. I think I'd have to rate this stay in my top 3 hotel experiences in New York. Ever. The hotel is nice, clean, and modern. The room we stayed in wasn't the biggest room, but the view was spectacular, the room was immaculate, and the bed was like sleeping on a cloud! The best part was the hotel staff though. Every single person I encountered, from the front desk staff to housekeeping, were all exceptionally helpful. I needed a late check out because of my meeting the next day and the girl at the front desk was extremely accommodating! The bell men were so friendly every time I left and returned to the hotel. And they were especially helpful when it was time to get a car back to the airport. The managers of this property should feel especially proud of themselves and their staff. I will highly recommend this hotel to my friends and we'll stay here again the next time we're in town. Highly Recommended!

My husband & I stayed here for our 10th anniversary. The hotel is clean and the rooms are above average. What makes this hotel standout is the customer service. Manager Steven Lamour and Bellman Michael Valentin are the best! Steven sent us champagne & chic. covered strawberries for our anniversary. Also we had an issue with our car and the parking garage. This issue caused us a great deal of stress. Steven took care of everything and made sure the issue was resolved. Michael was there for whatever we needed. He was extremely helpful and attentive. Stay here for the customer service!

Loved the stay there...the front desk,hotel ambience and the room was above par..but Eddie, the was simply the most courteous doorman i have ever come across ....he was v helpful n went out of his way to make my wife n parents comfortable...will come back again :)

We stayed at the Sheraton TriBeca overnight on a holiday weekend. I paid $136 for the room including tax on Priceline. We arrived at the hotel at 7am and parked on the street right across from the hotel. Free parking was great! Our plan was to park and then catch the subway to Time Square so we could take a tour, but we decided to stop by the hotel and just see if they would let us check in. I never expected they would actually say yes because it was 7am but they did which I thought was GREAT! I had emailed the hotel ahead of time to let them know it was our anniversary and they upgraded our room to a room higher up at no charge which was nice and not at all asked for since I was planning on paying the extra fee. We stayed in room 1216, which did not have the best view. The room was small but that’s New York people I’ve seen smaller. We toured around much of the day and returned to the hotel. When we got back there was a cheese and cracker plate waiting for us to thank us for staying. We got a great recommendation for a place to eat from the front desk. When we returned we realized one of our keys wasn't working so we stopped by the front desk to have it remade, they then offered us club access due to it being our anniversary, which included free breakfast. This to me was above and beyond! We planned to go the club lounge to sit but we ended up staying at the hotel bar. The only complaint I had about that was that the man behind the bar had his friends visiting him while he worked and when he poured me the wrong drink he then gave it to a women sitting down the bar and said "drink this". He was clearly in a hurry to get out of there because he did a last call early and began shutting everything down and cleaning around us. We asked him if he was in a hurry and he said he wanted to go out for his friend’s birthday, and pointed to a guy at the end of the bar, and said he could leave even if we were still sitting there. I found this to be rude, I understood it was a Sunday night, but it was definitely not consistent with the service in the rest of the hotel. We went up to the club level to see the view that night and WOW! The Empire State Building was all lit up it was beautiful. Cut to the next morning. I was woken up in the morning by loud people in the hallways, and they didn’t stop. You can clearly hear people in the hallway in the rooms. Again this did not ruin my stay, the rooms are close together and it’s not the hotels fault other guests are inconsiderate. We went to breakfast on the Club Level, and it was great, warm and cold options, bacon, potatoes, eggs, cereal, juices, fresh fruit, and the list went on. Check out was a breeze. I would recommend staying at this hotel to anyone the location, price, and service were better than I expected! My only complaints were the bartender and the hallway noise. So bring earplugs and go to a bar elsewhere. If you are staying for a special event let them know they will make your stay memorable.

We stayed at the Sheraton TriBeCa for 3 nights on our first trip to NYC. We got a decent rate on the room, $300 a night, and we felt it represented good value for money as far as NY hotels go. We got a premium room and it had the most amazing view across to the Empire State Building and certainly improved the sense of 'value'. The room was adequate, nothing fancy but comfy bed and everything we needed. The location on Canal Street, whilst not spectacular in itself, was at a fabulous proximity to SoHo and TriBeCa as well as close to a number of subway lines. The perfect location to explore downtown and still very easy access to Midtown and Uptown. I'd definitely stay again if we could get a similar rate, but not sure it would be worth the rates at the upper end of the scale. Staff were very friendly and helpful and the hotel also had a pretty decent gym.

The room was very small, the bed almost giving the room a cramped feel. Bed was comfortable, however, and the room was clean. Room had an updated look and feel, but rather bland over all. The bathroom seemed cramped, though the shower was large. It just didn't feel comfortable being in there, almost felt like you were in someone's basement bathroom that they just recently renovated. Exercise room also looked good, but didn't have a time to try it out. Hotel restaurant was adequate, had friendly service. The staff was super friendly, welcoming and helpful. I spent most of my time at the hotel in the lobby, which was comfortable, had free wifi, Starbucks, a decent bar and lots of computers. The lobby and staff made it a comfortable stay despite the mediocre room!Having stayed in more expensive hotels in NYC, I'd recommend this one for location and the lobby! It was situated perfectly to check out Soho, Tribeca and Chinatown.

The location of this hotel is great in terms of convenience as it is in Tribeca and within walking distance to lots of great stores, restaurants & bars. However, it is on canal st which is very busy and noisy 24 hours. If you are taking a taxi to the hotel, most cabbies will ask you if it is ok to drop you within a block or two of canal st as they don't want to get stuck in the traffic jam on canal st. Normally, this is ok but if it is a cold wintery night or if you are wearing high heels, it can be a bit of a pain. It is also disappointing that the hotel doesn't offer free wi-fi in the rooms. It is only available in the lobby. The rooms on the lower floors facing canal st are very noisy. Also, the water in the shower isn't very hot. It is only lukewarm. Overall, it is an average business hotel.

The pluses: The staff at the Sheraton could not be nicer, it has a small but very functional lobby. The free wi-fi works well there, they have newspapers and a Starbucks, and computers for guest use in the business center right there.The exercise room is good, with a lot of cardio, some free weights, and good mats, rollers, etc for stretching, abs, yoga, etc.The minuses:My room only had 2 very small windows in the corner and was dark. Shower but no bath, not a big deal, and the closet space was fine for one guy, but would have been a problem if I was travelling with my wife. Also there are no drawers for clothing.No matter how hard you try, you can't close the doors quietly. The locks make a very loud click, and if you try to close from the outside it's much worse. So be prepared to be woken up every time someone uses a door near you, unless you are a very heavy sleeper.

I've stayed at this hotel several times since its opening. While it's located on the crazy Canal street with its awful traffic and Chinatown stink, don't judge a book by its cover. Inside it is clean and modern and the staff is very helpful. I like to book this hotel because it is always well-priced given the quality of its rooms and you can walk almost everywhere from Chelsea to Battery Park. I've stayed for both business and for personal vacations.Please note:- Rooms are small if you're not used to NYC sizes. For example, a room with a king-sized bed has ~ 2 feet of extra space around it. But the rooms are well-designed so you don't feel (too) cramped.- Some rooms have water views. - There's a small lobby with a Starbucks and some lounge spaces.- You can hear traffic noise very slightly. With its double-paned windows, the honking below is muffled.Resources close-by:- Soho Pharmacy is around the corner.- Deli next door stocks beer, wine, ice cream, etc.- A couple of coffee houses within a block.

This Sheraton Hotel works quite well for a Manhattan weekend stay. Location is close to SoHo and Chinatown. We arrived by car late Friday night and was lucky to find street parking that's good for the entire weekend. Since it is close to Holland Tunnel, traffic can be quite congested at times. The hotel itself is quite nice as you would expect a Sheraton to be. Front desk receptions were all very pleasant. Check-in was quick and we were offered $5 credit if we don't use maid service the next day. We took the offer and put the $5 to good use the next day at the lobby's convenient store for Starbucks coffee and muffin. Our room on the second floor (room 212) is a bit small and the bathroom is extremely small but everything is nice and functioning well. We had a view of the building airconditioning system. Luckily it was a mild weekend; I wonder if it gets noisy in the summer. Not sure if the room size is the norm since we got quite a deal from priceline. Perhaps, rooms with regular rates would be larger. We would stay here again if we get another good deal from priceline.

Did lots of research to finally book this hotel based on some very positive reviews and they were bang on.While the lobby and check-in area was small and crowded and there was a bit of a wait to check in...the staff were extremely accommodating in upgrading our room per our request. They even acknowledged the special occasion for our visit..my brother's graduation from NYU with his PH. D. (had to add that because I am so proud).They didn't explain clearly the use of the room card in the elevator for every trip and there was sometimes an inordinate wait for the elevators. Appreciated the security system though. Front desk and concierge were phenomenal. They acknowledged us, wished us a good day and were generally engaged. How refreshing to not be treated like an intruder. The lounge on the 21st floor had a breathtaking view of the Hudson River, as did our room (1812) and well within walking distance. Breakfast was the usual eggs, bacon/sausages, hash brown potatoes, bagels, croissants, cereals, yogurt, juice and coffee. The happy hour treats (from 5-8 p.m.) were exceptional.The room was average (really the first time I have stayed in a hotel in NYC) but I understand it was roomy by New York standards.Loved the location. Close to the NQR and 123 lines... close to Chinatown and 1 or 2 blocks from Broadway and Canal. Lots of good shopping and people watch.Close by was a decent burger joint (Black Burger) and of course all the great places in Chinatown.Highly recommend booking a shuttle from the airport (LGA) as the cab fare was a bit more than we anticipated due to traffic conditions. Our driver was very concerned about the fare and suggested we get out and walk (3 blocks) instead of sitting in rush hour traffic and racking up an even higher fare.Also recommend a visit to the African Burial Ground operated by the National Parks Service. The Ranger on site (Chris) happy to share his knowledge and the history of the site. Didn't quite make it to the actual museum but be prepared for security checks as its located in a Federal Government building.A visit to the 911 memorial is also suggested. Get passes beforehand at 20 Vesey which gives a time to enter and be prepared to walk around in circles, go through security and finally see the grounds. Can also reserve online with a $2 fee. The infinity pool is a wonder. Can't wait until the museum opens. Always love going to New York, it is a world within a city.

We spent out Wedding Anniversary celebrating, dining & shopping in NYC and could not have asked for a more perfect hotel to stay in! Excellent price from Booking.com. Liz at the front desk could not have been more accomodating...thank you Liz! Eddy the doorman could not have been more helpful and is a wealth of knowledge....thank you Eddy!! Our room was on the top floor, facing east, no noise whatsoever. Housekeeping did an excellent job. We also had the luxury use of the Club Lounge. Our room was a great size especially considering the size of NYC hotel rooms. Great location and Canal Street is fun if nothing other than just to walk an people watch. Would definitely be a repeat guest here!

This is the perfect location and the best views I have ever had in New York. The staff makes me feel at home and remembered my name every time I came back to the hotel. I would stay here again and recomend this to anyone.

My wife and I have stayed at this hotel a couple of times now and each time we have been extremely happy. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful and go out of their way to answer any questions or help with everything.The location is also very good. We have stayed in several different locations through out the City and we have found that this hotel is a quick taxi, subway or walk to pretty much every destination through out New York.The price paid is also a big plus as many NYC hotels are incredibly expensive, while this hotel is moderately priced.

Just spent Mother's Day weekend there with my 77 year old mother. I've never been to a hotel where the bellman would NOT call a cab for you, but that was the case here. They didn't recognize my Starwood Gold status, just lots of little things that didn't get done. The rooms were nice, and there were lots of foreign tour groups there. Would be a great place for young people who can walk easily, but I won't go there again.

We all enjoyed our stay at this Hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful. for us the location was great. It is close to 2 subway stations and one can get there easily from the Airport. We really like the Tribeca, Soho and Greenwich Village area and the easy connections Uptown. I would recommend it.

I travel a good deal for business and pleasure and have found the Sheraton Tribeca NY to be a step above. From the large clean rooms, comfortable bed and very professional staff, to the great location. It is a great choice in Tribeca and it is a very consistent experience.

Trying to save some money on a last minute trip, my husband and I booked the hotel last minute and were pleasantly surprised by it. It was very nice and the lobby was really quite fancy. And the location is really fun as we are in our 20s and originally from NYC. I would stay here again if the price is right. The pros:Nice lobbyNice and helpful staff Good locationClean Free wifiThe cons:-The room was tiny and SO DARK, there was one window in the corner and it looked like a joke- the same thing you'd see in a prison cell. -the bathroom was also small- though cleanSo, all in all a pretty solid hotel for NYC and its price. Nothing really special but also nothing stopping us from returning especially considering the price.

I booked this Sheraton after looking at other reviews, and because I thought the price and location would be okay. Price was fine, hotel rooms are very, very small ( no drawers, nowhere to store a large suitcase, small wardrobe ). Exec lounge does have good views - of the neighbouring Canal Street area and the city in the distance.Neighbourhood is very dodgy and I witnessed a bag snatch right outside the hotel as I arrived and not a soul took action. To be fair to the Sheraton, this was not their fault but I did feel unsettled and unsafe. Because I'm British, and I don't like to upset folk, I lied to the hotel staff about why we were checking out. It's not their fault I had that experience after all. I went to the Sheraton in Times Square, which felt safe and secure, even though it was 10 times busier. I have learned that if a neighbourhood is described as 'bohemian' I will probably not be staying there in the future.

This is well located to get anywhere you need to go in Manhattan. Subway is right there, walk to Little Italy, Canal St, WTC....The rooms were decent size for New York and clean. The bartenders were great there as were the front desk.

My husband and I have stayed here since the hotel opened a few years ago, as it is very close to where our family live in SoHo. As retired professionals in the hospitality industry, we know how important the staff is to the operation and success of a lodging property. I can say with confidence that the staff at the Sheraton Tribeca is amazing--attentive and genuinely concerned. The hotel is clean, well located in a really "hip neighborhood" and a very good choice for travelers who want to feel like they are staying in "a home away from home!"

We stayed in this modern hotel during our visit to N.Y. and felt like we were in the middle of all the action. The proximity to deluxe shopping a few hundred meters away in the fashion district as well as good quality restaurants made this hotel an excellent choice. Two blocks away from Little Italy and walking distance to Lower Manhattan if you have the legs, you couldn't ask for a better location. The Hotel is modern and whilst the rooms are on the smaller scale for a hotel with this rating, one has to remember that it's N.Y. The staff was courteous however not exactly friendly which doesn't matter if you are out and about all the time but nevertheless dampens your enthusiasm for recommending to others. Take a left outside the hotel and the delicatessen next door has fantastic bagels and 20 or so different creamed cheese toppings. Take a right and walk to the next block and on the side street you'll find Colombe with great strong coffee and almond croissant. Great view from roof terrace but limited access makes it a bit tricky to get on there. A taxi up to RadioCity was 12 bucks...cheap as chips.

Room was a good size. Location was wonderful. No issues with noise. The staff were great. Friendly, helpful and courteous. Would be very very happy to return. Was part of a package deal and was an excellent value. 3 Subways within 2 blocks in either direction.

During our stay at the hotel, most of the receptionists were unhelpful and made a number of important mistakes. The internet connection was unreliable. The room was extremely small. Further details are below:1. When I arrived, they told me I didn't have a booking with the hotel. Then they found my booking and I waited for about 20 mins for them to save the booking into their system. 2. They charged me around US$1307 from my bank account and initially denied that they had done so. I then managed to contact their billing department and received a confirmation that they indeed charged the amount. They should have checked more carefully before responding my questions. 3. I was not able to use the login details to connect the internet. I had to call their IT team to manually connect my devices. 4. The king sized room was extremely small and there was little walking space. 5. The view from my room was bad. My window was facing another building next door. The distance between the buildings are so close that people living in the other building can easily what I'm doing in my room. 6. Gym is very small. I felt packed when there were only 4 people in the room. 7. They only have one restaurant, which served expensive and low quality food. The only good thing about the hotel is that it is located in a nice neighbourhood and is close to SoHo, Chinatown and Greenwich Village.

We've stayed at this hotel about half a dozen times over the last year and a half (usually on a Priceline deal). I am appalled at some of the choices they've made here given that it is marketed and priced like a "full service" Sheraton (versus a stripped down "value" choice). We like the Canal St location -- it works for us as close to transportation, Soho and the financial district. The lobby is a bit nicer and more comfortable than most of the value-line hotel lobbies. My biggest gripes are the super-thin plastic cups (exactly 2 are supplied), only two paper coffee cups and only two bath towels provided and the loudest bathroom fan ever (that comes on with the light). Not a single real glass provided in the room, and they can't even give 3 or 4 of the thin plastic cups (eg. 2 in the bathroom & 2 with the ice bucket)? Just 2 small bath towels? The rooms are typical small NY rooms but instead of maximizing surface space with rectangular desk and a square night table, they put in an oval desk and round night table. The bathroom has a nice stall shower (albeit with super boring and cheap looking matte beige tile) but the vanity surface again could have been a bit larger & rectangular to compensate for smallness. Sheraton is a brand that I think of as about on par with Hilton, in some cities abroad they are a very deluxe choice. I normally stay at one of three Hilton's near Herald Square/Chelsea when in Manhattan, two of which are Hilton Garden Inns. The HGI's are so much better than the set up here, not only can they see fit to provide real glasses but you also get a minifridge and microwave, and real cable channels including NY1. The Hilton on W.26th St is more upmarket so you get a mini-vending-bar rather than a fridge, but you also get real glasses, great bed linens, plenty of towels and good prices.

Stayed three nights end April 2013. Friendly staff. Decent size clean room. No complaints at all. Was just as expected. Located close to holland tunnel so good for a sharp exit to New Jersey or to Newark airport. Canal street a tad downmarket and traffic always very busy. Easy walk to bars shops and restaurants of Soho. If you want to be in that part of town then this is a good option. Not a place to hang out save for a late night drink. Eat all meals out....there are loads of options close at hand. Good Irish "dive" bar round the corner for a beer and a bit of local colour.....

The hotel on Canal Street is conveniently located to several subway stations and close to many places downtown. The customer services/check-in staff were friendly and helpful and the concierge was very helpful finding a place to eat for Cinco de Mayo. The rooms were very clean and had all the necessary requirements. The bed was very comfortable and the TV had a good selection of free channels and not just your standard channels. The shower/bathroom was more of a wet room so it would get very wet in there while having a shower but certainly had no complaints.

Great location near all of lower Manhatten.Get the hop on hop off bus from Concierge.Eddie and Dave great job guys always helpful day or night with smiles.Rooms okay as we were out and about seeing the sights.Thanks again Eddie and Dave

This hotel is fine. Clean and staff is friendly and seem to have it organized well. Canal street can be a bit icky looking but there are many place to eat that are good within walking distance. Not a fancy boutique but pretty standard for a business hotel. The 21st Club level room is a nice place for a drink and the sunset.

This hotel is clean and tidy as you expect and in a great location, but it's nothing special. We paid $320 one of the nights we stayed here, it didn't include breakfast and when we enquired about the roof terrace we were told it was $70 per day! I love New York but I didn't get the same feeling about the hotel unfortunately.

Stayed here two days before the disastrous Westin Grand Central - This is a very nice hotel. It is either new or recently updated. Has great views from higher floor and the Club level has a great terrace. Rooms were clean, nice and modern. The bedding seems to have been upgraded and the bed was comfortable. The lux level is not there (i.e not W or Le Meridian) but it is a Sheraton and good value for the money and was/is a lot better than other mid priced hotels in Manhattan. I have to say, the doorman, checkin, housekeeping - really everyone we ran into was quite nice, greeted you and seemed happy to have you and be there themselves. On drawback the auto valet spilt something in my car that needs to be cleaned (a little mad but it did not stain). They could have cleaned it up though or at least said something about it.

I spend 5 nightsin this hotel. Really good location just between soho and TriBeCa and had really good time there. Rooms are small but really nice.But I left the hotel back to Europe with my IPad still in the safe of my Sheraton room!!!!! And I realised that just one hour from taking off from Newark!l!! Thanks to Michael James (front desk manager at night) and Kevin from security my IPad was in good hands and they succeed to send it back to home before I get there!!! True magic!!!!!I'd like to thanks them again because they were really nice and took the time to listen to me (even with my bad English with my French accent) and took all this story rally seriously!!!Thank you again Sheraton to build so nice hotel and with your amazing team full of nice people you really make traveling a nice and safe journey!!!!!

First time staying there. It's for wedding anniversary and we got free upgrade with VIP club@top floor drinks+snacks (happy hour) & breakfast (next morning). Both standards are very high (much better than from a NY Hilton) which are very pleasant surprises.Staff are very friendly, young & energetic. From reception (young black lady) to concierge to club staff are all cheerful.Although the room is not very spacious, it's new and functional. The whole building is modern boutique design. It's on Canal St (Soho) and next to Chinatown / downtown. Metro is round the corner.

The service is the best. I cant remember all of them but, Eddie and the Concierge people are so helpful and nice. The location of this Hotel was perfect for my trip. It is walking distance to Chinatown and SoHo. The rooms are clean, a bit small, but this is common for most hotels in NYC. There is a Bar, Restaurant, and Starbucks in the Hotel. Great Deli next door for Fresh Smoothies, Bagels and snacks, in general. I would stay here again.

if you are staying in the tribeca area, this hotel is centrally located near the subway stations. the hotel itself is a bit tired, as is the immediate neighborhood. however, the convenient location and friendly staff make for a comfortable stay. canal street is a bit busy so there is some street noise. the only problem that i encountered was that the reception staff were not familiar with the starwood/delta cross over awards program and the related benefits. i would have expected them to have some knowledge about their own program! other than this issue, i was impressed with each member of the staff all of whom displayed courtesy, professionalism, and friendly service.

Just returned from a one-night stay at the Sheraton Tribeca which I booked through lastminutetravel.com. For the “bargain” price of $213 including taxes for a standard king room, this hotel did not disappoint. The location was close to many subway stops and my room (1112) was clean, comfortable and quiet. The bathroom was small but modern. There were no visible signs of wear and tear which is almost expected with many touristy NYC hotel rooms. Staff members were very friendly and attentive, especially the concierge and Susanah, one of the front desk clerks. I definitely plan to return.

Stayed at the Sheraton for one night two weeks ago. The location is absolutely perfect if you're planning on checking out Soho, Tribeca and Chinatown. We found that it was very easy to move around. The room was spacious, clean and the bed was soooo comfy! Did not want to get out of it :) The concierge was really polite and helpful. Bar in the lobby was pretty fancy too! Pity we didnt have time to have a drink. Would def stay again!

I traveled solo to New York in April 2013 and stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca NY Hotel. This was a very enjoyable experience, and I can definitely say that I hope to return to this hotel on future visits to NYC. I made the reservation online using the hotel's website and used my SPG (Starwood Preferred Guest) membership to my advantage. My rate was very competitive with similar properties in this part of Manhattan, south of Houston St. It included in-room internet at no extra charge, plus the daily breakfast buffet at their restaurant off the lobby. I requested and was assigned a guest room with a clear (big-window) view to the north of the Midtown skyline.Both check-in and check-out were a breeze, and I arrived a few hours early on my first day (a Saturday morning), and they were able to check me into a room right away. My guest room was clean, modern, well-appointed and nicely decorated. Everything worked very well, including the climate control. The room was actually slightly larger than I am accustomed to for NYC, and that included the bathroom, which was modern and plenty large enough for me. The king-size bed was super comfortable, and the desk was set up perfectly for internet access and my laptop. I could have used a couple of more electrical outlets in the room to plug in all my gadgets, but I did what I needed to do by just not plugging all things in simultaneously.There was plenty of hot water for my showers, and I took them at different times of the day. My room was quiet for sleeping; I was on the 14th floor, overlooking Canal St. The floors each have ice machines and beverage vending machines. The breakfast buffet was good, although not outstanding. I got plenty to eat each morning and was satisfied with the variety. The restaurant is not large, so a big group traveling together might be a little cramped in there, but as a solo traveler, I was comfortable. They have a nice sitting area in the lobby, with a bar and a grab-and-go snack venue, which is open throughout the day. The fitness center is one floor up.I found the hotel staff to be friendly and professional. Most are young; all seem very hardworking. The bell staff can give you directions to anywhere in the city, and a front-desk team member helped me choose a nice restaurant within a close walking distance in Tribeca for my final evening there. She made the reservation for me. Wi-fi is available in the hotel lobby and sitting area.This part of NYC abounds with restaurants, bars and shopping, and the Sheraton Tribeca is situated at a good access point for the exciting surrounding neighborhoods. A short walk, and you have easy access to a great variety of eating, drinking and shopping venues. It is a short walk to Chinatown and Little Italy to the east, and Soho is directly north of the hotel. Greenwich Village is only a few blocks' walk, and Tribeca is immediately to your south.The subway system's Canal Street station entrance is literally just around the corner from the hotel. I bought a refillable Metro card at the beginning of my stay and never needed a taxi. That includes from JFK airport into the city. I traveled by train from JFK to the hotel and back on this trip. Take the JFK Sky Train to the Howard Beach station, where you can get your Metro card and then access the A line train for a ride that had me at Canal Street station in less than 45 minutes.The city has done a lot to remove old obstacles in the stations to bringing along reasonably sized luggage. Old narrow turnstiles have been replaced by wider pedestrian gates through which you can pull your luggage, assuming it is not over sized and you keep moving. However, you still have to go up stairs to get back to ground level at many of the stations, so keep this in mind when deciding whether to go into the city by taxi or train. Anyway, the train is a viable option to consider if you want to save taxi fare to the Sheraton Tribeca, and if you have compact luggage, and are reasonably fit. This hotel does also have Canal Street curb front taxi access, and the bell staff can assist you, of course.Overall, I enjoyed the modern, progressive, well-located and well-connected feeling I had during my stay in this hotel. I hope to return to the Sheraton Tribeca the next time I am in or near lower Manhattan.

I stayed here while on an "Explore the US East Coast" tour with colleagues. The hotel was a great hub for exploring the city - near the subway and near interesting neighbourhoods like SoHo, Chinatown and Little Italy. There is a Starbucks counter where you can get a coffee and yoghurt if you do not want the breakfast buffet. For our last evening, I was the only one in the group who wanted to see a musical, but being groggy and tired from travelling I was not up to spending hours on TImes Square for a ticket. Martin the concierge rang around, got me a great last minute seat at "Chicago", gave directions and even walked me up to the subway station when I couldn't find it. The evening ended up being my best of the entire tour.On a down note, my 2 colleagues and I were booked in a double room. We had to share two 140 cm wide beds and two sets of towels. I would have expected an extra sofa bed being made up and an extra set of towels provided.

We stayed in the Sheraton Tribeca over March 25, 2013 weekend. The price was right and the Sheraton chain is reliable. The hotel looked great and the staff was helpful. The problem is, despite the updated decor, there was very little sound insulation. For example, we stayed in a room that adjoined another one. With both doors closed (we did not actually join the rooms) we could hear every word of the conversation in the other room at normal conversation volume. They were speaking a language we didn't understand, fortunately. We could also hear whenever any door in the immediate vicinity of our room opened and closed. So even though it was nicely updated, we won't be staying there again.

The best part is stunning view from the patio in the club lounge on the 21st.When you pay 200 to 400 for a room you expect some basic amenities to be available when you need it.Staff are polite and attentive..Very convenient for great eateries around the area. The A train from around the corner to mid town in 25 mins.

The rooms are decent and the hotel is ideally placed for those who fancy wandering around the funkier independent shops in NYC. The only downside, and a massive one at that, was the price of an international phone call. I was charged over $1000 for three calls to the UK, which is insane. I have tried to complain about this, but the hotel is refusing to answer my calls or emails. Be VERY WARY!!!!!!

The Sheraton Tribeca is a very common big hotel with a friendly staff in a very hot place of NYC. On the Canal Street, at the side of the very vibrant neighbourhood of Soho, at the side of Tribeca and Little Italy. Difficult to find a better space if you like to go for shopping in a trendy neighbourhood, full of boutiques, restaurants, bars and attractive places to visit.In itself the hotel and the rooms are nothing special, but the room is big, modern, clean and offer you coffee and free internet. You have a subway station 5 minutes walking. And I appreciate so much to be in the lower part of NYC. I could recommend it, even if, with taxes, you will have to pays around 270 US dollars a night + an extra of 30 $ for breakfast, better to go for eating outside, with a lot of shops and small friendly cafeterias. Expensive, but we are in NY, and a such a pleasure to go along the streets in spring season. Be care, a lot of temptation to spend money very close from here. Enjoy!

This is a decent mid-range hotel catering to a mixed bag of tourists and business travelers. It is relatively new so everything is in good repair and perfectly adequate. The main detraction is the location directly on Canal Street, which any New Yorker will tell you is the armpit of the city. The surrounding Soho and Tribeca area is great - it is just Canal Street itself that is the problem. It is not dangerous, just grimy and always choked with traffic.I paid around $170 a night which is good value for money and it did the job just fine. Rates fluctuate a lot for NY hotels so if you can get this for under $200 a night I would go for it but I'd be wary of paying much more than that unless you have few options.

We stayed for just one night and the hotel was just fine. Room was a decent size. Bed was very comfortable with high quality linens. Bathroom was a good size and exceptionally clean.Staff was very warm and accommodating. Bellman noticed that I was looking for a trash can and took it to throw away. The concierge even circled the lobby to see if he could help anyone out.$10 WIFI is the only drawback if you are just looking to check you e-mail. Although there are work stations in the lobby which are free. Still, there is no excuse for any hotel to charge for WIFI at this point.

I have stayed at this Sheraton a few times when in NY for sales meetings. It is convenient to many of the sights in lower Manhattan and SOHO. It attracts business travelers as well as tourists. Compared with many other hotels in NY, this one lacks charm and is fairy utilitarian, but it makes up for this with a warm and helpful staff, well appointed rooms, and a lobby with lots of computers to use, plenty of free newspapers, and a coffee bar that serves Starbucks, breakfast, and lunch items. I have not tried the hotel restaurant. If you are looking for a convenient spot downtown, you should definitely check it out.

Let's get this straight, this isn't a full-service hotel and it isn't up there with the mid-town four star experiences, but it isn't priced at that. What you get with this hotel is a business-focused hotel for the price concious traveller. The rooms aren't spacious, but they are clean, the bed and pillows are comfortable and the bathroom and shower adequate. It's not in a great area, but a short walk or taxi takes you into the nicer parts of downtown, and there is a subway entrance just up the road. The bar seems to be a bit of an afterthought, tacked on to the lobby, and the restaurant is lower priced (although the quality of the food is not high-end).What you get, therefore, is a room that you can sleep in, with access to the internet at $9.99 a day and a base on the edge of Tribeca. It's not the Trump Soho, but if you want that you can stay there for 40% more a night or more. The staff are friendly and seem willing to help and getting taxis is relatively easy outside.

We had fabulous service here, from the check in to check out and every request in between.The door men chased down cabs in the pouring rain and quickly had a lobby full of people on ther way to enjoy their stay in NYC. We requested a fridge and it was there and set up within minutes..they even called to make sure we were happy with it. The only down side was the crummy wine list in the bar and the 10.00 per day internet in the room. The area was a bit sketchy feeling at night, but we walked every night and had no problems.The gyn was really too crowded to use on the weekend, but was fine during the week.

We stayed here for 4 nights and we're greeted upon check-in by a rude non-enthusiastic clerk who seemed inconvenienced by our presence. The hotel lobby is modern except the actual rooms which are small and hallways outdated. Wifi is extra $10 p/day however free Internet in the lobby is provided. The doorman are helpful and friendly which is contrast to the reception staff who don't like to help tourists! I was quite shocked at the service walking into a Sheraton hotel.. The rooms are cramped, bed sheets are not changed daily and carpet dirty. The folded towels had hair in them and besides that the price you pay to stay here can only be justified by the location on tribeca area and chinatown just down the road. A little bit shady walking down Canal at night but besides that would not recommend as there are plenty of hotels in NYC offering accommodation for the same price and location and far superior service experience.

Don't be fooled by the "Soho" in the title of the hotel. The Canal Street is as Chinatown as Chinatown gets. The street is shady at night and full of bargain souvenir-shops by day. However, turn in the other direction and you get a wonderful real-New York feel that you won't find in the city center.PROS- clean room, helpful staff, easy-access computer area to print boarding passes and tickets, ATM in the lobbyCONS- not quite the Sheraton quality you get in Europe, very small rooms, 10$/day WiFi in roomsTip: There's a Deli right next door with excellent fresh fruit, try it.

Usually when I travel to New York I stay with family so I don't have a good barometer for what is considered a good value in NYC. I've stayed at Sheraton's in other cities so thought we couldn't go wrong. Our room was a bit pricy but was still low compared to other hotels we looked at.
