There's no parking at the hotel so we self parked across the street at Wooster parking on Wooster street. You can also drive your car to the entrance and they'll valet park for you at Wooster. Our self park price was $41/night--high but that's big city for you! The best thing about the hotel is its location. Canal Street is very busy with shops and vendors. Very close to Holland Tunnel but with NY traffic, it takes awhile to get there. Close to subway and Chinatown is nearby. Plenty of Chinese restaurants on Mott Street. Dunkin Donuts across the street and McDonald's down the street. There's also a bagel shop right next to the hotel. We ate at McDonald's one morning and it was close. We also went to a Thai Restaurant named 35 which is very very close to the hotel. My husband found it on an App and it had good reviews so we tried it. Food was very good and reasonable. Our family of 5 stayed in a room with 2 double beds. My kids, 14,12, and 5 slept in one bed and we slept in the other. The room size is neither big or small for NY but it's very tight for us. They did not have rooms with sleeper sofas. The elevators are very slow and you need your room key to access. Decor is modern and sleek and the beds are comfortable. We got there before check-in time so they held our luggage for us so we can start our sightseeing. I highly recommend this hotel.

First, I was placed in a room (supposedly a jr. suite) with the desk, TV, chair etc right in front of the window; the TV 12 inches from the bed on the extreme left. On the website, you see only floor to ceiling windows, so I called after a few claustrophobic moments, and they gave me a smaller room, but I got the floor to ceiling windows. Room service during the royal wedding was a joke. They did not deliver what was on the menu, had multiple omissions, and the breakfast was late and cool. Oh, and 1 pot of water for tea with one tea bag (no selection of Tazo teas). This seems trite, but here is the big thing. I budget! I keep what I can charge in my account (bank credit/debit). I go out to a show and dinner, and my credit card is rejected (with plenty available). They keep my license and tell me to go to the show...straighten it out later. Well, couldn't enjoy the show, went back to the restaurant and still the card is not good. Couldn't use debit as we took out the limit...but there's plenty available. Call my parents to get a card number to pay the bill after the show...embarrassing! Of course the night was a disaster. Called my credit union the next AM, and they tell me the Sheraton charged...CHARGED my card an extra $400.00 IN CASE I ordered anything else. Now, if there are any attorneys out there, isn't charging my account without my authorization (and without telling me) a felony or at least fraud. I could have been arrested the night before, lost my job and reputation....everything, and were they Rabda or Steven (the manager) reactive or understanding....NOPE! Too bad, so sad! This is how we do it. Well, I've stayed all over the world. The hotels have the credit card info...if you left with a towel, they'd charge you. I believe this is the worse hotel experience I've had, save Costa Rica, where a friend died because of no medical supplies on premises (AED). So, what to do? Review, blog, and hopefully find a good attorney because I could have lost everything because of the jerks at the desk and in accounting. Don't stay here. They don't care about you.

my wife and i traveled to new york for our tenth wedding anniversary and our first time ever leaving the state of florida, not knowing what we were in for we would soon find out. upon arrival we were first greeted by michael one of the bellman and i must say the abosolute best at his job an asset to your company, we were allowed to check in early, our luggage taken to our room for us by another bellman all is good.we settled in and went dinner at the restaurant on property of which was great, then to the starbucks of which the entire staff was magnificent we never waited for anything we were on first name basis from the first visit and for the whole week as soon as they seen us every morning they had our order ready for us. as if the attention to detail was not enough on the day of our anniversary , one of the hotel managers i cant remember his name but day to day he greated me by my first name which i thought was awesome being is he deals with so many people on a day to day basis, anyways on our anniversary he saw us having breakfast in the lounge he came up to me and told me in honor of our anniversary breakfast was on them and to come back for a speacial dinner also on them, i felt so impressed, i told them we felt like family there and were made to feel right at home.we come from a small island in florida that is totally tourist based and i can tell you that hotel you guys have there is very speacial , whatever you guys are doing dont stop you are for sure top notch in our book, we are already planning our next stay, sincerly jackie & michael cervantes, key west fl.

Good value for money. Location is close to subway stations, making it easy to move around. Rooms are of reasonable size (for NY even good), clean and comfortable. Maybe breakfast does not make it into the top 10.

Just a block from the subway. Nice rooms but not luxurious. This is a Sheraton not the St. Regis. Starbucks in the lobby w/o the hotel markup. Best of all - you can actually open the windows for fresh air!

Terrific hotel in an amazing area of NYC. I am a Corporate traveler, senior management, and this hotel had one of the best views of the Empire State building I have had to pleasure to view from my room on the 16th floor. The staff from check-in, maid service and bar personnel where friendly, welcoming and professional. The room was extremely comfortable, state of the art connections and no street noise! The film festival was in progress and yet the hotel never seemed hurried or congested. Highly recommend.

Question: What do you do when you are the Manager of a hotel in Tribeca during the Film Festival and the market prices on your room has increased dramatically but you are sold out and unable to benefit from this rising demand?Answer: You re-run the every credit card that was held to use a room and you re-sell any were the credit card has since expired.I tried to check in and was told my room had been given away. The city was entirely sold out and it was impossible to get another room. There were 4 parties stranded in the lobby in the exact same situation all trying to find a bed to sleep in because this property gave away all of our rooms (at we can assume is a much higher rate) If you book a hotel months or weeks in advance, why is the property only checking the reservation hours before check-in?! This hotel is run like a sleazy motel. I can't rate the rooms cause I never saw one, but I can strongly tell all travelers to avoid due to a money-hungry management team that will throw you out on the street if there is an opportunity to make a few more dollars. I know there were lots of people left in this same situation this week. Please do as I have done and post your account online. It's shady business practices like this that need to be stopped.

Hi I stayed this is hotel 4-14-11. There was a young man that worked at the concierge's desk, his name is Micheal. You could tell he loved his job and went above and beyond to help us out. First he brought my husbands laptop that he left in the lobey up to our room. Then he helped with directions, going on line because I could not remember the name of where we wanted to go, got us a map and helped with train info also. He is such a pleasant young man. Actually the front desk staff were all welcoming and very helpful.Thank youBarbara Fuchs

Room types are listed as: "Traditional King - Non-refundable" and for $25 more, "Traditional King."Now, a rational person would assume that one of those room types is refundable and one is not. That you are risking saving $25 if you are 100% sure plans will not change. Sadly, this is not the case. both room types are non-refundable, and they are happily ripping you off if you choose to pay $25 extra in case plans change, because if they do, you will still be billed in full.Shame on you, Sheraton Tribeca.

Amazing place... The hotel is great but tribeca makes the rest. I was there for a cinema's show and it has been a sublime experience.Rooms are big and comfortable. I had the smallest/cheapest and it was already very good. I would choose it more to live Tribeca and Soho (nearby) in a trendy and cool place rather than for the amenities, which by definition are among the best!The hotel has great things to offer among which one of the trendiest and coolest cocktail atmospgere in town!

What a great location. Just north of Tribeca and at the start of SoHo, this new hotel is exactly where my wife and I wanted to spend our couples get away in NYC. We had a good size room that was very clean and faced north looking right at the empire state building. We couldn’t have asked for a pretty view at night with the lights of NYC twinkling. The bed was so comfortable my wife wanted to buy one to bring home. Thank goodness we took the train down. We splurged a bit and got a club level room. This was definitely worth it, not only because of the freebies they hand out but because the club lounge has the best view in the whole hotel up on the 21st floor with a huge patio with a 270 degree view of new york. Everyone on the staff was friendly and helpful. The bell man even suggested a great breakfast place called Bubbies a few blocks away. The hotel is right around the corner from a bunch of great restaurants in Greenwich Village and SoHo. The place we ate at on Friday night was perhaps one of the best we have ever been to anywhere. The place was called David Burkes Kitchen. I knew the name from Top Chef but was still impressed by what was served. I will definitely return to the Sheraton Tribeca hotel and am already planning my next trip.

The Sheraton Tribeca is a relatively new hotel downtown, close to the trendy shops in SoHo. My room was stylishly decorated, in good condition and very clean. The room was not very large, but fine for a night's stay, and the bed itself was very comfortable. The bathroom was well appointed and the shower had good water pressure. The bathroom amenities included a hair dryer, soap, shampoo, conditioner and body lotion. There were also coffee and tea making facilities in the room, but no fridge. What continues to bug me about the big chains is that they continue to charge for internet access. This was partly mitigated by "The Link" facility in the lobby which consisted of multiple PCs with internet access in a new environment in which you could work. There is free wifi, but from what a colleague said, it sounded like there was a limit to the number of people who could use it at the same time. There is a Starbucks in the lobby and there is an onsite restaurant and the staff were friendly. Would I stay here again? If I had a meeting downtown, then maybe, although I suspect there may be slightly cheaper options nearby.
The rooms are small, but in NYC you have to expect it. Its in Tribeca, so only about a 30 minute walk to Midtown.

We had a most enjoyable time. There is so much to see and a week is not long enough.The hotel was new, the room was small, but the staff there was fantastic. Notably, Jarrett Royster went above and beyond the call of duty. We were never at a loss, because they answered all of our questions and made sure we got what we needed. We enjoyed getting around via the wonderful subway system and always felt safe. The best part is that it is very inexpensive. The location of the hotel is its biggest draw because you are very close to Little Italy, Chinatown, SoHo and World Trade Center. The entrance to the Subway is a few steps away. Bring money, New York is not a cheap vacation!

What a find! This new (opened fall 2010) hotel is perfectly located between Soho and Tribeca-- the best parts of New York City, if you ask me! Close to tons of shopping and great neighborhood restaurants, you get to experience New York the way New Yorkers do. Walking distance to the village too!Take advantage of all this great hotel has to offer: super friendly and helpful staff, great lobby, and the club rooms are great. One of the bonuses of the being on the club level: a gorgeous roof deck with a view straight uptown to the empire state building.Other things of note: subway in the same block will get you anywhere you want to go both up and downtown, the parking nearby if you drive in, and the beds are AMAZING!We'll definitely be back!

I took my two eldest kids on a trip to New York to celebrate my retirement. I had booked this hotel via our local travel agent (requesting a treble room, all endored on travel documents). On arrival we found that we had been booked a double! (Not the hotels fault, but Gold Medal). Rather than engage in the usual shoulder shrugging and 'it aint our fault' attitude that you get in some places, the duty staff, Zakiya McFayden and the day manager Steve Lamour made every effort to get us accomodated. Although they dont do trebles, Steve took us to several rooms that he felt may be suitable, eventually sorting us a very pleasant room that included a comfortable fold out couch. Not satisfied that we were getting the best from our accomodation and expectations Steve also gave us complimentary access to facilites that we hadnt booked. The hotel itself is set on Canal Street, a busy road near the Holland Tunnel which on occasion can get hectic with commuter traffic. We didnt find any issue with the traffic noise. After all, you ARE in one of the busiest cities in the World. You just have to turn on the air con if its too hot, and close the window!Our room was comfortable, well maintained, and had that clean smell you'd expect with daily visits by the cleaning staff. The usual room facilties (TV/tea & coffee, etc) were availble. The fold out couch was more than enough for me, and the hotel arranged extra bed linen/quilt. The hotel itself is well decorated and maintained. The staff are pleasant, accomodating, and refreshingly knowledgable about both Tribeca and New York in general.The food and drink prices are on a par with what you would get at any tourist city hotel anywhere in the world so I dont have any issues.Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Sheraton Tribeca. As a base for exploring NYC we found it completely suitable for our needs. Set in quieter surrounds than any hotel near the mayhem that is Times Square. We had easy access to the subway/buses, or indeed a very pleasant walk up to Midtown along either Avenue of the Americas or 5th Avenue.The staff again need mentioning because they prevented this holiday turning into a disaster. They DIDNT need to provide complimentaries as it wasnt the hotels fault, but the fact that they did can only exemplify the very high standard od customer care & service......Next time we head for New York City I know where to book.....

I had enjoyed my hotel stay until I went to the restaurant for breakfast. There was only one other person in the restaurant, so I could not have anticipated what was about to occur. I was seated straight away, and the server took my order immediately which was great. He also brought my beverage to me without delay. I ordered an egg white omelet listed on the menu, so no special order. I was then asked if I wanted fruit or potatoes and I opted for the fruit. However, I then sat for over 15 minutes without my food arriving. I did not get told by the server that there was any particular issue or delay in the kitchen. As I was getting increasingly frustrated, given that the restaurant was dead and no one except myself had ordered any food during this entire time (the 1 other person's food arrived a few minutes after I sat down ... I have no idea how long he waited for his!), I got up from my seat and walked over to the host area and asked if he was the manager. He said yes, I told him what had happened, and he then said he would go back to the kitchen to inquire. Meanwhile, a few minutes after I returned to my seat, another server brought my omelette and it had potatoes instead of fruit on the plate. I then asked for an explanation regarding why the order took so long AND why I was being given potatoes when I ordered fruit instead. This server was not the one who had taken my order, so she looked surprised and said she would return with it fixed. I then waited several more minutes, and it arrived. The manager then returned to the table to give me the most lame explanation, he said that the kitchen supports several areas of the hotel (room service, some club, etc.) as if that was supposed to make me feel better. I then said that it was shocking that it took 20 minutes to get an omelette when there was only me and one other person in the restaurant, he then repeated his previous explanation that the kitchen supports more than just the main restaurant. I then suggested that maybe there is not enough staff to which he responded by saying there are 2 chefs and this is the right amount and lack of staff is not the explanation. He then said he would comp the meal (would have been shocked at this point if he had not done so). The further upset was that although the omelette and fruit were ok -- nothing to write home about! -- the toast was burned! As I left the restaurant, I told him that I left the burnt toast and that I would be going to write this up on Tripadvisor. This was very unfortunate because although the hotel is on a very busy street -- Canal -- it is priced relatively well and is new which makes for a reasonably comfortable and good value hotel in New York. However, after the experience with the restaurant, I will not stay here again.

The hotels rooms itself are decently sized, but if you don't have a means of transportation catching a taxi on that side of town can be a bit difficult. As far as customer service...during my stay I had no major problems with Sheraton Tribeca, but not following through with complete customer service for guests after their stay means no returning clients! After staying almost a week at Sheraton Tribeca I realized I left behind my trench coat in the closet of my hotel room. I called the next day and found out that it was missing, but no other guests were assigned to that room. And no one but the cleaning lady was in it (the other woman that cleaned the room earlier during my stay remembers seeing my trench coat). The only solution they would provide for me was to claim it on MY insurance. After refusing I spoke with the manager of housekeeping who had to report this situation to the front office manager. It has been over a month since my theft and I have yet to hear back from this manager, Steven LaMoore. Whenever I call to speak to him, I only get that he's in a meeting or he's not available and emails and messages are supposedly sent to him to contact me back. I am told that he is busy but not even a courtesy call to let me know that he is aware of my situation or even an email in response would be polite. Maybe if I take legal action and file for litigation I will be taken seriously. I feel disrespected to not even get any sort of response back from the ONLY manager that seems in charge of matters of this nature. Sheraton boasts of making several billion dollars worth of renovations, but maybe they needn't have to go to that extremes of drawing customers to their hotels if they focused more on hospitality.

A great location for a very busy relatively new hotel. The rooms are small, very efficiently laid out and very comfortable. Clearly a lot of planning went into making the most out of the space. A great find is the restaurant which has healthy selections, (along with buffalo wings, which a fellow restaurant patron raved about) that are flavorful. After a long cross country flight and not wanting to go out again, we had soup in the restaurant and it was great. The restaurant staff and the food and beverage manager are terrific, very accommodating and friendly. Some of the front desk staff (day and night) seemed more impressed with themselves than with helping guests-we suggest more training or a new staff. The senior management is terrific and responded immediately to our concern about our floor becoming a weekend party location for locals and an error in the billing process. Overall, a great property-Sheraton should be proud.

A long weekend to celebrate my son's birthday became a special memory thanks to the kindness and the hospitality offered by the staff of this hotel. Not only was the room pristine and the amenities top notch, the real draw to this hotel is the incredible staff. It's as if everyone that we encountered had a personal interest in seeing to it that our time was memorable. Jessica, Simone and particularly Gilbert went out of their way to insure that we were aware of all that the hotel had to offer. Gilbert ran outside in 20 degree weather just to catch us before we got on the wrong train for our destination. To say that they rolled out the red carpet is an understatement. Additionally, Melissa and Leticia in housekeeping left us sweet notes each day, further enhancing our overall feeling of being home away from home.

Stayed here twice over the past two months (for business) and thoroughly enjoyed each stay. Small but efficient and very comfortable rooms, some with great city views (Empire State Building etc). Staff attentive and helpful, esp. the doormen. GREAT location at TriBeca, Chinatown, Bowery area near great restaurants and shops. Stayed above 12 and 16th floors each time and still heard some city employees working on the street, but it was not too bad and the vent/fan provided excellent white noise. Did not use the fitness room but checked it out -- it is limited and basically only useful for a few cardio machines but I understand there is not a lot they can do there. Did not eat at the hotel as there are a million different and excellent food choices nearby. Will definitely return and recommend to others!

Great hotel! The service was out of this world. The doormen were always friendly and helpful (thank you Paul, Manuel, Michael V. & Michael D.) The concierge always recommended great spots to eat from his own experiences (thanks Hubert). Our housekeeper even left us notes to have a great day (thanks Huimin).The hotel was so modern and super clean. If you visit NYC and like to visit the Greenwhich Village/Soho/Tribeca area (like I do every year), then this is your hotel. I still can't believe the deal we got with this amazing hotel. Highly recommend.

Like all NYC hotels, the room was small. But very modern, well decorated and appointed, very convenient to subway, soho, and downtown locations. The club lounge was terrific for free breakfast and drinks. Nice lobby with free internet. Great value and really nice choice for downtown NYC.

Staff is friendly and very helpful, provides excellent service consistently. The General Manager has a hands-on style, is accessible and pro-active. I've stayed at several hotels in New York - there is no doubt in my mind that the Sheraton Tribeca is my only choice when I return to the area.

I just found this as I looked for less expensive hotels in NYC. Apparently, it's fairly new and it shows (in a good way). Everything looked new. They have a beautiful lobby and everyone we came in contact with was very pleasant. Our room faced north so we had a great skyline view of the Empire State in the distance. The window opens a little but with it closed, we didn't hear much street noise. The bed was SO comfortable. Good security system. The block on which it's located isn't pretty, and you wouldn't expect a hotel like this Sheraton to be there, but once you get inside, you're in a different world. There are subway stops on the same block, but the hotel is in a great location for walking - you're right there in the middle of everything lower Manhattan.

Stayed here with girlfriend when she came to visit and overall hotel was not a disappointment. Rooms were very small, but as my title says its NYC. The door men were very helpful and the receptionist was very nice. Did not eat but did have coffee from their Starbucks inside the hotel.

I don't normally have the time to write reviews, but this hotel simply earned it. The hotel looks new. My room was fantastic, clean, new, big, nice decorated. Couldn't ask for more. Semi-Starbuck for coffee in the hotel lobby. Canal street is busy yukky, but you are seconds from soho, little italy, china town, lower east side and tribeca. I lived in Soho many years and for me it was perfect location. The rate was ridiculously low. (I paid $120 on a weekend, and be happily pay $200-$250 if had too). Staff is super helpful.

What a great addition to the Sheraton family! This brand new hotel is in a really funky neighbourhood, with amazing subway access. Our room was a good size for NYC, with some quirks (like no chest of drawers?) but super comfy and amazing views. The staff was brilliant -- everyone we interacted with was first rate. If you are a midtown person the neighbourhood may not be for you, but we will definitely return!

Visited the City last weekend with my 17-year old daughter and some friends who are thinking about going to college in NYC. We got in around 8 or 9pm on Friday night after a long day of driving and were immediately greeted by helpful, friendly staff. We were shown to our rooms and invited to visit the Club Lounge. As we'd gotten there so late, Gilbert was wrapping up the evening goodies and leaving the club as we got there. He went out of his way to ensure we got plates and helped ourselves to anything we wanted from the cart before he wheeled it away.He was on top of things in the mornings for breakfast, too. No matter that he'd left late the night before. He always had a smile and friendly, helpful conversation for us as we relaxed. The breakfast choices were delicious and plentiful. The view from the rooftop deck was beautiful. The city at night can not be outdone.The hotel is walking distance from China Town, Little Italy and SoHo. We were able to walk to nearly everything we did. A short walk put us on the subway for our excursion to Times Square. It felt like the whole city was at our doorstep.Overall the staff was friendly and helpful beyond compare. I really felt that they would go out of their way to fulfill any request that we had. I would like to thank Lowell Beebe-Center, the manager, for all his help in arranging the weekend. The accommodations we had and how we were treated by the staff helped to make it a wonderful weekend. If our daughter chooses to attend a college in the City the Sheraton Tribeca will be our 1st choice when we visit.

Seriously, this is the BEST hotel to stay in NYC!!!! Location is great, easy access to most Subway lines and most important of all, the service is incredible!! My husband & I stayed in several different hotels when we were in NYC, all Starwood hotels, W Times Square, W Union Square & Sheraton TriBeCa and Sheraton win hands down!!Their employees were warm and helpful and are genuinely happy to provide the best service. Nothing is too much for them and they go all out to please. Kudos to Gilbert from Club Lounge, who is a STAR! It was Valentine's Day and my husband & I were relaxing at the Lounge after a tiring day shopping and we haven't eaten our dinner yet, so Gilbert did his best to find some snacks for us as it was almost 9pm and there were no more food served at that time. Unfortunately, I couldn't eat any of the snacks as I am allergic to nuts. Gilbert took the extra step to arrange for a cheese cake to be sent up to the Lounge for us, so I don't starve and at the same time, to celebrate Valentine's Day!!! What a service! Keep up the great work, Gilbert! You are what it takes to make a hotel stay memorable and for sure, we will be back!

Walking distance from SoHo, clean, new, modern hotel. Housekeeping was not fantastic but generally ok. Room was quite big for NYC, the only thing that we lacked was a bath tub. One excellent point: the hotel has a Starbucks in the lobby, so you don't have to take the hotel breakfast or to get out of the hotel. The doormen were extremely friendly and well-mannered, the reception staff was helpful. The hotel provides computers free of charge in the lobby.

Great hotel, good location for shopping in Soho and the best for jumping on the subway to go uptown or down to World Trade Center location. Beds are comfy, rooms are tight and functional, staff is very helpful. My only negative about this hotel is the lack of concierge. There is a desk for a concierge but I didn't see anyone during the 5 days that we were there. Conveniently there is a little cafe next door where you can get fresh fruit and bagels etc. for breaky and cheap too! Check out Bubby's for a meal at Hudson and Beach.

We were here for the long weekend in February and had a great time! We loved the neighbourhood - not touristy, with tons of great restaurants and bars around. So close to SoHo and the trendy lower East Side! Also, sooo many subway stops nearby so all of NYC's sights are easy to get to. The staff were amazingly friendly and so helpful. We didn't find it too noisy, and had great sleeps in the comfortable bed. A great spot with great value for an NYC weekend!!

I found a great deal to stay at the Sheraton Tribecca. I didn't realize it was so close to downtown Soho. Walking distance to great shopping and my favorite place for brunch - Felix's. It's a new Hotel everything was so clean. And the beds are unbelievably comfortable and it was nice & quiet for sleeping. The doorman Michael D. was very helpful and friendly as well as the rest of the staff. If I could find anything negative to say, I guess it would be breakfast could have been better, although they do have starbucks coffee. And the lighting in the room was a little dim. Otherwise, we had a fantastic time!

We spent President's Day weekend at the Sheraton Tribeca. The hotel was pretty full, but the staff could not possibly have been nicer or more attentive. We were able to check in early and get help with whatever else was needed. The hotel itself is pretty new, so it is in good shape. The room was decent-sized for New York and comfortable for our needs. The hotel is also located 2 blocks from pretty much every major subway line serving Manhattan and is only 2 blocks from the Holland Tunnel for easy access. The price point can simply not be beat for a hotel of this quality. We will stay there again.

The staff at this hotel was very, very friendly. They could have been snooty, being Tribeca and all, but they were very fun, down to earth and welcoming. The room was one of the bigger NYC hotel rooms I have seen, and also one of the quietest. If you set the fan on low to medium, you won't hear the heavy traffic below (very close to Holland tunnel entrance). Rooms also have cool turn of the century photographs of the area (instead of lame hotel 'art') which I spent a lot of time studying with interest. We had a glorious view straight uptown with the Empire State bldg. taking center stage. Everything was much better than I anticipated.

My review partially factors in the incredibly good room rate I got. I assume this is because its an off time and the hotel is slowly trying to build a customer base. So, keeping in mind the price, this is a steal and a 5 out of 5. Assuming the rate goes back to a normal NYC hotel, I would still say this is a very good hotel. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and the concierge/bellman did a great job helping me out with a Valentine's Day gift for my wife. The rooms are very modern and clean with a good bed, bathroom and HD TV with separate outlets to plug in a USB or HDMI device. If you are a SPG member or just get lucky enough, a Canal Street facing room gets you a great view of uptown New York. As for location it is 2 blocks from the Holland Tunnel which is great if you are driving there on off-hours. It is also in between 4 different subway lines. As a launching point to go uptown or to walk around Tribeca and SoHo, this is a great spot. Also, they allow dogs for free which is a huge bonus if you plan on bringing a canine friend along.
Spent the week-end february 4th to 6th. Nice hotel, very clean, friendly staff, very helpful. I was on the 21st floor. Great view. Hotel was steps from chinatown and various subway entries.

This is my second time staying at the Sheraton Tribeca...and I'll be making in my first choice every time I go back to NYC. The staff, led by Lowell Beebe-Center makes a concerted effort to make you feel welcome.Location is great, fitness center is huge for NYC standards (and free), rooms are in great condition, bathrooms are spotless and feature nice amenities. For the reasonable price they offer in NYC, you cannot do better.

I stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca a few weeks ago when I was in town for business. The accommodations were great! The rooms are extremely clean and new. It's a great location and staff is very friendly and helpful. I liked it so much that I will be back in February.

I watched them build this hotel from day 1, and couldn't wait to stay there. Yesterday's snowstorm gave me that opportunity. I checked in at 3pm, and all I wanted to do was take a nap. IMPOSSIBLE as the hotel fronts Canal Street...the street between the Manhattan Bridge and the Holland Tunnel. Non-stop gridlock and horns honking until about 7 or 8pm. Unless you are looking for a view of the Empire State Building, I would suggest you ask for a room that is NOT facing Canal Street. The rooms are average size for new York...but it's new, so it's nice. Was not a fan of the $9.99 wi-fi charge. And be careful...their network blocks some websites. The rooms are a bit pricey. Overall, had a pretty good stay.

Nice hotel but insane internet policy. They block almost everything - its worse than your in house IT watchdog. A style website was blocked because of: "Bikinis/Lingerie". That's pretty draconian. Loosen up, management, it's not like I'm running my webcam porn business out of your posh TriBeCa hotel! Maybe you can lecture me about God and morality over my continental breakfast too.

I stayed in this hotel for the first time because of its proximity to Tribeca and Soho and because it was a new hotel. I couldn't have been more impressed. The staff from the moment we walked in was friendly and helpful and made you feel like you were family. The design of the lobby was beautiful - I enjoyed the area where you could surf the internet and my Mom and I had a wonderful relaxing time at the bar after our Broadway show. The proximity to the subways was excellent as well - several train lines to choose from close to the hotel. The sleeping experience was outstanding - my daughter was reading the tags on the pillows and sheets to see if she could order them! I look forward to visiting in the summer when I can take advantage of havng a cocktail on the roof top terrace with the best views of Manhattan. The management of this hotel should be commended for the outstanding people that were hired - from the cleaning woman who was so cheerful, to the friendly bartender , to the concierge who greeted us warmly each day.

As soon as I arrived (late in the evening), I was greeted by 3 separate employees. I went to the bar to eat. I don't eat meat, and although their were options on the menu for me - the bartender let me chose to modify one of their entrees to my liking - allowing me to eat exactly what I had been craving. Massive beverage selection.Loads of craft beers and a liquor selection you wouldn't expect to see at a hotel bar. The bartender, Robert, gave me tons of attention and conversation - making sitting solo at the bar completely comfortable and entertaining.I stayed for 4 nights and I was able to carry on my daily routine without any bumps. Anything I needed was always readily accessible. Between the most comfortable bed and Starbucks coffee in my room and in the lobby I was less stressed than if I'd been waking up at home.Upon arrival to my room I found a hand written letter from the housekeeping mngr, Sophia, thanking me for my stay with them. Even when I had housekeeping service while I was out of my room, the housekeeper, Giselle wrote me another note. She even took notice of the coffee type I had been drinking/ the type of sugar I used and left extra!Every single employee I walked by made eye contact and said hello, or asked how my stay had been so far.  In my time there, I must have met the entire management/supervisory team - which tells me they are closely involved in everything that goes on - and very available. This Sheraton is recently opened - so it truly embodies everything that the Sheraton brand is about today - which is an outstanding product. And being such a new property I have to say I am surprised I did not encounter any inconsistencies you might expect . Everything was smooth and flawless. Definitely exceeded my expectations.

The Sheraton Tribeca is a great downtown hotel. The staff is AMAZING! From the door men to reception to room service to the staff at the coffee bar - everyone was beyond nice and helpful. I was so impressed with the service.The location is great. I spent a lot of time seeing plays on Broadway and the subway to the Times Square was a quick direct trip. The subway is just a short two blocks from the Sheraton. I would suggest that the Sheraton consider adding movies on demand to their TV systems.The only downside was the door to the room. There are a few open inches between the bottom of the door and the floor board. It makes for a noisy experience if you have active neighbors.I would definitely return to this hotel! Another great addition to Starwood's properties.

I would highly recommend the Sheraton Tribeca New York, not only for their excellent service but for the accommodations they provide. I was traveling with my dogs and they provide to most amazing welcome to both myself and my dogs. The entire staff was very pet friendly and welcoming. We were also fortunate enough to use the lounge on the 21st floor which had views of the entire city as well as superb 24 hour food and beverage service.

I stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca for 3 nights in December 2010 (right around the time of the storm). All in all, a fantastic stay. The location is prime for any lover of NYC, as, you are a good distance away from the tourist traps. Lowell (the General Manager) was very accommodating with all of our requests and put in a room with a second to none view of the Empire State Building and the Manhattan skyline. Amazing view. Could not stop looking out the window. The rooms were clean, with a good sized shower and uber comfortable king bed. Modern amenities (chairs, television, desk, etc.). The free bottle of water daily was a nice touch. The only downfall is that there is no in-room safe or fridge, although there is a room to keep your valuables behind reception.The staff was very polite, however, unfortunately, I did not find them as knowledgeable as they could have been. They did not have many good recommendations/tips, and, did not seem to know the surrounding area too well. That would be my only criticism. Otherwise, a great stay. I would have no hesitation recommending this hotel

The service was average. The room was rather ugly. Our television broke on our second evening, and our request to fix it was untimely, despite the front desk's promise to send someone directly up to look at it. Also, the sconce in the room was broken as well as one of the electrical outlets I attempted to plug the hair dryer into. My biggest complaints were with the bathroom. The shower fixture was designed in such a way as to require one to blast oneself with cold water before arriving at the required temp, and the bath towels were rough and nearly as skimpy as the hand towels. Also, the toiletries provided are sub par. To have your linens replaced you have to have read one of the many in-room memos posted about the room, which state that this is only done upon special request. Finally, as we were leaving we were asked by the bellhop when we wished to depart (we checked out several hours later and were storing our bags at the hotel), and offered car service. Inquiring as to how much this would be, we were told $54, which is ridiculous, considering that we were able to catch our own cab for $20. Also, the way in which we were asked seemed to imply that it was somehow standard procedure. To a visitor unfamiliar with the ease with which one might secure a cab to LGA, I can see where they might prey on their guests.For the price, and considering the amenities offered by comparable hotels (terry cloth robes, newspapers, free wireless) I would look elsewhere for a hotel with more character. Would certainly not recommend.

Took my fifteen year old daughter and a few of her friends to NYC for the weekend. The hotel was perfect, within walking distance to WTC, Chinatown, SOHO and Little Italy. The trip was wonderful. The hotel staff was beyond anything that i expected. Starting with Ruth, she was awesome, she totally went out of her way and took time out of her busy schedule to personally make sure our trip was pleasurable. The entire front desk staff was also great. The bellman out front were super friendly and if we needed a cab, they made sure we got one. One of the guys walked 2 blocks to grab us a taxi, and rode it to the hotel and gave it to us. The neighborhood was perfect, great food, great shopping. Definitely my hotel of choice while in NYC

Our group was snowed in during the blizzard. However, though there were 170 passengers being checked in at 6am, Steven Lamour and his staff provided outstanding service getting all checked in. Even though I needed to change rooms a couple of times through no fault of his own, he never became flustered. I highly recommend this hotel to travellers. When the conditions are trying, I have learned that the best people shine. Steven is one of those people.

Was on my way to Cairo when the blizzard hit. Stayed at the Sheraton-Tribeca under very difficult circumstances. Arrived at 330 AM with about 200 other people. I stay at Sheratons all over the world and this was one of the nicest. The staff was great and in particular, the Sheraton manager who handled all of us was really great. His name was Steven Lamour and he was extremely professional and kind in extremely difficult circumstances. Will absolutely choose to stay at this hotel in the future because of this treatment. Thank you.The hotel itself is very modern and nice; Rooms are very nice and great beds. Good gym and the location of the hotel is unbeatable. Good food as well.

As I write this review the hotel has only been open for a few months. It is my second stay at this Tribeca location. The lobby is in the new "Aloft" like style for Sheratons - copy Sheraton Brooklyn but larger space. The small gym was ill conceived. For example, the flat screen tv is on the wall behind all the cardio equipment so your back faces it. Maybe this is just their temporary gym. It definitely needs a redesign.What the hotel lacks in the gym, it surely makes up for in its Platinum lounge. They serve a fairly good breakfast, but the best part is the outside deck. Weather permitting, the rooftop outside patio views are great. Perfect place to reserve for a party.One big issue I encountered on both visits is the desert like dry air in the rooms. Front desk does not stock any humidifiers. Trust me, it is very very dry. It is a new hotel, so expect unpolished service for a while.

Situated on a nondescript block of Canal Street between Tribeca and Soho, this brand-new hotel is shiny and bright, literally: Indoor lighting is blinding everywhere, in the lobby and hallways (except for the restaurant, which is lit like a nightclub). This is unfortunate, since the decor -- a kind of heavy modernist/wood retro thing -- would benefit from a bit softer atmosphere. The current low room rates ($250 is the least expensive rate offered on the hotel's web site) are tempting, but as I discovered, that rate will only get you an extremely small room that's barely big enough to accommodate the king-size bed, too small for two people to do anything other than sleep and jostle to get by each other while en route to the bathroom or the tiny armoire which is the hotel's version of a closet in that size of room. So I opted to upgrade to their "studio suite", which was nothing more than a normal sized room -- and for that was forced to pay over $500, a rate that could have gotten us into a dozen other far more comfortable and appealing hotels in Manhattan which don't feel like a chain hotel. Oddly Sheraton has put the "studio suite" on each floor not in a corner but in the middle of the main hallway right next to the Coke machine + ice machine, enabling one to hear hallway conversations through the relatively thin door. Once in the "studio suite", I discovered that the bathroom fan was so noisy, and triggered by the bathroom light, that it might awaken your companion if you visited the bathroom while he/she was sleeping, and that using the internet cost another $25 per day. The windows were double-glazed, but traffic noise was still noticeable. The overly active HVAC unit was too efficient, streaming out cool air if you wanted only to lower the temperature a degree or two, or hot air if you wanted just to slightly warm it up. But somehow that went along with the clunky room furniture, which was upholstered to look like it was designed to withstand annual conventions of professional wrestlers. This isn't a hotel with any subtlety. Its use of space and choice of decor is tolerable only for short stays by those who don't plan to do anything in their room except sleep. The only saving grace is a faultlessly gracious and helpful staff, from the bellmen to the front desk to the restaurant.

Good location if you want to buy purses and things on Canal street or go to Ground zero. From Penn Station is $8 cab ride, to 42 st (Broadway) would cost you about $20 with tip. During the day you can walk around, but I wouldn't go to far from the hotel at night. There is a bar inside that closes at 1 and a restaurant that closes at 11. We didn't try those. There is a deli next door that is open pretty late and they have decent cheap food.

Stayed here with my friends for a girls weekend. It was great! The staff was amasing! They were friendly, and truly went out of there way to make things as easy and comfortable as possible. There is a good little coffee shop that serves Starbucks and pastries in the lobby and there is a nice internet center with several computers and a printer available. The rooms are very clean and modern but have cool old pictures of NYC which I really liked. The beds were amasing!! So comfortable with big fluffy pillows and down comforters. Bathrooms were beautiful too and had everything you need including fog free mirrors which I thought was a nice touch. The rooms are a little tight but still very comfortable. Also, hotel had town cars available to guests, that are a little more expensive than cabs, but totally worth it if you need to get somewhere at dinner time on the weekend. We really had an enjoyable stay, and for a new hotel things really run very smooth.

Awesome hotel. I came in last minute and found this hotel. Very easy to check in, very friendly valet, doorman, and front desk receptionist. The hotel seems brand new, so the room was very clean and well designed!

Positives:- Great staff who try very hard and are extremely helpful- Very clean- Good location, close to both SoHo and downtown -> perfect for a business trip with leisure weekends included- Some nice rooms available with amazing views of Empire State building- Nice members lounge with great views: lots of facilities and breakfast- Generally very comfortable- Excellent wireless internet in the entire hotel (free for Platinum guests) and a lot of options on TV- Good value for money for NYC- Pretty quiet, given locationNegatives/constructive criticism:- Gym: currently mainly has machinery for cardio - only 1 multi-purpose machine for weight training (when occupied, you can’t do any training). This could easily (and cheaply) be fixed by getting some free weights - lets hope this gets done soon.- Some processes don't work 100% yet, e.g. deliveries to the hotel could sometimes not be found until a day later, since there's about 3 different places in the hotel where they could be stored- Some small things additionally in the room would’ve been nice at times: Fridge/mini-bar, pay-per-view- I'm an SPG Platinum member and still had to ask for upgrades every time. You generally do not get the feeling that SPG status makes a huge difference to your treatment until you make it an issue.I’m looking forward to staying here again and hope some of my criticism will be improved over the coming weeks/months. Then this hotel will become a 5 star rating very quickly…

I stayed for the first time at the Sheraton Tribeca and I have to say I was blown away from the second I entered the hotel. I am travelling a lot around the world for business and I didnt think I could be still suprised by attentive service. The staff are so friendly, helpful and sincere and over the 4 days of my stay I can just say, the team just get it right!!! Nothing is too much to ask, there is always a smile and help when you need it. The concierge is friendly and is giving great suggestions for the new findings in New York. The location is just perfect with Soho just being 5 min away, the subway a 2 min walk. The rooms are great, fantastic beds and a walk in shower. Would definitely to recommend to stay again and have so already to many of my friends.

From the warm greeting by the staff to the bellman checking the back of our cab with a flashlight for any forgotten articles when we returned from an evening out this hotel went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and cared for. The rooms were well appointed and very clean. Any requests were quickly and courteously filled. Great location!!! Convenient to shopping, NYU and many attractions. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the NYC area for either business or pleasure.

Let's hope their enthusiasm lasts. All staff are friendly, jolly and falling over themselves to assist you. The rooms are spacious, clean and the showers are better than the average Sheraton. The restaurant was quiet and given the meat-packer district is just around the corner not surprising but the food was fresh and tasty, with the waiter very enthusiastic and attentive.The only issue - they need more training in the bar - the cocktails were not up to scratch.

The new Sheraton Tribeca was everything I could of wished for in a NYC hotel. Great value, great location convienent to subway, financial district, SOHO food/dining and entertainment.Lobby was built for the seasoned traveller with all the amenities to support a trip for business of pleasure. Great Staff.

The first thing that attracst us to the hotel was the location, no complain about that. The hotel is close to two train stations and nice restaurants, it is relatively easy to get to anywhere including to and from the airports.The second thing was the "Sheraton" brand, but the Sheraton Tribeca, is not a real Sheraton, perhaps a small brother or sister, but defenitvely not a Sheraton. The rooms are clean, the service is helpful, the price is of a Sheraton but it is not a Sheraton.

I am staying at this brand new hotel and am very pleased. The staff are extremely friendly and showed quite a bit of concern when I had to wait about 15 minutes for my room to become available upon check in. Location is extremely convenient. I will definitely be back.

a new hotel in a great location. steps from chinatown, little italy and soho. lots of nice cafes and resturants in tribeca as well. one of my favorite cafes, la colombe, is located around the block. great lattes. starbucks is located in the lobby as well. friendly and courteous staff throughout the hotel. always a pleasant hello and offering assistance. room was small, standard for NYC. furnishings were new and clean. the bathroom was nicely appointed, shower only, no tub. very comfortable bed and bedding. as of December 2010 the lounge is available to platinum spg members only... what?? (how about showing some love to us gold members...)the hotel is situated on canal and can get really congested when the street hawkers are out.

We stayed at this brand new Sheraton Tribecca hotel in November 2010. The brand new hotel (built from the ground up...it used to be a parking lot) opened in October 2010.Everything obviously was brand new in the hotel (and still had that "new" smell). The staff was super-friendly. There was 1 free hour for Internet service with the computers in the lobby. There was a restaurant and a separate bar if you would be interested.However, the great thing we liked was the location in relation to the subway line (the blue lines A, C, and E trains). The subway was right around the corner from the hotel. The A, C, and E subway trains take you to Greenwich Village, Penn Station/Madison Square Garden, 42nd Street/Times Square, and the World Trade Center/PATH station. The hotel itself is right on Canal Street, with the Chinatown and Little Italy neighborhoods just a few blocks away. There's also lots of fun discount shopping and street vendors lined along Canal Street. Based on the great location, the nice quiet room, friendly staff, but extremely clean, brand-new hotel, we would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Great place - Rooms are very small but very nice. Great lounge for gold members. Nice rooftop place that you have a great view from. Nicest NYC hotel ever ( have stayed at the Sheraton Manhattan - UGH).

So here is the deal, if your coming to New York and you are not planning on staying here then you have already messed up. This hotel is BRAND NEW, not even 2 months old. I am always traveling on business, and have been to every major hotel in New York pretty much. This time I decided to bring my family, and show them a good time. At the reccomendation of a friend who stayed here in October, and was extremely satisfied I booked here. From our speedy check-in, to the killer mojitos and cocktails the bartender made for me it was amazing. My friend Susan said that I should only go to the bar when Robert was there. Let me tell you, most bartenders only want to get you drunk or suck up to you to get a nicer tip. This kid let me tell you is not like that. My wife, and I had lunch at the bar and were planning our day when he came and started telling us all the best places in New York. From museums, to the best broadway play. He told us the secrets for getting around the city fast and easy, and saved my wife and I a lot of time planning our day out. HE WAS MORE HELPFUL THEN THE CONCIERGE! He makes amazing drinks, and has a personality that very hard to come by in New York. Also the front desk manager steven is amazing! He is super friendly, and the General Manager is friendly as well. He approached my wife and I and we spoke briefly for about 3 minutes. So long story short, I will be bringing my family back here for many more years to come. The hotel is not your ordinary hotel in many ways, I am still in awe at how the sheraton found so many great people to work there. Kudos to their human resources department!

We stayed here for a full week during Thanksgiving and were very happy with most everything about this new hotel. It is wonderfully located between midtown and downtown with immediate access to all major subway lines. The shopping in nearby SoHo & Tribeca is wonderful. Traffic on Canal is congested because of the Holland Tunnel approaches and avoid the stretch of Canal just east of the hotel to avoid busloads of foreign tourists buying crappy souvenirs (although they're handy if you need a fast umbrella or ear muffs). The rooms are smallish but complete and perfect for a solo businessperson...we were a couple and made do just fine for the entire week. The shower is big and really nice...plenty of amenities too! Closet space is spare. They do have larger rooms available which I would recommend looking into for longer stays than overnite. Corner rooms with two windows look really nice and the "05" rooms on each floor are large. Higher floors are nicer because of the views which are stupendous. Try to use your Starwood status to bump up to larger accommodations. You may as well avoid the SPG floors because they provide nothing extra special as far as I could tell. They do a VERY nice job in the Club Lounge on the 21st Floor providing FULL breakfast, snacks, coffee drinks and beverages all day (24 hour access) and very tasty canapes with cash bar service in the evenings. Thomasz (?) makes a MAD $14. dirty martini!! The staff is full of smiles and helpful attitudes...if/when I needed anything they were reliably there for me.

Me and my wife just came home after 6 fantastic days in New York. We always use hotels ind the SPG group. We have been to NY 6 times and have found out that we like the area around Greenwish, Soho and Tribeca. This is the best placed hotel for that area in the SPG. I was vere hapy when a saw it opened. We had only good experience at the new hotel. The staff was so friendly and smiley.. Never walked ind or out the door without a frindly smile and a" how are you". The manager was often to see and very friendly. We got a SPG goldmember upgrade to at nice room on the 19th floor with a beatefull view of Manhattan and Impiere. The room had a good size for a couple. If you like to go out and listen to live music and eat at nice restaurants you will find everythings just outside the door. Just acros the street to the left you will find Broadway. Go north and you will find so many nice frensh, Italian and spancish restaurants. Go on to Bleekerstreet and you will find Terra Blues for fantastic blues musik and The Red Lion for som Rock N Roll. There is a litte bit of trafik noise but after a glad night in Bleeker street you want notice. Lots of people book there first NY hotel at Time Square. We also did. Ended up taking a taxi down to Bleeker Street every night. There is too many people at Time Square. Go there to see a musical and thats enough. If you are there when it is busy you will have to wait for at table at restaurant and the service is not the same as if you go down to the Greenwich/TriBeCa area.

Staff so friendly and helpful that it didn't feel like I was in New York! Rooms well appointed, very comfortable and immaculately maintained. Stayed on concierge level where breakfast was wonderful and we could request anything else we wanted. Easy access to Tribeca, Soho and Brooklyn Bridge - not bad to other parts of the city by subway. Would definitely stay here again. Only downside was trying to get a taxi at rush hour.

I was very impressed with this hotel. I typically travel to NYC on business but this was a combo business and leisure stay. I stay around 20 nights a year in Manhattan and over the years I have stayed in at least 50 different hotels. The staff at this hotel are some of the nicest people, which can be a rarity in NYC. They have the New York energy without the typical New York attitude (I am from NY originally). The beds were unbelievably comfortable and there was very little to no street noise. The room was an average size for NY and it had all the amenities. Nice bathroom with great water pressure in the shower. Free internet was easy to get on and very fast. Good restaurants in the area and easy access to the subway. The doorman was able to get a cab quickly even on a busy day. The hotel is right on Canal Street which I thought would be an issue, but it is actually a positive. All the shops are just a short distance away and I needed to pick up a birthday present for my daughter. There is a Starbucks in the hotel and they had a good selection of food there as well. The views are fantastic (see if you can get a room with a view of Midtown). There are no tall buildings in the way of the view and you can see the empire state building and Midtown skyline. It looks particularly nice at night. The empire state building was lit up in tye dye for a Grateful Dead type concert that night. That was really cool. I usually have some negative comments, but I really can't think of anything. This is a gem of a hotel. I will be bringing the family on my next trip. There is a lot to keep them busy in the area while I visit clients. This hotel may be a few dollars more than some others, but how much is a good night's sleep worth when you are doing business or pleasure in NY. Well worth it!

I travel a lot, and to be honest- this was one of the worst experiences I have ever had at any hotel. I was only in NY for one day and night, and spent 3 hours of it waiting to be allowed into my room. Check-in was at 3pm, and I finallly got into my room around 5:45pm. I even arrived at 2pm to see if I could check in early. The lat the front desk said there were problems with the cleaning staff, and they were still working on my room, and it would only be about a 20 minute wait. One hour later they said they could not reach the maids to see what was going on. I spent 4 hours just sitting and waiting in the hotel lobby with my luggage, while I could have been out doing what I went to NY in the first place for. It was obvious after I was finally let into my room at 5:45pm that is was not a problem caused by the cleaning staff as I was told. This was a blatant lie on the front desk\'s part. There was no cleaning staff in sight- in fact, the shower was not even clean. I will never stay at a Sheraton again. There is no excuse for this, nobody who pays for a room should be made to wait for 3 hours AFTER check-in to get into a room, it is completely unfair, and a total rip-off- even at the discounted rate I was able to get. I did not get what I paid for. By the time I got my luggage into my room, I only had until 7 pm before most of the stores in that area (which was not in the safest spot) closed for the night. This was a big waste of my time and money. The front desk staff was RUDE and snobby. We did, however, eat at the restaurant there. The food was good, our server's name was August, and he was the only pleasant person in the hotel. Location is not the best, either. Neigherborhood is sketchy, but fairly close to good shopping. The staff is unwilling to resolve your problems, even if you call down.

I've stayed in hundreds of hotels on four continents and the Sheraton Tribeca has by far the friendliest staff I've seen. What is more, they are friendly in a sincere and helpful way, not in the forced cheer you often encounter. The location is terrific, the windows open (yay,) free computers in the lobby aren't crowded, parking works, the food is good, and for those with small children who wake up at ungodly hours, there is a deli next door.And did I mention, they take dogs?

The rooms are new and clean, and very small (as is the case with any NYC hotel). The decor is modern and comfortable. I chose to stay here because it was cheaper than any other mid-tier option I could find, and if it stays that way I'll continue to stay here when I visit New York because it's a great value. Also, the staff was super-friendly, enthusiastic, and helpful. A word about the location, as a former resident of NYC -- if you are familiar with downtown and/or the subway system, this hotel is good because it's easy walking distance to SoHo, Chinatown, and Tribeca, as well as many subway lines (the closest being the A-C-E). If you aren't familiar with the city, the location may feel a little bit like a no-man's land, especially at night. The immediate one-block radius goes dead quiet at night, and because of that and Holland Tunnel traffic, the cabs tend to avoid this area. But once you get familiar with the area, you realize you're really only a block or two from some of downtown's most bustling and fun neighborhoods.

My first couple of days at the Sheraton tribeca was the worst; I woke up to horrible drilling noise and door slams the good thing is that I did receive a letter by the front office manager the day prior stating this but wow. My business plan was cut short due to a small fever, I called the front desk asking for a room move with piece and quiet (stating I wasn’t feeling well and just needed rest) Steven Amour came and apologized for the inconvenience and assisted with the room move. An hour later he personally came up and brought a bowl of soup for me. Steve is not your common manager; he empathized and showed sympathy .............. what a great asset this hotel hired. you will definitely be seeing me again ...........................JB

My daughter was running in the NY Marathon and she invited me at the last moment to be her ‘Official Supporter’ and we stayed here four nights, the Hotel was recommended by friends of hers.Ruth Lopez, Director of Revenue Management, was particularly helpful giving me Marathon Tips, and when she completed the Marathon a signed Card and Foot Balm from the team.We had a Club Room on 21st Floor with great views over Manhattan; we particularly enjoyed the well stocked Lounge, although the Hostess was lax at clearing the tables, preferring to talk to other guests. As in previous reports we noticed the gap @ the bottom of the door allowing noise from the corridor. In all other respect the room was adequate. On the day of our departure we were annoyed when the Room Attendant woke us by knocking on the door @ 8.30 amCentrally located hotel, helpful staff especially those front of house, clean & brand new so well maintained at the moment.

I stayed ONE NIGHT at this hotel and had to make 28 phone calls to finalize my trip and for them to give me a confirmation number. The communication between the reservations dept and the front desk is ABSOLUTELY HORRIFYING. I WILL NEVER STAY THERE AGAIN!! Good luck to you if you stay and check your credit card often. It is a week later and I am still calling to get the charges taken care of. NOT WORTH IT.

Stayed for a week in November - we have previously only had good experiences with Sheraton hotels but this definitely feels like a discount version. The hotel is new built but doesn't feel quite finished. The rooms are drafty, there is a big gap under all the doors which lets in all the noise from the corridors, and there is also lot of noise from Canal Street (windows not sound proof). We had to move rooms twice - the first room we stayed in had an extremely small window and felt more like a prison cell, the second one was so noisy that you couldn't sleep or think - the one we finally ended up in was quite but very small. Whilst the staff are friendly and accomodating, this felt like bad value for money and we were quite disappointed with our stay.

My wife and I stayed here with our dog for 10 days while we looked for an apartment in NYC. From the time we arrived (early AM after flying in on the red-eye from West Coast) to the time we left the staff was Excellent! They made us feel welcome and were very accommodating. The General Manager, Lowell Beebe-Center, was present, engaging and interested in making our stay as comfortable as possible. This feeling was also reflected in all of the staff. The bell staff and front desk were are especially pleasant and helpful. At all hours they were present, willing and able to help, plus they were just plain nice!The hotel is new, very clean and nice. The rooms were small, but I think that's fairly typical for NYC. I don't think they were any smaller than most, but don't expect a spacious room. That said, we were moving and had a dog, four full size suitcases and two carry-ons in our room and we managed just fine. I think for your normal couple of days in NYC, the room size was fine and they were clean and nicely decorated.Our only complaint about the room would be the lack of shelf space in the bathroom. The bathroom and shower area were large, very nicely done, but besides the sink, there was no place to put anything. That makes it a bit more difficult to get ready in the morning. I've seen some other reviews complaining about the location. I guess that all depends on where you think you are in NYC. The hotel is definitely on the north end of Tribeca which extends from Canal St. all the way down to Chambers. But for us that was a plus. We could easily walk through all of Tribeca, but also get to SoHo (lots of shopping), Chinatown and Little Italy. I wouldn't stay here thinking I was in the Financial District or Midtown. While those easy to get to, longer walks or easy subway rides, this is in Tribeca. For us, the location was perfect. Plus, there is a Zipcar location on Wooster, right across the street making it very easy to get a car for an hour or two if you need one.Overall our experience here was A+. We will be adding this hotel to our company list for out of town co-workers and I'll definitely put it on the list for friends and family that come to visit us in our new NYC apartment.

While being new is one thing the hotel has going for it, I too am an elite status with Starwood. Upon arrival in the lobby from LGA, one has to wonder why the airplane didn't land in the lobby. The arrivals area is so overpoweringly bright it reminds you of the runway you just came in from - problem is you'd never get anything more than a model plane in here.The first room they gave me was so small you literally could not turn around without hitting something. The need for a desk chair so extraneous - you could sit on the end of the bed and touch the back of the desk without a stretch. The ice maker outside sounds like a 747. As a 'preferred' SPG loyalty member, I expect better. Changed rooms to a larger room (so why did I get the 10'x8' room in the first place.)Second room is a little better but it has the HVAC blowing right onto the bed - we'll see how the first night will be. This place is too soon to tell but the price is right and its new and clean. (That lasts 5 minutes in NYC.)2 more nights here so its anybody's guess what's next. I will amend as needed - but for now, I will recommend it.

We stayed here for 3 nights last weekend while in NYC to celebrate my wife's 40th birthday. From the moment we arrived we experienced top notch service. The check-in was hassle-free in the modern reception area and as we entered our suite, my wife was delighted to find a platter of chocolate dipped strawberries with a note from the manager to enjoy her birthday! We stayed on the 21st floor and were able to enjoy the 24 hour lounge with tv/internet/breakfast/fruit etc, and also enjoy the spectacular view from the outdoor patio! The room was a very nice size for Manhattan, with contemporary but comfortable furniture and fixtures. The bathroom was large as was the glassed doored shower. Ideal location for 3 days of being "out and about", close to subways, shopping and restaurants. This is our new go-to hotel when we come to NYC. Highly recommended!

This was a combination business/leisure trip, with two friends and a 3 year old. The staff went out of their way to accommodate us. As others have noted, this is a brand new hotel, and the staff are still working out some of the kinks. That said - wow, they're some of the best people I've ever encountered at any hotel, anywhere. Rooms are a good size for a Manhattan hotel in this price range, and the interiors are very nicely done. Lobby/lounge area and business center sort of in the center of the lounge are really inviting and comfortable. Room service needs some work - things took a while to come and the food, not so great. But you're right in-between Chinatown and Little Italy, so skip the room service and head outside. Overall, a stellar performance by an excellent and enthusiastic staff. A hotel I will definitely return to.

I stayed in this hotel because I was trying to earn Starwood points.If you're going to charge over $300 a night, you shouldn't have tacky plastic cups in the bathroom that fall over when you put your toothbrush in. You should have a safe in the room for guest valuables. You should not claim to be in Tribeca when you're really on Canal, without much interesting around.Next time I'm staying elsewhere.

Visited while it was still very new. The staff tries really hard and the service and attitude is better than most NYC hotels. Hope it wasn't just because they were new and they don't get jaded after a while. Most of the staff tries really hard and that goes a long way. I will definitely return and hope they have the bugs worked out (and all the elevators running). Hotel smells brand spanking new when you walk in and is gleaming - even the employees are smart and well put together.Rooms are small, but acceptable for NY. Gym is great - BRAND NEW equipment so in excellent condition. Rooms are somewhat quiet for a NYC hotel. The location is ok - convenient if you have business in midtown/tribeca. Cabs do not know the hotel yet, so getting a cab takes a few minutes - they don't like to come down Canal trolling for fares. However, the bellhops were doing a good job telling the cabbies to come by more often, and were very willing to walk and find cabs. Again - excellent service attitudes, and am hoping it is not a case of their newness and not being as busy. I will definitely return to the hotel based just on the attitude of most of the staff (some bad apples), but the best overall service I have had in NYC in 2 years - including properties like the Essex and St Regis and the Peninsula. Being new there were a few bumps along the way with restaurant service etc. - we waited over 30 mins for a lunch order that was basically sandwiches. It didn't arrive and we had to go since we had a meeting, but we got held up by the staff again as they insisted on charging us for the 2 cokes ordered by the table (only items besides water). Not that I quibble with that - we drank the cokes, and can pay for them, but after taking 30 mins and not providing lunch - and then delaying us a further 10 mins while getting the charges run - as they say on SNL 'really?' Similar experience requesting a delayed check out - told ok by front desk, didn't get the warm fuzzies that it was secure and called again in the morning to verify, told nothing of the sort on file, and I could not be accomodated (1 hour extension request and SPG Gold) and would have to pay. Called and had my car service come and get me earlier figuring I could sit at the lounge in the airport, and was then called back by the operator and told I could have the late checkout as a special exception - made me feel it was a HUGE deal. Think more of a staff training issue, but fairly irritating. I give them a little leeway for being new.Bar area was excellent. They have an amazing selection of beers and even premium liquors. Someone knows his stuff here and takes it seriously and it shows. I haven't seen such a discerning beer selection in many hotels at this level anywhere in the world. The bar staff is friendly, and helpful. The service from the kitchen is still lacking, and being new, the staff does not know what the food should look like - a few dishes were served without major ingredients described in the descriptions, and the staff had no idea what they were or that they were missing. Bartender tried to fix the issues, but they were not major. One of the waitresses though merely shrugged to my colleague when he pointed out that the item he ordered was missing a key ingredient. Don't recall, details but imagine a cheeseburger minus the cheese.My colleague had lounge access, and the lounge is small and has really great service and the food is pretty good for a U.S. lounge. It has some strange lighting choices at a bar height table where the lights are exactly where your head would go (for average 5"8 people) - odd design and doesn't allow for using your laptop or sitting up straight. We didn't really get a feel for the lounge since it was a disaster for the first few days we were there and we jut gave up, but I think it will be a great bonus to this property at other times. The roof deck area has an amazing view and is very comfortable for an evening drink. Sheraton corporate was there filming for some promo the week we were there - which was odd that they would schedule that the first full week the place was open before they had their act together, but not a fault of the local property. The poor lounge manager was scurrying around in the evenings trying to accomodate the ad director and the models who were prancing around and re-arranging furniture and playing on their laptops and loudly speculating on what scenes would appeal to their demographic. From the sounds of it their target demographic is a 20 something on daddy's payroll. Poaching W's segment? Overheard the ad director talk about what he thought would be good images, and my colleague and I who both travel over 250k miles a year were chuckling since he had it pretty off in our humble opinions. Maybe in Australia or NZ where he was from (judging by his accent) business travellers have different needs. All I can say is that Sheraton was paying a lot of $$$ for some marketing whiz kids to jazz up their brand, and promote their lounges and I hope they get something good out of flying these guys all over the world to gum up operations in their lounges for a few days. They could start by not jamming up a property in a key market the first week it is open and inconveniencing the majority of the guests.Overall, this is one of the best SPG properties in the city, and the few teething problems aside, was my best hotel stay in NYC in over 3 years. It is still value for money and the attitudes of the friendly staff makes all the difference. The beer selection also does not hurt. I will definitely be back and have and will reccomend this hotel for business travel.

My second worst room short of the decrepit Manhattan in the Starwood system. Check in was awkward with weird explanations of construction being done on some floors despite hotel being "finished". The room I was assigned is smaller than any of the NYC Four Points and even smaller than the original W on the East Side. So small in fact that the only way to set up an ironing board was in the doorway and I had to stand in the bathroom. Calls to the front desk were not answered for 30 minutes. Everything's new but that's the only thing this place has going for it. I'm Starwood Platinum and got stuck next the maid's closet and ice machine with smallest room on the floor. . Hate to think of the kinds of rooms non-status SPGers get. Trying to get a manager to help but not overly hopeful.

I am a Starwoods Preferred Gold Member and have stayed at Starwoods properties all over Manhattan. The Parker Meridien is our usual standby, but after this weekend, the Sheraton Tribeca is our new place!! The service was amazing from start to finish -- Simone and David were particular standouts, as well as Crystal and others whose names I can't remember because I'm not as good as the folks at the Sheraton Tribeca!! There was a problem with our first room (just our personal preference, nothing actually wrong with the room), and the staff bent over backwards to help us out. When we walked in, the staff greeted us professionally and courteously. They really got the A team, you could never tell this place has only been open two weeks -- they are polished and ready to go. My daughter is 2 years old and usually has problems sleeping at hotels because of hallway noise, etc., none of those problems here! A+++, thank you so much and my compliments to the management and this stupendous staff.

Absolutely great for business travelers. The service thus far (still staying) has been awesome. They know how to treat SPG gold members. From the time of my really early check-in request, everyone has been pleasant, but genuine at the same time. The new rooms are nice. Clean, comfortable and nice amenities with great city views and central location. This will be my hotel for all upcoming NYC travels - i'd also recommend it for personal trips with the family.

Stayed in the hotel during the first Mon-Thurs that it was open. I've been travelling to NY for the past 11 months, and stayed in nearly every Starwood hotel in Manhattan, and I must say that I haven't encountered such an eager, friendly staff in any of my visits. They were knowledgable and didn't miss a beat while checking me in, helping with my luggage, calling cabs, cleaning the room, or providing food and drinks after work.The hotel shines and gives off a very warm, comfortable ambience. The lobby and bar area is bright and lively and has been a good hang-out at night before I turn in for bed. I have access to the SPG lounge, which has been providing great food and one of the best views of Midtown from the expansive outdoor patio that I have seen yet. My room is cozy and very quiet at night, as I haven't been woken up yet -- slept great so far. I don't have any complaints, but if I had to comment, I'd say that the beds are just a tad stiff, although this is expected as they're brand new, and the room could be bigger, although no smaller than anything else I've experienced in NY, where space is a premium.I've just booked my stays through the end of the year, and look forward to staying at the hotel and experiencing the TriBeCa nightlife.

Very satisfied with the hotel and the staff have been amazing. Everything is new and very clean. Excellent location with tons of great restaurants around and just off the subway. Spectacular view of the empire state building. Liam and Simone at the front desk were both incredibly accommodating and deserve extra praise and everyone else I’ve delt with has been very helpful. I travel frequently for business and this is my new favorite hotel in the NYC area. Really looking forward to continuing to stay here.
